name: Sergeants D-Day: German Light Infantry Sergeants expansion
description: The German Light Infantry Mauser 98 Leader comes as a private soldier, junior NCO and senior sergeant. The MP40 Leader comes as a private soldier, junior NCO and senior sergeant.

name: Sergeants D-Day: German Light Infantry Rifle Team expansion
description: The soldiers in the German Light Infantry Rifle Team are the backbone of low VP cost manpower.

name: Sergeants D-Day: US Paratrooper Scout Section expansion
description:
First sold during Kickstarter for the base game.

Contains: 2 soldiers and 32 cards

name: Sergeants D-Day: US Paratrooper Rifle Grenade Team expansion
description:
First sold during Kickstarter for the base game.

Contains: 4 soldiers and 32 cards

name: Sergeants D-Day: US Paratrooper M1919A4 MG Team expansion
description:
First sold during Kickstarter for the base game.

Contains: 4 soldiers and 32 cards

name: Sergeants D-Day: US Paratroopers BAR Team expansion
description:
The US Paratrooper BAR Team is effective as a firebase, or maneuverable enough to give you a tactical edge. The portable and powerful Browning Automatic Rifle is devastating at any distance. Along with the M2 Carbine, which is a light weight, medium ranged weapon and the two M1 Garands for additional long range fire support this is a perfect team to send into unknown battle conditions.

Contents:


1 private soldier M1918A2 Automatic Rifle
8 Cards, 1 Soldier card, 7 Action cards
Hidden Movement marker
Soldier marker

1 private soldier M1A1 Thompson
8 Cards, 1 Soldier card, 7 Action cards
Hidden Movement marker
Soldier marker

2 private soldiers with M1 Garand rifles
16 Cards, 2 Soldier card, 14 Action cards
2 Hidden Movement markers
2 Soldier markers

name: Sergeants D-Day: German Light Infantry Skirmishers Section expansion
description:
The German Light Infantry Skirmisher Specialist troops are a new addition to the SMG soldier line. These skirmishers are gritty troops who operated on the enemy front lines to assault and disrupt. These soldiers come with their basic playing cards but also 8 new Specialist cards that may include Story, Command, React and all new Equipment cards. These soldiers are a welcome addition to any players roster.

CONTENTS:
1 - German MP40 armed Standee with base and markers
1 - German Mauser98 armed Standee with base and markers
2 - sets of Soldier, Core, Rank and Specialist Cards (16 cards)

(Contains 2 soldiers and 32 cards)

First sold during Kickstarter for the base game.

name: Sergeants D-Day: German Light Infantry MG-42 Team expansion
description:
The soldiers in the German Light Infantry MG42 Team are a great firebase, equipped with a powerful light machinegun.

Contents


1 private soldier MG42
8 Cards, 1 Soldier card, 7 Action cards
Hidden Movement marker
Soldier marker

1 private soldier with a Mauser98 Carbine as ammo carrier
8 Cards, 1 Soldier card, 7 Action cards
Hidden Movement marker
Soldier marker

2 private soldiers with Mauser98 rifles
16 Cards, 2 Soldier card, 14 Action cards
2 Hidden Movement markers
2 Soldier markers

name: Anything To Declare?: The International Game of Smuggling and Detection
description:
You are the owner of a shipping line required to unload containers in a port, and move around the board collecting cargoes for delivery to a warehouse. As well as this, you must control movements of your lorry and also use your own customs security piece to follow and challenge containers carried by other players.

The bluff element in the game centres around decisions on whether to pay premiums to insure cargoes moving through the docks, and once at the lorry park you must decide whether to declare goods for payment or not.

Strategy elements include decisions on which piece you will move on each turn, or whether you use you throw to hire a forklift or crane. The detection element involves guessing whether all your opponents are as innocent as they pretend or if they are not declaring their full cargo.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Pick-up and Deliver, Push Your Luck, Stock Holding

name: Viking Conquerors: An Epic Game of Viking Adventure.
description:
BACKGROUND: Viking Conquerors is an adventure game for 1-4 Players, where players assume the roles of young Viking Huskarls (minor Chieftains) during in the Middle Ages. Each Player creates a Viking Character in search of Wealth, Adventure and Renown. To survive and thrive in the harsh and unforgiving world of Medieval Europe, the Player Vikings must take part in Raids, Blood-Feuds, Exploration, and Conquest. As your Viking gains experience and renown they can improve their attributes and Social and Military Status to eventually become Jarls (Earls) or even a King!

GAME OBJECTIVE: The Objective of each Player Viking is to Gain the most Territories and Renown Points in order to increase your Social and Military Standing. Player Vikings start out as Huskarls, a minor Chieftain with right to own a Ship and in control of one Territory.

GAME FEATURES: Viking Conquerors features many, many colorful game counters, rules for brutal man-to-man combat resolved in a fast and fun manner, and loads of Viking lore.
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Role Playing

name: Chaos Tactics
description:
Chaos Tactics is a dexterity game where skill and strategy are needed to defeat your opponent by using your army of eight units. Players battle over a series of rounds by flicking their units until one player claims the entire board. Each army contains seven different unit types with one type, the soldier, having two units per side. The six non soldier units have special abilities that can be used throughout the game. The constant action will create chaotic battles making each round feel like an entirely new game.
The player using the blue pieces starts the game by choosing one of their pieces and flicking it. Once the piece is flicked, resolve any special abilities if applicable. The red player then takes their first turn by doing the same. Play alternates like this until the round is over; with the goal being to knock all of the opponent’s pieces off the game board entirely. If any part of a piece is still on the game board, it is still in play.

A round is won when only one color remains on the board. With each round won, the winner claims a new row allowing them to place a piece or pieces in that row in the next round. For the following rounds, players may place their pieces in any of the spaces of the rows they own, with at least one piece in the row closest to their opponent.

The game is won when one color has claimed all eight rows.

Inspired by Chapayev

name: Round We Go
description:
Round We Go is a strategic family board game.

The goal is to race to the center of the board. First person to get both of their player pieces to the center wins the game.

The trick is that pieces are unable to turn on their own, which can cause you to go round and round on the circular board, unless you plan accordingly.

Players must strategically place arrow pieces on the board to either help them advance or force opponents to backtrack. However, it is important to remember, in a game of circles, sometimes what goes around comes around.

name: Sikarra: Volcano Island
description:
Sikarra, a volcano island rich in a rare resource that could launch your corporation years ahead in their research…or one of the multiple other companies that are racing to find it before you. Extracting the resources from Sikarra will not be an easy job; it is rife with dangers; cannibals, pterodactyls, and the volatile volcano itself. The slopes of the volcano are covered in a dense jungle that is very difficult for modern machinery to penetrate. The only people able to move through this difficult terrain easily are the local tribe…rumor has it they may even be able to travel on the backs of the great winged pterodactyls that circle the volcano. Befriending the tribe may be the only way for your corporation to be the first to reach the rare resources and come out on top.

“Jungle power rules Sikarra. In the jungle the tribe is king…”

The game is playable by 2-4 players.

Players vie against one another for control of the 6 territories of Sikarra attempting to harvest its rare resources while making use of favors traded by other players for much needed equipment. Players will need to stay a step ahead of the deadly volcano, cannibals and circling pterodactyls all the while trying to befriend the ruling tribe through completion of tasks in the tribes name if they want to succeed let alone stay alive.

Winning Conditions: Players must gain support of the tribe (10 support) or have enough forces to overpower the tribe (10 pieces of equipment). The way players gain the support of the tribe is by completing tasks that support the tribe from the tasks list.

Task List:


Build a tribute to the tribe on a territory you control. Cost: 2 Resources & 1 Equipment
Give back to nature. Select one free area and keep it clear of harvesting for one round.
Slash and Burn. Destroy a section of jungle in a territory you control. Gain 3 Resources. Move down one spot on tribe support track.
Bribe local officials. Move once for free at any time this round. Cost: 2 Resources. Move down one spot on tribe support track.


Players move through the following phases each round while trying to show the tribe they are most worthy of their support to control each resource rich territory:

1. Purchase/Place Equipment
2. Cannibals Attack.
3. Politics/Tasks.
4. Lava/Ash Track.
5. Harvest.
6. Intrigue.
7. Move.

Can you lead your corporation to success? Can you harvest the power of the jungle and rule Sikarra: Volcano Island?
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Trading

name: Mishpuchah & Mishegoss
description:
Microgame submission for 2015 Geekway to the West Design Competition. The game is a two player card game that takes about 30 minutes to play. It utilizes a deck of 18 cards.

When the mishpuchah get together, it should be a time of nachas, but there are always some tsouris. Such mishegoss! (Translation for the Yiddush impaired: When the relatives get together, it should be a time of joy, but there are always woes. Such craziness!)

Deal out the guests for the family get-together, then seat them one at a time. Gain points by making your guests happy. Some members are particular about whom they sit with, while others have family members whom they wouldn't be caught dead next to. For most rounds, there will be one branch of the family who is offended and won't score any points at all. The game is over when everyone has been offended at least once.

name: Galloway
description:
This is a card deck & game system with multiple suits, inspired by little ponies, and designed with young players in mind.

Unlike a standard deck of cards, this deck features six "mane" suits: Generosity, Honesty, Kindness, Laughter, Loyalty, and Magic.

The deck also features three other suits: Earth Pony, Pegasus, and Unicorn. The mane suits of Honesty and Laughter are adorned with the Earth Pony suit. Kindness and Loyalty are adorned with the Pegasus suit. Generosity and Magic feature the Unicorn suit.

Furthermore, another pair of suits split the deck in half: the Moon and Sun. Honesty, Laughter, and Loyalty lie under the Moon. Generosity, Kindness, and Magic under the Sun.

The deck is available as a print-and-play game.
categories: Card Game, Game System, Print & Play

name: Crack the Code
description:
Crack the Code with three levels of challenge is a brain testing game of logic and mental concentration. The object of the game is to crack the secret code of your opponent by means of simple logic and deduction. Players challenge each other in turn by setting out a row of three, four or five coloured code counters according to the level of skill and difficulty to be played. The game can be made even tougher by allowing the code maker to use any number of the same coloured counters, and or leave spaces, to make up the code.

The code maker sets up the sliding screen so that it is placed directly in front of them just allowing space to place and hide their secret code in the spaces provided. The code breaker must try to duplicate the exact colours and positions of the secret code. Each attempt is marked with a tick for an exact colour and position match or a cross for the correct colour but incorrect position.

Players swap roles and the winner is the one who breaks the code in the least number of attempts.

name: Trivia On the Go: America
description: Card game answering trivia about America.

name: Patron's Protege
description:
In Patron’s Protégé, you are a lord or lady in the Middle Ages and the time has come for your wards to receive higher education. You will attempt to give them the best education possible by sending them to classes where they will eventually gain proficiency and use their knowledge to teach their own classes.

Patron's Protégé is a two to four player worker placement micro-game. The game consists of 12 cards, which are: 7 class cards, 4 player credentials cards, and one Core classes card. Additionally, there are three punch cards that contain various markers for tracking resources and player pieces.

name: Das bunte Alphabet
description:
A word game for children.

In his turn, a player draws a card which will have a letter on it. He can now move one of his pawns on to a coloured space if he can think of a word that begins with the letter on his card.
On a purple space he must name an object.
On a red space he must name an animal.
On a blue space he must name a fruit or plant.
On a white space he must name a boy or girl's name.
If a correct answer is said, the player keeps the card.
Eventually, both of a players' pawns will reach the middle of the board. Everybody now tries to make the longest word they can, using the letter cards they have collected during the game. The player with the longest word, wins.

name: Picture Puzzles: Familiar Phrases
description:
Party game. The box contains 18 Picture Cards and 12 Answer Cards.
Each picture has some noticeabie feature and the words expressing it generally convey, in everyday usage, quite a different or wider meaning.
Example — 'TO SIT ON THE FENCE'
The usual Interpretation of this phrase is ' to be neutral' or ' not to take sides.' In the picture the expression is conveyed by showing hens (and boy) sitting on a fence.
Distribute the pictures about the area of play and give each player an answer card. A time limit should be fixed and the player who writes down most correct expressions is the winner.
Answer cards should be interchanged for checking.

name: Towns and Cities
description:
Party game with delightful cards.

The illustrated cards are placed around the room where they can easily be seen. Give each player an answer card. Set a time limit. The player who has the most correct answers when 'Time' is called, wins.

The cards feature a number of different illustrations and they are numbered. Players have to look at these images in number order and extract a number of letters from each answer to form the name of an English town or city. They give an example card. There are 5 pictures on that card.
The 1st is a Seal - use the ES
The 2nd is a Step - use the ST
The 3rd is a Bottle - use the BO
The 4th is a Nurse - use the UR
the 5th is a Net - use the NE
Thus, the answer is EA-ST-BO-UR-NE, which is a town on the southern coast of England.

name: Variety Quiz
description:
English party game.

A quiz for your party guests. Up to 12 may play. The host or hostess will read out the questions and the players write down their answers on their answer card.

As the title suggests, the questions will fall into 5 different categories;
Proverbial Last Words: Players must name the proverb just by being told only the last word.
Car Cavalcade: Players must name the manufacturer of the listed car models.
Sur Me: Players are given eight Christian names and eight surnames. Match them correctly to make a list of eight writers.
Triangulation: Players are given a pyramid shape triangle with lines criss-crossing and must write down the correct number of triangles in the image.
Chop and Change: Players are given a statement and the answer must be two words that are anagrams of each other.

The guest with the most correct answers, wins and, hopefully, gets a small gift from the hosts.

name: ATS Core Module: Clash Along The Psel II
description:
Clash Along the Psel II: A never before presented battlefield -- the push north out of the Psel River crossing .. and the Russian response? Also includes 2 BRAND NEW never before published maps, Central Stalingrad I and Tin Pan Alley, Sevastopol -- with and exciting and detailed scenario to play (and replay) on each!

Welcome to the ATS CORE MODULES, all new for 2014. New map, larger, on cardstock, folding with no trimming needed -- did we mention new terrain art throughout AND larger hexes? Perfect for those classic -- YET ALL NEW ATS COUNTERS -- the you'll have on the map deciding history ... all ... over ... again! This module is for owners of the ATS 2014 Color Rules plus ATS Standard Small Markers + Large Markers but may also be used easily by owners of any past edition of the ATS rules. All Special Rules and AFV Cards needed for play are included,

name: Sheeplike
description:
Sheeplike is a Theocratic Card Game for family worship based upon going out in the ministry and finding Sheeplike ones and starting bible studies while avoiding Do Not Calls. 2-4 players ages 9+ can play in 30-60 min using tools like the bible, pioneers, Jesus and even Jehovah to win the householders hearts over. The goal is the first player to 4 bible studies. You gain a bible study by finding the Sheeplike one out in the territory or be the last player still in the round.

Setup: The territory consists of 9 cards (houses) grouped in 3 piles hiding where the Sheeplike and Do Not Call cards are. Shuffle the Sheeplike, Do Not Call and 1 Not Interested cards and create 3 piles. Then deal 2 more territory cards on top of the 3 piles. Players are each dealt 1 card each from the publisher cards.

The game consists of 2 stages:

Door To Door: Players draw and play cards searching through the territory stacks for the Sheeplike one. There are 17 publisher cards that allow players to flip the cards in the territory and move cards around within the stacks. This allows for players to hide traps and uncover the Sheeplike card. If a Do Not Call is flipped without the protection of the Bible card, that player has to sit out of the current round. If the Sheeplike one is not found by the time that there is no more publisher cards to draw from then the next stage starts.

Return Visit: Once all cards have been drawn from the publisher draw pile. All players turns over their one card in their hand. Whoever has the highest value card, they get the first pick of where they think the Sheeplike card is at. Remember the players have had a few turns to deduce the most likely location of the Sheeplike one. So when the publisher pile is getting low, it is good to hold onto higher value cards.

name: Beginning Sounds 3-in-a-Row Game
description: Beginning Sounds 3-in-a-Row Game is a bingo-type game designed to teach the recognition of beginning letter sounds. Players have 3-by-3 cards marked with pictures. Like Bingo, in order to win, a player must complete a row of three across, down or diagonally. Unlike Bingo, each player takes turns spinning a spinner marked with five letters. They must then find a picture that starts with the letter spun. Only the player spinning may mark his or her card. The game comes with four separate sets of cards to cover the entire alphabet.

name: Innløsning: A Rune Casting Game of Redemption
description:
Rise again, noble Völva! You are being given a second chance for Glory!

As you walk the grey and barren lands of Helheim, songs of Valhalla fill your heart and empower your very soul.  However, you are Völva, a seer or ‘wand carrier’. Unlike warriors that got to fight and die in battle to be carried off to Valhalla, you were only an adviser and tactician who assisted by drawing upon the power of the Runes to help your fellow warriors in their battles.

However, Freya smiles upon you and offers redemption to the Völva who can prove their abilities. By using the runes to create gateways, you must work your way up from Helheim to Asgard. By being victorious in challenges and tests of strength, you gain valour and come one step closing to being accepted in Valhalla!

OVERVIEW
Innløsning is an abstract 2 player rune casting game where players are fallen Völva souls in Helheim looking for redemption so that they may enter Valhalla, the hall of the Chosen. Players must create gateways, starting in Helheim, and sequentially working their way up to Asgard. By casting the runes, they will generate power to create those gateways and activate them. However, this is not enough to gain entrance to Valhalla. You must also gain enough valour by using the runes to overcome challenges, or to defeat your rival, by drawing upon the strength provided by the gateways. When you have earned enough valour and opened all the gateways, only then will you be allowed entrance to Valhalla!

GOAL
The first player to have gateways in each of the 9 realms, open all their gateways and have 11 valour wins.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Tile Placement

name: Holidays in Malaysia
description:
From the rules:
"Holidays in Malaysia is a fun and enjoyable game that showcases the beauty of Malaysia. Plan your perfect vacation to Malaysia; you can experience the unique multicultural heritage, sumptuous cuisine, eclectic arts, and architecture of Malaysia. Discover its natural wonders; from some of the most beautiful islands and beaches in the world, to lost tropical jungles that have been wildlife for millions of years. With a little luck and clever planning, you might just outwit your fellow travelers. The first traveler to visit 6 landmarks, collect at least 2 souvenirs, taste 2 cuisines and arrive at the final square wins the game."

Holidays in Malaysia is a roll-and-move game where players move along a track, accumulating vacation experiences in Malaysia. Players roll a die to move along a multi-path track. Spaces may gain them vacation experiences or souvenirs, move them to other places on the board or cause them to gain or lose turns. After a player gains all the necessary experiences, they proceed to the finish to win the game.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Virtual Empire
description: In Virtual Empire, players try to create a business empire and amass a fortune by moving along a track, collecting various cards that represent ideas, assets and business developments, collecting income along the way. Spaces or cards may send you to court or help or hinder the development of your business. In order to finish the game, players must collect one each of nine different types of cards and land on the Empire Money Chest at the end of the track. Players get bonus money for finishing before other players. At the end of the game, the player with the most money wins.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Micro-manage
description:
Microgame for 3 - 5 players lasting 20 - 30 minutes. Game components are deck of 24 cards, although sheet of paper and writing implement are needed for scoring.

You and your opponents are city managers trying to improve the quality of your municipality in terms of Arts, Environment and Industry. During each of the four rounds you draft three cards to improve one of these qualities with one round devoted to improving an omnibus combined score. Player with the highest score at the end of the fourth round wins.

name: ifWHATthen?
description:
ifWHATthen? is the non-stop fun, action-packed party game for friends and family, old and young alike.

ifWHATthen? is the sentence creation game that starts with an "if..." statement and ends when you choose the funniest "...then" statement.

If I wonder which pants to wear...
...then I have a party for one.
...then we decide to call the band 'Mighty Hat'.
...then you oversleep and miss your first day of BEING AWESOME.

If your card is chosen as the funniest...
...then you win that round!

ifWHATthen? invites everyone at the table to use their imagination to find the more than 50,000 card combinations right out of the box.

IF… you are ready for fun,
THEN... this is the game for you!

name: King of the Jungle
description:
Publisher's description:
Who will be the first predator to reach the top of the food chain? It could be you. . . if you can answer questions about life science correctly!

King of the Jungle is an educational game designed to test and improve students' knowledge of life science. Players move pawns along a track. In order to move, a player must draw a card and answer the question on the card correctly. He or she may then roll the die and move along the track. Along the track, spaces may take away or grant extra turns, send the player back or forward along the track or allow the player to trade places with another. If a player lands on another player's space, the first player there must move back along the track to the closest space marked with an animals. The first player to reach the end of the track wins.

name: Mix & Match ABC
description:
Mix & Match ABC is a self-correcting matching game designed to teach the alphabet and reading. It consists of a series of matching cards, one side with a letter and word printed on it, and the other with a corresponding picture. The cards have a puzzle piece edge, and each card only fits its pair.

There are two possible ways to play. One is called Match Out. In this game, cards are placed face-down and each player draws an equal number. The first player places the top tile on their stack face-up. Each player in turn then turns up his or her top tile. If it matches any of the turned-up tiles, the player matches them, puts them aside, and turns up the next tile in his or her stack. This continues until no matches are made, and play passes to the next player. The first player to eliminate his or her stack wins.

In ABC Rummy, letter and picture tiles are places in separate piles. Players take turns drawing from either stack until they all have four tiles in their hand. If any players have matches, they may lay them down immediately. Each player then draws a tile from either pile and tries to match it to tiles in their hand. If there is a match, they are put aside and the player may draw again. If not, the player may keep up to four tiles and must discard any others face-up in the middle of the table. Further players may draw from either the piles or the face-up tiles, making as many matches as possible. Play continues until one player has five pairs.

name: Sergeants D-Day: German Fusilier MG42 Team expansion
description: The German Fusilier MG42 Team offers devastating sustained automatic firepower, capable of keeping the enemy pinned down. Featuring a MG42 and Ammo bearer, this team is a welcome addition to any assault or defense. These soldiers come with their basic playing cards but also 8 new Specialist cards that may include Story, Command, React and all new Equipment cards.

name: Sergeants D-Day: German Fusilier STG44 Leader expansion
description: Each German Fusilier STG44 Specialist Leader comes as a private soldier, junior NCO and senior sergeant. Also included are an assortment of Specialist cards that may include Story, Command, React and all new Equipment cards.

name: Sergeants D-Day: US Paratrooper Glider Rifle Grenadier Section expansion
description: The US Paratrooper Glider Rifle Grenadier Section has a great mix of long range capabilities as well as being heavily stocked with grenades and ammunition. These soldiers come with their basic playing cards but also 8 new Specialist cards that may include Story, Command, React and all new Equipment cards. These soldiers definitely pack a punch!

name: Sergeants D-Day: US Paratrooper Glider Assault Section expansion
description: The US Glider Assault Section brings to bear tremendous automatic firepower, capable of keeping the enemy pinned down. Featuring a BAR and Thompson armed soldiers, this team is a welcome addition to any assault. These soldiers come with their basic playing cards but also 8 new Specialist cards that may include Story, Command, React and all new Equipment cards.

name: Sergeants D-Day: US Paratrooper Glider Rifle Leader expansion
description: Each US Paratrooper Glider Rifle Specialist Leader comes as a private soldier, junior NCO and senior sergeant.

name: Sergeants D-Day: US Paratrooper Glider Thompson Leader expansion
description: Each US Paratrooper Glider Thompson Specialist Leader comes as a private soldier, junior NCO and senior sergeant.

name: Sergeants D-Day: US Paratrooper Assault Team expansion
description: The US Paratrooper Assault Team brings all the tools necessary to get in close to assault an enemy position. The main assault force is one soldier armed with a M1A1 Thompson sub-machine gun and one carrying a M1 Garand rifle with grenade attachment for explosive firepower at short range. Along with the long range fire support from two soldiers carrying M1 Garand rifles, this team is dynamic and effective.

name: Sergeants D-Day: US Paratrooper .30 Cal Team expansion
description: The US Paratrooper .30 Cal Team deploys the Browning M1919A4 Light Machine Gun. Capable of sustained long range fire, this powerful weapon is an asset anywhere on the battlefield. Along with a machine gun assistant, carrying ammo and a M2 Carbine, and two M1 Garand riflemen, this team excels at digging in to defend a position, or breaking down an enemy advance.

name: Purgatory: Micro
description:
Purgatory is a place souls go after physical death before Ascending to Heaven or Descending to Hell. In this Game, Angels and/or Demons are assigned the task to oversee the Souls and assist them on a final journey one way or the other. In some cases, multiple Angels or Demons are assigned. In these cases, they compete to see who can influence the souls better and win the favor of their father.

Angels Ascend Souls to Heaven. Demons Descend Souls to Hell. Also, Souls may be influenced to move toward the light or away from the light. Some actions require or gain grace or cruelty. After each round, Pure Souls move toward the light and Corrupted Souls move away from the light.

Souls vary in value depending on the Soul and if the player is an Angel or Demon. A player wins by gaining the most points after one of several Game Ending conditions are met. It is possible all players lose if Souls are not managed properly.

name: The Battle for Angmar
description:
A free fantasy wargame released by designer Alan Emrich for use in his Game Design course. The full game download is available on his website.

From the rulebook:

The Scourging of the North was a campaign of retaliation by the Alliance of western Men and Elves against the Goblins from the Northern Wastes. This was a war intended to break the Goblin army and scatter it forever.

Aimed at the great Goblin citadel of Angmar, with the northern snows fast approaching, whoever controlled that foul fortress would be in a strong position to survive the winter intact and finish the campaign of annihilation in the spring. The Alliance came very close to seizing Angmar, but a rallying of Goblins from across the Northern Waste to its defenses overcame the forces of the West.

Battle for Angmar is played on a map of the desolate Goblin lands where the 3-day battle was fought. It uses playing pieces that represent the military units that partici-pated in this campaign. Each player is a leader commanding an army of troops. The individual Alliance ground units represent approximately 250 Men or Elves and what was left of their equipment after the long march across the southern regions of Middle Earth. The Goblin units represent approximately 400 Goblin warriors each.

General course of play:

Players alternate turns moving units and attacking enemy units in order to achieve the victory condition of controlling the city of Angmar at the end of turn 7.

name: Santa Cruz
description: Santa Cruz is a simulation Wargame of WWII Carrier Combat, focusing on Japanese and United States forces in late October 1942. The game has both basic and advanced rules.

name: Investing
description:
Investing is designed to teach potential investors where is the best place to keep one's money under various economic conditions.

The game's main equipment is a standard fifty-two card deck. Each rank has been assigned a different type of investment. For example: aces represent retail stocks and tens represent silver. Each player gets five Business Trend Cards which let the players know each investment's value during the five possible economic conditions: recession, stability, depression, stagflation, and inflation.

To play the game, poker chips are distributed among the players equally. A die is rolled to determine the economic condition for this hand. Players proceed to play Draw Poker using the appropriate Business Trend Card to determine the value of one's own hand.

The instruction booklet gives the rules for four other variants of poker but all other poker variants could be played using this deck.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Commodity Speculation, Stock Holding

name: Elemental Dice
description:
Elemental dice is inspired by the classical elements of Earth,Water,Fire and Air. This five dice game comes with rules for 2 different games; Elemental Battle (played with 2 dice) and Elemental Bind*.
---
Elemental Battle: Each player Taket 2 dice. One spare dice is left aside. Each player throws one dice in turn. the strongest element thrown wins and the winning player retains both dice.
Players continue to throw until one player is out of dice and must pick up the spare. The winner is the player who takes all of the dice.If at any stage players get the same result the dice must be rolled again.
---
Elemental Bind*:
The first player throws all the dice, trying to get the best result according to the chart or they may pick only 2 or 3 dice and throw the again to increase the score. Extra scoring rules are adding different ways to gain points giving to Elemental Dice a touch of strategy.
Both games are using the Elements value chart provided: 1)Creation(strongest) - 2)Earth - 3)Water - 4)Fire - 5)Air - 6)Time(weakest)and rolling scoring chart: 5 x creation - 5 x Air - 5 x Water etc.
If there are only two players, the winner is the best out of three rounds.

name: RoboDrome
description:
Welcome to the RoboDrome. Test your skills as you control your robot in the premier robot battle arena. Make use of all your tools and wits to out think and out maneuver your opponent. Two bots enter, one bot leaves.

RoboDrome is a microgame for two players that uses elements of programming, hand management, and strategic movement to maneuver around the board and damage their opponent with a variety of special weapons.
categories: Card Game, Fighting, Print & Play, Science Fiction
mechanics: Action Queue, Grid Movement, Hand Management

name: Party Time: The Game That's as Fun as You Are
description:
Description of Party Time:

Party Time is the perfect party game - test your friends with wacky prompts and wild challenges in this new twist on truth or dare. Party Time is easy to play, interactive, works well for all group sizes and is never the same game twice!

Some examples of challenges are:


Truth or Dare
Kiss the person across from you
Take a mystery shot
Keep in physical contact with the person on your left for the rest of the game
Shotgun a beer with a friend
Exchange an article of clothing with the person on your right
Share your last five Google searches
Give out superlatives to all players
mechanics: Acting, Push Your Luck, Singing, Take That

name: Schlock Mercenary: Kickstarter promotional items pack
description:
Includes:


Tagon Dice: 5 custom dice that includes Tagon's logo in place of the 6.
Extra Character Sheet + Token: Andy, our multi-limbed friend. He has a lot of actions. This is an advanced copy of the character that will be included in a future release, but you get to play with him early.
1 Tagon Patch
An additional promotional Large Floor Tile (6" x 6", double sided) that will be part of the 2013 Convention Give away promotions.
An additional Connecting Floor Tile (1.5" x 3.0") featuring a secret room onboard the ship where you can pick up extra Power Ups.
A Schlock Mercenary Die / Tile bag.
An Extra Scenario
A Second set of Extra Dice with Partnership Logo.
An Alternate Plasma Gun Flying Schlock Character Sheet
A Blank Character Sheet for Funsies
Dice Cup + Punchboard
Wooden discs for the characters in addition to the normal chipboard tokens
Additional chipboard tokens featuring a number of characters with their heads in the Nanny Jars. Sure to be a hit when push comes to shove comes to knife comes to pistol comes to plasma cannon comes to crippling injury with horrific pain.
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Dice, Fighting, Science Fiction

name: Against Time
description:
Κόντρα στο χρόνο (Against Time) is a party game that requires a touch of knowledge but mainly quick thinking!

Every player in his turn rolls a dice and depending on where his pawn goes, he picks a card. For example he picks a card that requires him to note as many phytophagous animals starting from different letters as he can in 30 seconds. The next player has 60 seconds to write phytophagous animals, starting from different letters to the ones used by the first player.

Players get points going around the board and after a defined time the game is over and the player with the most points wins.
categories: Dice, Party Game, Trivia, Word Game

name: Design & Pantomime
description:
Σχέδιο & Παντομίμα (Design & Pantomime) is a party game that combines pictionary and pantomime!

Players are divided in two or more teams of at least two players each. Teams are tested in two tasks with time limits:
For the first one, a player is drawing in order to make his teammates find what he is drawing. In the same manner for the second one a player is acting without making any sounds, so that his teammates find the right answer!

A lot of fun and competitiveness comes through playing.

name: Pyramidion
description:
You are a dwarf, and tasked with building track for a mine cart that has already left its starting point and is rushing fast to its destination.

Your team of fellow dwarves will attempt to assist you in this endeavor, however the task is not proving as easy as you'd hoped...

In Mine Cart, players will cooperatively lay down cards as track for a runaway mine cart. Cards can path off in any direction, limited only by your table space, but must match connecting symbols. These symbols also grant one time special actions, some good, some bad. No matter what one action you choose on your turn (draw, place, take track from back on line) the mine cart always moves one space further. The color of the space it lands on also causes 'something' to happen, so careful as you lay your track, giving lots of choices...

Players cooperatively lay track until the last track (last card on bottom of deck) is placed, however the dwarf with the most vp left in his hand of track is declared the master track builder and receives the promotion from his boss.

This game is an entry for the geekway to the west design contest. And while it won't win, i'm just blessed to be in a cool contest with such an amazing and awesome community that supports each other and is growing every day. Saint louis!!!
mechanics: Hand Management, Network and Route Building, Tile Placement

name: Four More Years!
description:
A presidential election game that tracks elections from 1960 to 2012. Republicans fight Democrats for control of the White House and advancing their agendas.

Players run the gauntlet of primaries using chits and dice to resolve debates, scandals and all the pitfalls that come in American politics to determine who will represent their party in a national election. Your goal is to somehow get the best nominee through the process and win the general election.

name: Smash & Grab: A Two-Person Job
description:
Smash & Grab: A Two Person Job is a cooperative two-player game where you're charged with organizing the heist of well-guarded treasures.

In Smash & Grab, you choose a location to pull off your heist, choose 2 of 6 possible characters to perform the heist with, and then alternate revealing new events that occur during the heist and playing actions to a timeline in order to get in, grab the loot, and get out.

The game centers around resource management. Every round, a card from the event deck will be played to the timeline, which will increase the 'bad' resources (threat, fatigue, and setbacks) and limit your ability to gain the 'good' resource (progress). Then, players will take turns playing a card to the timeline to counteract these 'bad' resources while gaining as much progress as possible.

Each player has a hand of general action cards and starts the game with 3 powerful character-specific actions. Each action card adds or subtracts one or several resources, as well as sometimes giving the player access to powerful abilities such as looking through the action or event decks.

The resources are kept track of on shared boards. Each minute of the timeline has a threat track to keep track of the amount of threat you have minute-to-minute. Additionally, there is a progress and fatigue mat that is used in combination with specific tokens to keep track of your current totals for those resources.

If you are able to accumulate enough progress while keeping threat and fatigue low enough before you run out of space on the timeline or the event deck runs out, then you win.

name: Owata-shi no haraguro shicho
description:
User summary:
オワタ市の腹黒市長 (Owata-shi no haraguro shicho) is game from the Japanese doujin circle Hiruyumedo. In English, 'Owata-shi no haraguro shicho' means 'Evil Mayor Of A Hopeless Town'.

This is a game with the theme of a rigged mayor election and corruption along with an identity-hiding mechanism; and unbalanced team competition. The overall flow is similar to The Resistance, but the voting system is different, and the winner of each round is kept a secret. The team that gains more points at the end wins.

Publisher summary:
不均等の正体隠匿によるチーム戦で、市長選挙および汚職をテーマにしています。全体の流れはレジスタンス(Resistance)に近いですが、投票対象が異なり、ラウンドの勝敗は不明確です。
二つのチームでより多くの点数を稼いだほうが勝利です。
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Deduction, Medieval, Negotiation, Party Game
mechanics: Memory, Simultaneous Action Selection, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers, Voting

name: Pirates & Privateers: A Game of Trade, Piracy and Adventure on the High Seas.
description:
In Pirates & Privateers, Players take on the roles of Merchant Ship Captains in search of riches, plunder & adventure during the Golden Age of Piracy (1660-1720). In order to profit and survive in the dangerous occupation as a Ship’s Captain, they must use their skills and wiles, as well as, their fighting abilities. Player Captains may enter service with a Nation’s Government as a Privateer, charged with capturing and sinking enemy ships and plundering enemy towns. Of course, one man’s Privateer is another man’s Pirate. If you engage in any hostile acts against a Nation’s Ships or Towns, you will be considered a Pirate to that Nation and will be pursued until brought to justice.

Ojective
The objective of Pirates & Privateers is for the Players to accumulate the most Gold after 12 Rounds. For a longer game play 16 Rounds; for a shorter game, play 8 Rounds. If your Player Captain is killed you may create another one and start with half the Gold (round down) of your previous Captain.

Features
Pirates & Privateers features many colorful counters of ships, pirates, officers, crew, and native forces. The game includes rules for Trading and Commerce, Special Missions, Naval and Land Combat, Port Raiding, Buried Treasure and Duels.

name: IQ Bingo Logik
description:
The top card from the deck is drawn question-side up. There are 3 answer-variants with rock-paper-scissor symbols. Simultaneously, players show their symbols and then turn around the card. Whoever answers correctly first takes the chip and puts it to the correct number on their 4x4 bingo board. If the player has filled this space already or there is a "bonus"-number on the card, the player may choose any bingo-space for their chip.

The player who fills a vertical or a horizontal line first shouts "IQ Bingo" and wins the game!

name: IQ Bingo Tiere
description:
The top card from the deck is drawn question-side up. There are 3 answer-variants with rock-paper-scissor symbols. Simultaneously, players show their symbols and then turn around the card. Whoever answers correctly first takes the chip and puts it to the correct number on their 4x4 bingo board. If the player has filled this space already or there is a "bonus"-number on the card, the player may choose any bingo-space for their chip.

The player who fills a vertical or a horizontal line first shouts "IQ Bingo" and wins the game!

name: IQ Bingo Welt
description:
The top card from the deck is drawn question-side up. There are 3 answer-variants with rock-paper-scissor symbols. Simultaneously, players show their symbols and then turn around the card. Whoever answers correctly first takes the chip and puts it to the correct number on their 4x4 bingo board. If the player has filled this space already or there is a "bonus"-number on the card, the player may choose any bingo-space for their chip.

The player who fills a vertical or a horizontal line first shouts "IQ Bingo" and wins the game!

name: For Hive and Colony: The Great Insect War
description:
It was a simple arrangement: The Bee Queen shall rule the skies above the earth, and the Ant Queen shall have sole rule of the land. However, the Bee Queen, sick of controlling a domain consisting of mostly air, has declared war!

The Bees launch the offensive, gathering allies from other varieties of flying insects. The Ants scramble their defenses, drawing on the loyalty of their ground-dwelling friends. But admist the conflict lay the beetles: divided, it is unsure which side(s) they will support.

For Hive and Colony is a microgame of strategic, physical card manipulation. Players will take on either the United Colonies or the Hive Powers. They will deploy their oddly shaped cards to the table, then take turns moving them as indicated. Each insect moves in a slightly different fashion. Flip, rotate, translate, and even divebomb the enemy in a mad rush to capture their queen! To the victor: the whole of the world!

For Hive and Colony is a two player game which plays in about 10 to 20 minutes.

NOTE: The images associated with this game are prototype images. All art is used for example only.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Animals, Card Game, Print & Play

name: Sons of Cronus
description:
It is a story as old as time: brothers fighting amongst themselves to prove who is strongest. These brothers, however, are the mighty Greek gods Zeus, Poseidon, and Hades, the sons of the great Titan Cronus. And through you, they fight for control over the land, seas, and skies of Ancient Greece.

OVERVIEW
Sons of Cronus is a three player trick taking game. The cards feature three suits, one representing each of the gods Zeus, Poseidon, and Hades. Several powerful Myth cards represent other figures from Greek mythology with special abilities that add a wrinkle to the gameplay. The players score points by correctly predicting how many tricks they think they will take each round. The player who best manages his cards and scores the most points after the sixth round wins the game.

name: The Pascal Deal
description:
The most deadly virus known to mankind (known as the Pascal Project) has been stolen. The perpetrator of the crime is looking to get rid of the virus quickly to avoid capture.

Players must use their influence in the global gang world by managing and playing cards from their hand in order to collect the information they need to set up the soon to be infamous Pascal deal and purchase the virus.

Information in this game is represented by cards in players hands. Your goal is to identify which players hold these cards and to use your actions from played cards efficiently to steal these information cards from them, all while trying to put on your best poker face to attempt to hide any information cards you hold from other players so that they are not stolen from you. The first player to obtain 3 information cards has everything they need to establish the Pascal deal and win the game.

name: Random Armor Generator
description: Random Armor Generator is a 10 - 30 minute card game in which players pass their hands of cards after selecting one to play to assemble the toughest armor to survive the tournament! Each player begins with 6 cards consisting of armor pieces and weapons that are played one at a time in front of the player, then the rest of the hand is passed either clockwise or counterclockwise (depending on game round) until all but 2 cards have been played. Then each player has the opportunity to swap out one piece of their assembled armor for what remains in the hand they are passed to complete their set. The remaining cards are discarded and everyone compares armor values, which are increased or decreased by certain affects on each card. The player with the highest value wins, simply because they can take more of a beating than the others. Cards are then shuffled and dealt for another round. Play as many rounds as you like, but we recommend 1 round per player +1 round, best out of that number wins!

name: Helenaopoly
description: This version of Monopoly celebrates Helena, Montana.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Dice Rolling, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Kings of the Mountain
description:
Kings of the Mountain is a 1-5 player cooperative card game in which players fight through dragons and undead on the way to cleansing a legendary mountain of the evil that resides on it.

Players win if they can rid Kings' Mountain of monsters by defeating each one in order before the Heroes deck is depleted.

In the print and play version, cards numbered 2-10 represent heroes that players control. Each hero has two abilities that pass or fail based on a single skill check, based on the flipping the top card of the hero deck. Players recruit heroes each round, use their abilities to deal damage and defeat monsters, and try to clear Kings' Mountain of the threat before the heroes are depleted!

KotM is a "Dungeon Crawl in a Deck of Cards" that can be played as a print and play with a crib sheet and a deck of cards to represent the heroes, monsters, and bosses.
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Fantasy, Medieval, Print & Play
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: The All-Seeing Eye
description:
The All-Seeing Eye is a speed-based card game featuring simultaneous play and symbol-recognition for two to four players.

Players are trying to make points by slapping matches as fast as possible. Players can only hold one card in each hand and play to three piles in the center of the table. They may discard cards from either hand to their discard pile. If Players do not have cards in their hand, they may slap the center three piles if they see a match. A match may be made by slapping three of the following combinations: three of the same color of top symbol, any three same parts of a symbol regardless of color, and the whole symbol matching regardless of color. Slapped matches or missed matches are removed from the board quickly and play is continued. Color matches score one point, part symbol matches score two points, whole symbol matches score five, and missed matches are scored minus two.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Action / Dexterity, Card Game
mechanics: Set Collection, Simultaneous Action Selection, Trick-taking

name: Tower Babies
description:
Tower Babies is a 30-minute hex tower defense board game for 2 players.

STORY

The monster baby parents have left for the weekend and the babies need food and hugs. Smelling porridge and comfy beds, they head to the village.
In the village, the grown ups won’t wake up! The babies wake each other up and grab their parents armor and head to the wall.

ACCESSIBILITY

Tower Babies is a fantasy themed board game for ages 8 and up.

GOALS

Tower player must defeat all monsters. Monster player wins if one monster reaches the end.

SETUP

Tower player begins by placing the ₩ wall pattern piece. Place the walls so that they do not prevent a path from the starting to ending spot.
After Tower player has placed a wall, Monster player rolls a d4 and places that many paths. Walls may not be placed on paths.
Tower player places a wall from wall pattern ₩ to pattern ¥ to pattern £ and back to pattern ₩. Monster player rolls a d4 and places paths until the path reaches the ending spot.

PLAY

After the path has reached the end, Tower player places a tower on a wall that is not within the starting zone.
Monster player spawns a monster.
Towers may fire or reload. Then, place a tower until a maximum of five towers is reached.
Tower player may move towers that can move.
Monster player moves monsters up to their full movement as long as they do not block the starting spot.
Monster player spawns a monster.
Repeat these steps until the sixth monster is to be placed. Monster player may now play a monster and the boss monster. No more monsters are spawned.
Play continues until all monsters are killed or one monster reaches the end of the path.
mechanics: Hexagon Grid, Network and Route Building

name: Make It!  Animal Babies
description: In Make It! Animal Babies, players compete to assemble a three-dimensional cardboard animal. Each player chooses an animal and takes the five pieces (head, body, forelegs, hind legs and tail). The body parts are depicted tiles, which are laid out face-down. Players take turns choosing a tile. If it depicts a part of their animal, they take that piece, add it to their animal and discard the tile. If it is not a part of their animal, they return it to the same spot face-down. The first player to completely assemble their animal wins.

name: Paddington Bear's Suitcase Scramble Game
description:
From the box:
"In Suitcase Scramble, Paddington must go through the Brown's house to fill his suitcase so he can accompany Mr. Gruber on an exciting trip to France! You must make sure he packs all of his useful items. . . Paddington has to be quick because Mr. Gruber is in a big hurry. Be careful that he doesn't lose any of his items while he packs. The first player to fill Paddington's suitcase with all 10 items wins the game."

Each player has flat cardboard suitcase marked with ten items Paddington must pack in his suitcase. On their turn, they spin a spinner and move along a track. Each space is marked one of Paddington's ten items. If they need it, they may take a marker with the that item and cover its space on their suitcase. Some spaces allow the player to take a marker of their choice. Players circle the track until they have collected all their items. The first player to fill their suitcase and reach the "bon voyage" space wins.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Metropolis Rescue Mission: The Chase Game
description:
From the box:
"Superman has a new mission of stopping the falling meteorite from striking the city of Metropolis. Superman gets information that the falling meteorite is heading towards Metropolis and is targeting the Daily Planet office (where he works as a reporter.) On his way to destroy the meteorite, Superman encounters three deadly villains and has to knock them down and collect the tokens to destroy the meteorite with all his new super powers."

Metropolis Rescue Mission is a roll-and-move game where players move around a track, trying to reach the end and destroy the meteorite. Along the way, they may land on spaces that force them to defeat villains as well as other spaces that will grant them extra powers. "Diversion" tracks and transportation spaces allow players to shorten the track and avoid some villains. The first player to the finish wins.

name: Off with their Heads
description:
"A clever and interesting game for afternoon and evening parties."

Each guest is given a card and a time limit to resolve the clues. On each card are 32 rhyming couplets. The first line of the rhyme describes one word and the second line describes another word for which the correct answer is found by taking off the first letter of the first word. An example:
It's bright and sparkling, seen when dark.
Daub well your boat ere you embark.
First line = STAR. Second line = TAR

When "Time2 is called, the winner is the guest with the most correct answers.

name: Who and When?
description:
Party game, "A jolly game for any party".

There are 9 Names' List Cards provided. Place these at suitable distances apart about the room (attach to walls, !f convenient).
Look at the Key Sheet and you will note that a girl's Name heads each list. Now the idea of the game is that the girl is friendly in turn with each of the boys whose names follow and finally marries the young man whose full name is made up of the first letters of the Christian names reading from top to bottom of the list and the wedding date is that at the foot of the list.

By filling in his recording card as instructed below a player is able to make a list exactly the same as that on the key sheet corresponding to a particular girl's name.

Suppose we take the name Barbara. Write Barbara in the first space of a recording card; then look for Barbara in the left columns of the Names Lists and on finding it write in the second space the boy's name opposite in the right column, i.e. Roland. Next find Roland in the left column of a Names List and write in the third space the name opposite, For example - lan. Continue in this way until the date June I2th is found opposite Stuart and entered in the last space alongside the word WHEN.
Now enter the first letters of each name recorded in the column headed "FIRST LETTER" and it should then be fairly easy to divide them into two groups giving a Christian name and surname. Write them in the space alongside the word WHO.

Give each player a recording card and see that he has a pencil.
To begin the game call out one of the girls' names on the Key Sheet and the player who is first to present a correctly completed recording card is the winner.

An alternative way of playing is to write in the first space of each recording card to be used, before the game starts, the name of a girl and at the word " GO " each player completes his card in respect of the girl whose name appears on it.

name: String Thing
description: String Thing is a pen-and-paper dexterity game. Players draw maps with a start point and an end point, and goals and obstacles in between. Then they take a long string with a bead tied to one end, drop the bead at the start point of a map, and slowly lower the string, attempting to draw a line with it from start to end while connecting the goals and avoiding the obstacles. Crossing (or capturing) a goal gives points, while touching an obstacle subtracts points. If a player runs out of string before they reach the end point, they score zero for that map. After playing through several maps, the player with the most points wins.

name: Zombie Mutation: City of Mayhem
description: In Zombie Mutation, each player will take the role of one of the six heroes, all fighting to escape the growing Zombie hordes. During the game, players will fight their way through a multi-level 3D game board searching for items that can help them survive, rescuing other survivors and of course killing zombies.

name: Blanchette: la vache qui pète
description: Blanchette the cow begins the game disassembled. Each round players roll dice and in order to get certain combinations. The winner of each round gets to add a piece to Blanchette. When Blanchette is fully assembled the game ends and the player with the most points gets to make a fart noise using the included "pâte pèteuse".

name: Robot Empire
description:
Robot Empire is a strategy and battle card game set in a large space age universe where Robot armies battle it out for control of the galaxy. Use Super Weapons, Human Agents, Upgrade Components, Base Equipment, and Monster Mercenaries to wage your war. Power Management is crucial in the game as you will need to mine for Power Coins to obtain enough energy to run your empire.

The cards have beautiful and colorful imagery right out of 1950s science fiction. Players will easily get emerged into the genre of the game.

Game Play:
Each turn, players spend their Power Coins (earned by minting or mining or landing on Mining Moon cards)to bring out fighters like Robots or Monster Mercenaries that can attack opponent's. Building a strong Base (Base cards form the back row on tabletop) allows players to shoot Long Range Weapons, Use Force Fields for extra defense, and create Power Coins. Players can customize their draw decks to follow different strategies and playing styles. A player looses Life Points when attacking fighters are not blocked. When a player reaches zero Life Points, they are out of the game.
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building

name: To Build a Wonder
description:
You are an Egyptian military foreman leading your workers to carry large boulders to the great pyramid Giza, one of the seven great wonders of the world.

Players cooperatively pull a giant boulder first to the pyramid, then up the pyramid to be set in place.

On your turn, you may choose two actions:


play a track card from your hand
give a clue to the other players
draw a card (usable only once per turn)


No matter the actions, the boulder moves one space further at the end of each player's turn.

All players win if they successfully pull the boulder and put it in place on the pyramid, players lose if the boulder ever falls off the track.

At game end, IF all players make it to the end, the player with the most cards in hand wins.

A microgame for the BGG / Geekway to the West design contest.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Network and Route Building, Tile Placement

name: Puppy Phonics
description: Puppy Phonics is an educational game about consonant blends and short vowel sounds. It is designed to be enjoyed by 2, 3, or 4 players age four and older. Each player twirls a spinner and names the sound indicated... for example, A E I O U. The player then advances his or her puppy token to the next space on the illustrated pathway which features an image matching that sound. The first player to reach the finish line is declared the winner.

name: Maze-o-Lines
description:
Party game for observant guests.

Each player is given a card with a vast amount of scribble on it. At least, it looks like scribble but hidden within the mess are 36 objects. The aim is to be the first to identify the objects.

The game is rather like the more famous Word Search but with images rather than letters.
publishers: Mad Broot Media, Party Games Publishers

name: Switch Hunt
description:
This game is a kind of treasure hunt played sitting down instead of moving about the house.

A box contains 12 similar Picture Cards, 12 Clue & Answer Cards together with the Instruction and Solutions sheets.

The clues in some cases are somewhat cryptic and use is made of a play on words.

Each player is given a Picture Card and a Clue & Answer Card. The answer to each clue is an object in the picture; its name should be written in the 2nd column and the first letter of the name written in the end column. All these letters when correctly arranged give the answer to 'Find the....'. The blank space at the bottom is usable for this purpose, the dashes indicating letters of one or more words.

A SECOND GAME
The pictures can be used for a Memory Game, preferably before the hunt. Give each player a Picture Card and allow them to look at it for say a minute. Then collect the pictures; give each player a sheet of paper and the one who writes down most objects from memory is the winner.

name: CardPG
description:
A challenging adventure awaits!

CardPG takes the best elements of such games as Munchkin, Talisman, and Dungeons & Dragons and polishes their best features, resulting in a game that's both easy to learn and fun to play.

Choose from one of six adventuring classes and battle a wide array of monsters, from the lowly Dire Rat up to a fearsome dragon! Each class has unique strengths and weaknesses, so you can always find a character that matches your play style.

Team up with other players to take on challenging foes, or try to go it alone and reap all the rewards for yourself.

Game play is structured so that everyone gets to do something meaningful on every turn. There's even a handy "Rules Card" that both keeps track of whose turn it is AND serves as a reminder of all the turn phases, turning a potentially complex turn into something that anyone can understand!

The aim of the game is to level up your character to level 5 or collect 30 gold. You level up by gaining experience from defeating monsters. In each turn players can commit their characters to fight one of the enemies, buy/sell equipment, spawn new monsters or heal themselves. Players can join forces to attack enemies together and share the prize, but only if the first attacker agrees, so there's an element of negotiation involved. Additionally players have equipment and action cards at their disposal which allow them to boost their stats and perform additional actions. Monsters are defeated by comparing your characters and the enemies attack/defence stats modified by the result of a dice roll.
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management

name: Advent Saga: Tactical Card Game
description:
Advent Saga is a story-driven physical and digital Tactical Card Game that combines the excitement and traditions of popular card games, with the strategic elements of Tactical RPG's. The game takes place in an original universe where a devastating war is waged upon 3 different galactic factions. Players will choose from hundreds of cards to battle with, while discovering endless possibilities in combat strategy.

Advent Saga is a highly customizable game, in that each of the 5 resources have their own strengths and weaknesses, while each of the 10 advents have unique abilities that set them apart from each other. This allows you to build a deck to cater to your own style of play! The object of the game is to reduce the opposing Advent’s morale to zero. This can be achieved by strategically using the cards in your hand to deploy, attack and dominate your opponent.

One goal with Advent Saga was to add elements that rewarded meaningful choices over just drawing powerful cards. With the creation of our 4x4 battleground, players would not only need to rely on strength and power, but would also need to discover and develop new strategies involving Battleground position, Range, areas of effect, and much more.
mechanics: Grid Movement, Hand Management, Set Collection, Variable Player Powers

name: Knuckle Down the Nile
description:
From the box:

"Knuckle Down the Nile with your marbles.

A classic game of marble madness for ages 5 to adult.

Using skill and strategy, outmaneuver your opponent. Enter the sacred kingdom of the Nile. But watchout!! You may lose your marbles...and the game!!

Don't let the legions of dinosaurs barricade your path. Capture them to score and become pharaoh of the Nile."

From the rule book:

"Object of the game: To score the most points by shooting marbles to knock down barriers, hit your opponents' marbles and to storm through the entrances to the pyramids, the sphinx and into a dinosaurs mouth."

name: Evening Party Games: Clues – Celebrities
description:
24 cards with a clue to a correct name are placed around the room. Players are given a card to record their answers and a time limit. When 'Time' is called, the player who returns to the party host with the most correct answers, wins.

It is undated but must have first appeared in the 1930's. The answer to the 2 example cards in the images are Norma Shearer and Bessie Love, both stars then but almost forgotten after WWII.

name: Name the Lady for the Dressmaker
description:
Party game that comes in two parts.

First is a simple word game. Each player gets a card headed with What is the Female Name for each of the following words.
First to get all correct, wins.

Second game is another word game. This time the host puts around the room cards that ale all identical (thus to cut down over-crowding around just one card). On each card there is a little story and hidden within the story are items associated with a dressmaker. This is a considerably harder game than the first one. The first player to return with the most correct answers, wins.

name: Pre-Historic Marshmallow
description: This page does not exist. You can edit this page to create it.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Deduction, Educational, Math, Number, Prehistoric
mechanics: Pick-up and Deliver, Push Your Luck, Set Collection, Take That, Team-Based Game

name: Klammeraap
description:
This is a game similar to Skat but with an Rhenish touch and some special rules that differ from the original Skat.
The gameplay is quite simple: each player plays a card and the player who played the highest card wins all played cards. The player who has collected the most tricks when all cards are played is the winner of the game.

Text on the box:

Das Rheinische Doppelklammerskatspiel

"Klammeraap" ist das ultimativ spaßige rheinische Familienkartenspiel mit Elementen aus Herzblättchen, Doppelkopf und Ramsch. Leicht verständlich, unterhaltsam und überraschend.
Die Schachtel enthält 45 Spielkarten und eine ausführliche Spielanleitung mit vielen witzigen Sonderregeln, die für Spaß und Abwechslung sorgen. Wem die kölnisch-ripuarische Mundart noch fremd ist, mit der die Karten bezeichnet sind, der kann sich trotzdem entspannt zurück lehnen. Ein Wörterverzeichnis liegt bei.

name: Verkehrsspiel
description: The players start on space 1, have to visit all numbered spaces in the right order and return to space 1. While doing this, they have to mind the traffic signs. Movement is determined by a die. The first player to return to space 1 wins the game.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Eleciones en Lanolinas
description:
24th July 1993, La Ciudad, Republic of Lanolinas.

People are celebrating, flocks of sheeps coming form the Meseta are invading the streets, the Plaza Merinos, hearth of the Nation, where the Parliament overlooks the Presidential Palace, is overcrowded... the dictatorship has finished!

The President Candidates of the two main Parties, National and Popolar, are speaking to the crowd... the elections are set in the next month!

Will you manage to win the Elections, gain the majority at the Parliament and elect the President?

Welcome to Eleciones en Lanolinas!

A 18 card game fast and interesting!


Here some hints on Lanolinas:

Capital City: La Ciudad

Goverment: Presidential Republic

History: Found by Colombo in 1495, Lanolinas gets its name from the flocks imported from Spain since 1545. La Ciudad is founded in 1553 as commercial distribuition of the wool here produced. Since 1648 Lanolinas is a Spanish Royal Colony, till the indipendence, declared on 19th March 1891.

As independent republic, Lanolinas is influenced by the US and knows a period of dictatorship, ended in 1969 by the Marxist Revolution of Ignacio Las Casas. At its death, in 1980, Guillermo Rosas restores the Presidentail Republic using terror and corruption, till its recent resignements.

Economy: Sheep Wool, treated into the Woolen Mill, the main local industry.

Politics:there are two main parties, National and Popolar. The country is divided into three Constituencies, each electing one Candidate to the Parliament:

First: La Ciudad, urban, with officies, University and Army Headquarter;

Second: El Centro, rural, with medium villages with shops and the Woolen Mill.

Third: La Meseta, rural, with small villages, farms, sheep breeding, hills.
The game is for two players,each represents one of the political parties of the Republic of Lanolinas; one is the National Party (its badge is a blue N), the other is the Popolar Party (its badge is a red P).

Each Party shuffles its Candidates cards (with its party badge), draws all four of them, turns them on the opposite face and gets the Candidate President and a Candidate for each Constituency.

Each Party has to nominate the Candidate President and to assign one Candidate for each Constituency, showing them on the table in echelon.

The country is divided into three Constituencies, each electing one Candidate to the Parliament:

First: La Ciudad, urban, with officies, University and Army Headquarter;
Second: El Centro, rural, with medium villages with shops and the Woolen Mill.
Third: La Meseta, rural, with small villages, farms, sheep breeding, hills.

Game Rules (available on cards as well)
Each Candidate has a Vote Value valid in all or some Consituencies only, a Note with a special empowerement of a specific Electoral Card and might have a Candidate President Special Ability too, to be used if designed as Candidate President.

Then after having shuffled the Electoral Cards, each Party draws 4 cards each; these are the cards to be assigned to the Constituencies in order to get the most Votes and therefore manage to elect its Candidate in the Constituency.

The Ecards are valid in specific Constituencies only, it is possible that a Party doesn't have any Ecard in a Constituency.

Each Party assigns the ECards for each Constituency face down; when all the cards have been assigned, the Polls start and the ECards are revealed, starting from the First Constituency.

If any Candidate President Special Ability is to be solved, solve it when necessary; the exchange of one Ecard is with an adverse revealed one at Candidate choose!

In each Constituency each Party calculates how many votes got (including the Candidate President Vote Value where is valid and all the appliable Notes of the Candidates), the most elect its Candidate at the Parliament; in case of draw, the seat remains unassigned!

The party with the most elected Candidates elects its Candidate President as President of the Presidential Republic of Lanolinas.
In case of draw, the Elections are annulled and the game restarts.

The President’s Party can retain one card for the new Eleciones; one Candidate (kept to be used as Candidate President or Constituency Candidate) or one ECard, which will be not reshuffled but kept apart.

Then restart the game for a new Electoral Campaign!

A Party wins if gets the President elected three times on five Elections.

Will YOU manage to make your Candidate President?

name: Solar System Spin
description:
Solar System Spin is a spin-and-move game where players move along a track from Pluto to the sun, trying to collect planet cards with facts about the planets. Along the way, the spinner may send players to the black hole, supernova or worm hole, causing them to move backward, lose turns or lose cards.

The first player to reach the sun with at least three planet cards wins.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: The Lion King
description:
Scar plots to get rid of Simba by telling him about a dangerous elephant graveyard. Just as he hopes, Simba and Nala head for this forbidding place, where a pack of hungry hyenas await them. Can you help King Mufasa rescue the cubs?

Published in Disney's Giant Board Game Book, The Lion King is a roll-and-move game where players must move two markers representing Simba and Nala simultaneously along a track, trying to reach the end and be rescued by Mufasa. Along the way, they may land on spaces that move them forward or backward or cause loss or gain of turns. If a player lands on another marker, they move back six spaces, and in order to start moving a marker at the beginning of the game, they must roll at least a three. The book comes with an "electronic" die that generates random number from 1 to 6. A small element of strategy is added by the ability to move either marker, offering the choice to move the marker that will land on an advantageous space or avoid a negative space.
categories: Animals, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Beauty and the Beast
description:
A mob of angry villagers, led by Gaston, has decided to invade the forbidding castle in order to kill the Beast. Belle saddles Phillipe and sets out to save the Beast. However, you must help her to get to him before the last petal of the Enchanted Rose falls, or the Beast will never become a prince again.

Published as part of Disney's Giant Board Game Book, Beauty and the Beast is a roll-and-move game where players take the part of Belle, rushing to save the Beast. Each player in turn presses the "electronic die" and moves the indicated number of spaces along the track. Each player also has a marker on the rose board, indicating petals falling from the enchanted rose. As they move along the track, they will land on spaces that may move them forward or backward or cause loss or gain of turns. Landing on another player's marker moves a player back 2 spaces. Players landing on spaces marked with a rose must move their marker one space forward on the rose board. The first player to reach space 42 by exact roll without their rose board marker reaching the end of the rose board rescues the beast and wins.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Mexico Ablaze: A Solitaire Game of the Mexican-American War (1846-1848).
description:
BACKGROUND: Mexico Ablaze is semi-historical simulation of the Mexican-American War (1846-1848). The Game begins shortly after the United States of America (USA) and Mexico have begun hostilities near the border of the Rio Grande. The Mexican Army is now building up their forces to kick the United States out of Mexico. The US must capture enough Mexican controlled Settlements before the Mexican Army is able to effectively mobilize an overwhelming force.

OBJECTIVE: Player takes command of the United States Forces in Mexico. The Player’s Objective is to attempt to capture three or more of the five Key Mexican Controlled Settlements of Monterrey, Buena Vista, Vera Cruz, Tampico and Mexico City before the “Treaty of Guadalupe Hidalgo” Campaign Card is Drawn. If the Mexicans capture 3 of the four US Settlements of Fort Texas, Laredo, Corpus Christi or San Patricio, they win. Also, if the US has not captured three of the four Key Mexican Settlements and the “Treaty of Guadalupe Hidalgo” Campaign Card was played, the Mexicans Win.

GAME FEATURES: Mexico Ablaze features many colorful game counters of the various Unit types that fought in the Mexican War, including individual Heroic Officers that later served in the Civil War. Battles can be fought on a large Battle Mat and includes assaults on fortified settlements.

MEXICO ABLAZE can be found at http://www.berserkergames.net
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement

name: 101 Dalmatians
description:
