Cruella hired Horace and Jasper to kidnap lots of Dalmatian puppies. She wants to make a fur coat out of them. Can you help Perdita and Pongo find all of them and bring them back home?

Published as part of Disney's Giant Board Game Book, 101 Dalmatians is a roll-and-move game where players take the part of the Dalmatian parents Pongo and Perdita, trying to save their puppies from the evil Cruella de Vil. Each player in turn presses the "electronic die" which generates a random number from 1 to 6 to move two markers representing the dogs simultaneously along a track, trying to reach the end and be save their offspring. Along the way, they may land on black paw prints or white paw prints, which move them back or forward six spaces respectively. Other spaces may also move them forward or backward or cause loss or gain of turns. If a player lands on another marker, they move back five spaces. A small element of strategy is added by the ability to move either marker, offering the choice to move the marker that will land on an advantageous space or avoid a negative space.
categories: Animals, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: The Little Mermaid
description:
King Triton has lost his magic trident. He sets out to search for it with Sebastian, Ariel and Flounder. They find a sunken ship at the bottom of the sea, and divide into two teams. Which team will find the trident and end up with the most objects?

Published in Disney's Giant Board Game Book, The Little Mermaid is a roll-and-move game where players must move along a track, collecting objects along the way as they try to reach the end of the track and find King Triton's trident. Players choose to play as either Ariel and Flounder or Triton and Sebastian, and press the "electronic die" to move along separate tracks which merge at the end. As they progress, they may land on spaces that move them forward or backward or cause loss or gain of turns. Some spaces are also marked with objects to collect (designated by taking a marker). The player who finishes with the most objects collected wins.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Aladdin
description:
Aladdin has lost the magic lamp! You must help him and Princess Jasmine find it before Jafar does.

Published in Disney's Giant Board Game Book, Aladdin is a roll-and-move game where players must press the "electronic die" to move two markers representing Aladdin and Jasmine simultaneously along a track, trying to reach the end and recover the magic lamp. Along the way, they may land on spaces that move them forward or backward or cause loss or gain of turns. A small element of strategy is added by the ability to move either marker, offering the choice to move the marker that will land on an advantageous space or avoid a negative space. The first player to reach the end of the track with both markers wins, and the other players must "grant three wishes" to the player by roaring like a genie, making a face like Abu and flying around the room like a magic carpet.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Snow White and the Seven Dwarfs
description:
Snow White and the Seven Dwarfs are out in the woods picking berries. The forest animals warn them that the wicked Queen, disguised as an ugly old hag, is after them. In order to deceive the wicked Queen, Snow White and the Seven Dwarfs separate into four teams and set out, each in a different direction, for their little cottage.

Published in Disney's Giant Board Game Book, Snow White and the Seven Dwarfs is a roll-and-move game where players simultaneously move four markers on a grid, trying to get all four safely to their designated cottage. Each player presses the "electronic die" and then chooses one of four markers to move from its starting point onto the grid. Markers must make their entire move either vertically or horizontally, not both. Many grid squares are marked with various character, events or objects from the movie. Landing on these may move the player's marker or cause loss or gain of a turn. An element of strategy is added by the ability to move any marker, offering the choice to move the marker that will land on an advantageous space or avoid a negative space. The first player to move all four markers from their starting spaces to the safety of the cottage wins.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Grid Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Operation East Front: A Solitaire Game of Tactical Combat on the Russian Front
description:
Operation East Front is a solitaire game of Combat on the Russian Front during World War II. The player assumes the role of a German commander of an Infantry Company during a German Offensive Operation to advance on a Key Soviet City. As the Company Commander, you are responsible for securing your Sector of Advance by successfully taking and holding key objectives with the least amount of casualties. Although there are many support units available to you, they may often times be limited to you by political, logistical or geographical obstacles.

GAME OBJECTIVE
The objective of Operation East Front is to successfully take and secure an number of key objectives and destroy enemy forces in order to gain Victory Points (VP) for the German Forces. Once all Objectives have been secured or the Campaign Deck is exhausted, the Campaign is considered over. The Player must then total his VP and compare this with the Victory Determination Table to determine the level of success.

You can find Opeation East Front at http://www.berserkergames.net
categories: Print & Play, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid

name: Elliot Moose Counting Game
description: Elliot Moose Counting Game is a game designed to teach numbers and test memory for young children. It can be played three different ways. The main game is called "Elliot Moose Counting Board Game." In this game, players roll a die to move their pieces around a track around the outside edge of the board. When they land on a space, they take the tile depicting a number or objects. They must then choose a face-down tile from the middle with a number printed on it. If the number matches, they keep the pair. If it does not match, both tiles are returned to their places and the next player takes a turn. When all pairs are claimed, the game ends and the player with the most pairs wins. Players can also choose to play "Counting Memory," which plays similarly but with the die and track removed. Players simply choose a tile from a stack and try to pick the face-down number tile that matches the number of items depicted on the card. Another option is "Guess Which Number!" where one number tile is hidden, the other are placed face-down and players take turns guessing which number is missing.
mechanics: Memory, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Math Bingo
description: Math Bingo is a twist on traditional Bingo designed to reinforce basic arithmetic skills. In this game, each player has a 4x4 card with a series of numbers. A caller reads a series of math problems (either addition and subtraction for younger children or multiplication and division for older). Players must solve the math problem and mark a space on their card corresponding to the answer. Once a player completes a row or column and claims bingo, the caller checks the math to make sure their answers are correct. If so, they are declared the winner. If not, incorrect answers are removed from the card and play continues until a player completes a row or column of correct answers.

name: The Great Dreidel Race!
description: The Great Dreidel Race is a roll-and-move game contained in The Great Big Box of Hanukkah Fun. Players use dreidels and playing pieces, rolling a die to move them along a track. Along the way, they may encounter a variety of spaces that will help or hinder them. Some spaces move the player forward or back, others may cause gain or loss of a turn, some move other players' dreidels, some offer shortcuts. When landing on a "spin" space, a player must spin his or her dreidel and move to the space corresponding to the Hebrew letter spun. If a player lands on another player's dreidel, the other player is sent back to the nearest space marked with a candle. The first player to reach the finish space wins.

name: Hurry Home!
description:
Hurry Home is a game designed to teach letter sounds to young children. It was published as part of a Scholastic Phonics Reading Program boxed set.

In Hurry Home, players must get Sound Hound home to his doghouse. Each player chooses a path, made up of a number of spaces marked with pictures, leading to the doghouse. Each player takes turns spinning a spinner marked with 0 to 3. The player then draws that number of cards from a stack of cards marked with words or pictures. The opposite side of the card shows the first letter of the picture or words. The player must then say the name of the pictured item or read the words (an adult facilitator may help with reading) and the say the letter. The player then looks at his or her path and places a marker on any picture that starts with that letter. If no matches can be found, the card is placed at the bottom of the pile. The first player to place marker on every space on his or her path brings Sound Hound home and wins the game.

name: Ujub või Upub kaardimäng
description:
There are 36 cards in Ujub või Upub kaardimäng (Floats or sinks cardgame).
Some of the items on the cards float, some sink if on water.
The cards are turned around one by one and player who first shouts correctly floats of sinks wins the card as a point.
If the deck is exhausted the player with the most cards is the winner.
categories: Card Game, Nautical, Party Game, Real-time

name: Hidden Treasures
description: In Hidden Treasures you have a set of legendary treasures you're seeking to find. Every player places one of these treasures face down on the table and all players begin to play Expedition cards in order to claim the treasures for their own. You know what you're after, but what are the other players after?? and can you beat them to it? Through clever card play and careful observation of other player's expeditions, maybe you can swoop in and get what they're after before they do!

name: Imbroglio
description:
Imbroglio is a fun, fast-paced tile laying game where the players are racing to escape an ever changing maze full of mythological beasts, natural disasters, and a handful of colorful characters who are also trying to be the first to escape. Each time you play, the game is quite different with custom characters, a lot of strategy, and a dash of luck.
Imbroglio is a game for 2-7 players and has multiple styles of play, from player vs player to players vs board. An average game can be played in 45-60 minutes, but with possible expansions in the future, games could be expanded to almost any length. The basic mechanics of the game are a mix of tile laying, resource management, and dice rolling.
Our original thought would be that the game would be targeted toward families or gamers who like mythology, strategy, and 'sticking it' to other players. That being said, the game is quite modular and could accommodate many different game genres!
categories: Dice, Exploration, Maze, Mythology, Print & Play
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Network and Route Building, Roll / Spin and Move, Take That

name: Plunder Straits
description: Plunder Straits is a pirate-themed strategy board game where players sail around a map, entering harbors and trading cargo for gold. Each turn, players draw Plunder cards which can benefit them by giving them extra turns or more gold or by increasing their ability to defend, attack, or move. Players can also attack other players and take their cargo, gold, or abilities for themselves. The first player to bury 50 gold and keep their Jolly Roger flying win the game.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Trading

name: Five Elements
description:
The era of this world is coming to a close. Before the planet collapses, we need you to extract the essence of the Five Elements so we can rebuild.

The game revolves around the idea of the Elemental Cycle: when elemental energies are used, rather than being depleted, they just change state.
Fire burns things, leaving only Earth.
Earth pours out springs of Water.
Water evaporates and becomes Wind.
Wind blows in storms with Lightning.
Lightning strikes and creates Fire.

This game's defining feature is the use of the "dice progression" mechanic. Each die has the five elements on a different face, with an arrow pointing to the next element in the cycle. During the game, the dice will be rotated, following the arrows, through the cycle of elements.

Use your dice to obtain cards, which in turn help you build clever combos to manipulate your dice even more. Align your dice and cards to get essence tokens. Whoever can collect essence of all Five Elements wins.

name: Battle of The Electric Vikings: Thrall – Vikingsweatlive
description: 10 new cards based on one of the designer's favourite metal bands, Danzig. With the new words you'll be making awesome Danzig songs like: Mother, Left Hand Black, and It's Coming Down.

name: Benedict Arnold Poker
description:
During the American Revolution, no officer on the rebel side was a better field commander than Major General Benedict Arnold. This has been overlooked for well over two centuries; nothing is taught about Arnold except his treason. The fact is: if not for him, the rebellion would probably have failed and its principal players hanged. If he had died at Saratoga instead of being seriously wounded, his legacy would have been nothing short of legendary. Cities, counties and perhaps even a state would be named after him. Statues of Arnold would be standing in parks nationwide and his monument would be visited by throngs of people in the District of Columbia every day.

Unfortunately, Arnold had enemies as well as supporters, and those enemies contributed significantly to his conclusion that the colonies were not yet ready for independence. In Benedict Arnold Poker, a breezy combination of poker and rummy, you will meet some of the men in each group, and Arnold himself.

[Note: this game is an unfinished, although playable prototype. - ASF]

name: Neuroshima Tactics: The Outpost – Assault Troopers II
description:
30 years ago...civilization as we know it was blasted to smithereens. Later we learned what happened - that it was the rebellion of machines, but back then it was pure chaos. Bombs vanquished cities and factories, architecture and culture, science and social etiquette. In the radioactive pyres, raging pandemics and chemical assaults an immense number of good people lost their lives. Today...the nuclear holocaust marks an end to taxes, school exams and insurance brokers, so there were some perks to all this mess.

Neuroshima Tactics is a dynamic skirmish wargame with immense tactical possibilities. It's a stealth shooter, with a twisted Mad Max vibe. Sneaking. Shooting. Neuroshima. Are you in? This is a 28mm tabletop based game. The English rulebook is available for free download online. "Tough guys in full battle gear: heavy guns, Kevlar armour and unquenchable thirst for battle. There's no room for wusses among their ranks - they are the strongest regular Squads of the Outpost, a true elite. They carry out the riskiest missions, defend the most important strategical spots, on front-end posts, where the enemy is superior in numbers. Hardened in the heat of battle and very experienced, they are key Outpost unit. They can break the enemy resistance in a flash, and hold the seized zones for indefinite amounts of time. They're great in defense - perfect in attack. They're awesome shooters, and even if they get hit, their sturdy armour and great Constitution allows them to push through more, than anyone else could take."

Assault Troopers II, The Outpost. Blister includes: 1 Assault Trooper 3 figure, 1 Assault Trooper 4 figure, 2 bases, 1 dual language location card & 5 counters.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Realms
description:
Six Gods have forged a world together from their elemental powers, and now vie to control them. Realms is a bidding and bluffing game for 2-6 players.

Each round, players bid for control of "Realms," cards that are selected for auction by the active player. The only currency players have is the cards in their hand (the same cards that represent the Realms for auction), but each of those cards also contains a scoring condition at the end of the game.

How will you use your cards? Will you bid them often and try to control as many realms as possible? Or will you pick your spots and focus on scoring in specific ways?

Players are pressured keep cards in hard for scoring and later bids, but they have to bid successfully to claim the Realms needed to make the scoring cards as effective as possible - all while setting traps and avoiding the traps of the other Gods.

Realms plays in about 10 minutes per player, and will be available in print-and-play soon. For questions, please contact the designer, JR Honeycutt.
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Civilization, Economic, Print & Play, Science Fiction, Territory Building

name: BBQ: Look at my awesome life
description:
THE PRINT AND PLAY VERSION CAN BE FOUND UNDER FILES
We would be grateful of any and all feedback

The local bbq is coming up.
Go and win at life by taking a picture that shows off your awesome life.
Or, at least, try to look better than your friends do.

Look at my awesome life is a short card game designed to have few rules but a lot of complex and meaningful decisions.
It is a challenging game, yet easy to learn and short to play.
Less experienced boardgamers are eased into a more complex game made less intimidating by it's inviting artstyle, short playing time and increasingly difficult playmodes.

The basics are simple. Players collect neighbors that are coming to the BBQ and place them in a line to form the most awesome picture.
Every round players choose a neighbor, the player that chooses the quickest goes first and:
-places his neighbor in a picture.
-uses that neighbors ability.
-selects a new neighbor to take into their hand.
When any player has 10 or more neighbors in his picture the game ends. The player who has the most awesome looking picture (points) wins.

The different cards are what makes this game interesting. Some neighbors look better than others, meaning they are worth more look-at-my-awesome-life (lamal) points. Other neighbors are faster or have better abilities. For instance, some let you take neighbors from another players hand or let you switch around neighbors who are waiting to have their picture taken.
This is useful as many neighbors only look good in the right spot. That hillbilly standing next to the BBQ with a jerrycan could make for an awesome picture, but not when a policeman or concerned mother is standing next to him...

Other playmodes introduce the option for fast neighbors to pick up stuff(cards), which can help your strategy in different ways and 'you'(cards), which reward you for having neighbors of a certain color. With these you get a game where there is no right play, only a right play for the situation!
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Simultaneous Action Selection, Tile Placement, Variable Player Powers

name: Anagramix
description:
Anagram is a type of word play, the result of rearranging the letters of a word or phrase to produce a new word or phrase.
On this game a card is drawn. All players, at the same time, should try to write as many words as they can using all the letters that are shown in the card. Whoever makes more words, gains more points!
Some words are easy to make, but there are others that will demand more knowledge and memory effort from your part.
A very dynamic and challenging game where you will want to defy your knowledge every time a new card is drawn.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Word Game

name: Export
description:
The players are merchants and travel the game board to establish branches by moving through or to the red marked cities. Movement is determined by a die, but only the odd numbers count! When a player moves through the branch of another player, he takes posession of this branch. But the other player may take any one of the first players branches for compensation. When all branches are set, the players return to their sparting space.
Winning Points are awarded for singele branches, 3 branches in an area, 2 or more nighboring areas with 3 branches und the order of return to the starting space.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: No Slots
description:
Educational game developed for "Libera" an anti-mafia association that wanted a game to educate people on which bar in Perugia city, Italy, were free from slot machines.

In this game a player is a gambler who is wasting all the money of his family gambling on slot machines of the city's pubs.

The other players cooperate all together moving family pawns in order to find him and sae his soul and the money of the family.

Twenty-five 3D Slot machines are placed in a 5x5 grid representing the city.

The gambler takes turns hiding the gameboard with a screen, and moving his pawn of one space. The pawn is always hidden inside a 3D slot machine. Each time he moves the pawn, he leaves one hidden gold coin below the visited slot machine.
On the family's turn, players cooperate choosing which family pawns to activate.
Family pawns stay among the 3D slot machines, on the intersections of the grid.
When activated, a family pawn may move one space OR search in a bar in the surroundings.
If searching, players can look below the chosen slot machine:

if they find the Gambler pawn, they win
if they find a Gold coin, they remove the 3D slot machine from the gameboard (several gold coins may indicate the current position of the gambler)
if they find nothing, they must put back the slot.


The gambler wins if he runs out of gold coins without being found.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Grid Movement, Memory, Point to Point Movement, Push Your Luck, Secret Unit Deployment, Simulation, Voting

name: Todos contra a Dengue!
description:
English:
In the game "All against the Dengue!" players must treat cases of the disease in cities and eliminate vector breeding Aedes aegypti for dengue and Chikungunya. They also have to deal with cases of Leptospirosis, caused by the urine of mice present in flooding.

To eliminate the breeding of Aedes aegypti, players will use cards and dice. For the treatment of diseases, players will use only dice. It is possible for players to improve the outcome of dice, with the acquisition of knowledge about the disease and the breeding of Aedes aegypti.

During the game, players must eliminate Aedes aegypti vector breeding and treat disease. The Cards round will add new scriadouros vector and new diseases. The aim of the players is tp decrease number of breeding vector and number of diseases, as low as possible. This way they can get a good evaluation at the end of the game.

The Aedes aegypti has caused many problems in cities such as the large number of cases and outbreaks of diseases. The lack of poorly trained infrastructure and public officials, makes the population has a very important role in the fight against Dengue, Chikungunya and leptospirosis.

Português:

No jogo "Todos contra a Dengue "os jogadores devem tratar casos da doença em cidades e eliminar o criadouro do vetor Aedes aegypti para Dengue e Chikungunya. Eles também têm de lidar com casos de Leptospirose, causada pela urina de ratos presentes em inundações.
Para eliminar a reprodução do Aedes aegypti, os jogadores vão usar Cards e também Dice. Para o tratamento de doenças, os jogadores vão usar apenas Dice . É possível para os jogadores melhorar o resultado do Dice, com a aquisição de conhecimento sobre as doenças e também em criadouro do vetor Aedes Aegypti.
Durante o jogo, os jogadores devem eliminar criadouros do vetor Aedes Aegypti e tratar doenças. As Cards de rodada irá adicionar novo scriadouros do vetor e novas doenças. O objetivo dos jogadores é dexar número de criadouros do vetor e número de doenças, o mais baixo possível. Desta forma, poderão ter uma boa avaliação no final do jogo.

O Aedes aegypti tem causado muitos problemas em cidades como o grande número de casos de surtos e doenças. A falta de infra-estrutura e os funcionários públicos mal treinado, faz com que a população tem um papel muito importante no combate à Dengue, Chikungunya e leptospirose.
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Point to Point Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: BOOMorBUST
description:
1940's America, Hidden Value Property Game

In the early 1940’s the Great Depression was finally beginning to ease. Americans were earning more and being able to buy more goods. In turn further fueling the economy!

The US Government made the decision to spend over half a million on making new and renewing properties to support this economy boom.

The government also introduced trespassing fees and crowding regulations due to the general panic of invasion, during the war.

You are one of four property tycoons who are trying to corner the market and make the best Real Estate Deals! It’s an all-out property war, it's BOOM or BUST baby!

Game Overview

The idea of the game is to move around the board and purchases property (hidden value) in an attempt to have the most money and combined property value by the end of the game (all property is sold).

Players have to be aware of their purchases to make sure they have enough money in the correct account to be able to pay bills and property purchases.

There are also various ways to exchange, trade or sell property. Plus there are three slightly different auction systems (Bank, Secret Bid and private auction) that allow players to bid on a property owned by the bank or other players.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Auction/Bidding, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Skyskraper
description: This is basically an unscramble-the-word game where score is kept on the board. The board depicts a skyscraper where players start at the ground floor and try to be the first to reach the penthouse. They do this with elevators, which are paths along the diagonals of the board. Advancement toward the penthouse occurs when words are successfully unscrambled. Players may be hindered, however, by having to take other paths around the skyscraper. And advancement may be helped or hindered by action cards obtained on various spaces around the board.

name: Ventures in the Void
description:
Opportunity abounds, proving the void is anything but. Players have a ship and planets have demands. It's up to the player to buy low, sell high, and try to bankrupt their opponents out of the sky.

Ventures in the Void is all about risk and reward. The unique double ended cards mean that each time a player transacts with a planet they increase the opportunities for opponents to reap huge rewards. Will they make their rendezvous in time to cash in, or will an opponent stick them with a customs inspection or labor disruption and delay them right out of their profits? Every credit matters when the first captain to make 300,000,000 credits wins.

Each player starts with a ship and a fist full of credits. Each turn players may play a trade card, move, and play an event card. Movement is based on the range of the ship and a player may move along the grid up to that range.

Trade cards are double ended with a supply and demand for a single planet. When a player transacts with a planet they play the end of the card that they are utilizing facing them and no other player may use it. The other end of the card is now available for all other players to use. Each player may only have two trade cards active in front of them at a time. New trade cards replace those that are in play, cutting off access to those deals.

Event cards either hinder opponents or give the active player an advantage. Events are resolved at the end of each players' turn.
Ship upgrades that extend range or cargo space are available for the duration of the game for a tidy sum of credits. Players must decide if the bonus will recoup the investment in time to edge out their opponents.

The goal is for each trade to double or triple a player's resource investment but with only two of the available trade cards in a player's control each transaction is a gamble.

name: The Banksters' Banquet
description:
Roll and move satirical political game.

From the publisher:

Understanding the global debt crisis is just one aspect of The Banksters’ Banquet board game, which is starting to go viral as friends spread the word about how the world really works. In the Supreme Court of Public Opinion nothing is more powerful than an idea whose time has come.

Follow the money, and players soon learn who is pushing the levers and pulling the strings that make world leaders dance in a propaganda puppet show of monetary magic. Former bank presidents, elected officials and leaders of industry provide historical quotes that challenge the status quo and serve to explain why the Occupy Movement is just getting started.

“It is well enough that the people of our nation do not understand our banking and money system. For if they did, I believe there would be a revolution before tomorrow morning.” - Henry Ford, founder of Ford Motor Co.

Role-playing as financial gangsters helps the 99% understand the motives and mindset of the invisible elite. The ultimate goal is financial control and a monopoly on currency creation for all major industrialized nations.

Confusing coincidences are exposed as clever strategies, designed to steal the wealth of the working class. Hidden secrets shaping modern society are revealed during a face-to-face contest for wealth and power.

It has been said that Dr. Ron Paul is the only candidate who can cure the cancer eating away at the heart of our great nation.
The creators of The Banksters’ Banquet board game are donating 10% of sales to support Ron Paul’s Presidential campaign. He appears to be the one candidate whose platform of sound money and personal liberty can save America from financial and moral ruin. The Fed’s quantitative easing programs have increased the national debt by trillions of dollars.

“The Federal Reserve has caused every single boom and bust that has occurred in this country since the bank's creation in 1913.” - Congressman Ron Paul, October 20, 2011

Alive Games is a new company based in the northwest US with a primary focus on educational products. Traditional board games bring people together in a relaxed setting to share a laugh and occasionally learn something new about each other and the society in which they live. This is the goal of The Banksters’ Banquet – a thinking game, wrapped in a classic work of cartoon art.

name: He-Man and the Masters of the Universe Spin Action Grayskull Game
description: The He-Man and the Masters of the Universe Spin Action Grayskull Game is a game included on plastic lollipop covers. Each player has a lever-actuated spinner showing various characters from Masters of the Universe. Each character has a point value (positive for good characters, negative for evil characters and higher values for more powerful characters). On his or her turn, a player spins and adds or subtracts the value of the character that appears in the window to his or her total. Each player must continue spinning until a positive value comes up. The first player to reach 10 points wins.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Lalaloopsy: Sew the Last Stitch Game
description:
From the rulebook:

Be the first to collect all the pieces to your "create a" Lalaloopsy doll and magically bring your Lalaloopsy doll to life then return home.

Lalaloopsy: Sew the Last Stitch game is a spin-and-move game where players must move their pieces along a track, landing on a series of spaces where they collect the various parts of their dolls. Along the way, they may encounter "move" spaces that allow them to move to any space on the board, "trade" spaces that allow them to trade places with another player and "skip" spaces that cause loss of a turn. Players may choose to move either forward or backward on each turn. The first player to collect all four doll pieces and return to the home space wins.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Getting Dressed
description: Getting Dressed is one of the games published in Math on a Roll, a book of number games using polyhedral dice. In this game, characters roll the two dice (a 20-sided and a 12-sided) and consult a chart in the book to try to completely dress their stick figure (drawn on a piece of paper). Underwear and socks must be put on before other pieces of clothing. Each piece of clothing requires a certain combination such as "Underwear--Blue odd, purple even" or "Jacket--Blue die is greater than the purple die." Many die rolls will allow more than one piece of clothing to be chosen, but only one piece may be added per turn, so players must choose which piece to add strategically. The first player to fully dress his or her stick figure wins.

name: Flip and Roll
description:
Flip and Roll is one of the games published in Math on a Roll, a book of number games using polyhedral dice. This game uses a 12-sided die and also requires a deck of cards with the face cards removed.

Each player takes turns choosing a math operation (addition, subtraction or multiplication). The player then flips over the top card and rolls the die. All players try to perform the math operation and shout out the answer first. The first player to correctly answer the question gets the card. Players who answer wrong cannot guess again until the next card. The first player to collect ten cards wins.

name: Poly-ingo
description:
Poly-ingo is one of the games published in Math on a Roll, a book of number games using polyhedral dice. In this bingo-based game, players choose either multiplication or addition and create 5x5 bingo-type cards using lists of numbers included in the book. Players may choose the numbers on their cards and their positions on the card. One player then rolls two dice (12 and 20-sided), calls out the sum or product and players mark that number if it appears on their card. The first player to finish a row of five, vertical, horizontal or diagonal wins.

The strategy in this game comes from where the players choose to place numbers on their cards. Since some numbers are more likely to be rolled, players may choose to place those numbers all in one row or column or in the center of the board where they can appear in horizontal, vertical or diagonal rows.

name: Kaisenyuugi: Twinkle Trick Spirit
description:
User summary:
One of three kinds of the Fairy cards are dealt to each player. You obtain a stronger Fairy card by cleverly exchanging your card for the card of other players, and then launch a battle. This game uses a rock-paper-scissor mechanic for the exchange of cards, with images of the Fairy's Changelings on the cards. The deck is a standard Poker deck size and the game is published in Japanese and English.

Publisher's summary:
３種類の妖精カードが１枚づつ配られます。 他のプレーヤーカードと上手に取り替え、強い妖精カードを手に入れバトルをしかけましょう。 妖精のChangelingをイメージした、カード取り替え式のジャンケンゲームです。

name: Reise durch Deutschland
description: This is a simple roll and move game. The players start their round trip in Hamburg and end it there. The first player to return to Hamburg wins the game. On several spaces the players get the usual rewards or penalities. On space 9 the player has to sing the song: „Ich weiß nicht was soll es bedeuten“. If a player gets on space 24 he ends his journey and stays in Nürnberg because he likes it there so much!
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Cards of Kink
description:
Cards of Kink is game for your naughty mind. It is a question and answer game inspired by Mad Libs, Apples To Apples, and Cards Against Humanity. The game is built with content focused on the Fetish/Kink community.

These are the draft instructions:

1. Deal Cards: Deal 10 Answer Cards to Everyone.
2. Choose a Card Dom: The person with the most subs at the table becomes the first Card Dom. Everyone else is a card sub.
3. Pick Master Card: The Card Dom picks a Question card and reads it aloud. This card is called the Master Card.
4. Create Submission Pile: All players, except the Card Dom, choose an Answer Card from their hand and pass it to the Card Dom.
5. Choose Cards: The Card Dom picks Answer Cards from the submission pile, and reads them aloud one by one.The Card Dom then chooses his favorite card. That Master Card goes to the player who submitted the favorite Answer Card. Each Question Card is worth one point
6. Choose a New Card Dom: The person to the Card Dom’s left becomes the new Card Dom.
7. Replenish and Repeat: Every player picks a new answer card. Then go to Step 3 for the next hand.

name: Paws: Devious Dogs versus Crafty Cats
description:
Paws: Devious Dogs versus Crafty Cats is an easy to learn 2-8 player casual card game in the style of great classic games like Rummy, Uno, Hearts, and Crazy Eights and can be played in as little as 15 minutes.

The object of the game is to be the first player to get rid of all the cards from their hand.

The deck is made up of Numbers and Colors. Each player is given 7 cards at the start of the game. On your turn you must play cards in a certain color and direction. It could be Higher or it could be Lower.
Now, some cards in the game can be played as the Number & Color OR as a "special action". These cards can affect the game in numerous ways. But, be careful with them as they can help you and they can also hurt you.

Watch out. The Devious Dog is lurking somewhere in the Draw Deck. He is a troublemaker. If you happen to draw him, you cannot win the game. You must try and find a way to get rid of him.

name: Valkyrie
description:
In 2050, the world is in chaos. Resources are drying up, military forces freely raid across international borders, and Valkyries, the most powerful war machines ever devised stride across the battlefields on every continent.

Valkyrie is a fast-paced miniatures solitaire board game played on a map. Each game takes roughly 15 minutes to set up and 1 to 2 hours to play. It can also be played collaboratively (multi-player vs AI) or competitively (player vs player).

You command a mix of giant Valkyries striding across the battlefield with your supporting elements of real-world military vehicles like M1 Abrams and T-80 tanks, Strykers, infantry, and more. Each nation fields its own unique mix of Valkyries and conventional vehicles.

The core game provides you with everything you need to command, or play against, the United States and Russian Federation.

name: Usagi Curry
description:
User Summary:
Usagi is Japanese for Rabbit, and in this game, players are competing to run the best curry shop. Curry rabbit, yellow rabbit, and brown devil rabbit try to serve the best combinations to win the most customers. Some customers want hot and spicy curry, some want sweet curries. Players draft cards to produce a three card set that appeals best. The cards have values and icons on them, by clever drafting and watching your opponents, you can really curry favour.

Publisher's summary:
カレーウサギは黄色いウサギ、褐色の魔王ウサギと
いつもカレーショップの経営を競っています。

プレイヤー達は手札である3枚のカレーカードをドラフトし、
一斉に1枚出してカレーの辛さである数値を競い合います。
数値が被るとバッティングとなるのでお互いに警戒して出し合います。
辛口が好きなお客には高い数値を、甘口が好きな客には低い数値を
それぞれ比べ合いお客を獲得していきます。
最終的に最も多くのお客を獲得したプレーヤーが勝ちます

name: Panzer Platoon: East Front – A Solitaire Game of WWII Armored Combat on the Russian Front.
description:
Panzer Platoon: East Front is a solitaire game of Armored Combat in Russia during World War II. The player assumes the role of a Tank Platoon Leader responsible for securing your Sector of Advance by successfully taking and holding key objectives with the least amount of casualties. Although there are many support units available to you, they may often times be limited to you by political, logistical or geographical obstacles.

GAME OBJECTIVE Panzer Platoon is to successfully take and secure a number of key objectives and destroy enemy forces in order to gain Victory Points (VP) for your Nation’s Forces. Once all Objectives have been secured or the Campaign Deck is exhausted, the Campaign is considered over. The Player must then total his VP and compare this with the Victory Determination Table to determine the level of success.

GAME FEATURES
Panzer Platoon Features many colorful counters and includes many combat units including PZ-IVf1s, PZ-IVf2s, PZ-V Panthers, PZ-VI Tigers, T-18s, T-34 and T-34/85s, KV-1s, SU-76s, SU-122s and a variety of Infantry, ATG and support weapons. Your Tank Crews have the ability to improve their ratings and gain Tank Upgrades.
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid

name: Labyrinth Auto Rennen
description: The players draw cards, which determines their starting points and destinations. On their way all players have to visit Wien and Bregenz. If they get on a red arrow, they have to follow the arrows direction. On passing a "P" (border checkpoint) they have to pay a coin into the cashbox. If they get on the "P" they have to pay two coins. The first player to return to his startinh point, wins the game and gets the contents of the cashbox.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Space Monsters!
description:
Space Monsters is a solitaire patience game in which you want to throw out all the monsters in a deck out to space where they belong. Powerful monsters can use abilities to try you patience. They can spawn more monsters and hide other monsters forcing you to try and find them again. In general, monsters mess up your progress!

Good thing you have your crew! Using your crew members special abilities, avoid monster penalties, uncover hidden monsters, and hunt for monsters you haven't found yet. Not all of your crew has special abilities though, so you need to keep them out of harm's way!

In Space Monsters, the goal is to throw out all the monsters in space, and keep your crew out of it. Do you have the patience for it?

name: System at War
description:
In the 22nd century eminent scientists and leaders of mankind realized that the earth had past the point of no return and the downward spiral of Earths conditions was going to leave it impossible to sustain the civilization of mankind beyond the century. A plan was conceived to send fleets of Terra forming ships with vast crews in cryo. The ships were to spend hundreds, if not thousands of years, searching the stars for a new system that could support mankind once more. One of those fleets arrived upon ‘Mu Area’ a system that surpassed expectations, providing a number of larger planets that could support life, colonization began.

Now many years on the colonies established have splintered, separated and developed their own societies. They each now take a stride to control the system and guide mankind to the future.

The play of the game takes place on a circular board with 3 rings that rotate around the star in the center at the end of each game round. You are able to research an extensive list of technologies, some unique to each player, build ships, colonize and conquer.

The start of the game sees an interesting aspect where the players actually create their own race with various advantages over each other. This gives you the option to try and forge your own style or hinder others.
Victory is achieved by proving your might to the other emerging empires and obtaining the most victory points at the end of 4 rounds of play.

Play is fast, lots of research, building and of course combat. The game takes approx. 3 hours to play with very little waiting or downtime.
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Fußball
description: The players play two halfs of 45 minutes. The game starts at space 50. The beginning player keeps the ball, till it gets on a space of the opposite color. Movement of the ball is determined by a die. Some spaces got special rules which correspond to the actual soccer rules. If a player gets the ball into the opponents goal, play resumes at space 50. The player, who gets the most goals wins the game.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: The Tower Of Babble
description: This is a co-operative game in which 2-8 players each select an 18 card deck of cards in one of 12 different languages (Arabic, Chinese, French, German, Greek, Hindi, Italian, Japanese, Navajo, Russian, Spanish, and Swahili). Players must select a language which with no one is familiar and read foreign words, giving clues through facial expressions and mime as to their meaning. Large wooden cubes are used to build a tower on the board (which is the inner part of the box).
mechanics: Acting, Cooperative Game, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Help Star Swirl Find the Valentine's Day Picnic!
description:
Help Star Swirl Find the Valentine's Day Picnic! is a simple My Little Pony-themed flip (a coin, that is) and move game published on the back cover of the children's picture book "Valentine's Day, Up...Up...and Away!"

In this game, players hope to be the first to move the length of the track and reach the Valentine's Day picnic at the end. Each player flips a coin and moves one space for heads and two spaces for tails. They may land on spaces that move them forward or back, cause them to lose a turn or return them to the start. The first player to reach the finish wins.
categories: Animals, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Big Bucks
description: Big Bucks is one of the games published in Math on a Roll, a book of number games using polyhedral dice. It is designed to help teach adding decimals to children. It is played with a 20-sided and a 12-sided die. In turn, players roll the two dice. The smaller number represents the dollars they gain, and the larger number the cents. Players take turns, adding up their totals and they go. After ten turns, the player with the highest total wins.

name: Unforgettable Flight!
description: This page does not exist. You can edit this page to create it.
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Children's Game, Exploration, Negotiation, Transportation, Travel
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Pick-up and Deliver, Set Collection, Team-Based Game, Trading, Turn Order: Time Track

name: A Colmeia: Micro-game
description:
English description:

A Colmeia - Micro-game (The Beehive - Micro-game) is a game reimplementation of A Colmeia.

In this game, players will have to leave with his bee his hive, and take 3 nectar the game board, and return to their hive. The first player to do this will be the winner.

To move your bee, use tiles of arrows that will make your bee walk through the board. There is also, at the end of your turn, choose 1 tile (Green, Yellow or Red) and put these Tiles in Tray. These Tiles, change the tempo of the game, adding new barriers and also giving some advantages to bees. You can also earn Nectar + 1, more trees or problems with pesticides.

Portuguese description:

A Colmeia - Micro-jogo é uma reimplementação do jogo A Colmeia.
Neste jogo, os jogadores terão que sair com sua abelha de sua colmeia, e pegar 3 néctares pelo tabuleiro do jogo, e voltar para sua colmeia. O primeiro jogador que fizer isso, será o vencedor.
Para mover sua abelha, utilizará tiles de setas que fará com que sua abelha ande pelo tabuleiro. Terá também, no final de seu turno, que escolher 1 tile (Verde, Amarelo ou Vermelho) e colocar estes Tiles no Tabuleiro. Estes Tiles, alteram o andamento do jogo, acrescentando novas barreiras e também dando algumas vantagens para as abelhas. Poderá também ganhar + 1 Nectar, mais árvores ou surgirem problemas com agrotóxicos.

name: Coin Horror
description:
Coin Horror is an abstract microgame for 2 players set in Myths of Cthulhu. Players must solve a case in the town of Arkham, and prevent at all costs the plans of the evil cultists.

To play you only need one board -from size of a coasters-, and a handful of coins.

In turn, players place coins on the board to score better than your opponent, while trying not to lose all the Stamina and Sanity. The game ends if any of these cases occurs:


The fourth coin of Doom is placed.
The two players can not put more coins or decide not to.
Both players are eliminated.


The player with more Clue (Victory Points) wins the game.

name: Auf dem Kriegspfade!
description: There are 9 red and 9 blue meeples in 3 different sizes. Each player has 3 meeples of the same color and size. The red meeples represent native American warriors of 3 tribes and the blue ones white settlers, cowboys and trappers. The players start at space 1 and try to reach space 70. Red and Blue travel in opposite directions on the blue or red path. On several spaces, there are special rules to observe, which are described in the game rules. The first player to get all 3 meeples to space 70 wins the game.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Static Capture, Track Movement

name: Batorque!
description:
User summary:
Known as バトルク！(Batoruku!) in Japan, Batorque! is a 2 player robot fighting game. The robots' actions are determined from a combination of cards and dice. By combining the dice rolls in different ways, players can use the card actions with various combos. And players can multiply or reserve effects with duplicate rolls or sequences.

Publisher's summary:
ダイスの出目を組み合わせて戦うロボット対戦ゲームです。
複数の出目を任意に組み合わせることで、様々な行動が可能となります。

name: ADJitation
description:
64 cubes with different adjectives on all sides and 13 family-friendly and gamer-friendly games to play with them.

ADJItation is fun, funny - and subtly educational. Shake the cubes in the ADJitator(box) and you are ready to play.

Some of the games that challenge your mental ADJility are:

Spin Cycle- keep spinning cubes until you hit a stumper.
Dirty Laundry - find out what your friends really think.
Air Dry - an air-writing amusement.
Lonely Launderomat - create and repeat your own urban legend.
Clothesline - name the next alphabetical noun in line.

name: Allons zo Zoo
description:
The game is to create a panorama of a visit to the zoo. All 30 cards that make up this scene are numbered. Each player gets 5 cards and the top card on the draw pile is revealed. This is the start card.

In her turn, a player must play a card (if she has one that fits) one before or one after the card on the table. Thus the panorama is created. At the end of her turn, whether she played a valid card or not, she draws a new card from the draw-pile. If there are no cards in the draw-pile, she ends her turn by drawing a card from the hand of the player on her right.

The Zookeeper is a Joker. Once played, if a player has the correct card which the Keeper has replaced, that player may play that card and take the Joker for herself. The Snake card acts like an Old Maid card in that whoever has it when the panorama is complete, loses.

name: Inspector
description:
The object is to collect the most possible of a complete “set” of cards in sequence before the Inspector turns up. A valid set of cards is either a;
Male Nudist + Shirt + Trousers + Tie + Shoes (M) + Hat (M) + Pipe
or
Female Nudist + Undies + Jumper + Skirt + Shoes (F) Hat (F) + Gloves.

METHOD OF PLAY
The dealer gives one unexposed card to each player, places the rest of the pack face down on the table and turns up the top card which is put face up near the pack.
In the event of the Inspector being dealt or turned up in this round (the first of any hand), the cards are reshuffled and the next player on left of dealer deals.
The player on the left of dealer must now choose two cards, the exposed one and one from the pack or two from the pack.
He then discards one, placing it face up on the exposed heap.
The next player does the same, until the Inspector is brought into play. On turning up the Inspector, the player must call “Inspector” at which all hands are exposed on the table.

SCORING
Player turning up “Inspector” counts “ 0 ” for hand.
The numbers on the cards headed by a nudist and in sequence, of the same set, are not counted.
But all cards not of the same set, and not in sequence, are added and scored against player.
If a player has two or more Nudists, 12 points is counted for each one after the first.

REMNANT CARD
Player holding “Remnant Card”, may call it any card except a Nudist, but if it is found in a hand, when inspected, not holding a Nudist, it counts 15 points against the player.

THE WINNER
The player with the least number of points after playing as many deals as there are players wins

name: Mutugo Nanakumi
description:
User summary:
６つ子７組 (Mutugo Nanakumi) (literally "Seven Sextuplets") is a set-collection card game. There are 42 cards with 7 ranks and 6 suits. You make collections of 3 or more cards of the same suit or rank and display them in front of you. A collection usually comes from your hand, but you can use one card from the table, including a card from a collection an opponent displayed. You may even disband a collection you previously displayed and make multiple collections or one bigger collection.

Publisher's summary:
"カードを取ったり捨てたりしながら、手持ちのカードを整えます。
既に取ったカード、場の捨て札、手札を組み合わせることで、カードを連続で取得することができます。"

name: Film Festival in a Box: The Interactive Movie Game
description:
Film Festival in a Box is the new interactive movie game that brings award-winning independent films into your living room! The game is easy to play, an intriguing conversation starter, and a fun way to entertain family and friends.

Players watch DVDs of indie movies and then vote on the best pictures or rank the films. Winner is the one with most individual matches to overall group votes.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game, Trivia

name: Modern Africa: Rules for modern skirmish battles on the dark continent
description:
Modern Africa is a set of rules to fight/refight battles on the dark continent in the 1960´s through the 1990´s. The majority of these battles were smaller scale fought between warlords or other dictators. The arms were either leftovers from an earlier era, state-sponsor (US or USSR) supplied, or black market purchased. These are not the latest, greatest weaponry and they may not even be welded by trained soldiers, but the goal was always freedom.
The game is played with 15mm miniatures.

name: Salamander Verkehrs-Zeichen-Spiel
description: The players begin at the parking lot near space 1. Movement is determined by a die. The first player to reach space 48 at the Salamander shoe store wins the game. At severaL spaces special rules are printed on the game board.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Wer kann lesen?
description:
Four games to learn reading.

Game 1 (alphabet game): Match upper and lower case letters.

Game 2 (caterpillar game): Find the matching words for given starting letters.

Game 3 (pictures and words): Find the matching words for given pictures.

Game 4 (pictures and letters): Create the words for given pictures.

name: Ernies und Berts Farben-Memo
description: Memory-type game with lots of characters from Sesame Street to learn matching colors and shapes.

name: Yippi
description:
A wild-west adventure with Benjamin Blümchen and his friends, Otto, Chief Black Feather and his daughter, Red Feather.

Twelve Cattle were stolen and must now be returned home. But the way home is hard to find: you turn right, then left and sometimes there is no way! You have to look closely and build the way anew, relocating the game boards if nescessary.

To play, the 16 large game boards are laid out in a 4x4 grid on the floor.

Each cattle is assembled by putting the die-cut cattle in a colored standee. Then, the cattle are randomly distributed between the players. All players start at the same spot on the grid, Mike Donalds Ranch.

On your turn, a player throws the die and moves his pawn along the way, one field for each pip. The goal is to reach the color-coded pasture, matching the color of one of his cattle. To do this, it is allowed to change the grid of game boards to open up new paths and maybe hinder the other players on their plans. The first player to place all his cattle in the right pastures wins the game!

name: Perfekt auswärts: Urlaubs-Französisch
description:
Learn first language ability with this game!

The game is played in four rounds. In the first round, you only use the cards 1 to 10 and the blue cardboard counters. Shuffle the cardboard counters face down. Give each player a card with a short phrase in french on it, the lowest number starts then. Pick up a cardboard counter and read the word aloud (it is written both in latin letters and in phonetics). Each player listens carefully, and says "yes" if he thinks this word belongs to his card. He then put the counter on his tray. If the sentence from his card is now complete, he reads it to the other players and gives a translation. The translation can be checked with the translation wheel. If it is correct, he keeps the card, otherwise the first player giving a correct translation gets the card. A round is played until all cardboard counters are gone. Then you start another round with new cards and new counters. Afer four rounds, the player with the most cards is the winner.

name: Der Smaragd des Maharadschas
description:
The game plays in the palace of a maharajah. It's a mixture of board game and role play.

A crime has happened: a smaragd was stolen. The players try to find out, what happened and which Person(s) have committed the crime.

Each player gets a character (Maharajah, Maharani, Guru, ...), and instructions on how to play their character.

There are 2 parts:

Moving a pawn around the plan of the palace by rolling a die to find objects.
Interrogate the other players to get more information.


Both should lead the players as team or against each other to solve the crime.
mechanics: Role Playing, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Vorsicht Stufe!
description:
Be the first to lay all your stair parts on the gameboard to win! A simple color and recognition game for younger kids.

Each player gets stair parts in different lenghts (10 with 2 players, 7 with 3 and 6 with 4). Spinn the color wheel and put one of your stair parts on the matching stair on the game board with exactly two persons step on it. It is possible that you can't place a any of your stair parts (no matching size, not able to match exactly two persons, not enough free space on the chosen stair). If so, you must collect all stair parts from the chosen stair. The player who has placed sucessfully all of his stair parts is the winner!
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Tile Placement

name: Suchen und finden
description: Charlie and Lola are always in the middle of the action! Lola likes to play with her friend Lotta, drinks strawberry milk or goes on a walk with Sizzles. Charlie likes to play soccer with his friend Marv or looks after his little sister. But what exactly is happening? Two spinners show which tile the players must find, as fast as possible! Whoever got six tiles, wins!
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Teenage Mutant Hero Turtles: Pizza-Memo
description:
Teenage Mutant Hero Turtles need their pizzas badly!

Shuffle the 16 pizza pieces facedown and lay them in a 4x4 pattern facedown on the table.

Each player gets a Turtle board with its 9 matching counters. On his turn, a player turns pizza pieces face up as long as they all are matching. He stops after the first different piece and turns all pieces facedown. Then it's the next players turn. If a player happens to find all four pieces, he fills his Turtle board with four of his nine counters. The second completed pizza only nets three counters, the third two counters and the fourth and last pizza only one counter. When all four pizzas are found, the pieces are shuffled and placed anew. The first player to place all his nine counters on his turtle board wins!
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Dora Tip & Flip
description:
Dora Tip & Flip a educative Memory game with a special flip mechanic based on the series character Dora.

There are some variants in playing:

Normal searching of pairs
Searching a Special pair given by a Card
Searching a Special pair given by the English Name on the Card.

name: Rot! Achtung! Ampel!
description:
A traffic game with dice and event cards.

Each player rolls the six-sided die and moves his pawn around the game board. At a roll of "1" you draw an event card and follow the instructions. At a roll of "6" you may roll and move again. The goal is to collect a picture card in each shop visited. Be the first to have 6 cards and win the game.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Benjamin Blümchen: Lern das ABC!
description:
Four different game variants to learn the alphabet with Benjamin Blümchen!

The games included are:

Color-Dominoes, where player have to match color-coded buffers of the waggons. If done right, the ape is in the first, the bear in the second, the chameleon in the third waggon and so on until the zebra in the last waggon. The player to match all of his waggon tiles first, wins.

Color-Memo, where the train build in the first game is used again. Here, the waggons are turned on the other sid, where only a color and a uppercase letter is visible. All players use now the pawn showing Benjamin Blümchen and a six-sided die to walk along the train. Where Benjamin stopps, the player must name the animal in the waggon. If correct, the player gets the matching card. When all cards are found, the player with the most cards wins.

A B C game. The waggons must be added in the correct sequence, the color-coded buffers are used for self-control. Can be played by one player or cooperatively.

Where is my waggon? Each animal wants to find his own waggon. All the waggons are shuffled and laid out in the middle of the table, showing only the backside. The cards are also used again here. A card is drawn and the animal on it announced. The player to the right of the card drawer is the first to try to find the matching waggon. If he is correct, he gets the card, otherwise the next player tries it. When all cards are found, the player with the most cards wins.
categories: Animals, Children's Game, Educational, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Chef, ärgere dich nicht!: Das Spiel um Wissen und Karriere
description:
This game is a party game. The story behind it is making career in your company. The career level is shown by the position of your figure in the company building.

You go your way up by rolling the dice and fulfilling your tasks. These tasks can be knowledge questions (getting harder the higher you come on your career) and actions. Both tasks are given by cards to be taken on action fields.

Actions could be e.g. making gymnastic lessons or kiss the other players.

name: Noah und die Tiere
description:
A memory game with a twist.

Shuffle the 40 tiles and place them facedown on the table. Get each player a board. On your turn, turn two tiles face up. If you find a pair of an animal or Mama Noah and Papa Noah, place them on your board. Else, turn the tiles face down and pass the turn. The first player to completely fill his board with Mama and Papa Noah and four pairs of animals wins the game.

name: Farben lernen
description:
Learn the colors and match them with pictures. Three learning games in one box.

Variant 1:
Three cards make a set. These sets are marked with a little animal (a bug). If you place cards of one set side by side, the bugs match each other, when placed correct.
Shuffle all 36 cards and place them faceup on the table. On your turn, throw the die. On 2, 4 or 6 take any one card from the table and place it front of yourself. On 1, 3 or 5 pass the turn to the next player. Try to collect all three cards of a set. No one may take a card belonging to a set started by another player. You may start a new set only after you finished a set. The game ends when all cards are collected. The player with the most cards in front of him wins.

Variant 2:
Memory - play with the 24 picture cards or with all 36 cards. If played with 36 cards, always turn up three cards and try to find the matching triplets.

Variant 3:
I spy with my litte eye something ... Use the color cards to determine the color to spy and use the chips as victory points.

name: Kampf um Wildpferde
description:
Each player has 4 cowboys in 4 colors (each player the same).
A player start with 1 field diagonal movement each turn.
After the player has reached special marked fields with all 4 cowboys, he now moves like the chess horse trying to get on the field were the wild horses are placed at the begin of the game.
Reaching one of them he brings it with the same kind of moves back to his ranch.

There is one White Mustang on the field this can be caught by one Player in the same way after bringing 3 wild horses back to the ranch.

Game ends after a preset number of rounds.

Wild horses in the ranch 10 Points, on the way to the ranch 5 Points, White Mustang in the ranch 20 Points.
Special rule: The Player has to choose a different Color as the openent had chosen on his last turn.

name: Our Town Trivia: Camp Rockwood
description: Players move around the board and must answer trivia questions from one of four color categories matching the space they are on, for the level (1 thru 5) they are currently on in order to continue their turn. If space is indicated as a bridge, advance to the next level. Correctly answer a Level 5 question and win the game.

name: Spaßvogel Spiel: Städteflug-Spiel
description:
Spaßvogel Spiel is a role-and-move game.
The track has 3 parts.

Each Player has to collect a full set of city Cards to get in the next part of the track (1st and 2nd part).
There are fields with the city names. Each time a player hits one of these fields he gets one of the cards of this city.
Due to the fact that the number of cards of 1 City is limited the player gets the card from another player if he knows who has this card.

The third part is only a short part to come to the finish field.
There are some special event fields (fixed events and card driven). Cards are for example: Joker city-Card, Exchange city-Cards, has to skip 1 or 2 turns.

name: Zingeln
description:
A exciting encircle game for 2 players played in a 4x4 grid with a few special spaces.

The aim of the game is to encircle the opponent in 21 turns so that he is unable to move.

Setup:
The five blue pawns are set up in the 4x4 grid in the spaces with a single circle at one corner of the board. The green pawn is started in the opposite corner in a space with a double circle. This circular field markings apply only to the starting positions.

Movement:
The player with the green pawn starts and counts his turns. He may move orthogonality (forward, backward, up or down) and diagonally. The blue pawn may only move move orthogonality. Turns are take alternately, moving always only one pawn. Skipping over another pawn is not allowed.

Object:
The player with the blue pawns must now try to encircle his opponent so that he can not move anymore. If he can do that in at last 21 turns, he's the winner. Otherwise, the other player has won.

Trivia:
"Zingeln" is a non-existent short form of "umzingeln", meaning encircling in german.

name: Mein erstes Rechnen
description:
Learing by playing, that's fun!

variant 1,2: Memory. Match the number card with the picture card showing excatly this number of items. In the second variant, use the plus card also.

variant 3: Place the 12 number cards faceup on the table. Shuffle plus and minus cards into one stack. On your turn, draw a card from the stack and read one of the tasks on it to the next player, clockwise. If he can solve the task by pointing to the correct number card on the table, he gets the task card, otherwise the next player has a chance to solve it. Whoever gets to solve six tasks first is the winner!

name: Ruck und Sack: ein Aufstieg mit Haken
description:
In this game the players climb a mountain.
The mountain is a 3D pyramid, build out of 4 triangles.
This mountain has many holes, which are connected to a net of paths. Each hole is marked with a colored ring around.
On players turn he rolls a dice, and decides which path he wants to go with exact this number of holes.
If there is already a hook placed, he can hang his backpack (marks the players positon) on this.
Is there is no hook he has to make an action or answer a question (dependent on the hole color). If he was successful he can place a new hook and place his backpack on it.
For some cards and wrong answered questions the player gets garbage.
To win the game, the player must had climbing on all four sides of the mountain (called 4 seasons of the year) and reach the Peak cross first. This is only allowed if the player has no garbage. The garbage can be reduced with some of the actions done or some Kind of questions answered. Sometimes just with getting the right card on the action Points you reduce garbage.

For more than 4 players there is a team rule included.

name: Modern Africa: Scenario Book 1 – Somalia Intervention
description:
Modern Africa is not a great period for any of the so-called superpowers. No one has been able to pacify or even influence for any length of time events in Africa. As stated in the rules, Modern Africa, generic is the key with a tribal mindset against the big green (or red) machine. When time has passed, only the Africans are left in Africa. So, with this in mind, let´s move on this set of seven scenarios based on the book "Blackhawk down".

And good luck on those morale rolls!

Scenarios include:
Raid, The Gauntlet, Cornered, Defense of Crash Site Super 6, Blackhawk Down Campaign Game, Embassy Evacuation, and Overland Embassy Relief.

Special Rules cover:
Body Armor, Night Vision, Off-Board Artillery, Airstrikes, Hostages, and Helicopters.

name: Modern Africa: Scenario Book 2 – Marine! Intervention Operations in the Third World
description:
Modern Africa continues to be the world´s weak sister. Unable to govern themselves and ungovernable from without, Africa stands as an enigma. The scenario book that James Meldrum has put together is a superb collection of "what if", thought provoking gaming possibilities.

And good luck on those morale rolls!

Scenarios include:
Beach Head Assault 1 and 2, Embassy Raid, Ship Rescue, Recovery of a Warship, POW Rescue, Installation Raid 1 and 2, Urban Hostage Rescue, Embassy Relief and Arctic Confrontation.

Special Rules cover:
Elite Troops, Body Armor, Night Vision, Off-Board Artillery, Airstrikes, Hostages, Helicopters, Hostile Casualties, Terrain, Snipers and Amphibious Landings.

name: Modern Africa: Scenario Book 3 – Tears: SEAL Operations in Nigeria
description:
Modern Africa continues to be the world´s weak sister. Unable to govern themselves and ungovernable from without, Africa stands as an enigma. The scenario book that James Meldrum has put together is yet another superb collection of thought provoking gaming possibilities.

And good luck on those morale rolls!

Scenarios include:
Doctor Evacuation, Encounter with Militia, Ethnic Cleansing, Initial Skirmish, Main Battle, Retreat to the Border, Battle Campaign, and Campaign.

Special Rules cover:
SEAL Team Detachment, Body Armor, Night Vision, Off-Board Artillery, US Navy Airstrikes, Hostages, Nigerian Army Casualties, Hidden Movement, and Silenced Weapons.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Modern Warfare, Wargame

name: The Board: Fantasy skirmish wargame
description:
The Board: Fantasy skirmish wargame.
Chapter One: The Frondglaucous Conflict.

In a world of God and mortals, several races fighting for control of The Triple Gift. Make a band of humans, dwarves, ugris, samaris, egir, sorgoins (snake-humans), alares, mercenaries...

In this chaptes you can use both dwarves and ugris.

name: Capital Edition
description:
From the rules:
"Capital Edition is designed to help you enjoy Washington, D.C. before and after you visit."

Capital Edition is a roll-and-move trivia game designed to teach players about Washington, D.C. Players start at the beginning of a track printed around the outer edge of the board. On each turn, they roll the die and move along the track, landing on one of many types of spaces. On a monument space, the player gains the trophy card for that monument. A Metro space allows a player to move to any other Metro space. A Tourmobile space allows movement to any monument, but the player must answer a question from a Challenge card to win a trophy card. On a challenge space, the player draws a challenge card and asks another player the question. On an incorrect answer, that player must return a trophy card to the board. On a take a card space, the player must choose a card and answer the question to continue. There are also roll again and lose a turn spaces.

Players' turns end in one of four ways--answering a question incorrectly, answering three consecutive questions correctly, winning a trophy card or landing on a "lose a turn" square.

Players continue to circle the board until one player collects trophy cards for all four monuments, winning the game.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Trojan Challenge
description:
Developed by University of Southern California Alumni, Trojan Challenge is a Monopoly-type game where players move around a track, landing on activity spaces which represents conferences, exhibits, performances, athletic contests and other events at the university. When a player lands on an activity space, he may purchase that activity for the designated cost. He may then purchase up to two upgrades (which are called "reserved tables," "group reservations," etc.) either immediately or on a later turn. When other players land on these spaces, they must pay the owner the amount designated on the card.

A few extra wrinkles are added. Detour spaces place a player onto an alternate track when they are landed on. "Go Trojans Go!" and "We Are SC" cards can give players extra money, take away money or offer other benefits or detriments. Parking Lot spaces cause loss of a turn, and various other spaces may increase or decrease the player's money total. Passing the start space, unlike in Monopoly, costs the player $600.

Players start with $6000 each (tracked on paper--no paper money is included) and try to gain funds as they play. Landing on other players' spaces forces a player to pay them a designated amount. If a player cannot pay, he or she may sell any assets owned to other players or give them back to the bank for half value. If still unable to pay in full, the player is out of the game. The game can be played to one of three pre-agreed ending conditions--a time limit, until one or more player are eliminated or until only player is left. The player with the most money wins.

Optional rules allow a player to move another player back to the starting space by landing on their pawn and allow for discounted purchase of upgrades on spaces if matching sets are collected.

A metagame rule governs the use of a "Trojan Gold" space. If a player lands on this space and agrees to donate a pre-determined amount of real (not in-game) money to the real University of Southern California, he or she gains an upgrade to place on any owned property.

name: dishes
description:
User summary:
ディッシズ (dishes) is a postcard game from Spieldisorder. Alex the cat is working hard today as a waiter at the restaurant Uoza-tei. Suddenly, the waiters collide, and all the dishes go flying up in the air! Alex races to catch them on his tray before they hit the floor. Can he save the best dishes?

This is a postcard game, and can be played by one person or others working together (typically it's for two players). You hold the postcard like a tray with one hand, and flip chips in the air to try and catch them on the tray. The tray has scoring positions for 5, 3 and 1 points. Can you get the perfect score of 18 points? The game is printed as a Japanese postcard, a new style of game introduced at the Tokyo Game Market in Autumn 2014.

Publisher summary:
ネコの”アレックス”が働く「うお座亭」は、今日も大忙し。そんな中、ウェイター同士がぶつかって、お皿が宙を舞う。果たして、アレックスはお皿を上手に受け止めることが出来るでしょうか？日本の葉書に印刷された、ポストカードゲームです。
publishers: シュピールディスオーダー (Spieldisorder)

name: Benedict Arnold and the Northern Theater
description:
An insightful strategist and leader of men, Benedict Arnold was the true hero of the Battles of Saratoga in 1777, which resulted in a formal alliance with France and the turning point of the American Revolution.

Operating in the Northern Department (the northern theater of the war), Arnold worked tirelessly in the cause of liberty for years. If he had died at Saratoga instead of being seriously wounded, his legacy would have been nothing short of legendary.

Benedict Arnold and the Northern Theater is designed to provide players with a neglected yet important slice of history -- and, using the Do or Die Roll(TM) game system -- an easy-playing, exciting gaming experience for both experienced wargamers and newbies alike.

Now in development with a well-known, respected publisher!


Update 1/9/18: unfortunately, for various reasons the production of this game has been canceled. There may be some interest from another publisher, so cross your fingers. Meanwhile, I've uploaded all the files to the game as print-and-play.
categories: American Revolutionary War, Print & Play, Wargame
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Dice Rolling

name: Das Superhelden-Riesenspielbrettbuch
description:
The book has a compartment for game token and an electronic die.
The following simple roll-and-move-games:

Die Spinne ist Spider-Man
Die Fantastischen Vier (The Fantastic Four)
X-Men
Wolverine
Die Rächer (The Avengers)
Der unglaubliche Hulk
categories: Children's Game, Comic Book / Strip, Racing
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: President Wars
description:
Get your underground edition of President Wars! Contains our new set of rules.

Kickstarter Exclusive card deck for the game - This deck will never be sold to the general public.

President Wars is a card and dice game that takes the traditional game of war and transforms it into a battle of epic proportions. The deck contains every president from George Washington to Barack Obama. Each president is given a hit point value based on Crisis leadership, public persuasion and overall performance as president (data taken from C-Span Presidential Leadership Survey)

Easy to learn and fun for all ages young & old and with so many card combinations this game has unlimited replay value and should never be the same game twice. Every battle brings together a different era in American history.

name: Samuel Sandwich
description:
A Gentleman's Game Of Cannibalism

Players take on the role of wealthy victorian era socialites and compete through braggadocious storytelling to determine who is the most interesting person. The only problem is that when money is no object what could you possibly wager with? Well winning a hand in Samuel Sandwich may be more literal than you might think.

Samuel Sandwich is designed for 2 to 4 players
