The game consists of cards, playmats, counters and coins.

Each player is dealt a hand of “doings & deeds” cards each of theses cards has a selection of color coded words which are used to construct a story. These cards also contain a custom Samuel Sandwich suit and a point value so that at the end of each round your point total can be determined.

At the beginning of the round a “consorts & cohorts” card is flipped to reveal a famous historical figure. This person will be the subject of everyone’s story as they try to outplay each other. There are 2 wagering rounds one when the “consorts & cohorts” card is revealed and then again when players select and place the cards they will be using face down on the table.
after wagering is resolved players take turns revealing and telling their story to the group. After everyone has told their tall tale the points are added up and the winner takes the money bet during this round as well as all cards played during the round (minus their own).

Feeling hungry?

Winning A Hand
After winning a round a player may then select one part of another player to eat. The correct counter is removed from that persons player mat and is placed in the stomach of the round winner.

Trading In
Players may also trade in 10 doings and deeds cards they have won from other players to select an additional part to eat.

Selling Off
If a player finds themselves low on funds at any time in the game they may sell off a part to the highest bidder in order to replenish their financial stockpile to continue wagering.

At the end of the game the player who has eaten the most is declared the winner.
The key to success is not what you eat, it’s who you eat and how much!

name: Be a Hero
description:
Each player is one of the warriors to win this competition.
In order to achieve a wish or a warrior lays out to prove their strength.
Players use the cards that make up your own warrior and harmony to create the ultimate warrior hero to subdue the other people.

Defeat the monsters to get the treasure, and you can buy the equipment in a store for the treasures you collected.

The equipment will be the key for a player to success.
Treasure card consists of mounting the card and passive cards, trap cards, counter cards.
By combining these cards you can create your own unique tactics.

name: Rasslin' Strategy
description:
Rasslin' Strategy is a 1990 pro wrestling card game by Mike Besky that normally requires (if not using an alternate rule) that the game be played WHILE wrestling is on, specifically wrestling that neither player has seen yet (original airdates, PPVs, etc).

The cards, which are moves like Choke, Bodyslam and Dropkick, are realistically and competently illustrated black and white images with a few rules and values that are used to resolve success and score points. Gameplay involves playing cards from your hand that match those being performed in the currently playing matches on your television (if the match you're watching has Shawn Michaels using a dropkick, you can play Dropkick).

The goal is to pin your opponent of course, by playing the correct cards/sequences to end the match.
categories: Card Game, Fighting, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Sports

name: Spaß am Lesen
description:
"Reading is fun" is the game for 1st and 2nd graders.

There are 81 picture cards, 34 word tiles and 140 letters.

One of the variants:
Players must take the word tiles and find the letters from the table needed for those tiles. If all letters are found, the picture card must be find. Who is the first to find certain number of picture cards is the winner.

name: Spaß am Rechnen
description:
"Computing is fun" is the game for 1st and 2nd graders.

There are 48 puzzle cards: 24 with numbers and 24 with images.

In his turn player takes any number tile and must find the image tile with same number of elements. If correct take the tile as a point, if incorrect put both tiles back. If all tiles are taken who has the most tiles is the winner.

May be played also as a Memory.

name: Yowza!
description:
From the publisher:

Zap, Zoom, Boom, Bam, Wham... Yowza! You Gotta Say It to Play It in this quick discarding game. Chant along, and if the card you discard matches the word you just chanted, then you get stuck taking the discard pile! If you discard a "wild" card, you get to keep going... but at your own risk! Just be sure you're the first to get rid of all your cards so you can be the winner... Yowza!

name: Travelling Goose
description: Roll the die, get through the obstacles and be the player whose goose passes first the finish line!

name: Stapel Gekkies
description:
Variant 1:
Everybody takes the cubes in his color.
Make one central pile, everybody puts one cube on the pile. When it falls, you take your cube back. Other cubes stay in the middle.
Then start a new pile.
The first player that has no cubes left this round and gains one point.

Variant 2:
The start player builds a construction with his cubes.
Then the other players try to rebuild this one. The first player to achieve this receives one point.

The game challenges you to invent new variants whith these cubes.

name: Whirly's World
description: Glide along the trail rolling dice, completing odd & even cards & gathering Whirly tokens. The first snail to join Whirly in the center of the garden wins the game!

name: Komm, wir ziehen nach Bethlehem!
description:
A Christmas-themed racing game for children.

The four (yes, four!) wooden Magi are placed on a table or on the floor, about a meter from the pieces representing Mary, Joseph and baby Jesus. At the start of the game, each player is secretly assigned a color, and to win he/she has to be the first to move the wise man of the corresponding colour to the Holy Family. Movement is decided by rolling a die and moving a king the length of a wooden camel piece. Players can move their own wise man as well as those of other players. Give your colour away too soon and you risk that the other players move you back!

name: Mensch freue Dich!: Das Quadriga Rennspiel
description:
Each player starts with four horses. The first player to get all his horses behind the finish line wins the race. If a horse gets on a space already occupied by the horse of another player, it sends this horse back to the starting line. Horses on a space of their own color are safe. Several horses of the same color may occupy the same space. If a player rolls a 1 he may roll again.

If the players chose to bet on the winner of the race, the winner of the game is the player who won the bet. Since the bets are revealed only after the end of the game, the players can hinder or favor their favorite to influence the outcome of the race.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Der Teufelskreis
description: Each player receives the same number of meeples (4, 5 or more). At the beginning of the game, a pawn is placed on each of the spaces 1-5. If a player rolls the number of an occupied space, he must take away the pawn. If the space is free, he may put a meeple there and rolls again. If he rolls the devil's head, he may put a pawn on the inner space. No pawns is taken away from this space. The first player who loses all his pawns, wins the game.

name: Wer hat, der hat!
description: At the beginning of the game, four token are placed on every colored body-circle of the eight figures on the game board. The players start from the circle of their color in one of the four corners of the board. If they get on a colored body-circle, they get to stack one of the token on their playing piece. On a circle of his own color, the player takes all token on the circle. If a player gets on a space that is occupied by another player, he gets all the token from his playing piece, which is then returned to it's starting circle. The captured token can be brought back to the safety of ones starting circle. The game ends when all body-circles are empty and all playing pieces have returned to their starting circles. The player, who catures the most token wins the game.
mechanics: Pick-up and Deliver, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Dearg Due
description:
Long before famous Irishman, Bram Stoker, penned his famous novel, the vampire stalked the night in the Emerald Isle. The Dearg Due is Ireland’s original vampire. A woman of stunning beauty, the Dearg Due was forced into a marriage to a man she didn’t love by her controlling father. Distraught about never being able to be with the man she truly loved, she killed herself, but death could not hold her in the grave. She rose up and exacted revenge on her father and husband, and drained their bodies of blood. Now, she rises from her grave in County Waterford to spread her curse upon the land.

Her vampire minions must drink in the counties of Ireland, vying to become the top vampire of all the island. Or, choose to be a werewolf and try to thwart the vampires.

Gampeplay
The gameplay is designed so that the game is interesting and fun, even for those not drinking, but simple enough that people who are drinking can play the game. The game will still be quite enjoyable if the drinking aspect is omitted entirely.

Goal
The first player to reach 25 victims, and make it safely back to the Waterford Cemetery, wins the game.

Players travel from adjacent county to county (or by train, if they wish to skip to a different part of the island). They then roll the dice to determine how many victims they will get that night (if any). Drinks are determined by the number of victims. The players may also attack each other.

If the players wish, one player may take on the role of the werewolf, whose mission is to kill all of the vampires.

name: Match 'em! Subject-Verb Agreement
description: A card game of rummy in which players form correct subject/verb agreement combinations of two or more cards. Reinforce language arts skills with this 60 card deck.

name: Silvanus
description:
Silvanus is a co-operative 2 player card game in which players are spiders with human like battle tactics. The goal is to survive to game end, possibly carrying remaining health to a more challenging scenario. Threats deal a sequence of colored card icons which must be matched in a given time for success. This is accomplished with small icon decks called "Halots".

Action action decks contain either enemies or Items that can be gathered to help in encounters. At certain points of the game, "Happenstance" cards will sometimes hinder players actions whereas Character cards present helpful traits.

Silvanus is a versatile game, many of the components can be added or adjusted to fit a desired difficulty for players. There are optional modes of play such as allotted moves instead of real time play, and more. Short story snippets are included in the rules to give players a glimpse of Silvanus lore.

name: Aqua Brunch: The Sea Dragon Promo Card
description:
The Sea Dragon is a promo card for Aqua Brunch.

Shuffle the Sea Dragon in the predators deck. The Sea Dragon is a predator with Strenght 10.

It can be kept in hand or passed like any other predator. At the end of the round, if the player who has the Dragon scores the highest sum, he/she will choose the food first. Otherwise he/she will be the last to choose, regardless of his/her outcome.

name: Brainy Bear Learning Games
description: Brainy Bear Learning Game is an educational game for young children. It is designed for 2, 3, 4, or 5 children of kindergarten age. This version is designed to enhance verbal and reading skills. Players advance along a pathway by responding correctly to flash card cues. The board has a travel theme with automobile graphics. The first child to reach the finish line (a garage at home) is declared the winner.

name: Eine Harzreise
description: The round trip begins and ends in Wernigerode. The winner of the game is not the player who ist the first to return, but the one who vists the most cities and landmarks. This is achieved by collecting points at the spaces marked with the number of points awarded. If a player gets on a big red space, he has to follow the blue path, till it leads back to the main red path.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Rapax
description:
From the introduction:

These Ancient Wargaming rules are a set of tactical simulation rules for miniatures, which allow players to recreate and fight, historic or hypothetical battles which occurred from the rise of organised warfare to the beginning of the age of gunpowder.

The rules are set out in detailed format, divided into logical chapters, and sub-chapters. In the rear are a set of charts and tables most frequently used, thus saving time and trouble when playing.

name: Lemons
description:
When life gives you Lemons... make lemonade!

Lemons is a card game where each Lemon card is played in front of a player and it counts as a minus point, but if a player gathers 3 matching Lemon cards he makes Lemonade and the 3 negative points become 1 positive point. So keep an eye on his Lemon stacks and make sure you don't play a 3rd card of the same type.

Each type of Lemon card in front of a player allows that player to play cards on his/her turn in a particular way. Which can be to his left or right, straight across or on his own stacks. On a player's turn he/she must choose one of the Lemon card stacks in front of him/herself and play cards as allowed by that card.

To add a bit of suspense, when a player legally chooses to play a card in front of themself, it may be placed face down in their secret stash. When the game ends, these cards are added to the face up stacks, so you might not know how many pitchers of Lemonade have been made by a player until it's time to... drink up.
mechanics: Hand Management, Memory, Set Collection, Take That

name: Treasures of the Hidden Tomb
description:
Welcome Archeologists! This tomb has been recently uncovered by a freak sand storm. It’s up to you and your rival archeologists to traverse the long forgotten tunnels, defeat monsters, and search for the vast treasures beyond your wildest dreams Before the tomb is once again lost to the sands of time.

On each turn, a player rolls 1d6 to determine their movement to explore the tomb. The tomb itself is broken down into 3x3 square tiles that you draw randomly and add to the map as you go. Sometimes you might find a monster Hiding in the halls. These monsters are hoarding the treasures for themselves and it's up to you to defeat them by rolling a higher dice roll than their power level. Once the monster is defeated you get the treasure for yourself. Some of this treasure may help you in your adventure, or be a curse that hinders your progression.

Be careful though. The tomb is only open for a limited time and anyone can trigger the collapse. Once the tomb collapses you have a limited amount of time to get back to the entrance. If you make it out then congratulations, count up your treasure. The archeologist with the most treasure wins! If you don't make it out, sorry about your luck. Maybe someday the tomb will be uncovered again and a future archeologist will find your corpse among a pile of valuable treasures.
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement

name: Princess Escort: Magic & Machine
description:
User summary:
Princess Escort 魔法と機械 (Princess Escort - Magic & Machine) is an expansion to Princess Escort. It adds new professions; the witch and machine soldiers. Six new cards are added to the base game, making conversation and voting more dramatic. There are also new matching tokens and a manual to explain the new powers.

To play Princess Escort - Magic & Machine, you require a copy of Princess Escort. Princess Escort - Magic & Machine cannot be played on its own.

Publisher summary:
PRINCESS ESCORTの拡張となります。新たな職業[魔法使い]と[機械兵]６種が加わり、より会話と投票が劇的になります。
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Secret Unit Deployment, Voting

name: Bibelbingo & Bibelmemory
description: Bibelbingo & Bibelmemory has two games in the box. Bibelbingo is a variation of bingo, but with bible characters, where every player gets one of the 25 bingo cards. Every card having 16 characters from the bible on them. One person draws one of the 36 characters that are in the game, explain who that is, and then all players puts a marker on that character if they have in on their own bingo card. The goal is to get a line of markers on the card. The second game in the box, is memory (Concentration), with a bible theme.

name: Pound Puppies Runaway-Roundup Game
description:
From the box:
"The Pound Puppies are on the loose trying to avoid the dogcatcher and a stretch in the city pound. As Pound Puppies are collected the cards are inserted into holders which are specially designed for small hands to grasp. The player who is the first to collect all the puppies pictured on his/her card holder will be a doggone hero and winner of the game."

Players start with 4 dog cards in their holder. The remaining cards are shuffled and placed in the center of the table. One card is flipped over next to the deck to start the discard pile. Players can choose a card from the discard pile or the deck to add to their holder. They must exchange this new card with one in their holder. If the dogcatcher card is drawn the player must discard all of their cards and draw new ones. The first player to match all the dogs on their holder with drawn cards wins.

name: Oh Snap! A 'Blank Cards With Text On Them' Game of Insults
description: Oh Snap! is a game for three or more players in which the players have a hand of cards. The goal is to create the best insults and retorts that include the phrases on the cards in your hand. Two of these players put down the cards they want, and the rest of the players vote on which one they like the best. The first player to reach an arbitrary number of points is the winner.

name: Monorail
description:
A grid of tiles are placed face-down with four stations in the corners. Players in turn take a face-down tile into their hand and choose to play it or a reserve track tile face-up in the position just vacated. The tile can be rotated in any direction they choose. Each player holds a secret hand of routes from station to station. When their routes have been completed, they are the winner.

A light tile placement game for fans of Ticket to Ride and Tsuro. Simple enough for children 5 and up.

Similar in mechanics to Indigo.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Card Game, Children's Game, Trains

name: Mini Copa
description:
A BOARD GAME CREATED FOR SOCCER AND GAME FANS ALIKE!

Mini Copa is a soccer board game where you can play with the athletes behaviour and skills in a realistic and simple way, Each new play benefits from your good technical eye and an athletes’ sense of opportunity.

The mechanics of the game is broad enough to represent anything that can happen in a live soccer match. Each player, in alternating rounds, can use different actions with his team in an agile manner, while deciding to focus on the technical, physical or psychological aspects of the sport. These choices allow the development of teams with very varied personalities.

The board game will begin in a more basic form, with four national teams and rules to play endlessly unique matches. But, with the help of additional goals, we can unlock and release the game’s full fledged potential by means of the campaign mode, in which the rules for managing the entire technical and administrative team, including trainings, casting athletes, managing the teams resources, fully customizable teams and even stadiums construction will be out allowing a hugely expanded strategical and tactical options in the best and definitive soccer game ever made!

NOTE: WE ARE CURRENTLY UNDER A CROWDFUNDING CAMPAIGN ON: https://www.sibite.com.br/ViewCampaign.php?cid=63

Check out the project in english and english subtitles as well! Don't forget to invest and share!
mechanics: Acting, Action Queue, Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Simulation, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: Arcasam: Beat The Dragon
description: Arcasam: Beat The Dragon is a strategy role-playing game for 2 - 5 players. In this game, where you can fight monsters as well as your opponents, and get a reward if you win the fight. At the end, when you are strong and equipped enough, you can dare to fight and beat the evil Dragon - which is menacing the world of Arcasam - before your opponents do. You will get better, stronger and more powerful each round, however your victory depends on the strategy you choose.

name: VERBA: Latin Core Set
description:
VERBA is the new language learning card game developed by The Pericles Group. The concept is incredibly simple -- one player (acting as a judge) draws a random card containing a fill in the blank sentence in the target language and the other players play a card containing a noun from their hand. The player who has played the sentence card then chooses the best card played and that player scores a point. Play continues with that player as the new judge.

All VERBA players benefit from seeing high frequency words, with many repetitions, in a context that fosters authentic learning and comprehensible input. As with all of The Pericles Group's educational games, the play objectives and the learning objectives are one in the same. Players win by making comprehensible sentences, scaffolded by the cards, the images, and the helpful hints included on the sentence cards. We always want to ensure that the learners are seeing correct forms and those forms are continually reinforced by the mechanics.

name: Cosplay Showdown
description:
Cosplay Grab lets 2-4 players build the best costume wardrobe in five different genres of costume (fantasy, sci-fi-, steampunk, anime, and superhero). Build the best selection, collect the most in each genre, and stick your friends with some #epicfail pieces that look like they bought them on clearance at a drug store!

On a player's turn, they draft an item from the racks (card stacks) and based on what they select, another player gets a costume item, too. The trick is to select items that will get you a better take and help you build the best costumes. Players also score for having the most costume items in each genre.

Cosplay Grab is a quick-playing game with fun elements but a eurogame soul, borrowing the central mechanism from Zomboozle, another game from 3SidedCard.
categories: Card Game, Fantasy, Puzzle, Science Fiction
mechanics: Open Drafting, Pattern Building, Set Collection

name: Sidewinder Checkers
description: Sidewinder Checkers is a Checkers variant for play by two to four players. The game board is a 14x14 square checkerboard with the four corners of nine squares replaced with artwork. Each player has twelve checkers of a different color. Rules of movement are similar to other Checkers variants; the differences in Sidewinder Checkers are mainly to do with its emphasis on partnership play and different variations called "Strike," "Ruler of the Pit," and "Criss Cross," which have to do with where players' pieces may be promoted, and in winning conditions.

name: Spørgsmål og Svar
description:
A card game very much like Foolish Questions, but with some differences:

The game contains one deck of cards with questions (Green) and one deck of answers (Blue). The Answer cards are dealt to all players equally and the questions are spread out on the table.

One player begins by selecting another player and draws a Question card from the pile and ask the question. The player selected then takes the top most answer card and read this.
Now (s)he pics a player, draws a card and reads the question

The game continues until there are no more Questions and Answer cards.
The one who first get rid of Answer Cards is the winner; if the game ends because the Question cards run out, the one with least Answer cards is the winner.

Possibly illustrated by Hans Quist (1922-1983).

name: Ferienwanderung durch unsere Republik
description: The roundtrip starts and ends in East-Berlin. Movement ist determined by a die. If a player gets on a blue space, he has to use the detour. On a red space (city) the player misses a turn. The last player to arrive in East-Berlin, wins the game.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Nocturn
description:
Nocturn is a game that combines two genres — strategy and horror. It takes place in the underworld where players take control over one of the nations struggling to survive among the dead realm. Players establish Houses and grant them lands, obtaining more Lords for their wars and intrigues. Through these Houses they also call armies or build mighty cities and strongholds for their nations. Their goals are simple: expanding borders and finally subjugating each other. During the gameplay the fifth player will lead diffrent force. Death, the original sovereign of the realm. In an attempt to recapture his lands, now lost to the living, he will pose a major threat to all the other players.

Easy to play/Difficult to master

The game can be played using Short Campaign rules (for 3 players, game time ~150 min) or Long Campaign rules (for 4-5 players, game time ~180-240 min). The basics of Nocturn are simple to learn and a game can start even with only one person fmailiar with rulebook and other players having only general idea about it. Gameplay favors not the players who blindly memorize all the rules but rather those who can scheme and think outside the box.

The possibilities on how to play Nocturn are only up to player imagination.
As a player you can shut your nation inside a massive well defended valley surrounded by the mountains, waiting for an outside world to degrade into chaos. You can play as an agressor, focusing on conquering other players cities and strongholds while building few yourself. Or if you want to scheme in darkness, submit early in the game to the neigbour and deceive stronger players while engaging in secret actions destabilizing the world everywhere but in your lands. Still, you have to remember the World is constantly evolving around you with each passing turn. It may happen that your well devised plan will crumble - your Court taken by other stronger player, forcing you to wonder around with few loyal troops left, selling your services to whoever would give you a glimpse of hope.

Nocturn is played for 10 turns. Each consists of three Phases:

1) Darkness Phase
During this phase Rulers ressurect their dead Lords.
– Death plays Darkness Cards and Omen Cards (Long Campaign).

2) Action Phase
During this phase players, one after another, execute actions using their Action Tokens.
Available actions for them are:
-Moving Lords of the chosen House,
-Building up to 2 new Fiefdoms,
-Developing existining Fiefdom,
-Collecting Tributes form Houses,
-Calling Lords to arms,
-Buying new Technologies.

3) Siege Phase
During this phase, players may assault besieged enemy strongholds or relieve allied ones.

name: Aftermath: The Newcomers
description:
Expansion to Aftermath: The Beginning

Includes:

16 new Publicity cards
16 new Objective cards
4 new Character cards
80 Influence tokens (20 for each new character)
categories: Abstract Strategy, Expansion for Base-game, Political

name: Aftermath: The Beginning – Kickstarter Exclusive Characters
description: The Gambler and The Sailor character cards are exclusive for backers of the base game on Kickstarter. Each character comes with its own set of 20 influence tokens.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Expansion for Base-game, Political

name: Get Out Alive
description: Get out Alive is a card game where you find yourself in an abandoned building with instructions saying only the first person to escape will live. Not remembering why or how you got there, you plan your escape.

name: Elemental
description:
Elemental is a strategic board game of simultaneous action and hidden information. Players assume control of either the light mage or the dark mage and control 7 elementals in a duel. The elementals--water, fire, earth, wind, frost, bolt, and light/dark--interact in a 5-way rock-paper-scissors system. Each of them is equally strong, given the right circumstances. The goal of the game is simple: either defeat or isolate your opponent's light/dark elemental.

The trick is that you can only find out your opponent's pieces by battle or deduction. Each player will be trying to gather information while cutting losses and revealing as little as possible. Elementals can sustain 2 hits, allowing players to take calculated risks and control an area with a bluffed piece.

The arena itself plays into the deduction process with its fountains (which provide tantalizing bonuses for matching elementals) and its energy wells (which generate crystals for special one-time maneuvers). Once the player has deduced their opponent’s strengths and weaknesses, they can take command of the arena and lead their elementals to victory.

The Print and Play is available here: Elemental Print and Play
Note that the print and play is meant to convert an old set of checkers and 2 D6. As such, the lightning elemental is not included in this version, as that would require 4 more pieces than the standard checkers set.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Bluffing, Deduction, Print & Play
mechanics: Grid Movement, Rock-Paper-Scissors, Secret Unit Deployment, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: A Potato Salad Card Game
description:
A card game inspired by the Potato Salad Kickstarter project, personally approved by Zack Danger Brown.

Players compete to be the first to gather all the ingredients to one of four potato salad recipes. You can acquire ingredients by drawing them from the deck, purchasing them from cards on the table or in the discards, or trading with other players.

name: Automotive Annihilation
description:
Automotive Annihilation is a car racing and combat game; the core mechanics are rolling five custom dice, moving around a board, and playing weapon cards. It has several unique features that separate it from similar themed games including a lane changing mechanic where you cannot pass cars that are in your lane. The dice rolling is similar to King of Tokyo.

Automotive Annihilation will appeal greatly to hardcore gamers while being accessible and easy to learn and play for almost anybody
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Race, Take That

name: Bienenspiel
description: The bee game consists of 32 playing cards and is adapted for 2 - 5 players. The goal of the game is to dispose of all your cards by attaching them to the already existing honeycombs. When doing this, at least two sides of the cards must be attached and the bees must be put together correctly.

name: Ferdinand wird Vater?
description:
This is a simple roll-and-move game. The first player to reach the circus, wins the game.

The game was published as a program booklet for a children's varieté.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Benjamin Blümchen: Ringetauchen
description:
The board represents a swimming pool, made up of 25 squares. Shuffle the tiles and place them face-down on to the board, one tile per square.

In your turn, roll once with one of the two dice (the other is only needed for the 2nd version of the game). The diced colour shows where you can take a card.

This is very simple: Each of the dice colours can be seen on the board edge. One line of colours runs along the top and one on the side. If you have thrown red, for example, you take any cards, which lies in the range below or beside the red box. If you are lucky enough to roll White, that is a Joker and you are allowed to take any tile from any of the game board squares plus you can take any one tile from an opponent.

You keep your tiles concealed and you lay them face-down in front of you but shhh, no one will know if it has a rubber ring or not. If you roll a colour which is empty of rings, you are out of luck and you don't get a tile.

When the board has no tiles left on it, the game ends. Whoever has the most cards with a ring has won the game.

There is a variant which is intended for slightly older children.

name: Schweinchen Treffen
description:
There are 22 white cards which are shuffled and laid out as a board. Special plugs are used to hold the cards together. One of these cards is the Start space and all players put their pawn on that card.

There are 40 Piggy Cards. Their background colour determines which family they belong to. There are 4 families of 5 cards (so each family member has two cards.

The Piggy cards are shuffled and each player is dealt 5 cards. The remaining cards are stacked in the middle of the board. The youngest player begins.
The aim is to collect the 5 members of a family first.

Before a player begins to roll, he draws a card from the deck. Then he rolls the die, and moves his pawn. Whichever card he lands on, he must follow the instructions on it. He ends his turn by discarding a card, forming a discard stack.and shall finally again a card beside the stack. Players may never have more than 5 cards in hand at the end of a turn. The play continues in a clockwise direction. Whoever rolls a 6 may roll again.

The card-types that form the board:

A Chair:
All players need to move one place to the left and leave their cards behind. Thus everyone gets a new hand in effect. The sixth card is discarded before this happens.
Single card icon with two arrows pointing to the right:
All players are required to pass a card to the left, without having first seen the card of the right neighbour.
Paw Print:
The player has to imitate an animal of their choice. Only when the other players have guessed which animal it is. Then he may discard a card.
Die:
The player may roll again.
Two Arrows pointing left and right
All players have to change direction of play, clockwise to anti-clockwise and vice versa.
Circle:
Nothing happens.
Start Card:
All pawns start the game here. Should you land here during play, you get to roll again.
Card Hand Icon
The player draws a card from the player of his choice, and then gives any card from his hand to the chosen player.
Exchange Icon:
Landing here also lets you pick an opponent and exchange a card but this time the two cards are swapped face down.

First to get all 5 members of one family, wins the game.

name: Buntes Bilderbongo
description:
The game is played rather like Lotto but has the variation of Bongo Cards. When these are revealed they add a feature to the game. For example, a player who was very far behind, could now be the the frontrunner at once and the former leader drops back to 2nd place. There are 10 different Bongo Cards and once used they go out of the game.

The game is played over a pre-set number of rounds. The one with the most matches after that time has won the game.

name: Finish Line
description:
Can you outmaneuver the other players and control the finish?

Finish Line is a simple game of moving cars from start to finish. Except everyone is moving every car, and everyone is trying to get the cars to finish in a different order.

On a turn, a player can move up to five cars one space, or remove a stop sign from the board. Optionally and in addition, a player can place a stop sign, or use one of a limited number of "shift chips" to move a car, move a stop sign, or draw a new Finish card. The goal for each round is to get as many cars as possible to finish in the order on your Finish card. The goal of the game is to be the first to have 10 cars finish in the order on your card.

The dynamic of Finish Line changes depending on the number of players, so that an effective strategy for a two-player game might be of no help at all in a four-player game. Adaptability is key.

name: Neck-Back-Toe
description:
Life is tough when you are a mad scientist trying to resurrect the dead.
Body parts are hard to find, your hired help is unreliable, reanimating lifeless corpses makes your electricity bills skyrocket and those nosy police officers just keep showing up...!

Neck-Back-Toe reimplements the classic game of Tic-Tac-Toe as a solo card game. Every round, nine action cards are laid out in a grid. The player chooses one action at a time, but when three actions in one row on the grid have been taken, the round ends.

Dig up the body parts you need, suture them together and give them life! Then sell your "creations" on the black market before the police catch on to your plans. Hurry! Your reputation at the Mad Scientist Seminar is at stake!
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Print & Play

name: Quadrifid
description: Players build a four-column tower from blocks chosen based on rolling two dice. They score points after each round depending on how many columns, two to four, in the tower have equal heights. Scores are kept over multiple rounds, with the highest score, after a number of predetermined rounds, winning.

name: Garam Masala
description: Garam Masala is a card game, in which every player try to enhance his farming and commerce systems in order to gain money and prestige. Buying new fields and hiring new workers, players have the opportunity to yield spices and sell them at the Indian people obtaining prestige points and the chance to recover the used Action cards. The Merchant can reclaim used action cards and he can also control the goods at opponents disposal, but in the meantime the opponents will try to steal the title of merchant.

name: Cutthroats
description:
Welcome to the swashbuckling Caribbean, young buccaneer! It is a world of savage danger and merciless pirates. Take command of your own Flagship, arm it to the teeth with powerful cannons, and pile as many gold doubloons into your cargo hold as you can! The New world is yours for the taking, but beware there are other ambitious adventurers who would dare try and take what is rightfully yours. Forge your own destiny and make history on The Spanish Main!

In Cutthroats, you and up to five other players vie for control of key towns in the Spanish Main. Players utilize one of seven skills to attack each other's ships and towns.

Ships move by use of a 12 sided die. But players can only move in certain directions on the board, which can be changed after reaching a port. Players that land on another player's port must pay port fees to that player or try to conquer the town.

Combat takes place when a player passes another on the high seas and decides to attack. Each player rolls a 10 sided die and adds to that number, the number of cannon upgrades they have. Best two out of three wins the fight. Losers are forced to lose an upgrade, and pay a ransom to the victorious player as well as being sent to the nearest town.

Players are eliminated if they owe more doubloons than they have in their hold. Last player with money wins. A secondary way of winning is to conquer all five towns and hold them for a full round of play.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: A Confederate Spy in Washington
description:
From the publisher's website:

This is the world's only American Civil War espionage game. It allows the players to spy for the south and see if they can influence the war. In the first scenario they try to steal the plans of the Monitor. In the next scenario it is 1863 and they get to try and influence the outcome of the Battle of Gettysburg. The last scenario is in 1865 and involves a fellow named John Wilkes Booth.

This is an Engle Matrix game of moderate complexity. Players take turns moving character tokens on a map to set up scenes and create sections of the narrative. Each addition to the story is evaluated in terms of how likely it is to happen and how well it fits with the overall story. This evaluation determines the number that needs to be rolled for the new segment of the story "to happen" and to be added to the main narrative.

The player who contributed the most significant elements of the story is the winner of the game.

name: Take Charge
description:
Simple war game of maneuver and combat. The flags represent army formations where Infantry and Artillery are assigned in secret to the armies. Terrain, and positioning of attacking and defending units modify the combat results. Dice are rolled to indicate combat results. The record pad is where each commander records strength and losses to his units.

The game maybe be played by 2 or 4 players and rules are included to split the commands and you can see in the pictures where each army's home camps are printed along the map edge.

Rules are about 6 pages digest size, a more involved game than the typical 60's kids game like 1863 or the MB Civil war.

name: REBUKE
description:
REBUKE is a cooperative memory game where everyone that plays, will be rebuked! Help one another while fighting off Sin. Sin may not seem like anything severe at first, but watch as the Sins pile up in front of you. Forgiveness, Christian Character, and Recall will aid at discarding your Sins. To win, everyone must be without Sin at the end of the game. Don't hold onto your Sins in secret as the Hypocrites do. Accept the Rebuke and be made new.

WHAT IS A REBUKE AND WHY IS IT SO IMPORTANT?
When most hear this word they apply a negative connotation, however it is quite the opposite. To rebuke means to correct someone in a loving manner. God the Father gives us the 10 Commandments and His word as a rebuke.

Great to play with:
• Ministries
• Bible Studies
• Families
• Friends
• Churches
• Academy Classrooms
• Anti-Bullying School Programs
• Road Tripping
• Game Nights
• Camping
categories: Card Game, Educational, Memory, Party Game, Religious

name: Cubular
description:
From the box:

It's exciting, it's challenging. It's Cubular! Join in the 4-player action where strategies are built and alliances are formed. Be the only player left standing as you out-maneuver and out-wit your opponents. Grow a legion of cubes by jumping your opponents to "flip" their color to your own, but be careful because it's 3 against 1. Cubular is a fast-paced strategy game that will have you fully engaged in every player's move. Developed within the classical style of board games, Cubular adds a fresh, original spin to the game-play. Cubular is also a great game for helping students develop strategic thinking and problem solving skills in the classroom. Included are directions for 4-player and 2-player games.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Set Collection

name: ScrambledEggs
description:
In this game you compete for points by completing sets of 5 cards in a straight line on a 5 x 5 grid. Block your opponents by covering cards in play or rearranging the grid using special scrambler cards. Your score is multiplied by the variable score multiplier.

Game is very easy to learn and fun to play.
mechanics: Hand Management, Pattern Recognition, Set Collection

name: GREXIT
description:
Grexit is a card driven competitive game in which up to 4 creditor countries (USA, Germany, Russia and China) vie for contol over the valuable resources of the debtor country (Greece) through economic pressure and by enforcing policies.

Each Creditor country has it's own special ability that affects it's balance in the game, while the Debtor country draws a "political party" card to determine what kind of government is in power (left, center or right, each with it's own special ability). All the players draw a hidden objective card which will give them their own personal agenda to fullfill. These agendas will most of the time lead to conflict of interest between the players. Objectives can be for example: to control the most of one kind of resource (eg. oil deposits, natural gas), to own public utilities or services of general interest (eg. Power, Water or Telecommunications) or to save the country (preventing the country from either falling apart in revolt or declaring bankruptcy) or ruining the country (to end the game before the 8th turn).

The game begins with each player drawing hidden objective cards
Each turn, an event card is drawn, which will give flavor to the game as well as affect the policies and actions taken during that turn.
Then, the players controlling the creditor countries, draw cards from the "Memorandum" deck and choose which policies they'd like to have adopted by the debtor country. In order to entice the Debtor, they offer the policies face down with a bribe card face up. Bribes can be either money or relief measures which give victory points and breathing space respectively to the Debtor player.

As a general rule, in order for the creditor player to earn victory points, he needs to control properties and to fullfill their hidden objectives to win the game, while any debt owed to him by the debtor player by the end of the game will be lost. On the other hand, the debtor player earns victory points from the bribes accepted, from the properties that remain public, from the happiness of his people (if any) and from the level of the debt (if he hasn't declared bankruptcy).

name: Nordlandsreise
description:
Nordlandsreise is a simple "Roll & Move" game. Starting in Copenhagen, players attempt to be the first to complete a round trip (1-60) through Scandinavia.

Note: likely published end 1920's/early 30's.
categories: Children's Game, Educational, Nautical, Racing, Travel

name: Be Legend: Ragnarok
description:
Be Legend: Ragnarok is a programing combat system based on legends, myths and other works of fiction and nonfiction. This set is based on the Norse mythology and has some of the known favorites such as Odin, Loki and of course Thor. Also some other Legends such as Surt the fire giant, Freya the Enchantress and Fenir the Great Wolf. With a total of 8 playable and customizable characters to choose from.

Each player will have a deck basic abilities, which will be identical to the others. Each player, depending on who they picked to be their legend, will add two unique cards to their deck. Out of this deck you will pick only six to use during the game. So chose wisely. All players will use these cards to move around the board, capturing emblems from each player, first to do so wins.

How to move around the board each play will also have a deck of movement cards number 1-6 these are one time use. Also two direction cards that are reusable clockwise and counter clockwise.

During turns everyone at the same time will be playing one ability card, one movement card and a direction. Once all players have locked in their cards played them face down.Players will all reveal just the ability cards some cards are faster, some negate while some do really awesome things.

Once the cards are revealed plays in turn order or priority will move and activate their abilities. You can land on a person's realm and take their emblem. You can also land on them knocking them out and take choice of emblem or use unique ability cards to extend your range of attack or manipulate emblems or decks.

name: Wordy Speedy Spell
description: Verbal skills and quick wits are used in this exciting spelling game. The spinner determines the size of the words created. Players use their knowledge of vocabulary and quick thinking to make as many words on the game board before the timer runs out.

name: Collider Cards
description:
This is a brand new concept for traditional card games. In this game, the cards are colorful particles and the table top is an active collider slamming them into each other for the betterment of science. Experimental patterns called Waveforms are placed into the collider in an attempt to break them down into readable samples. Depending on the strength of the collisions you might get the harmonization of a perfect sample, or the particles might cause an explosion, scattering random particles around the collider and possibly ending the experiment too early.

This game comes with rules for both solitaire and multiplayer games for up to four players. Both versions of the game play very similarly. At the beginning of the game you pick a Waveform, which is a pattern of face up and face down cards played to the table. At the beginning of a player's turn they play one card from their hand by placing it face up onto the table. Once the card is played, the collider engine begins to run.

The collider engine is a set of rules that cause the cards on the table to interact. The highest numbered card located at the bottom of the Waveform will search for the lowest numbered card it can interact with (based on suit). If it finds one, it will pull that lowest numbered card to itself and they will merge into a new number (by adding their numbers together), then one of four different reactions will occur based on that new number. Once that reaction is done, the collider engine begins searching for another possible interaction, and keeps doing so until there are none left, which ends the turn.

Players score points by collecting cards based on some of the possible reactions. In the solitaire game the object is to score well while trying to clear all of the cards from the Waveform. The multiplayer version is all about getting the highest score through multiple rounds of play.

name: OUTPOST WAR: A Solitaire Game of Combat in the Hills of Korea (1951-1953).
description:
INTRODUCTION: OUTPOST WAR is a solitaire game of the battles for the Hills and Ridges along the Main Line of Resistance (MLR) during the later stages of the Korean War (1951-1953). The player assumes the role of a commander of an Infantry Company during its grueling and miserable turn manning a Hilltop Outpost before they are relieved. As the Company Commander, you are responsible for securing your Sector of Front by successfully taking enemy positions and defending yours with the least amount of casualties. Although there are many support units available to you, they may often times be limited to you by political, logistical or geographical obstacles. You have the choice to play as a US Marine, US Army, French Army, Foreign Legion or British Commonwealth Infantry Company.

GAME OBJECTIVE
The objective of OUTPOST WAR is to successfully survive a Tour in the Hilltop Outposts along the MLR in Korea. A Tour consists of a number of Rotations manning an Outpost on a Ridge or Hill. The Player can play a Short Tour (1 Rotation), an Average Tour (2 Rotations) or a Long Tour (3 Rotations). Each Rotation consists of making a Rotation Deck of 20 “Outpost Life” Cards and once all Outpost Life Cards have been drawn and resolved, the Rotation is over and the Player totals his Rotation VP and adds it to his Tour VP. Once all Rotations have been completed, the Player totals his Tour VP and then compares it to the Victory Determination Table to determine the level of success.

OUTPOST WAR can be found at the following URL:
http://www.berserkergames.net
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid

name: Road to Madness: NCAA Basketball
description:
Road to Madness is a print & play, solitaire statistical replay game on College Basketball, featuring individual yearbooks with data for all Division I teams and also for the entire NCAA Tournament brackets.

Each team is rated for offense and defense and the game is resolved comparing the opposing team values and rolling a couple of 6-sided dice on a Result table, with modifiers given by a random die modifier, that could be activated or not activated at all, according to real performance during the season or the tournament (a team with a winning record has more chance to activate the random modifier than a team with a losing record, but there is the possibility to the underdog to win a match).

As most of TCS Games sport design, the game privileges easiness and speed of play than deepness and strategy (is a solo game after all, and the player takes both sides, so he doesn't have to make any decision).

Two yearbooks available till now: 1977/78 and 1978/79

name: Mingle & Murder
description:
In Mingle & Murder, you are attending a dinner party where one guest after another is found dead. It is now a fight against the clock. Will the murderer get away or will the Inspector catch him or her? Will the guests be saved by the doctor or will they take the opportunity to enrich themselves? Whatever happens, this party will indeed be the talk of the high society!

Each player has a unique objective.


The Murderer wants to murder two guests by playing them murder cards.
The Inspector wants to arrest the murderer by being played a murder card and prevent items from being stolen by playing the guests catch cards.
The Doctor wants to save the guests by playing them save cards or be played a murder card.
Each Guest has a unique list of three rooms that they want to steal valuable items from.
A murdered Guest may still win by identifying the murderer at the end of the game.


Each player starts with a secret hand of one object card and five action cards. Most action cards are mingle cards of no importance. However, the Murderer has three murder cards, the Inspector has three catch cards and the Doctor has three save cards. The game board consists of 3x3 room cards, on which the players move their meeples.

The players take turns to move between the rooms and leave action markers there (steal from it). They may also leave action markers with another player (steal from him or her). When a player has no action marker left, he or she leaves the game board. When all but one have left, the round ends. Players place and draw new cards where they have placed their action markers, shuffle and resolve them. The game ends when an object is fulfilled. A murdered player is eliminated but may still win by identifying the murderer.

Mingle & Murder has a player elimination mechanism with a unique twist: the eliminated player may avenge his or her death by identifying the winner (the murderer) and claim the victory!

name: Da Vinci Machine
description:
Detect. Deduce. Decode. A Battle of Wits over the Code Machine. A word game for the critical mind.

Da Vinci is a genius in coding messages creatively. In this game, you will stretch your imaginative and logical mind to crack the secret behind the Code Machine. Come unlock the genius within! The product is a beautiful fusion of a word game and a logic game. Its interactive game-play makes it a great piece for friends and family pastimes. The difficulty levels are controlled by players, so it is also a nice adult-child educational toy. Something special about this product is that it features a patented word coding method that is unique, but easy to understand. So while enjoying the fun and challenge, players can gain knowledge of vocabulary and coding.

Easy to learn. How to play ...
Step 1: Draw two game cards to determine the "Word Type" and "Spelling Condition" of the secret word to be formed. Reveal the two cards to all players.
Step 2: One player uses the chips to form a secret word by the method illustrated on the Code Machine. Cover it with all windows closed.
Step 3: The other player(s) must crack the secret word with as few windows opened as possible. Ask questions wisely for hints in the process. The player that requires less windows opened is the winner.


In a two-player game, one player is the Encoder, the other the Decoder. The Encoder forms a secret word by the method illustrated on the Code Machine using the information from the "Word Type" and "Spelling Condition" cards, starting from the farthest left position, in correct spelling sequence, and announcing the number of letters in the word. In each round, the Decoder opens one small window at any position and attempts to name the secret word. In each game, the Decoder has a total of three changes to ask the Encoder a yes-or-no question for a hint. The questions can be used all at once or separately. When the secret word is cracked, count the number of windows opened. Switch roles and repeat. The player who required less open windows to decode the secret word is the winner.

In a three-player game, one player is the Encoder and the other two players are the competing Decoders. The Decoders take turns opening windows and attempting to crack the secret word. The Decoder who successfully cracks the secret word first is the winner.

name: Network Negotiator
description:
Network Negotiator is a game about the television industry. Players represent high-powered executives who buy and sell TV programs. The game was developed as a promotional item for Turner Broadcasting.

The object of the game is the accumulation of television ratings points. After each player is given one million dollars and assigned a company (CNN, TBS, Headline News, etc.) an assortment of programs will be available for purchase.

The session proceeds for a previously agreed upon number of rounds as players negotiate and gather ratings points. An executive can choose a risky move with ratings based on the roll of the dice or accept "guaranteed" ratings with a safe choice. A special set of Monkey Wrench cards can be used to wreck another player's deal.

At the end of the game a Blockbuster Round is played with three unique programs (Election Night Coverage. etc.) are auctioned and ratings points are totaled. The player with the highest ratings is declared the winner.

The game includes a colorful board, play money, a score pad, 40 Program cards, 16 Monkey Wrench cards, 3 Blockbuster cards, dice, rules, and a storage insert.

name: Hagiga
description:
Hagiga - a perfect way to learn more about Jewish holidays while playing with your kids in fun and entertaining way!

There are 72 perfect quality colorful cards with various concepts of Jewish Holidays.
The rule of the game is very simple - find 3 cards among 15 spread on the table which all together point to exactly one Jewish Holiday and shout the holiday name.

The winner is the one who collected maximum number of cards.

This is actually very educational game because while playing it you'll find yourself thinking and discussing with your kids various questions about Jewish holidays. For example:

To which holidays King David is related?
When Ecclesiastes is read?
Is Fast related also to Passover and Rosh Hashanah?
To which holidays is Sefirat HaOmer related?
Are Shiv'at HaMinim related only to Tu Bishvat?


and more...

name: Skits-o-Frantic
description:
Skits-o-Frantic is a party game for people that like to make a fool of themselves.

In this game you will be divided up into teams and act out scenarios that can be politically incorrect, but that’s what makes it fun!

The game is simple. Each round, one person from a team draws three card and acts out the scenario without saying any of those words. The person's teammates then attempt to guess what’s on the three cards.

name: Rondo, mit der großen Drehscheibe
description:
Rondo is a game for 2-4 Players, with a rotary disk on the game board.

The Rotary disk is transparent. Except the start and end fields the whole way with all fields are covered with this disk.
The path on the board is seperated in 2 concentric circles, with the private starts at the outside and the private destinations in the middle.

The base rule is a simple, role the die and move one of your four pawns in direction of your private destination.
The pawns have 2 sizes. If your pawn is larger or equal as the pawn before it, you can pass it with a high die number.
If your pawn is smaller than the pawns on your way you have to stay behind it.

Each pawn can throw out each opponents pawn if the pawn reaches exact the position of it. This is independent of their size.
Some fields are marked. If a pawn hits one of the marked fields, the disk is turned with all pawns on it. The new position is reached, when the players pawn is on the next marked field.
There are only some single links between the circles and only 1 link from the inner circle to your Destination.

Therefor the rotation of all pawns may move them nearer to the destination or they have to run a full round again because they were moved on the wrong side of the link.

name: Sunken Treasure Game
description: In Sunken Treasure, the player's deep sea diver has to leave the salvage ship to recover a gold bar from a chest at the bottom of the sea. The player must then return the gold bar to the salvage ship.

name: Disney's Aladdin ... und die Wunderlampe
description:
This game is based on the Disney movie Aladdin.

Each player has his own Aladdin figure in his color. The players try as fast as possible to get to the palace of the Sultan trying to get the most valuable treasures on their way.

The movement of the figures is card driven. Player plays 1 card from 2 each round and gets after the action is done a new card.

There are the following card types

Aladdin cards: for moving 1 to 5 fields (exact)
Carpet cards: moving to the next carpet field.
Dschafar cards: 1 opponent player has to pause.


If the card played has the same color as the last on the trash pile. The player can play an additional card.

There are Special fields (so called wonder caves). If a figure passes it, he gets a treasure Card without looking on the value.
If he hits the field. The player is allowed to check the value and to decide if he wants this or a blind new one.

Each player has 3 different wishes, he is allowed to use in his turn (1 Opponent 6 fields back, all opponents back 1 to 3 fields, himself 4 fields in front) Maximum 1 wish/turn.

In the palace the player can choose 1 of 4 open treasures (value 1-4) if he is the first. Otherwise one of the remaining

Game Ends when all figures are in the palace. The player with the most valuable treasures gets Jasmin as his wife and wins the game. If 2 have equal treasures the first arrived player wins.

name: 2 Super Spiele: Allegro Zet
description:
This are 2 games in 1 box: Allegro & Zet

For both games: Each player has figures and stones which he moves by dice rolling.
There are possibilities to throw out figures or Stones.
Stones can block the movement of opponent's figures

Allegro:
Start field of the stones is in the middle of the plan. The figures start at a field at the boarder.
On Players turn he moves 1 figur or stone the sum of number of the 2 rolled dice.
Stones can throw out other stones and other figures. They can cross over figures and stones.
Figures can throw out figures and stones but figures are not allowed to pass by stones. Figures are allowed to pass by other figures.
The player whose figures are first on his stones start place and additional the Stones on the figures start place has won.

Zet:
All Stones and figures start at the same place. 2 dice are rolled. The Player chooses 2 Stones or 1 Stone and 1 figure and moves each for the number of 1 of the dice.
Stones are placed on other Stones if they reach exact the same place.
Stones are blocking Stones below them. Figures are also blocking stones below. Figures on stones are save (cannot be thrown out).
Figures throw out other figures if they reach the same place.
Figures and stones are allowed to pass by other figures and stones.
Player whose figures and stones are first on the Destination field wins.

name: TORNADO 1-2-3-Im Sausewind, wir sind gespannt, wer heut gewinnt
description:
Each Player has four figures and tries to get first all of the to the centre in the middle of the circle shaped game board.

The movement is dice driven.
If the 2 dice show a double the transparent disk covering the whole gameboard is rotated to the next mark on the board, before the a figure is moved.
All figures are turned around with this disk move.
Due to the fact that the 7 circular paths have gaps some figures may have after the turn a position outside the path.
These have to start at the start field at the boarder again.
Opponet figures can be thrown out by coming exact on their position.
Movement can be done in both directions.

name: 2 Super-Spiele: Glücks Pilz & Master Mix
description:
Box includes 2 Games:
Glückspilz (2-4 players): Looks like Pachisi but with dice instead of pawns.
Master Mix (2 players): Player has to place dice on a chess board.

name: Mosaico
description:
Each player has 45 stones of his Color.
On a player's turn, he rolls a special die. The die sides show the numbers 1-3, card symbol and star.
Rolling a number allows the player to place this number of Stones.
When rolling a card, the player takes a card and tries to fullfill it (e.g. build a special form with his stones)


remove 1 Stone.


In most cases placing stones is only allowed if they are neighboard to each other and to previous placed of the same Color.
Game ends when no field is empty or if one Player has placed all his Stones. The Player who placed the most stones wins the game.
Cover description in 3 languages. The box contains only German rules.

name: King of Tiger Heart
description: In King of Tiger Heart, players represent knights of the kingdom who are trying to regain control of the country — well, all but one of them are as a traitor lurks amongst the knights...

name: Rabbit Project
description:
In 2396, with an invading force surrounding the Earth, different army troops have had genetic implants to grant them the characteristics of a particular animal in order to aid them on missions against this force.

Rabbit Project is a role-playing card game in one player takes the role of the invading Overlord and 1-3 players comprise the rabbit team and work to complete missions with limited supplies available to them.

name: Olympian Gods
description:
Players try to bring their population to prosperity by gaining the blessings of the olympian gods!
The game uses dice to track population size and a secret bidding mechanism for gaining the god's blessings.
It's a fun mix of some careful planning and scheming but as always, when gods are involved, things can often go horribly wrong and get a bit chaotic!

Overview: In this game players take control of a population (=points, represented by dice) and compete with other players for the favours of gods in hope of being the first player to advance their population to 15 (20 for a longer game, 12 for a shorter game) points and thereby win the game.

Gameplay:
The game is played in several rounds divided into Phases, the „worship phase“ and the „blessing phase“.
During the "worship phase", players play their offering cards on the gods in rounds of secret bidding.
Then in the "blessing phase", the gods are checked in sequence for which players played offering cards on them. The player to have played the highest card receives the "major blessing", all other players to have played any cards with a value greater than 0 receive the "lesser blessing".
blessings can have all kinds of effects, ranging form players directly gaining points by gaining dice or adding points to their dice, but also performing actions like stealing other player's dice or exchanging dice with other players.
When all god's blessings have been resolved play continues with the next round of bidding.
categories: Ancient, Bluffing, Civilization, Dice, Mythology, Print & Play

name: Kraken's Cove
description:
Outwit your fellow swashbucklers to claim the treasures hidden in the Cove! the blood seal which lies over the entrance to the Kraken's lair requires items which are identical in nature.

Kraken's Cove is a social Bluffing game inspired by the prisoner's dilemma. it is designed for 4 to 8 players and lasts about 20 minutes.

Treasure cards are placed facedown for the amount of players in the game. each player starts the day with two facedown cards of stolen goods, these can come in many forms from being magical elements, precious gems and sometimes just everyday things such as grass. players must aim to get identical items so that they may access the treasures and score Victory points in the form of Coins.

on their turn players will trade one of the two item cards they have with another player, this is done facedown and both players must agree to the trade. you can be as honest or as dishonest as you like, keep in mind players are after what you may or may not have so keep your wits about you and suss out the liars.

When you have an identical pair you may enter the lair which the kraken sleeps, you may now secretly look at a facedown treasure card. you may now choose to take either take this card or look at another one, the second card however must be taken. the treasure cards have point values on aswell as curses and items which carry bonuses. once all but one of the treasures have been taken all players must flip over their cards and score their winnings.

The player who collects the most coins (victory points) over a period of 7 weeks (rounds) will go home the victor!

name: Collector's Edition Girls' Night StoryClub
description:
What Is It?
Girls’ Night StoryClub is a reinvention of girls’ night in. Actually, it’s so fun it feels more like a girls’ night out! You know Mad Libs? Where the story is written and you fill in the noun, adjective, verb, etc. and you have this funny story? Well Girls’ Night is just the opposite. A ‘Sex and the City’ saucy kinda opposite. We give you a Storybook and Story Starters, People, Places and Things cards for you and and your friends to create one helluva crazy adventure. It’s a girls’ night like you’ve never experienced filled with laughter, connection and creativity.

“Funny, Unpredictable and Unexpectedly Outrageous!”

The Game:
Girls’ Night can spice up any girls’ night in, book club, wine club, dinner party, supper club, or moms’ group. The game can also be customized for a special event activity to shake up networking groups, writing groups, company retreats and women’s conferences. Girls’ Night creates better connections, creative thinking and laughter—the perfect recipe to kick any gathering into high gear. You never know where the story will go! Oh, and FYI, the guys love playing too!

name: The Candy Man
description:
The Candy Man is a Symbol Matching, Set Building Strategy game for all ages.

In this game, each player has a hand of ingredient cards. In the middle of the table, there are five recipe cards, which show different ingredients. Players take turns drawing new ingredients and playing ingredients on the recipe. On their turn, players can either play one ingredient on a recipe, or play all missing ingredients on a recipe. If a player plays the last missing ingredient, he scores that recipe, and it is replaced by a new recipe. Play continues until a player reaches 100 points.

The game has different game modes. The basic game is aimed at younger players, and allows them to focus on the symbol matching. The other game modes add Golden Ticket cards to the game, which are special actions that are rewarded randomly, and Role Cards, which give the players different special powers.
mechanics: Pattern Building, Set Collection, Variable Player Powers
publishers: Laughing Rain Dancer, The Packy Company

name: Math Kings
description:
Math Kings is a collection of fun math's games in one box!

Classic Mode
Played on the board side with numbers. Classic Mode can be considered a Math's version of scrabble. The extra numbers on the board once used add to your points score for your sum.

Almost Countdown
A guide for the dice order Left to right is indicated on the back of the game manual. Players have to make a sum to match the dice roll amount (1-7 D6 Dice). Can be played against the timer. Players sums are hidden behind screens and only revealed once all players have made the sum or the time has ran out.

Advanced Sum up
Players have to use the shards to display the sum total. Players sums are hidden behind screens and only revealed once all players have made the sum or the time has ran out.

Pure Brain Power
Played on the board side with no numbers. Pure Brain Power eliminates any extra points from numbers on the board and comes down to pure math's. This mode is for you uber math's people out there.

name: Struwwelpeter
description:
Objective: be the first reaching target space '75'
- simple 'Roll & Move' game/ moving by turns -
each player moves his/her meeple according die roll
ending on a red marked space follow instructions...

name: Doki Doki Love!
description:
Welcome to the world of Doki Doki Love!. Love is in the air and it is your job to help your Hero find that special person in their life. Things aren’t as simple as that though, oh no, this world is full of all the Anime tropes you’ve come to know over the years. Tropes are elements that appear in multiple creative works, so if you watch Anime, you will know lots of the tropes that are used. Can you help the General Protagonist end up with the Girl Next Door? Or will the obsessive Yandere try to keep them apart? Maybe you’re lucky and the Yandere isn’t interested in you, but you still need to worry about your Rival getting in your way, along with all the other guys trying to get the Girl Next Door’s attention.

Heroes and Love Interests are drawn randomly, so each time you play Doki Doki Love!, you will have to find the best way to make you Hero appeal to the various Love Interests. While it may seem easy to just increase your Appeal and Encounter a Love Interest, be warned that it is not. Other Heroes will try to lower your Appeal and get in your way. Who said love was simple? You must fight with all your soul to end up with the person you want! And don’t worry, you can mess up their plans as well.

The base set for Doki Doki Love! contains tropes found in slice of life, romance/comedy, and school Anime. Do not fret though! There are plenty tropes in all kinds of Anime, so maybe (hopefully) there will be new ones coming in the future… And don’t worry if you don’t know many tropes, you will learn more after playing this game.

Oh, and this game is about Anime and love, so you know some Ecchi elements will find their way into the game.

name: Cabrio: Die kleine Fahrschule
description:
Be the first, who visits all ten numbered points, avoiding major mistakes.

Players choose any starting point. Then, they take turns, rolling the die and following the streets/roads in recommended directions. Players should consider all traffic signs - mistakes will lead to penalties.
Likely published late 1950s.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Race, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Wolf In The Fold
description:
Wolf In The Fold is a game of tile placement and cooperation. The wolf pack is on the hunt, and they want your herd. Build fences and hire shepherds to protect your flock. If the wolves eat more sheep than you can round up, you lose the game!

Simple rules make Wolf in the Fold fun for younger children, but this game is not suitable for very small children who may choke on the game tiles.

name: Treasure Tomb
description:
Treasure Tomb is a game of strategic tile-laying, dice-rolling, and card collecting. Players lay tiles to construct pathways through the mummy's tomb. Draw a treasure card when you pass a treasure token or place the mummy when you land on a sarcophagus token. Treasure cards can be either event cards or gold. Place the gold in a face-up pile near you. The first person to collect 50 gold wins the game.

But beware! Others may steal your gold with event cards or boot you from the maze.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Network and Route Building, Tile Placement

name: Oceanica
description:
The world is flooding, and it is your job to build the biggest, happiest, most populous fleet for humanity to survive on.

Players roll and draft dice to gain the resources they need to build various types of ships to add to their fleet, and to fend off regularly occurring storms.

Players score points by building ships, upgrading ships, increasing population, and having high morale.

name: Tree
description: In Tree, players raise trees from seedlings to majestic oaks, by combining various stages of root and treetop cards. But as players nurture life, they must also destroy it – by breaking, burning, or harvesting their opponent’s trees. By growth, or by destruction – players fight for victory points, or to outlast their opponents and hold the last living tree.

name: G-Men and Gangsters: The Gang Wars
description:
From the PDF:

G-Men and Gangsters: The Gang Wars is a miniatures skirmish game set against the backdrop of America in the mid–1930s. But this is not America as history records it.
In this alternate vision of the world, America has divided into separate factions, mobsters and bootleggers control many of the major cities, and law and order are upheld only by those with the grit to face death every day and the strong will required to avoid the rampant corruption plaguing the American nations. Before we look
at the rules, take a brief moment to see how the passage of time has led to the rise of the Gang Wars.

User Summary:
This is a supplement for Savage Worlds: Showdown.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Variable Player Powers

name: Micky's Ringe
description:
Indoor target game.
Each player in turn will take the plastic rings and try to throw them over the Walt Disney characters. Most successes wins.

likely published lste 1950s
similar in concept to Noddy's Ring Game - product code 36222
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: The Salmon Life Cycle Game
description:
The Salmon Life Cycle Game follows the adventures of a salmon as it grows and travels from freshwater to the ocean, then back to its' birthplace stream. Each fish encounters dangers growing to adulthood. Players learn how few salmon actually return to their birthplace to spawn and reproduce and some of the many hazards they face as they complete their life cycle.

Up to six individuals may play the game, or two to six teams with two or more players per team.

Players or teams collect and lose "energy tokens," representing how salmon feed, grow, and lose energy in a daily struggle for life.

Players or teams have a reserve of fish lives. During the course of the game if they lose one of their lives they may cash in a fish life to continue play. This reinforces the concept of how many salmon die before they spawn.

name: Wer hat Vorfahrt?
description: Simple roll-and-move-game. The first player to reach the Shell station wins the game. On some of the yellow spaces the players have to answer questions about the pictured traffic signs and are punished or rewarded, depending on the verity of their answer. On other spaces events happen, that hinder or benefit the players.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Auf der Straße: aufgepasst!
description: Simple roll-and-move-game. The first player to reach space 50 wins the game. On some spaces events occur, that hinder or benefit the player.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Copa: Bohnenpower
description:
The red bean extended game for Copa– the cups game.

With the red POWER BEANS, you can “spice up” the Copa bean choice, however you like!
The extra beans can be used in all 4 game versions. They add some surprising effects to each set of game rules. And best of all: players using the beans are always at an advantage. Go ahead – choose your beans!

name: DICE Quick Play Hockey
description: In DICE Quick Play Hockey you can run full seasons in a very short amount of time and get accurate results. You play entire games with the roll of two 10-sided dice. Each game only takes minutes and allows you to play an entire season in a matter of hours.

name: DICE Quick Play Basketball
