description: In DICE Quick Play Basketball you can run full seasons in a very short amount of time and get accurate results. You play entire games with the roll of two 10-sided dice. Each game only takes minutes and allows you to play an entire season in a matter of hours.

name: Recon Team: Vietnam – A Solitaire Game of Long Range Reconnaissance Operations in Vietnam (1967-1973).
description:
RECON TEAM: VIETNAM is a solitaire game of Long Range Reconnaissance Operations in Vietnam. The player assumes the role of a commander of a US Marine Force Recon, Long Range Reconnaissance Patrol (LRRP), Special Operations Group (SOG), or Ranger Long Rang Patrol Platoon in Vietnam. As commander, you are responsible for securing your Area of Operations (AOR) by successfully conducting Reconnaissance, Intelligence, Ambush and Raid operations, deep behind enemy lines, in order to locate and destroy the enemy. Although there are many units available to you, they may often times be limited to you by political, logistical or geographical obstacles.

GAME OBJECTIVE
The objective of RECON TEAM is to successfully complete a number of missions to locate and destroy enemy forces in order to gain Victory Points (VP) for the US Forces. The player can choose to play a short game (4 Missions), an average game (6 Missions), a long game (8 Missions) or a full Tour (12 Missions). Once all Missions have been resolved (successfully or not) the Player totals his VP and compares this with the Victory Determination Table to determine the level of success.
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Tote essen keine Kekse!: Ein mörderisches Rollenspiel für 6-11 Knabberfreunde
description:
The game plays in the cookie factory. It's a mixture of board game and role play.

The director of the factory died and it's not clear if it was a crime or not. The players try to find out, what happened and which scandals happened in the company.

Each player gets a character (manager, purchaser, Marketing assistent, ...), and instructions on how to play their character.

There are 2 parts:

Moving a pawn around the plan of the factory by rolling a die to find objects.
Interrogate the other players to get more information.


Both should lead the players as team or against each other to solve the situation.
mechanics: Role Playing, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Verkehrs- und Heimatspiel
description:
Simple roll-and-move-game. The first player to reach space 70 wins the game. On certain spaces events occur that hinder or benefit the players.

The game was published in the 1950s.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Sylvesterexpress: Ein mörderisches Rollenspiel für 6 bis 11 Bahnreisende
description:
The game plays in a Train - the Sylvester. It's a mixture of board game and role play.

Something strange or even a crime has happened in the train: e.g. someone has been murdered. The players try to find out, what happened and which person(s) have committed the crime.

Each player gets a character (Police officer, passengaers, ...), and instructions on how to play their character.

There are 2 parts:

Moving a pawn around the 2 plans (Train, area around the Train)by rolling a die to find objects.
Interrogate the other players to get more information.


Both should lead the players as team or against each other to solve the crime.
mechanics: Role Playing, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Kimi To Boku No Maou Toubatsu!!
description:
User summary:
きみとぼくの魔王討伐!! (Kimi To Boku No Maou Toubatsu!!) is a Japanese game produced by the publishing circle Moshimoswitch. Kimi To Boku No Maou Toubatsu!! means something like "Demonlord-punishment by you and me together", so "Together we punish Demonlord" is close.

Unite your power and defeat monsters!
Two magic-fighters are to defend a kingdom against approaching monsters. Monsters are deadly, but they can be overcome by coordinated attacks. Defeat everything that comes to attack the kingdom!

This is a two-player cooperative game where players fight against monsters. Each player plays one action card to damage a monster or to heal themselves. A card itself has little effect, but a bonus effect is added when players play the same card. Players have to try to read each other's intention without saying which card they will be playing.

Players win when they defeat all of 10 monsters. Players lose if both players' HP are reduced to 0 or there are no action cards remaining in draw pile and players' hands.

Publisher's summary:
2人で協力してモンスターを討伐だ！
プレイヤーは王国にせまるモンスター軍団を倒すべく派遣された魔法戦士。
モンスター達は手強いが、2人で協力すればきっと勝てるだろう。
次々と襲いくるモンスターを全てやっつけよう！！

勝敗条件
勝利・・・モンスター10体を全て倒す！！
敗北・・・両プレイヤーのHPが0になる。
　　　　　
山札と手札のアクションカードがすべて無くなる。
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Gold Sucher
description:
The players search for gold, trying to get the most and the best claims (game board fields)
The game for 2 players or 4 playrer in 2 teams.
The game board has 7 x 5 square fields (western scenery back ground without game relevance)
On Players turn he places 1 of his fences on a line between the squares (or at the edge of one at the board border).
Each time all a fence is placed on all 4 edges of a field and the last placed fence has the same color as the fence on the opposit side, the player places one of his "Mini-Boys" (figure name in the game rule) in the field. Now it's his field.
At the end of the game (all fields have 4 fences) the player (or team wins) which has more points.
Some fields give 2 points, middle field 3, all others 1 point.

name: Poker Club
description:
This is a Poker game, but instead of cards there is a die.

Each player has 5 or 6 figures (dependent of the number of players)
The game board has 2 concentic circles with the same number of fields and additional 4 x 2 places in the player Colors. 1 of them at each corner of the board (owned chips) and 1 in the middle (nearest possible to the same color in the corners (bets).

At the begin of the game each player gets the same amount of chips.
Each player has to place 1 of his figures on a empty field on the outer circle. The players have to do this clockwise till all figures are placed.

The youngest player has started this positioning and also starts the "real" game.

He chooses 1 of his figures, places it in the neighboring field of the inner circle. This is the start figure. The next 6 figures have to bet clockwise 1 to 10 coins. The minimum bet is always the bet from the previous figure. After all bets are done the owner of the start figure rolls the die. He counts from his figure the number of the die and the owner of this figure gets the all bets and this figure is the start figure of the next round. Players which cannot pay the bet are out of the game. All their figures are taken off. The empty fields are counted for the result. If the die "hits" an empty field the money stays in the pot for the next round. The figure next clockWise is the next start figure.

Game ends when only 1 player is left or after a pregiven time. Player may decide to end the game earlier as planned, then the rules say a Minimum of 6 rounds have to be played.
Game winner is the one who has the most money.

name: Wohin geht der Brief?
description: A kind of Lotto game in which players collect cards that correspond to postal codes on their maps based on what city is called out by a caller. The first player to get cards for all the postal codes on his map wins the game.

name: The Crazy Daisies Game
description:
Roll the die and add or remove petals to your daisy base according to what you roll.

Roll a petal and add it to your disc and roll again.
Roll a + and attach a petal to your disc.
Roll a - and remove a petal from your disc.

First one to complete their daisy wins!
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Rääcer Frääser
description:
Players compete in building race cars. The cars are represented by physical models, which are assembled from a chassi, wheels, a seat, a steering wheel, and a variety of beams. Availability of car parts is decided by dice rolls.

Two, three, or four players can join in playing Rääcer Frääser. Each player is to build his/her own racing car. The player who finishes building first will win.

To build, players roll dice. Each number on the dice correspond with a certain car part. 1 is the chassis (you have to start with this), 2 (which is required to come next) is the steering beam, 3 is the seat, 4 is the steering wheel, 5 are the beams, and 6 are the wheels (you need four of these). If a player gets a valid car part, he gets to roll again.

The game is 100% luck but still brings some tactile fun assembling the cars. Of course, when finish, you can play with the built racing cars.

name: Ice Cream Combo: Baboo
description: With アイスクリームコンボ:バブー拡張 (Ice Cream Combo: Baboo Expansion), players now get to take the role of customers who are eating the ice cream cones created in this shop.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Party Game, Real-time

name: Dogeza Cat
description: Dogeza Cat is a microgame. No other details are known at this time.

name: Royal Ruin
description:
This game uses a standard deck of playing cards to pit two groups of heroes against one another in an epic battle involving tactics, spells, and espionage. The game is for 2-players and usually takes 20 to 30 minutes to play.

If you are familiar with fantasy role-playing games then you will immediately recognize many of the game’s concepts. In this game the three court cards - the King, Queen, and Jack - become the Knight, the Witch, and the Thief. Each hero type has it’s own unique strengths and abilities.

The setup is easy, the action is fast, and you more than likely already have a deck of cards lying around. So the next time you and a gaming friend are looking for a little action why not use those cards and see how your valiant knight fares in battle against some wily thieves and crafty witches?

Each player is dealt 4 court cards and these will become their Party of Heroes. The heroes are placed in a 2x2 pattern in front of each player, called their Marching Order. In this way the two teams can be imagined to be facing each other in a battle formation. The position of each hero in the marching order is important as some hero types are more effective on the front lines while others are better off in the rear.

The game is played in rounds similar to RPG games where initiative, movement, special abilities, and attacks are used to hinder and eliminate the members of the opposing party.

Attacks are resolved by comparing cards played from the players hands (their "Inventories") and if it succeeds then an extra combat step is played to determine if the defender survived the attack or not. Throughout the combat decisions must be made and there is a press your luck element to the fighting.

First team to eliminate the other wins!
categories: Card Game, Fantasy, Fighting, Print & Play
mechanics: Grid Movement, Hand Management, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: Patent Deal
description:
Invent, Patent and Negotiate Deals to WIN. Invent and create technology in eight different fields. Patent your invention or negotiate patent deals to dominate the market place. (from the box)

Each player draws a type of company and random inventions. Depending on whether the inventions you've drawn match your genre of company or not, you follow flow charts (printed on mats) as to whether to patent or not, whether to license out to another player or develop the product for market. As you go around the board, you land on spaces that cause you to draw revenue from your invention, pay license fees to the other player, or go to patent court. Play continues until the first patent expires (or second patent if a longer game is desired).
mechanics: Commodity Speculation, Simulation, Turn Order: Time Track

name: Le Jeu de Polynésie
description:
From the introduction:

This game consists in buying properties: islands - islets - realestate, factories, piers and then developing them by building on them. (Note: You must take care to follow the order in which you are authorized to erect buildings). Each investment is provided added value thanks to a rent which becomes higher and higher, as this enables the player to set up a cash flow for himself. But if it is true that all of the players collect rent for their respective properties, they must also pay money out when they pass over the properties of other players.

Moreover, the game has a number of small surprises that the player must evaluate in advance to avoid finding himself at loss. Of course, "Le Jeu de Polynésie" Game, is only a game and the names of the property, islands, assets indicated as well as the card rules have no basis whatsoever in reality. This game is a pure fiction that seeks only to entertain your children and the big kids that we have remained too!

User description:

Players take the part of land owners in French Polynesia, attempting to buy and then develop their islands. Income is gained by other players visiting their properties and money is spent when they visit properties belonging to other players. When times get tough, players may have to mortgage their properties to raise cash for fines, taxes and other misfortunes. The goal of the game is to be the last player remaining with any money or, in a timed game, to be the player with the largest amount of assets.

On his turn, a player rolls two dice and moves that number of spaces around the board. If the player lands on an as-yet-unowned property, he has the opportunity to buy it and add it to his portfolio. If a player owns all the spaces within a colour group, he may then build hotels, farms or a fishing fleet on these spaces, generating even more income from opponents who land there. If he lands on a property owned by another player, he must pay that player rent according to the value of the land and any buildings on it. There are other places on the board which cannot be bought, but instead require the player to draw a card and perform the action on the card, pay taxes, collect income, or even go to jail. The game allows a player to purchase insurance or hire an attorney, to have some protection against some forms of misfortune.
mechanics: Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Stock Holding, Trading

name: Autorennen auf dem Nürburg-Ring
description:
Objective: be the first crossing finish line (space 70) .

Simple die rolling game. From the start, players take turns moving round the track, obeying instructions on special (red marked) squares. The first player crossing the finish line wins.

Likely published during 1920s

name: Circus Spiel
description:
Objective:

Be the first reaching space 54. Players take turns rolling the dice and moving their pawn. Landing on a marked space has a special effect, which is described in the instructions.

Likely published 1920/30s

name: Nur kaltes Blut
description:
Nur kaltes Blut is a variant of Pachisi.

It has one added rule: a pawn on a circular space cannot be beaten; if a second pawn joins him on that space all other meeples behind are blocked

Likely published mid 1920s.

name: Storekeeper
description:
You work in a neglected warehouse, where the goods are irregularly on the shelves, which should be ordered.

The goods are coming and coming, and a variety of goods to be moved to the right places.

There are two groups of goods, the "food" and "non-food". In both groups there are various types of goods.
Foods: cereals, vegetables, mineral waters and spices
Non-foods: metals, textiles, plastics and chemicals

After placing a goods, you get points according, how good is the location of the goods.

There's plenty to do, and the working time will soon be over, which lasts until, all goods will be on shelves.

At the end of the game, the storekeeper with the most points is the winner.

name: Froschprinzessin
description:
Objective: Be the first racing to position '130'
'Move by turns' game from the 1910's in Germany.

A plastic frog has to be flipped onto a big board showing a large pool with different animals. Depending on the area the frog is landing on you may move forward (acc. number) or backwards (snake, stork...). When you reach space 120 or higher you are safe, but the target must be reached with a matching jump.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Animals, Children's Game, Fantasy, Racing

name: Pride and Glory: The Peloponnesian War
description:
Pride and Glory: The Peloponnesian War is a strategy game set during a war in Ancient Greece. Players take control of the cities of Athens and Sparta and train soldiers, construct buildings, capture cities, and engage in epic battles for the future of Greece. Players control their empire from a full campaign perspective on the game board, but once a battle begins, players can command their soldiers in tactical, unit-by-unit combat on separate battlefield maps.

Game turns are divided into the four seasons of the year. Each season has four phases in which players: 1) Build up their empire by recruiting units, constructing buildings and conducting diplomacy. 2) Move their units around the Campaign Map and besiege cities. 3) Engage in battle and command their soldiers in tactical, simulation combat. 4) Protect themselves against revolts of the people and the stormy seas of the Aegean.

Every triumph brings your city more glory, and closer to victory, until all Greece kneels before you. Throughout the game players earn things called Glory Points for doing things like capturing cities, winning battles – even just by proving that your enemy is too cowardly to come out and fight. Whichever player is the first to get to 75 Glory Points wins the game.

name: El tesoro pirata
description: El tesoro del pirata (also known as "Pirate's bridge") is a fun and exciting game of skill, where you have to get the most coins you can. You must extract them carefully, because too much trepidation will make the skull jump out of it's chest, and that'll end the game. Also, not all coins are the same and some are more difficult to extract that others.

name: Der Triumph des Zwanzigsten Jahrhunderts
description:
Objective: be the first reaching space 79; learn more about European history/cities - increase patriotism.

Players start in Friedrichshafen (1 & 79). They take turns moving their pawn according to a die roll. Some of the spaces have special rules.

Note:
Likely published early 1910s. Pawns are pewter.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Children's Game, Educational, Racing, Travel

name: Loca Pizzeria
description: It’s lunch time! The mechanical chef maniacally spins in the middle of the game board and throws them all over the place, and the players manually move their plates so they can get the pizzas delivered to them. But they should be careful! Not all the pizzas are well cooked and if they get one half-cooked, they lose points. In the end, the player with the most points (counting the good pizzas minus the half-cooked ones), wins the game.

name: Ever After More: The Card Game
description:
Ever After More is a mixture of Yu-Gi-Oh, Magic and Munchkin. If you're a fan of any of those games, then you'll like EAM. The way to win is two-fold. Either retain the most Life Points or have the most card points at the end of the game. Oh, this game is also rigged so that anyone can win or one person could win every time. (Believe me, it's happened to me...)

The way to play is really simple. Draw your cards; lay them down; and attack! You choose your opponent, but be careful. Your opponent could have a card to counter your attack. It's all up in the air when you start playing. Anyone could win, at any time too.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Player Elimination, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Fischereispiel "Frische Fische, gute Fische"
description: Simple roll-and-move-game from the 1920/30s. The first player to reach space 28 (Bremerhaven) wins the game. On certain spaces the players are hindered or favored, on some they are rewarded game coins or lose some.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Heroic Hustle
description:
Heroic Hustle is a fully cooperative team-based experience for 2-4 players. The superheroes (that's you), lead the other heroes of the city into battle to protect a city on the edge of destruction.

A wide range of threats will endanger the city every round, and it's up to the players to nullify them before they can launch an attack. By pairing up your heroic strengths to the weaknesses of your enemies, you'll be able to arrest the attacking forces.

These threats are only the first layer of danger, though. There's always a supervillain in the background working against Cascade City throughout the entire game. Even worse, the more progress you make towards foiling their schemes, the angrier the supervillain gets, and the more dangerous they become.

As if all of that wasn't enough to keep your heroic hands busy, plot twists will change the way the game is played from round to round. One round might see the villains sporting shiny new weapons, while in the next your entire team might be turned into gorillas! As the supervillain's master plan unfolds, these dynamic events will force your team to work together and adapt your strategies.

Thankfully, your elite team has plenty of resources to combat these threats. Some of the heroes in your team work better with each other and can join forces for massive, game-changing unite attacks! You can even summon entire supergroups to show the villains what havoc really means! Not only that, but the denizens of Cascade City are ready to fight for their homes. Whether it's the plucky news team alerting the populous of danger, the tireless repair crews rebuilding the city after vicious attacks, or the dashing Kelly Courier who risks life and limb to help your team get to where they need to be. And if all else fails, each player has their own special superpowers that they can unleash when the situation is dire!
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Science Fiction
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Role Playing, Storytelling, Variable Player Powers

name: Flower Frenzy
description:
It's that time of year again: the Flower Festival is in full swing, and like every year, there's a price for the most beautiful garden!

Flower Frenzy is a garden building game in which players collect seeds and use them to buy colourful flowers to add to their garden. The more colourful flowers, the higher you will score! And this year, the Jury awards additional points for completing Flower Arrangements!

A set collection game for 2-4 players, from the age of 8. It plays in 15-20 minutes.

To win Flower Frenzy, you need to have the highest score. Points can be scored by:
- buying available FLOWER Cards.
- completing Flower Arrangements depicted on the FLOWER ARRANGEMENT Cards.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Environmental, Farming, Print & Play

name: Neuss-Quiz
description: Simple trivia game with questions related to the German city of Neuss. The game consists of cards with one question and answer each. Players take turns asking the other player(s) questions. A player who can answer a question gets the card. The player with most cards at the end of the game is the winner.

name: Varuhuset
description:
Varuhuset ("The Department Store") is a game simulating the excitement and everyday hardships of department store salesmen. Players try to rent different departments and disks within the department store at as favorably prices as possible, with the hope of making good commerce later on during the game.

Luck plays a part in this game, as prices for buying and selling is partially randomized through card drawing. Another important mechanic is the initial auctioning for renting the different departments, which then become the main source of income for the different players.

The game ends when the first two (!) players leave the department store; then the richest salesman win!

name: Hunsrück-Quiz
description:
Trivia game with (some tricky) questions related to the Hunsrück, a region situated in Germany, located between the cities Trier, Coblenz, Bingen & Saarbrücken.
The game consists of cards with one question and answer each. Players take turns asking the other player(s) questions. A player who can answer a question gets the card. The player with most cards at the end of the game is the winner.

name: Hessen-Quiz
description:
Trivia game with questions related to the German federal state Hessen. The game consists of cards with one question and answer each.
Players take turns asking the other player(s) questions. A player who can answer a question gets the card. The player with most cards at the end of the game is the winner.

name: Attaque
description:
A strategy game for two players, being generals for the red and blue armies.

On your turn, you roll two dice. The larger number is the number of squares to move a cavalry unit or flag; the lower number is how far you move a cannon. If you roll a pair, you draw an event card.

The goal of the game is to conquer certain squares.

name: Sauerland-Quiz
description: Simple trivia game with questions related to the region Sauerland, located in Germany. The game consists of cards with one question and answer each. Players take turns asking the other player(s) questions. A player who can answer a question gets the card. The player with most cards at the end of the game is the winner.

name: Lüneburger Heide Quiz
description:
Trivia game with questions related to the region Lüneburger Heide in Germany. The game consists of cards with one question and answer each.
Players take turns asking the other player(s) questions. A player who can answer a question gets the card. The player with most cards at the end of the game is the winner.

name: Ludwigsburg-Quiz
description:
Trivia game with questions related to the German city of Ludwigsburg. The game consists of cards with one question and answer each.
Players take turns asking the other player(s) questions. A player who can answer a question gets the card. The player with most cards at the end of the game is the winner.

description:

Players take turns asking the other player(s) questions. A player who can answer a question gets the card. The player with most cards at the end of the game is the winner.

description:

Players take turns asking the other player(s) questions. A player who can answer a question gets the card. The player with most cards at the end of the game is the winner.

description:

Players take turns asking the other player(s) questions. A player who can answer a question gets the card. The player with most cards at the end of the game is the winner.

name: Climb ON!
description:
User Summary:
クライムオン! (Climb ON!) is a Japanese board game produced by the doujin circle Kichikichian.

Climb ON! is a tile placement game with a theme of lead climbing. You assume the role of a climber and create climbing routes by placing wall panels on the board. Several squares are drawn in a wall panel. You roll dice and advance the number of squares, heading the top of the wall.

Every action consumes stamina, so you need to rest during your climb. You can try to make a challenging climb to the top without a rest, but it comes with a risk of falling down. To save you from falling down, a belayer controls a rope tied with you. You win the game if you climb up to the top of the wall first.

Not to be confused with the game Climb On! which is completely separate.

Publisher's summary:
リードクライミングをモチーフとしたパネル配置型すごろくです。
プレイヤーはクライマーとなり、自ら壁面パネルを配置してルートをつくりあげていきます。壁面パネルにはマス目が刻まれており、クライマーは2～4個のダイスを振りながら壁を登っていくことになります。
すべての行動はスタミナを消費しますから、休憩をする必要もあるでしょう。
挑戦的なクライミングで一気に壁を駆け上ることも可能ですが、それには墜落というリスクがついて回ります。その被害を最低限にするためにプレイヤーとビレイヤーの間はロープで繋がれています。
こうやってルートを駆け上り、壁の頂点に上がったプレイヤーが勝利者となります。

name: Grevenbroich-Quiz
description:
Trivia game with questions related to the German city of Grevenbroich. The game consists of cards with one question and answer each.
Players take turns asking the other player(s) questions. A player who can answer a question gets the card. The player with most cards at the end of the game is the winner.

name: Osnabrück-Quiz
description:
Simple trivia game with questions related to the German city of Osnabrück. The game consists of cards with one question and answer each.
Players take turns asking the other player(s) questions. A player who can answer a question gets the card. The player with most cards at the end of the game is the winner.

name: Sonimania
description: The objective of this game is to identify the sounds contained in the audio cassettes as they're played, in order to get rid of your "note tokens" (DO, RE and MI, each representing different difficulty levels). When you think you know what sound is played, press your button in the electronic device and give your answer. If you're right, you can get rid of the correspondent token. If you fail, you have to take another token. The first to get rid of them all, wins the game.

name: Darmstadt-Quiz
description:
Trivia game with questions related to the German city of Darmstadt. The game consists of cards with one question and answer each.
Players take turns asking the other player(s) questions. A player who can answer a question gets the card. The player with most cards at the end of the game is the winner.

name: Chocolatized Quotes
description: Every card in the deck displays six movie titles. Each player in turn draws a card, chooses one of the movies, and then recites either the title of the movie or a quote from it, substituting the word chocolate for one of the words in the title or quote. The first player to guess the title gets a point. Play until an agreed-upon score is reached.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game, Trivia

name: Ric
description:
Many, many sunsets ago, it started as a card game. It is a game about an armadillo in a handheld video game. Two twins, who had been playing the game since the womb, decided to create such a game by designing a system they deemed the Intento RiiPlay. It may have had monotone graphics but it had a cool level editor.

However, the prototype was hijacked by their rival creators and codenamed the Mega Raystation. Soon after, the project was apprehended by the government which saw the name as a threat to national security. Nonetheless, Intendo went on, and its founders continued playing RIC O’ Chet, the armored ‘dillo card game.

You too can play this card game! Players create a level from their level cards for their opponent to beat. Each players level starts as 3 cards with controller button icons that must match the icons on their editor cards to score.

As cards are scored from the left, cards shift just as they would in a side scrolling platformer. The creator of the level uses their editor cards to determine which level cards are placed next. The first player to score all 12 of their opponents level cards wins the round and the opponent loses a health. If a player loses all health, they have lost the game!
categories: Card Game, Print & Play, Video Game Theme

name: Dragon War: Riders of Ashara
description:
Dragon War: Riders of Ashara is a table-top miniatures game of riders and their dragon steeds. Set in an original world drawing upon dragon mythology from the many legends of our own world, Dragon War: Riders of Ashara focuses on dragons and riders fighting against air, ground and sea adversaries. Their foes come from the nine kingdoms of man across three separate continents- each with their own motivations and machinations. Ashara is a world of incredibly high mountain ranges that divide the continents, meaning that wars must be fought either from the air or by sea.

Ashara, being the known lands of the kingdoms of mankind is at war. The year is 1448, being the 120th occurrence of the year of the Falcon in the Zodiac of Shen. Nations battle for conquest, glory, and power. Dragon riders, highly trained warriors and the pride of their nations, sit atop powerful dragons to do battle with one another and defend against threats from the skies, lands and seas of Ashara. Dragons fight with tooth, claws and their mighty breath weapons of fire, ice, lightning, poison, acid, wind or the mysterious life stealing power of the rend. Choose your dragon and the nation you defend as you take to the skies from the back of a young and agile drake or an ancient and powerful wyrm. Or, choose to register as one of the many mercenary wings, small bands of dragon riders fighting for the highest bidder or for your own personal crusade. The time has come for heroes and their mighty steeds to take to the skies. This is the age of the Riders of Ashara.
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Willich-Quiz
description:
Trivia game with questions related to the German city of Willich. The game consists of cards with one question and answer each.

Players take turns asking the other player(s) questions. A player who can answer a question gets the card. The player with most cards at the end of the game is the winner.

name: Wagner-Quiz
description:
Trivia game with questions related to the German composer Richard Wagner. The game consists of cards with one question and answer each.
Players take turns asking the other player(s) questions. A player who can answer a question gets the card. The player with most cards at the end of the game is the winner.

name: Deutsche-Zitate-Quiz
description:
Trivia game with questions related to German citations. The game consists of cards with one question and answer each.
Players take turns asking the other player(s) questions. A player who can answer a question gets the card. The player with most cards at the end of the game is the winner.

name: Lüneburg-Quiz
description:
Trivia game with questions related to the German town of Lüneburg. The game consists of cards with one question and answer each.

Players take turns asking the other player(s) questions. A player who can answer a question gets the card. The player with most cards at the end of the game is the winner.

name: Göttingen-Quiz
description:
Trivia game with questions related to the German town of Göttingen. The game consists of cards with one question and answer each.
Players take turns asking the other player(s) questions. A player who can answer a question gets the card. The player with most cards at the end of the game is the winner.

name: Spurs and Sprockets: Mercenary
description:
The Mercenary Start Card Expansion includes one card/tile that may be used with all Spurs and Sprockets card/tile decks.

The Mercenary is placed in the field first and the start player places his/her card/tile adjacent to the Mercenary. Play continues based on which Spurs and Sprockets rules you have decided to play with. The Mercenary card/tile has lines in all directions and can be added to all players adjacent rows for scoring purposes. Although the Mercenary has a 0 on it and does not give any points to any player. The Mercenary may be destroyed by using Fired Away rules.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Print & Play
mechanics: Hand Management, Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition, Tile Placement

name: Underprepared Heist Management
description:
Planning a bank heist is hard. Pulling off a heist without a plan is even harder...

You have an idea for an amazing heist. You know of a bank that is stocked with safe deposit boxes loaded with cash, and you have assembled a team of 13 faithful robbers to do the dirty work. As you settle down to craft the perfect plan for the heist, you find out that several other people are planning to hit the same bank. Naturally, you decide to throw caution to the wind and move forward with the heist, planning it as you go... What’s the worst that could happen?

Underprepared Heist Management is a fast-paced card game for 2-5 players. During the heist, players work with a limited pool of plans that they are dealt, managing their heist as best as they can by ordering their robbers to steal and terminate other robbers. Situations may arise that completely alter the flow of the heist in unexpected (and sometimes deadly) ways. After the heist, everyone tallies up their take, revealing the hidden contents of the safe deposit boxes they managed to grab during the heist. The manager with the highest haul is the winner!

name: Shootout
description: At the beginning of Shootout players receive an identity: sheriff, deputy, gunfighter, outlaw, etc. Initially, only the sheriff is known to the other players. Before each round, every player chooses a weapon and then all players simultaneously "shoot" other players by pointing at them. Shots can be deflected or dodged; players take wounds and get healed and take more wounds. Identities become easier to figure out. The sheriff and deputies win by killing the outlaws and vice versa.

name: Cazboin
description:
Cazboin is a card game in which players try to collect as many points a possible. To do so, they draw and play cards that are worth points, including action cards that may affect opponents' points totals. To play a card, players roll a six-sided die to determine which cards they can play, based on a to-play cost.

The game revolves around chance (drawing the best cards), strategy (knowing when to play which action cards), and math (knowing when a certain move is the most effective one to make).

Players draw cards from a single deck and then play cards from their hands to create their own pile of cards, the Stack. At the end of the game, the total value of the stack is the points total for that player. However, by playing action cards players can exchange cards from their own stack with that of an opponent, thereby getting rid of bad cards or stealing good cards. Interaction with stacks is done by Action cards, which have a negative value.
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Open Drafting

name: Gist: The Game of Dueling Metaphors
description: This is a twist on Apples to Apples. Deal each player five cards from the OF deck to start the game. Each round, the Decider draws a card from the THE deck. Each other player then plays an OF card and replenishes his hand. Each combination of THE and OF creates a question in the form of, "What is the X of Y?" After everyone has a chance to explain their combination, players predict which combination of THE and OF the Decider will choose, and then the Decider makes his choice. Score for predicting correctly and for playing the chosen OF card. An example might be, "What is THE microwave OF friendship."

name: Appeteaser
description:
"An easily digestible game of food and spirits"
A trivia game for self proclaimed "Foodies" with mechanics very similar to Trivial Pursuit. All questions are focused on food or beverage knowledge.
The categories are

ingredients
spirits
definition and preparation
potpourri
kitchen basics
history & customs
food & beverage industry
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Star Farmers
description:
The world needs power and we have learned to travel to and harness the power of the stars. Star Farmers send ships to get as close to stars as possible to gather the most valuable power. The Star Farmers are also racing to gather this power as quickly as possible. Some pilots get too close to the stars and burn up in the process. Who will be the most successful Star Farmer and win the government contract.

In Star Farmers players are flicking their ships across a flat surface in an attempt to get as close as possible to a set of stars numbered 1 to 5. Players get points for being the closest or second closest at each star. Once any players have scored on each of the 5 stars points are tallied and a winner is declared.

The first edition of Star Farmers is included on the back side of the cards in the first edition of Bocce Piatta.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Farming, Party Game, Science Fiction, Space Exploration

name: Star Slayers
description:
There are stars that have been determined to be causing problems with the balance of the universe. Pilots have been tasked with traveling to these stars and firing weapons at them in an attempt to destroy them and set the balance right.

Star Slayers is a dexterity game where players are tossing, throwing or sliding 3 Star Slayer ship cards at 5 stars with point values on them from 1 to 5. The ships only fire in certain directions. A line is traced from the weapons to the stars to determine if points are gained.

The first edition of Star Slayers is included on the back side of the cards from the first edition of Bocce Piatta.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Party Game, Science Fiction, Space Exploration

name: Quarters
description:
Quarters is a dexterity game that is played in the same manner as the popular drinking game. Quarters includes 3 beer cup cards that players attempt to bounce their discs onto in order to give negative points to another player of their choice. When any player gets to 13 points the player with the least points wins the game.

The first edition of quarters is included on the back side of the cards in the first edition of Bocce Piatta.

name: Karlsruhe-Quiz
description:
Trivia game with questions related to the German city of Karlsruhe. The game consists of cards with one question and answer each.
Players take turns asking the other player(s) questions. A player who can answer a question gets the card. The player with most cards at the end of the game is the winner.

name: Kriegs-Spiel
description:
A Pachisi-like game, with a theme based on the French-German conflict in WWI.

Major differences:
Two pawns on the same space block others. Pawns on circular spaces are safe. The winner is the first player to move all pawns "home".

Likely published during WWI.
categories: Children's Game, Racing, World War I

name: Die Menagerie: Ein sehr unterhaltendes Kinderspiel
description:
Objective: get most money/chips

At the beginning of the game, the track is filled with a chip on each of the 25 illustrated animal spaces. Then, players take turns moving their pawns by rolling three dice and advancing to the indicated space. If you land on a chip you may keep it if you call the number and can identify the illustrated animal. If you fail you must place an additional chip. Throwing '3x3' just clean the map.

name: Die Urlaubsinsel
description: This simple roll-and-move game was published as a insert in the magazine "Fernsehwoche" in the 1970s. The players begin at "Start" and try to be the first to reach the Grand Hotel on Vacation Island. On some spaces evets occur, that hinder or benefit the players. If a player gets on a space that is already occupied by onother player, the other player has to back up 7 spaces.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Borealis
description:
Introduction
Old legends say that a long time ago gods lived in the great boreal forest of Canada. If one got lost in the woods, one might have seen among the trees one of their totems, which were sacred objects they used to channel their energy. The legends also say that the gods loved to play and that, every few years, they would transform the entire forest into their playground and compete for control of these totems.

Borealis is an epic game of conquest in which players represent old gods of the boreal forest, trying to capture each other's totems using units with various abilities. It is played on a modular hex-based board, which is created anew at the start of each game by the players and can be transformed during it. It lasts 9 rounds, and to each round is assigned a season, summer or winter, which affects the units' movements and the arrival of reinforcements.

Goal
Be the player with the most Victory Points at the end of the 9th round. At the end of each round, a Victory Point is awarded to the player who controls the most totems. If there's a tie, no Victory Point is awarded. If, at any point, a player's victory becomes inevitable because his or her point lead is greater than the number of rounds remaining, the game should end then.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Kikki's Magical Delivery Service
description:
User summary

A board game based on a bunch of anime that are not to be named (too obviously).

The players are flying delivery services and should pick up and deliver as many goods as possible on the board. On his turn, a player will roll dice and play any number of action cards that will benefit him, then move his pawn on the board, picking up and delivering objects.

name: Lapitta, the island in the sky
description:
User summary

A board game based on an anime that is not to be named too obviously.

The players run back and forth on a crumbling bridge, between the flying ship and the island in the sky. Each turn, the player rolls dice and decides which to use for movement and which to use for destroying the bridge. The removed bridge tiles can become items and whatever the players find on the island will decide what points they will get for what items. The players can also bump into each other and steal items.

name: Summon & Dragon
description:
User summary

A card battle where the players compete for laid out treasures. Players take turns putting out one of their summoned characters face down on any treasure they want. When all have placed, the cards are turned face up and activated, and the player that has the highest total on each treasure gets that treasure.

Each card also have special effects, and character cards are also turned face up each time someone places a new character card on the same treasure. This allows for strange combos and traps.

name: Lily & Rose
description:
User summary

A card game in which the players try to pit together couples of the same sex in order to get points.

Nine characters (girls or boys, but not both) are lined up, each getting a certain personality from a deck of personality cards. Each player gets one date spot card. On a player's turn, they can either exchange their date spot with one of the open ones, or put another personality on a character, or show their hand card (date spot) and pick two characters who will date on that spot. If the requirements on the date spot card match the personalities of the characters, the player will earn points. A perfect match means a couple is formed, and the characters are removed from the game.

The game ends when there is just 1 (poor) character left, or if the personalities deck runs out of cards.

name: Neco Londele
description:
User summary

A board game where the players' goal is to invite as many cats as possible into their house. Fire cats are walking around the board, and the players roll dice and use cards to get the cats to come to their house.

The player who gets most cats into his house wins.

name: War of Wonders Miniature Game
description:
War of Wonders is a skirmish miniature game set in an alternate, grim World War II fought by superhuman beings.

Details:
War of Wonders Miniature Game is a fast paced 30mm strategic skirmish game based on the deeply immersive setting of Project H.O.P.E. RPG by authors Simone Fini and Riccardo Giuliani, published by Limana Press.
In War of Wonders extraordinary human beings with powers beyond imagination fight on WW II battlefields alongside regular troops and iconic heavy tanks to change History. National heroes, monsters born in laboratories and mysterious beings with their own secret goals: every and each of them will add new tactics, game options and strategies to your games.

Setting:
Nazi Germany declares war on Europe, and its army is unstoppable. Prodigious beings appear on the battlefields to support the Wehrmacht's efforts: flying men shower flames upon the enemy; women wearing iron masks punch through tank armour; bloodthirsty beasts devour entire regiments. The world is about to succumb to the might of the Third Reich. Aaron Spiegelmann, a Jewish scientist who escaped from the Mauthausen concentration camp, is the only hope for the Allied Forces to stop the Nazis. Spiegelmann is the genius who created the Wunderkammer, a new technology that allowed the Germans to create real superheroes with extraordinary powers. With his guidance, the US Army launches Project H.O.P.E. in order to produce their own genetically modified humans to be deployed on the battlefields. As the war rages on and every army creates its own Meta-Humans and war machines, Natural Prodigies, unscrupulous Adventurers and even secretive groups of Warlocks step into battle. From the European battlefields to the Pacific Islands, a conflict like never before is unleashed and spreads with no boundaries: humanity will forever remember it as the first War of Wonders.
categories: Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame, World War II

name: Long Long Long Sword Girl!
description:
User summary

Players are all girls fighting a dragon with their swords. On a player's turn, he will roll a die to attack the dragon, and if successful, may add new cards to his sword, making it longer. The player may also play cards for special effects.

The dragon will attack the girls each round. The goal is to remain standing when the Final Round starts (round 7, if not triggered earlier), and defeat the dragon. The player with most points at the end wins.

name: Long Long Long Sword Girl!: Girls and Dragon!!
description:
User summary

An expansion for Long Long Long Sword Girl. This adds a deck for the Dragon, and contains 2 extra rules, that can be adjusted for difficulty.

name: Shinsei Maougun: VS the triple kingdom alliance
description:
User summary

An expansion to Shinsei Maougun. It adds the Lacour Kingdom to the human side, increasing the difficulty, but also makes the Demon Army a bit stronger.

Contains 32 new Demon cards and 4 new Human cards

name: Idol Conclave
description:
User summary

An idol-themed card game. Players are all a member of an idol group, but while being in the same group, wants to be voted to top idol. Each player has a set of cards with votes and scandals on and will play these onto the other members of the group. Each player also has one member they openly support.

Of the set cards each player has, one is Backstage Deal, which alows the player to play cards on a specific sheet, where each played cards will have various effects.

The player with the most votes at the end of the game wins.

name: Sandmännchen's Abendspaziergang
description:
Simple roll-and-move game.

It's a bedtime game for children - players roll the die and move their pawns, following the directions when they land on certain spaces - e.g. move forward, skip a turn...

Notes:
Predecessor of Sandmann, lieber Sandmann. Different editions were published during mid 1960s

name: SAVAGE WAR OF PEACE: A Solitaire Game of the Algerian War (1954-1962).
description:
SAVAGE WAR OF PEACE is a solitaire game of Combat during the French-Algerian War (1954-1962). The player assumes the role of a commander of combined French forces in Algeria. As commander, you are responsible for securing your Area of Operations (AOR) by successfully conducting various military operations in order to locate and destroy the enemy. Although there are many units available to you, they may often times be limited to you by political, logistical or geographical obstacles.

GAME OBJECTIVE
The objective of SAVAGE WAR OF PEACE is to successfully complete a number of missions and destroy enemy forces in order to gain Victory Points (VP) for the French Forces. The player can choose to play a short game (4 Missions), an average game (6 Missions), a long game (8 Missions) or a full Tour (12 Missions). Once all Missions have been resolved (successfully or not) the Player totals his VP and compares this with the Victory Determination Table to determine the level of success.
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Fireforce: Rhodesia – A Solitaire Game of the Rhodesian War (1964-1979)
description:
FIREFORCE: RHODESIA is a solitaire game of the Rhodesian War. The player assumes the role of a Commander of a combined Force of Rhodesian Security Forces, including the Rhodesian Light Infantry (RLI), Rhodesian SAS and the Elite, Selous Scouts. As commander, you are responsible for securing your Area of Operations (AOR) by successfully conducting various military operations in order to locate and destroy the enemy ZANLA and ZIRPA forces. Although there are many units available to you, they may often times be limited to you by political, logistical or geographical obstacles.

GAME OBJECTIVE
The objective of FIREFORCE: RHODESIA is to successfully complete a number of missions and destroy enemy forces in order to gain Victory Points (VP) for the Security Forces. The player can choose to play a short game (4 Missions), an average game (6 Missions), a long game (8 Missions) or a full Tour (12 Missions). Once all Missions have been resolved (successfully or not) the Player totals his VP and compares this with the Victory Determination Table to determine the level of success.
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid

name: Schmückt den Baum
description: This game was published on a "Toffifee" Box. The players roll a die. At the result of an even number, the player takes a random christmas Ornament, places it on the christmas tree and gets points awarded, as noted on the ornament. The gameeEnds when all ornaments are placed on the tree. The player with the most points wins the game.

name: Swop It
description:
Back cover text (translated):

"Swop it" means "to trade", and that's exactly what this game is about -- trading clothes with each other! First, let the clothes-spinner determine who you will challenge, and which item of clothing you two will exchange with each other, then the countdown begins. Let the clothes fly! The person who first succeeds at removing their piece of clothing and putting on the exchanged piece gets to go forward on the gameboard.


The game is played to 23 points (with more points given out in a round if the winner finishes trading clothes before the timer runs out).

name: Little Beaver's complete 3 game set
description:
Compilation of 3 games for children -
Game 1: see Little Burro Chase Game
Game 2: Falling off... : move according to die around the board; last player who survives (doesn't 'fall off' - see board) wins
Game 3: Prospecting... : first player who obtains an uranium mine wins

name: National Network Game
description: The National Network Game is played on a wooden board printed with a 5x5 grid. Each player has five pawns of the same colour. The game starts with a row of pawns in alternating colours on opposite sides of the board. Players alternate turns, moving one of their pieces one square at a time in any direction (horizontal, vertical, or diagonal.) The first player to manoeuver four pieces in a square or continuous straight line (in any direction) is the winner.

name: The Little Big Game of Moocho Sudooko
description: The Big Little Game of Moocho Sudooko turns sudoku puzzles into a board game. The board is a 9x9 square divided into 9 grids of 9. Each player gets 27 tiles (3 sets with the digits 1 to 9) in one of four colours. At the beginning of each turn the player rolls the dice and uses the result to decide which tile to play. A tile can be placed in any spot as long as there are not two identical numbers in the same row, column, or grid square. If the player cannot make a legal move, or the player does not play before the timer runs out, play passes to the next player. Play continues until there are no legal plays that can be made. (Alternatively, players may shift (but not remove) tiles to allow further plays.) The player with the fewest remaining tiles is the winner. In case of a tie, the numbers on the remaining tiles are added and the player with the lowest total wins.

name: Weg mit dem teuren Brennholz
description: Promotional game for "Individ Kohle" (brown coal briquettes) from the 1930s. The game can be played as a simple roll-and-move-game with event spaces, that hinder or benefit the player, or as a Pachisi variant (Heraus mit ihm!).
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: City Country World
description:
In this game, the children learn countries, capitals, flags and continents in an enjoyable game, while enriching their knowledge and memory skills!

Similar to matching pairs memory game.

Contents: 27 country cards & 27 city cards

name: The Road
description:
The Road is a post-apocalyptic survival card game set in the zombie-infested Australian outback.

It is a 3-5- player game which explores the social-dynamics of balancing group welfare against self-interest. You need to help each other in order to survive, but at the end of the day you must make ruthless decisions about who lives and dies.

As the name suggests, you are travelling down a road through the outback, attempting to reach the airfield which is your hope of escape. The game proceeds in a series of "days". Each day you choose the next location to explore, fight some zombies and scavenge for useful items. Each night you must decide who you can trust to stand guard while the others sleep.

As the days wear on, hunger and tiredness build, supplies run short, and you face a difficult decision: whether to remain loyal to the group, to run, or to turn on your fellow players (before they turn on you).
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Batman: The Joker Air Race Game
description:
Object: Capture the Joker. The first player to fly from Wayne Manor to the Joker's Flying Fortress wins.

Playing the Game: All players start a Wayne Manor. (green start square) The youngest player spins first and then moves his/her playing piece the number shown on the spinner. Play continues with the next player on the left. The first player to reach the Joker's Flying Fortress (red finish square) wins.

Flying: Players move in a straight line (left-right, up-down, diagonally) one direction per turn. Player may pass each other, but they cannot occupy the same space at the end of the turn. If a player lands on an occupied space, he/she must move one space less in another direction. Players CANNOT fly through buildings, they must fly OVER them.

The Spinner: The spinner is divided into six parts. The five numbered sections (2,3,4,5,6) show how many spaces a player can move during his/her turn. The Joker spinner section activates the "Plane Scrambler" forcing ALL PLAYERS to land on the building space directly below. Player resumes when the next player spins.
mechanics: Grid Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Disneyspin
description:
Each player chooses a Disney character He puts the character’s picture in front of him and pushes out all the pieces; eyes, gloves, pants, shoes, hat and jacket.
Players take turns to flick the Spinner round the Disney Circle. If the pointer comes to rest on a jacket, the player places the jacket on his character. If it comes to rest on a shoe, he puts one shoe on his character and so on. If the character already has the item on which the pointer has come to rest, the player doesn't score that time round. If the pointer comes to rest on a star the player may choose any one item and put it in position. The first player to complete dressing his character wins the game.

name: Alarmstufe 6
description:
The title refers to a 'level' of an alarm. Level 1 might be helping a cat down a tree but Level 6 might be a massive fire at a chemicals factory.

The board is a track of 60 spaces and, in that regard, it is a 'Goose-Type' game. Throw the die and move along the track and if you land on a space with instructions, you must obey those instructions. It has a few differences to common games of this type. Some spaces 'attract' other players' pieces to come to help you with an Alarm. This in effect means that other people will be helped forward if they are behind or brought back if they are in front. First to get to space 60, wins.

The playing pieces are small metallic fire-engines.

name: The Little Big Game of Word Maven
description:
The Little Big Game of Word Maven consists of 6 letter dice, a dice cup, paper money and a sand timer. One die is a vowel die, with a e i o u and an 8-ball on the faces. Five dice have a mix of consonants, vowels and wild sides. Players roll the vowel die to determine who goes first. Each player receives starting money from the bank and a Jackpot Fund is started.
On their turn each player rolls all 6 dice. The goal is to make the longest word possible with the letters on the face of the dice. The player may roll up to 3 times per turn, but must keep at least one die per roll. The first roll is free; money must be paid to the Jackpot Fund for each extra roll. If the 8-ball face is rolled the player's turn is immediately over. Each turn must be finished before the timer runs out.

Scoring is based on the length of the word the player makes. Longer words pay more money. The Jackpot is won when a player makes a 6 letter word without using any wild sides. The winner is the player who has the most money at the end of a predetermined time, or the player who reaches a predetermined amount of money first. Additionally, each die has an orange letter on one face that spells the word “MAVENS”. Spelling MAVENS instantly wins the game.

name: Pyrates: Curse of Neptune
description:
A 2-4 player board game that combines elements of Tower Defense and Dice Rolling to see who rules the seven seas. The name of the game is eliminating your opponents and getting the most loot as possible while in the process of taking over the Caribbean. You will sail throughout the board, discovering treasure, obtaining island defenses, and trying to survive a War on Piracy--all while avoiding the dreaded Curse of Neptune.

Each player is dealt a Pirate Captain and a Ship--which will give you a total hit point value for the game. Avoid the cannons, find the treasure, defeat your opponents.

name: Samurai Rundown
description:
The fortress has fallen. The battle lost. The forces are scattered. You're on the run! You can't tell who is friend or foe. Suddenly you hear a noise! Your enemy is upon you! You have to attack! But with what? You've forgotten his weakness! No matter, attack with all you have! Pray you'll go down with honor and your ancestors will be forgiving. Attack!

Samurai Rundown is a tile based player versus player game with card based battles. Players start on a tile based map and go around collecting items and weapons, and revealing map tiles. When a player thinks they have enough weapons, they go after their enemy to attack them. When they are adjacent to their enemy, they initiate a card battle. The loser of the card battle loses a heart. When a samurai loses 3 hearts they die.

Be the last samurai standing to win.

Samurai Rundown also has a showdown mode. When all the weapons are found and drawn. All samurai drop their hearts to one from being exhausted and head to the nearest temple to duel. The samurai then battle to the death. The last samurai standing here is the winner.

Be the last samurai standing.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Ancient, Card Game, Fighting, Print & Play
mechanics: Grid Movement, Modular Board, Open Drafting, Rock-Paper-Scissors, Tile Placement

name: Wizard Survival
description:
A dark age approaches the Realm of Atheria –- the vast ancestral lands of the Amurelden people are under siege by countless hordes of mana-infected beasts.

While cold steel and piercing iron may help defend the Kingdoms and Empires that stretch across the sub-continent, their only real chance for surviving rests in the hands of wizards.

The passing of the Lorelias comet signalled the coming of a new era –– one marked by a relentless battle for survival.

The sapphire colossus was last seen more than three centuries ago – it torched the skies, spilling its mana-filled insides across the entire planet. Many believed that the mystical messenger of doom would never return --

Some of the more ancient wizards still remembered the chaos of its last passing -- they themselves witnessed the horrors and death that unfolded in its wake -- things they had hoped never to see again.

Wizard Survival is a card game for 2-4 players. The games mechanics were specifically designed to assure that every game is a new and unique challenge.

One of the games two modes is survival - a free-for-all match that is won by being the last surviving Wizard in the game. Players use magic spells to defend against marauding monsters, and are limited by the scarcity of resources.

The other game mode is cooperative, in which players join forces in order to vanquish the 4 powerful bosses. This mode has four difficulty levels, especially designed to push players to their limits.

name: Blood Fall: The Last Days
description:
A fully cooperative survival miniatures board game. Mission-based with a highly modular game board.

Every player takes the roll of a survivor to fight against the reavers and horrifying mutants, causes through the outbreak 5 years ago.

Blood Fall: The Last Days offers a great combat system where positioning is the key to survive. You have to find Items, weapons, crafting upgrades with components to manage your character. You can learn skills to improve your chances to survive.

Beside the combat system one of the great and innovative game features is the enemy AI. Every enemy acts by itself. They have movement paths and smart combat mechanics.

The game design has finished to 90%. The artwork is about 90%. Actual focus is on mission design for great adventures.

Play Testers Voice:
"So complex, but not complicated."
"Highly cooperative. Don't split the group!"
"The best weapon system i've played with...a shotgun feels like a shotgun and a kitchen knife -puh- feels like that. Great."
"Very smart A.I. system. The routing of the enemies is great and acts as a natural timer. If you had the chance to test it. Test it!"

name: Bild-A-Word Picture Puzzles
description: A spin-off of the then-popular game Bild-A-Word, meant for very young players. It includes 36 cards each with a letter, color band, and part of a picture. The object is to match cards by their bands, assemble the picture on the included easel, and see the spelling of the animal pictured.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Word Game

name: Blaas-Balspel
description:
Cute old Dutch game.

Components in my edition:
2 Spoons
4 Balls
Insert that acts as the board
Rules inside lid

The game is intended for children and was designed to help children with their mathematical skills. Game 1 is for the youngest children. Game 2 is for slightly older children. Game 3 is intended for much older children, say, 8 to 10 year olds.

The board is punctuated with holes and each hole has a value next to it. The cute spoons have a long handle and a 'bowl' into which you balance a ball. Hold the spoon over the board and blow the ball off. If the ball is in a hole, do the same with the 2nd ball. If, at any time, a ball does not roll into a hole, the player may blow it again.

Game 1. Add the two numbers together after both balls are in holes. The highest total wins.

Game 2: Start with a base total of 5. Add the value of the hole where the first ball lands. Subtract the value of the hole where the 2nd ball landed. Highest total wins.

Game 3: Use all 4 balls. Again, start with a base total of 5. The first ball's value multiplies the base score. The second ball is added to the running total. The third ball is subtracted from the running total and the 4th ball is divided into the running total after the third ball has been computed. Highest total achieved, wins.

name: A Golden Game of Biology
description:
A children's game that teaches about the development of life on earth. Players spin the spinner and move their dinosaur-shaped pawn that number of spaces, which correspond to different species. They progress from micro-organisms through plants to invertebrates and then vertebrates, each time doing ocean life and then land life. There are numerous squares that make you go back 2 if you land on them, and the last 5 spaces must be landed on by exact count, all giving a catch-up mechanism.

The back of the board has family trees for the plant and animal kingdoms, and charts showing forms of life appearing during different epochs of earth history.

name: Das Sprungbrett
description: The first player to get his 2 pawns from space 1 to space 100 wins the game. Movement is determined by 1 or 2 dies. If a pawn lands on a space with the number 10 or a multiple of 10, its next roll counts double. A pawn that gets on a space with a square number automatically advances by as much spaces as the numbers square root. Spaces with prime numbers can only be left by rolling a prime number.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Hongerige Harrie
description:
Harrie has eaten all your stuff. Try to pick them one by one out of his mouth. He's asleep. Watch out! Don't wake him, he'll grab your hand!

Is the object you grabbed colored? Well done! Did you grab an insect or a black object? Ouch! You have to put the item back into Harrie's mouth and you lose one of your collected items.

When Harrie bites while your hand is in his mouth, you lose 2 of your collected items.

The first player to collect 5 items, wins the game.

There is a special scoring system for older children.

name: Spurs and Sprockets: Villager Start Card Expansion
description:
The Villager Start Card Expansion includes one card/tile that may be used with all Spurs and Sprockets card/tile decks.

The Villager is placed in the field first and the start player places his/her card/tile adjacent to the Villager. Play continues based on which Spurs and Sprockets rules you have decided to play with. The Villager card/tile has no lines in any directions and can't be added to any player's adjacent rows for attacking, defending or scoring purposes. It works as a blocking mechanism. The Villager may be destroyed by using Tic Attack Toe or Fired Away rules.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Print & Play
mechanics: Hand Management, Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition, Tile Placement

name: 20 Questions (Pepys Party Game)
description:
A spoken party game in which players try to guess the object on the card using closed questions (that can only be answered 'Yes', 'No', or 'Maybe'). If players fail to guess correctly within 20 questions the answerer wins.

Based on the BBC Radio panel game show (which was itself based on a US radio show derived from a 19th century parlour game) the package contains twelve object cards with enough information to answer most questions.

name: Dead Man's Hand: Bushwhackers and Jayhawkers
description:
Three scenes and rules and card for two new gangs found in Wargames Illustrated 320.

The rules allows you to use the gangs Jayhawkers and Bushwackers in three new scenes set during the American civil war.
categories: American Civil War, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement

name: Dead Man's Hand: Rogues' Gallery – Wild Bill
description: This expantion includes miniature rules and card for using Wild Bill in your Dead Man's Hand game.
categories: American West, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement

name: Dead Man's Hand: Rogues' Gallery – Buckshot Roberts
description: This expantion includes miniature, rules and card for using Buckshot Roberts in your Dead Man's Hand game.
categories: American West, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Dead Man's Hand: Rogues' Gallery – Jonathan Pain
description: This expantion includes miniature and card for using Jonathan Pain in your Dead Man's Hand game. Full rules are found in Dead Man´s hand : Down Under.
categories: American West, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Dead Man's Hand: Rogues' Gallery – Roy Magnum
description: This expantion includes miniature and card for using Roy Magnum in your Dead Man's Hand game. Full rules are found in Dead Man´s hand : Down Under.
categories: American West, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement

name: Dead Man's Hand: Rogues' Gallery – Doc Amos
description: This expantion includes miniature rules and card for using Doctor Amos in your Dead Man's Hand game.
categories: American West, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement

name: Pokerette
description:
From the game:

"The object of the game is to form as many poker hands as possible by placing cards as they are called in the spaces in the bottom of the board (a 5x5 grid). Hands are read horizontally, vertically and diagonally. The maximum number of hands is therefore twelve, but total score will vary according to the skill of player in placing the cards."

Every player has a deck of cards. There is one caller, who shuffles their deck, then draws 25 cards, one at a time, and calls it out. All players then take their copy of that card and everyone, on their own board, places the card somewhere on the 5x5 grid. Once everyone's grid is filled, whoever has the highest total score, calculated based on the poker hands created when placing cards in the grid, is the winner.
publishers: The United States Playing Card Company

name: Audentese lauamäng
description:
Promotional board game for Audentes privat school for their 20th birthday.

Player rolls the die, moves around the board and if the game-piece lands on certain places He/She tries to answer the questions or solves the different tasks. If player answers incorrectly or doesn´t solve the task He/She misses next turn. All questions and tasks are connected with the school somehow.

First player who has made the whole round around the board is the winner.

name: Fantasy Football: Draft, Deals, and Dice
description:
Fantasy Football: Draft, Deals, and Dice (FF3D) is a card drafting and dice rolling game that allows players to simulate the fantasy football experience. FF3D is designed to be played with 2 or 4 players, though expansions can easily allow up to 16 players. FF3D can be played in anywhere from 60-120 minutes, depending on the length of time players spend on their initial drafting process.

The base game of Fantasy Football: Draft, Deals, and Dice allows players to compete with each other over a shortened four week fantasy football season. The Owners have the opportunity to draft their fantasy rosters from a pool of randomized Players at the start of the season. The Team and Player Ratings are randomized at the start of each season, so no two seasons will ever be the same. One year, the San Francisco QB could be a star player with major upside – the next year, he could be a mediocre talent that shrinks in the Primetime. The winner is able to initially assess the random market conditions of the league to maximize their draft selections within their roster restrictions, as well as able to navigate the flow of the season’s Defensive Matchups, Injuries, Hot Streaks better than their opponents.

After establishing agreed upon Roster Requirements for the League, the game begins with (and features) everyone’s favorite part of the fantasy football season – the fantasy draft.

The Game is split into three main segments:
The Fantasy Draft
The Regular Season
The Playoffs

Owners will draft a team of Players and set their starting lineups against the opposing Owner on their Fantasy Schedule. The Owners take turns determining their Weekly Results by rolling a specified number of Offensive and Defensive dice for each Player in their Starting Lineup. The number and types of dice rolled are influenced by the Player's Skill and Upside Levels, as well as any Team Matchup Modifiers, Player Hot Streaks, or Player Injuries that have been assigned to the player during the game play. In-Game Events could also trigger unexpected outcomes that can swing the momentum during a game. After all games have been played, the Owner with the most points in the matchup receives the win. At the end of each week, Players are randomly selected to either go on a Hot Streak or go on the Injured Reserve. Owners may replace Injured players by following a Waiver and Free Agency process against the other Owners to select Players from the pool of unselected Players from the initial draft. The first three weeks make up the Regular Season, with the Top 2 teams competing in Week 4 for the Championship.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Simulation, Trading

name: Fröhliche Ferienfahrt mit dem Blendax-Max
description:
Simple roll-and-move game. The first player to reach space 50 wins the game. Movement is determined by a die. On certain spaces events occur, that hinder or benefit the player.

This game was used as a consolation prize for a competition in 1955 but it may have been produced since as early as 1936.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Mit Blendax-Max auf Reisen
description: Simple roll-and-move game. The first player to reach space 60 wins the game. Movement is determined by a die. On certain spaces events occur, that hinder or benefit the player.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Der Niklas kommt
description: Simple roll-and-move game. The first player to reach the house wins the game. Movement is determined by a die. On certain spaces events occur, that hinder or benefit the player.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Im Schnee: Ein lustiges Leiterspiel
description:
A simple race game in the tradition of Chutes and Ladders. Move by die roll. If you land on a red number (step forward), green number (fall backwards), follow instructions glued into the lid. The first to reach space 130 exactly is the winner.
note:
likely published during mid 1920s

name: Fields of Fire: Movie Monster Madness
description:
Fields of Fire: Movie Monster Madness is a short supplement for Fields of Fire: Miniatures Rules for Modern Combat that allows you to battle historical miniatures against giant lizards, zombies, hordes of insects, and more!

What's more, Fields of Fire: Movie Monster Madness includes fast play rules so that you can get started even if you don't own the core rules set.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Secret Unit Deployment, Team-Based Game

name: Im Schlaraffenlande!
description:
A simple race game in the tradition of the Game of Goose. Move by die roll. If you land on a colored space, obey the instructions glued into the lid.
notes:
Translation: cockaigne, mythical land of plenty;
Cover written in 'Sütterlin' script

name: Aschenbrödl
description:
Objective: gain most chips (coins) and become the wealthiest player at the end of the game;

Each player has to buy in first; 32 cards are describing the fairy tale of 'Cinderella' by forming a board; cards are distributed among the players who must play cards according rising numbers. Read aloud card before placing it upon the table und follow instructions according an advantage/disadvantage table.
note:
likely published ~1890
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Mythology

name: Berg Heil!
