description: A simple race game in the tradition of the Game of Goose. Move by die roll. If you land on a marked square, obey the instructions. The first to reach target space is the winner.

name: Apfel-Ernte.
description:
Objective: be the first getting rid of all your chips
rolling by turns
Each player gets an equal quantity of numbered (1-5) chips.
A board with 60 spaces with numbers from 1-5 has to be filled up with chips. Roll the die: any matching number you may place a correnspondent chip on. Throwing a '6' - free of choice + another turn.

supplement to the magazine 'Deutsche Kinderwelt', edition no. 22/1935

name: After Dinner Games Compendium
description:
'After Dinner Games Compendium' consists of 1 deck of 50 over-sized cards. Each card or card set provides instructions for a group game or activity. Twenty-one games are included:


Analogies
Charades
Clumps
Colander Game
Contortion
Desire
Dumb Crambo
Eye-Spy
Guggenheim
Hot Gossip
Obstacle Race
Orange Game
Pass It On
Poetry, Please
Quick on the Draw
String Along
Telegrams
Tricks
Up, Jenkins
Word Bluff
Yatzee

name: Savage Plains: A Solitaire Game of Indian Fighting on the Southwestern Plains (1865-1890).
description:
BACKGROUND: SAVAGE PLAINS is semi-historical simulation of the American Indian Wars on the Southern Plains from 1865 to 1890. The Game begins after the American Civil War and the re-United States is ready to expand its influence and power. The US feels its Manifest Destiny is to expand and annex the Territories separating the Eastern States and California. In order to accomplish this, they must attempt to bring peace and stability to the region by “Pacifying” the Indian Tribes living there. This can be accomplished either through military victories or through diplomatic Peace Treaties.

OBJECTIVE: Player takes command of the US Army Forces on the Frontier of the Southern Plains. The Player’s Objective is to pacify the Indian Territories in the region in order to make it safe to build US Settlements, as well as, the Transcontinental Railroad. The Player must attempt to build a number of US Settlements with a total Settlement Value (SV) of at least 41 by the end of the Turn in which the last Campaign Card is Played.

FEATURES: SAVAGE PLAINS features many colorful game counters including US Cavalry, US Infantry, US Artillery and Gatling Guns, Sioux, Cheyenne, Comanche and Apache Indian Units. Counters, also, include individual US and Indian Heroes and Scouts.

SAVAGE PLAINS can be found at the following URL:
http://www.berserkergames.net
categories: American Indian Wars, Print & Play, Wargame
mechanics: Area Movement, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Royal Combat: Warriors of History
description:
In this exciting battle strategy card game with 4 methods of play, dueling Kings and Queens gather the greatest warriors from history to battle against their rivals.

Imagine playing the popular "war" card game with actual warriors from history, or playing a "battlefield" strategy game in which you organize an army to capture your opponent's castle using the greatest warriors from different times and places from history, or playing the popular "memory" game with pairs of historical warriors. And imagine playing "capture the flag" outside and giving each player a role to play as a specific warrior from history.

You get these 4 games in 1 from Royal Combat: Warriors of History, the card game.

Led by the Royal Gold Star players and assisted by the Special Silver Star players, each team / player strategizes against their opponent to defend their own castle while attempting to capture their opponent's castle. In the active role play option and the tabletop battlefield option there is a castle area and a battlefield area on which your green star warriors from history can be placed along with the gold star, silver star and shadow players. Shadow players are lowest in rank but operate subversively and secretly in the shadows and have special powers that enable them to capture certain members of the higher ranks.

For example, the Royal Gold Star cards (King, Queen and Knight) can take out the Special Silver Cards (General, Admiral and Ace), which can take out the Green Star Warriors from History (Commando, Spartan, Samurai, Mongol, Ming, Viking, Highlander, Zulu, etc...), which can take out the black star Shadow cards (Sniper, Ninja and Spy). Yet the black star Sniper can take out the Silver Star General and the black star ninja can take out the Gold star King, etc...

name: Artilla
description:
Objective: gain most victory points by hitting opposing army

Each player places his army pawns according a spreadsheet (general rearmost). Then they take turns loading their cannons (called 'Brummer') and firing in direction to the enemy by using a puff-ball. Game ends after agreed time (sum up victory points) or if a general is pushed over.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Wargame, World War I

name: Dieb im Haus: Lustiges Verfolgungs-Spiel
description:
There's a thief in your house - try to catch him or escape successfully (as thief)

Players take turns moving their pawn on the track. The thief needs to reach space 50 and then return to 1 to escape, and has a headstart of two turns. Certain space apply special effects when you land on them.

If any other player can leave before the thief escapes he/she's the winner.

name: Tag Fur Tag
description:
A simple promotional race game in the tradition of Game of Goose. Move by die roll. If you land on a red number (advantage - see event list on the map), blue number (disadvantage - dito) follow instructions. The first to reach space 90 exactly is the winner.
note:
likely published during mid 1950s

name: Deutschland braucht Kolonien
description:
Trivia game with questions based on the German colonies until WWI.
-
There are six different maps showing German colonies/Africa. Each player chooses one to play with. Then, 78 cards are shuffled, and players take turns answering questions from the deck. If a player knows the correct answer, he gains the card. The player with most cards is the winner.

Each set of the six maps shows a nice puzzle on the backside.
likely published ~1937;

name: Würfeln mit Kundi: Geburtstagsfeier im Pionierhaus
description: A simple 'GDR' race game in the tradition of Game of Goose. Move by die roll. If you land on a marked number follow instructions. The first to reach target space (Pionierhaus) is the winner.

name: Chromatix
description:
Chromatix is a connection game (in the vein of Hex) for three players. The game is played on a “hexhex” board (a hexagon shaped board made of hexagonal cells). Opposite sides of the board are labeled in the three secondary colors orange, purple, and green. One player owns the orange sides, another owns the purple sides, and the final player owns the green sides. The playing stones are the primary colors of red, blue, and yellow. Each player plays the primary colors that mix to form his/her secondary color (e.g. the player who owns the orange sides plays the red and yellow stones). On his turn, a player must play a single stone in one of his/her two primary colors ("own-stones") to any empty cell. Once placed, stones do not move. Corner cells belong to both of the sides that meet there.

A player can win in two ways: if there is (a) a group of own-stones that connects his sides; or (b) a group of own-stones that connects three non-adjacent sides. If more than one win criterion is achieved simultaneously, then the winner is the first player in move order (beginning with mover) who has thus fulfilled a win criterion. A player who is blocked from both ways of winning is eliminated from the game (but his/her stones remain on the board).

One last rule is the “STOP-NEXT” rule: A player may NOT play in a way that leaves the next player with an immediate win on his/her next turn. (In other words, you must block the next player if possible.)

Chromatix was inspired by the three player connection game Triskelion, designed by Bill Taylor and Joao Neto.

name: LR Fraustadt 1706
description: A simple fast treatment of a small Great Northern War Battle. Find Rules and Vassal Module in Files section this page.

name: Verkehrs-Rallye
description: The theme of the game is a rally in Stuttgart. Movement is determined by a die. On certain spaces the players have to draw cards and answer questions about traffic situations. The cards come in 3 different difficulty levels.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Ultimate Rock Paper Scissors
description:
A hilariously intense card game that combines fist bumps, mind games and good ol' Rock Paper Scissors.

Two players compete by throwing rock paper or scissors to play the corresponding card on their play area. These cards have various effects and deal damage to a player's opponent. The first player to reduce his opponent's life to 0 is declared the victor.

name: Maneuvers
description:
Maneuvers is an abstract naval strategy game published in 1942.

The board is a grid of 11 by 14 interconnected squares representing naval bases. Each player controls 33 tokens representing battleships, submarines, and aircraft.

Players take turns placing ships or planes on the naval bases; when a row of five identical tokens has been created the player wins a victory. Depending on the type of sequence created the victorious player may remove certain combinations of enemy units from the grid. For example, if a submarine pattern has been formed a player may decide to remove two enemy battleships.

The first player to lose seven tokens in any two categories is considered to be incapable of continuing the struggle. The other player is declared the winner.

While the game is designed for two players optional rules permit three or four to enjoy a session.

name: Futebol Total
description:
Futebol Total is a card game where you assume the role of a technical team. Know your players and select them as you like using the tactic you prefer (attack, defense, balance etc). You can literally create a 8-1-1 tactic if you want, for example.

Organize your deck to match the cards according to your players and their tactics on the field for better performance in the game. Attack cards using dribble, pass and speed, control of midfield, perfect kick, foul, among many others, are part of the game deck . Choosing the right cards at the right amount, according to the characteristics of your team is essential for your game flows well and you win.

Futebol Total is a LCG with basic decks (balanced team, counterattack team, offensive team etc.) and specific expansions to increase and improve your team and your tactics alternatives with more cards.

Choose and well organize your deck and choose your players will be as important as the game itself. Each game has 10 to 12 rounds.

(Sorry, description translated by google translator. Better description in the future.)

name: KURSK 1943
description:
After the defeat at Stalingrad and destruction of the 6th Army, the Wehrmacht has regained strength and it is ready to inflict the Soviets a Tactical defeat around Kursk, where huge Soviet forces are massing in preparation of the summer offensive.
In the first days of July, thousands of tanks will fight the greatest tank battle in history.

KURSK 1943 is a new concept game covering greatest tank battle in history fought in Russia in July 1943.

Developed on wooden blocks, over a colorful 86x64 cm mapboard, 400g thick.
The over 200 wooden/plastic components have been created by the best Italian artisinal industry and painted "A buratto", a technique usually adopted for painting car parts and accessories.

Historical Background
In July 1943, the Germans tried the last gambit in the East before the initiative switched (and remained) to the Soviets.
The Heer planned an offensive around the Kursk salient with the aim to annihilate the huge concentration of Soviet forces massing in the area. The outcome was the largest tank battle in history with tousands of tanks involved in close combat fights for days.

KURSK 1943 is a game for two players, one controls the Germans and the other one controls the Soviets.
Although based on history, players in command of the two sides can modify the evolution of the battle and of the history in the Eastern Front.

Rules Introduction
The rules are easy - 6 pages - players can start playing the game without too many rules to remember and the game is 5 turn long (90-120 minutes)
Then the 10 Optional Rules provide more specific and detailed rules for an enhanced realism, such as special Tank abilities (Blitz, Tiger Battallion, Charge), Soviet Minefields and Maskirovka, Retreat, Combined Attack, Morale...

Scale
A cm is approximately 7 km.
A turn is 5 'days' long.
A full strength counter represents a Leader or a Division (a Corps for the Soviets).

Fog of War
The game must be played with the Fog of War on (wooden blocks are placed on the map in such a way the opponent player can not see them).

Language: English, German, French, Spanish and Italian
Genre: Tactic
Turns: Turn-Based
Complexity: Entry Level to Basic, depending on which rules are used
Period: WW2

name: Serpents
description:
User summary:
Serpents is a strategic race game with almost no luck involved. Its theme is the struggle for survival among 7 varieties of serpents. The game is played with 2-4 players.

Each player takes a postcard-sized game board that depicts a winding serpent. The serpent is divided into 26 segments, each with a number ranging from 1 to 3 (some segments have a special effect: Attack or Guard). Each player places their three tokens on three segments from the tail. The goal is to take all of the three tokens to the serpent's head.

Each turn, each player add up the numbers where their three tokens are on, and simultaneously advance one of their token segments equal to that total. If the token lands on an Attack segment, each opponent must move all of their own tokens 1 segment backward, unless they had just advanced a token to a Guard segment.

Players interact with each other by Attacking/Guarding, and each serpent has its own special ability. Each turn, each player has limited options, and they are known to all players. So players' decisions and interactions will determine the winner.

Publisher's summary:
サーペンツは2～4人用の異なる7種のヘビで生存競争を行う、運の要素がほぼ無い戦略レースゲームです。
プレイヤーは異なるヘビのコロニーとなり３つのコマのマス目に書かれて居る数字の合計を１つのコマの移動力としゴールをめざします。
マス目には攻撃やガードのマークもありプレイヤー間のインタラクションが発生します。
また各ヘビはそれぞれ固有の能力を持ち、これらの使用の見極めが重要となります。
最も早く3つのコマ全てをゴールさせた者が勝者となります。

name: Sinister Winds of Rising Dogma
description:
You are the leader of a band of mercenaries funded by an employer to take control of a location and rid it of your employer's enemies.Your home is dud of a safe haven planet to which your ancestors fled from an unwinnable war. Turns out the planet's wildlife is more of a threat than the war was. Now most people are doing what they can to survive, while those few that thrive aim to mold this new world as they see fit.

Players spend currency called Clips, which is provided by controlled bases, to hire differing levels of troopers, based on the amount spent to hire, and summon them to Base Spaces they control on a hexagon girded map consisting of various different terrain types.

Players selectively draw cards from a personal deck into their hand. Players spend Clips to purchase Tier Cards and summon them from their hand of cards to a base they control. There are three tire types, Blue Tier, Green Tier, and Red Tier, each with different types of corresponding weapons and armor cards. Tire color types and sub-types determine the effectiveness of different types of weapons vs. different types of armor and vice versa. The more Tier cards of a color the player has attached to bases they control the better the items, of the matching color, they can equip from their hand to troopers.

Once players have troopers on the map they then spend movement points to maneuver their troopers around the map in an effort to defeat their opponents by utilizing terrain spaces which conceal troopers to keep their tier investments a secret, eliminating enemy troopers in combat, capturing neutral/enemy bases, stealing enemy tech, exploring dangerous ruins for lost technology that could aid their efforts, and visiting settlements which will challenge their wits and offer beneficial trading options.

Combat is initiated when a trooper attacks a target that is within range of their equipped weapon at which point an eight sided die is rolled. If the number rolled plus the level of the attacking trooper is greater than the level of the target plus any modifiers, then the attack hits and damage is calculated based on weapon and armor types and sub-types.

name: All Gods Are Dying
description:
All Gods Are Dying is a strategic board game about the true nature of religions

Earth is the planet of our evolution. The home of all mankind and all of it’s imaginary creations, the so called „Gods”. These things can elicit such emotions in humans that make them able to willingly do literally anything. Churches are organizations created to control and use these emotions. They nourish the delusion and work for their owners’ greed. Atheists are free fighters against Gods.

Every player leads a religion. Religion deceives with light but good things are all available by secular ways. Delusion, oppression flow from religion. Missionaries collect money and convert people. The aim is to make more money, to level-up the religion, to reach the highest level and power over all others.

There are three different kind of areas in the game where religion’s missionaries can get money from believers. City, country, and playground - because some religions like to use children for their purposes. Values are depending on the religion’s nature and popularity in the area.

You start the game on the first level. By collecting enough money you level-up your religion in greed. By successfully finishing a mission you level-up your religion in spirituality. On player's board numbers show bonus points or penalties valid at that level. That value influences the collected money and the power to convert as well.

Four kinds of levels are to go through from white to red. With different colors new action cards and mission cards become available. Level-up by money becomes more expensive. You have five cards in the game, action and mission cards mixed. You have three cards hidden with face down. And you have to show openly the other two.

You may do the following in your turn:

Roll the dice and move your followers (the pieces)
Get your money from your followers
Or convert other player’s follower
Use an action card and draw another one – action or mission card
And may accomplish one of your missions


Or, if you don’t like your cards

You may replace up to three of them.


Your aims are

to reach the top level of greed,
to reach the top level of spirituality.


Depending on the game style you may win by reaching the top level, or beating others.

name: Norsk Galskap
description:
This is a game full of humoristic streaks, Norwegian myths, sensations and celebrities.

In Norsk Galskp (=Norwegian Madness) you win if you are the first player to travel from start through to finish, but on the way you have to do funny tasks that will bring out your true inner madness.In this game you can get the ability to send your opponents into a 4 second slow motion state, draw cards to make the others pick invisible apples from the ceiling every time you shout "apple-picking", or maybe you are the one who has to improvise a "Joik"(=Sami song) whilst the other players clap a beat?

If you bring Norsk Galskap to the check-out till, you're not just buying a game, but moments filled with both madness and laughter. Norsk Galskap takes but 20 seconds to learn, and will make holidays, cabin-trips and Friday nights into stories and events that might never be forgotten.

name: Die lustige Kletterstange
description: Simple roll-and-move-game. The first player to reach space 28 wins the game. By the roll of an even number, the player moves forward. If the player rolls an odd number, he has to move backward.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Sjansen
description:
"Sjansen" is a Dutch word for flirting. It's a tongue in cheek game about flirting.

From the publisher's website:
In the bar, at courtside or in class rooms: flirting is possible everywhere. Nevertheless one is better at it than the other. Fortunately a game exists that teaches you flirting in three simple lessons. Decide how far you will go and with whom.

It's a matter of luck, an enormous challenge, but above all it's a tactical game. Newbies need practise, others are naturals. Anyway every single student needs to do it often. Everyone gets the same lessons but not everyone will learn as fast. Mixed signals, it's all there. Take your chance and maybe you will find Mr. or Mrs. Right this way!

name: Knight-mare Chess
description: In Knight-mare Chess each player controls their troops with their knights and the shaman. Players should move their pieces and destroy their opponents with strategy and luck.

name: Stack 'Em 5
description:
Stack 'Em 5 is a highly addictive, unique new board game that has aspects of several classics before it, such as chess, checkers, tic-tac-toe, Connect 4, Go, and even Pente, but on a whole new level, or should I say levels. Think of it as 3D connect 5 on gogo juice! And, unlike all its predecessors, and most strategy games of today, Stack'Em 5 allows for more than 2 players at a time. That being said, it is an incredibly strategic battle for 2 players, however as many as 7 can enjoy it, but with 8 or more we wont take responsibility for what might happen next. You and your family & friends will find a new meaning of competitiveness, making Monopoly Night look like a calm night! It's extremely simple to learn for even the youngest gamer, but will take years to master its strategies, making it challenging for the veteran player as well.

Strategy 101: Every single move counts in the which players try to achieve 5 in-a-row, ball by ball! The fundamental rules take less than a minute to learn, yet the game has the complexity to engage both beginners and experts alike - perfect for the entire family!

Stack 'Em 5 Rules!

Each player chooses a color and takes a set of balls. Players take turns stacking balls on the board, the first player starts by placing his/her first ball within the 9 center rods, after which point play is open to any of the 49 rods. Each and every ball is stacked strategically so that 5-in-a-row is accomplished vertically, horizontally, or diagonally just so long as it forms a straight line from point to point with NO turns. Easy Right! The rotation of play is counter-clockwise with a time limit of 30 seconds per turn, keeping you on your toes. The board itself spins completely around, either left or right on the center rod, giving the current player the ability to look at all the different angles. Only the current player may move the board, and he/she may do so as mush as they like, until the end of their turn. Once a ball is stacked, it cannot be removed or placed elsewhere, and the players turn is over. There are no restrictions on how balls of different colors are stacked. You may put a ball on any of the 49 rods that are open. Once 7 balls occupy a rod, that rod is full, giving the players a total of 343 possible positions on the board. The goal is to simply block your opponent from getting 5-in-a-row while strategically placing your balls to do just that. Be tactical. Obstruct your opponent(s) while expanding your own “territory”. The game ends when a player has been able to link 5-in-a-row in any way possible.

name: Pour It To 'Em Boys: Fast Play Civil War Rules
description:
Pour It To 'Em Boys is an accurate fast play rule set for the American Civil War. It is designed for an evening's fun with a few figures or for a large battle with no paperwork. As written the rules are for 15mm, 20mm, and 25mm models. For 5mm to 10mm substitute centimeters for inches. The rules are written for reasonable people. If there is a disagreement during a game each player rolls 2 dice and the high scorer makes his/her point.

Originally published without copyright.

These rules were previously published as a broader period rules set titled "Kepi & Pickelhaube".
categories: American Civil War, Book, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Battle Axe
description:
Battle Axe is a simple diceless tabletop system for skirmish-level battles in the fantasy genre. It uses a card-based system that offers a wealth of options in game-play and allows players the experience of seeing their tactical decisions win the day, rather than the luck of the dice. By combining the best that CCG and tabletop gaming have to offer you end up with a system that offers endless options and expansion.

The rules and cards provided in the Deluxe Set will be enough to get you started, and new characters and rule expansions are available to increase both the size and composition of your War Bands.
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building

name: Spurs and Sprockets: Turncoat
description:
The Turncoat Start Card Expansion includes one card/tile that may be used with all Spurs and Sprockets card/tile decks.

The Turncoat card/tile has a single orthogonal line on one side and a single diagonal line on the other side. After deciding which side you will be playing with the Turncoat is placed on the field first and the start player places his/her card/tile adjacent to the Turncoat. Play continues based on the Spurs and Sprockets rules you have decided to play with. The Turncoat has a 2 on it and it may be added in the normal manner to all players adjacent rows for attacking, defending or scoring purposes.
At the biginning of your turn you may turn the Turncoat 90 degrees.
The Turncoat may be destroyed by using Tic Attack Toe or Fired Away rules.
categories: Abstract Strategy, American Revolutionary War, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Party Game, Print & Play
mechanics: Hand Management, Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition, Tile Placement

name: TetrAction: The Duel of Wisdom
description:
For a long time ago,three witches duel each other for that get the epic magical relic called "Tetrite".
They must draw magical power form 3 tetrite, and cast their spells for beat their opponent.
It depends on your choice which witch will can survive?

TetrAction is a game of Three-dimensional puzzle for 2 players.
Your goal is to beat your opponent that you must decrease opponent's life 15 to 0.

The feature of this game is 3 tetrahedrons.They have 3 colors: red,blue,and yellow.Their surface have one of them.
On the board and your hand(reveal) have some magic scroll.
It have cost that 3 colors and sequences.

[example1] R:Red B:Blue Y:Yellow X:any color
If the cost is "RRRXX" 3 surface in your view must be RRRXX.

name: TRIGON
description:
Strategie Game/Placement Game for two people:

The winner is the first person who can place a pyramid, a strip or a group of stars with his own blocks. In most cases the game is then finished.

Contains 36 triangles in red and blue, 3 sets of each pieces each numbered from 1-6

General Rules:

An enclosed empty space may never be formed on the playing field.
Each block must be placed so as to be touching at least one other block on at least one side.
Star:


6 blocks of the same colour placed together in a hexagon form a star; complete stars (including those which extend into other stars) are only protected against the moves of an opponent, not against the player's own moves.

Course of the Game:
The players decide who shall start. Every player places one block of his colour. All of the blocks must be placed in the playing field before the first player begins moving or exchanging blocks. Only one block can be moved or two blocks exchanged per turn.

Moving:
A player can only move his/her own blocks at random to a new position in the playing field.

Exchanging:
The positions of two blocks may be interchanged in an exchange. A player's own blocks rnay be exchanged regardless of the numbering. A player's blocks rnay only be exchanged with those of an opponent when the numbers of both blocks are the sarne, i.e., 4 for 4.

Formations:

Pyramid:
The placing together of 16 blocks of the same colour in an equal-sided triangle.

Strip:
11 blocks of the same colour in a straight line.

Star group:
Four stars of the same colour extending into one another and containing 16-18 blocks (depending on the form of the group) make up a star group.

name: Johnny Condom
description:
Card Game
Object of the game: To get as many high scoring pairs as possible.
The winner: is the one with the highest score. This is determined by adding up the numbers on the right hand corner of each pair of mates.
Dealer gives each player seven cards and puts the rest of the pack in the middle, turning over the first card. Each player looks to see if he has any mates. This can be seen by matching the number at the top right hand corner. A pair must be one male and one female, not two males or females. If he has any pairs, he places them face up in front of him, so that everyone can see.
Each turn, the player must have a minimum of five cards in his hand before he starts. If his hand has become depleted because he won some pairs on his previous turn, then he must take as many cards as he needs from the middle pile to bring his hand up to five. He can take the last card thrown down by the last player as one of these cards if he wishes. If he has a pair (or pairs), he puts them in front as before so that everyone can see. At the end of his turn, he throws down one card on the upturned pile.
Tracey Trouble card can be acted upon when the player wishes to steal unprotected pairs ie: if one is picked from the pile, he may act upon it immediately or keep it until it is of more use.
Johnny Condom cards can be used whenever a player wants to protect his pairs whether he picks one up or is dealt one. To protect a pair he must place a Johnny Condom card on top of that pair.
Right Brian Bummer cards are good for nothing and are there as a joker card - mainly to hold up the game.
5When all the pairs are out and the only cards still circulating are Tracey’s, Johnny’s or Right Brian’s, then each player adds up his score and the player with the highest number is the winner.

Amusing Note: According to the back of the box there are cards called 'Right Brain Bummer', i.e. no good, but in the components they have changed to 'Right Brian Bummer'. Someone didn't do their spell-checking very well.

name: At Bat Game
description:
A 3-in-1 in which you try to predict the Outcome of the Batter at Bat. The 3 ways are:"LIVE" Batter a Batter; from a Custom Deck of 52-Cards; a Batter from a custom 12-Sided Dice;
Using an 8-card "Master 8" deck, you choose a card that you predict will be the outcome.
The 3 versions of the game each have a different "Outcome":
"LIVE" Interactive version - Predict Outcome of Batter at bat in a live game.
"TABLE" Custom 52-Card Deck version - Predict Outcome of next card to be turned over.
"DICE" Custom 12-Sided Dice version - Predict Outcome of next roll of single 12-sided dice.
Score is kept track with "Game Tokens". Each Player starts with 15-20 (Depending upon Game Set). For each "At Bat", Players put token in and pick a Master 8 card. The Player with the most Game Tokens at the end of the game is the winner!

name: Quackscam
description:
Board Game based on the events of Quackscam, a 1980 wildlife/poaching raid in Beardstown, Illinois.

A simple roll and move game. Players roll 1 die and move along the hunting path the number of spaces rolled. Spaces along path have you draw Violation/Lucky cards or take various other actions.

From the manual:

"The game of Quackscam is played along a "hunting path" consisting of 96 spaces. It is designed for 2, 3, or 4 players. The game includes the following items:

1 Quackscam playing board
54 Violation cards
20 Lucky cards
4 plastic markers (or tokens)
2 Dice

The object of the game is to get to the end of the hunting path as quickly as you can with as many high point violation cards as possible. Each violation card has a point value.

After all players have finished the "hunt", each player adds up the total points of all his violation cards. The player with the most total points wins the game."
categories: Adventure, Animals, Educational, Environmental, Humor, Political, Sports
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Art Dealer
description:
Art Dealer is a game about buying and selling of fine-art paintings, including Picasso's, Rembrandt's, and Carravagio's.

Players can buy paintings from six galleries, specialising in Landscape, Portrait, History, Genre, Still-life, and Animal paintings.

They can then sell these paintings at a profit (and an increase in reputation as an Art Dealer) to Collectors against Commissions. Each Commision specifies which movement the painting must come from (Renaissance/Mannerism, Baroque/Rococo, Neoclassicism/Romanticism, Impressionism/Symbolism, Cubism/Expressionism, or Surrealism/Contemporary).

Alternatively, the can sell their painting to one of five Museums for less profit but greater increase in reputation.

Finally, they can Exhibit their painting to improve their cashflow and enhance the star-value of their paintings.

Other actions include taking money from Investors; employing an Art Historian to find paintings previosuly discarded; restoring damaged paintings to their full glory; and even forging paintings in the main galleries.

name: Kurukuru Takopon
description: A motorized dexterity game about collecting balls of takoyaki before the timer expires. Can be played either in turns, or simultaneously with scoring based on the contents of the balls.

name: Bürgermeisterspiel: Werde Bürgermeister in Kassel
description:
Objective: be the first to get the permanent majority of votes for the coming election of the mayor - learn more about the city of Kassel

In turns, each player rolls the die, moves according the number, follows instructions of space landed on; buys, if possible and/or (preferable) votes.

"Chance" cards are created with circumstances out of the history of Kassel. Corrects answers give economic advantages.

Voting process about the next mayor: Each owned company corresponds to a number of votes. The results of each voting are kept and the final winner is the first player who reaches the target.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Set Collection, Stock Holding, Trading

name: Japanese: The Game – Storyteller Deck
description:
This is a meld-building card game wherein the rules of play are the rules of Japanese syntax. The game has solo, collaborative, and competitive modes. The cards each have a Japanese word printed on them, and are color-coded by part of speech (e.g. all verbs are red).

Each card has a point value, and playing the cards according to a color pattern results in a grammatically correct Japanese sentence that awards the player points equal to the sum of points on cards played. In solo mode, the player tries to reach 20 points in the fewest amount of hands. In collaborative mode, players work together to build and improve sentences until the deck runs out of cards. In competitive mode, the points a player earns on his or her turn ("turn points") allow the player to eliminate cards from opponents' sentences or entire sentences if enough turn points are available.

This deck of Japanese: The Game differs from other decks in vocabulary and art. The vocabulary is in the theme of Japanese folk tales and mythology: sentences like "Momotaro defeated all the Oni on the island" and "The elderly woman healed her companion". This is in contrast with, for example, the Original Core Deck of Japanese: The Game that creates much more general sentences like "My dog will eat the doll" and "Your friend is fun."

name: Bürgermeisterspiel: Werde Bürgermeister in Hilden
description:
Objective: be the first to get the permanent majority of votes for the coming election of the mayor - learn more about the city of Hilden (city close to Düsseldorf).

In turn, each player rolls the die, moves according the number, follows instructions of space landed on; buys, if possible and/or (preferable) votes.

"Chance" cards are created with circumstances out of the history of Hilden. Corrects answers give economic advantages.

Voting process about the next mayor: Each owned company corresponds to a number of votes. The results of each voting are kept and the final winner is the first player who reaches the target.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Set Collection, Stock Holding, Trading

name: Bürgermeisterspiel: Werde Bürgermeister in Höxter
description:
Objective: be the first to get the permanent majority of votes for the coming election of the mayor - learn more about the city of Höxter.

In turn, each player rolls the die, moves according the number, follows instructions of space landed on; buys, if possible and/or (preferable) votes.

"Chance" cards are created with circumstances out of the history of Höxter. Corrects answers give economic advantages.

Voting process about the next mayor: Each owned company corresponds to a number of votes. The results of each voting are kept and the final winner is the first player who reaches the target.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Set Collection, Stock Holding, Trading

name: Bürgermeisterspiel: Werde Bürgermeister in Alfeld
description:
Objective: be the first to get the permanent majority of votes for the coming election of the mayor - learn more about the city of Alfeld.

In turn, each player rolls the die, moves according the number, follows instructions of space landed on; buys, if possible and/or (preferable) votes.

"Chance" cards are created with circumstances out of the history of Alfeld. Corrects answers give economic advantages.

Voting process about the next mayor: Each owned company corresponds to a number of votes. The results of each voting are kept and the final winner is the first player who reaches the target.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Set Collection, Stock Holding, Trading

name: Baden-Württemberg Reise
description:
A game where 2-6 players travel through Baden-Wuerttemberg. They get between 9 to 11 city cards, must sort the cards and travel to all their cities in the best order possible. Rolling a 6 means a special acitivity card must be drawn and a detour taken. The last destination to be reached is Stuttgart, the regions capital city. First player to Stuttgart wins the game.
The city cards also contain information about each city such as its characteristics or famous sights found there.

Games from this series are also available for other regions like Hessen-Reise, Sachsen-Reise etc.

name: Der Irrgarten
description:
Objective: Be the first reaching target spaces with all (3) of your pawns precisely

Simple 'Roll & Move' game; use one die moving forward; ending on a red space: promotion; black space: move backwards. Other pawns can be passed if rolled number allows to jump, otherwise you are blocked. Pawns can't be kicked, a '6' forces you to step out of starting position and let you roll again.

name: Bürgermeisterspiel: Werde Bürgermeister in Gifhorn
description:
Objective: be the first to get the permanent majority of votes for the coming election of the mayor - learn more about the city of Gifhorn.

In turn, each player rolls the die, moves according the number, follows instructions of space landed on; buys, if possible and/or (preferable) votes.

"Chance" cards are created with circumstances out of the history of Gifhorn. Corrects answers give economic advantages.

Voting process about the next mayor: Each owned company corresponds to a number of votes. The results of each voting are kept and the final winner is the first player who reaches the target.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Set Collection, Stock Holding, Trading

name: Die Rheinreise
description:
Objective:
Be the first to reach target space (59)
Typical 'Roll & Move' game similar to Game of Goose.
Very nice drawings/printing and - of course - pewter pawns
notes:
at least 2 different editions, one with rules glued on lid inside
published ~1900
predecessor of Ein Rheinreisespiel

name: Farben und Formen
description:
Educational game for the under 10's. Each player is given a board with 9 large squares on it. Each square has a shape in it, diamonds, circles, etc.. Tiles are revealed one by one and the children have to recognise the shape and if it fits on their board. First to find their nine shapes, wins.

There are variants on this theme that can be used depending on the age of the children.

The boards and tiles are incredibly sturdy, better than games made today.

name: Café Olé
description:
There's chaos in the café! Countless customers are waiting hungrily for tasty cakes, cookies, sweets and drinks while Ole, chef of the café, is thinking about retiring.
In the shoes of the relentlessly working café staff the players are creating fancy cakes and pies and everything else the customers are ordering. If they are busy enough to fill the whole load of orders before closing hour is there, Ole will be satisfied enough to retire carelessly and one of the players will become the new chef of Café Olé!

Café Olé is a cooperative game in which the 1-6 players:

Reveal the topmost order-tile from the stack
Use their dice-cards to gather 3-6 dice
Roll their dice to gain the right ingredients for the open orders
Try to gain all open order-tiles before the closing-hour-tile is drawn


That's it and it's a lot of fun. But beware of the "Special Treatment" and "Complaint" tiles!


German description
Im Café Olé ist die Hölle los! Unzählige Gäste warten hungrig auf feine Leckereien und zu allem Überfluss will Ole, Chef des Cafés, auch noch in Rente gehen.
Schlüpft in die Rollen des eifrigen Café-Personals und bereitet leckeren Kuchen, köstliches Eis und kalte und warme Getränke zu. Wenn ihr besonders fleißig seid und die Flut an Bestellungen abarbeitet, kann Ole beruhigt in Rente gehen und einer von euch wird der neue Chef des Café Olé!

Café Olé ist ein kooperatives Spiel, in dem die 1-6 Spieler:

Jeweils das oberste Plättchen vom Bestellungsstapel aufdecken
Ihre Würfelkarten nutzen um 3-6 Würfel werfen zu dürfen
Die Würfel werfen um die richtigen Zutaten für die offen ausliegenden Bestellungsplättchen zu erwürfeln
Insgesamt versuchen, alle offen ausliegenden Bestellungen abzuarbeiten, bevor das Ladenschlussplättchen aufgedeckt wird


Das ist schon alles und macht eine Menge Spaß. Aber passt auf die "Extrawurst-" und "Beschwerdeplättchen" auf!

name: Rescuer Game
description:
A little girl is left alone on the topn of a burning hill and the fire is raging. She is in danger! the rescuers must climb up to the top of the hilltop to save her as fast as possible. But, the mission is not easy. They must watch out for the burning wood and be careful not to lose their way on the hill. Otherwise they will be slowed down, while the time is running out!! The perfect dice game for little ones.

Game-play:
Each player takes turns to roll a multi coloured dice, then move their rescuer to the next space on the board which matches that colour. If a '?' is rolled, that player must draw a card from the deck and follow the instructions; e.g move forward/backwards x spaces, swap places with another player etc... If a player lands on a fire, they miss a turn while they extinguish the flames. The first player to get to the top of the hill, rescues the little girl and is declared the winner.

name: Globe-Trotter
description:
The goal of the game is to get with all four pawns into one sector (II, III, V, VI) of the game board. The first player to achieve this wins the game. If a player gets three pawns in an sector, all other players have to vacate this sector. Placement and movement of the pawns is determined by two dies, a standard die (1-6) and a degree-of-latitude-die.

A second game rule is for a travel game, where the players are to get their pawn from their starting point (colored dot on the game board) to three destinations (determined by the draw of 3 "Orts-Karten" and back to their starting points. On the roll of a 6 the Player has to move his pawn and draw a "Zufalls-Karte" and follow the printed instructions on the card.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Grid Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Rette sich, wer kann!
description:
Objective: Gain most victory points by bringing home as many of your pawns (geese, ducks, chicken, young chicken) as possible - or as fox: catch many them.

Roll & Move Game, best with (4) 5 players

All players move around the same board like Pachisi; board is divided 10 segments with 6 spaces each. Payers are forced to start with a second pawn as soon as the first has left first segment. After a complete round a turnable fox (in the centre of the board) is spun - the segment he's pointing on is in danger: each involved player has a saving throw escaping into next segment - otherwise the pawn is caught by the fox. Depending on order of running in victory points are granted. Slight modifications with 4 or 3 players.

name: Cyborgs: Earth Twin I
description:
Cyborgs vs Earth Crew.
With Earth's depleted resources and overpopulation, another planet must be found to support Human life, and time is running out. One of 11 teams of space explorers, Earth Crew's mission is to travel to Kepler-452b, Earth Twin exoplanet, and confirm potential support for human life.

But first the Crew must survive.

On entering Kepler-452b atmosphere, Earth Crew are attacked by Cyborgs, who invaded the planet already, merging with many of its primitive humanoids. Cyborgs have taken over communications with Earth and they're coming for the Crew.

Who will defeat the other in a battle for survival of their species, and domination of the Earth Twin planet?

Choose a side, Cyborg or Human, then trek your way through Kepler-452b terrain, fighting opponents, encountering strange Humanoids and plants, before taking over the opponent's command centre.

Cyborgs game is a unique sci-fi strategy game, both cooperative and competitive. The goal is to beat your opponent team and dominate the planet.

name: Magical Spell
description:
Six brave fourth-graders join forces to protect the playground from the tyrannical Dark Prince Ipal, but only one of them can be crowed Spell Master. Overcome treacherous obstacles and defeat the evils of recess by spelling!

In Magical Spell, you create words to earn dice, which you use to overcome enemies and obstacles.

On your turn, players will assemble Letter Cards to create words. Each letter grants the caster dice. The more rare the letter, the more powerful the die. To defeat encounters, players must exceed or match a combat value. Defeat the enemy and gain victory points. Fail and take wounds.

Magical Spell includes a deck of Letter Cards which also grant special abilities. Use F to create fire spells, or H to heal. The game is played with a polyhedral set of dice and invokes the feel of a light dungeon crawl set in the imagination of elementary school kids.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck, Set Collection

name: Love & Laughter: The Game of Smiles
description:
The invitation of color pedagogue Frederike Herrlich makes a playful way a new approach to themselves and others, by the freedom of choice. Regardless of gender, age, culture and religion. Knowledge and personal experiences of individuals are recognized and contribute to original answers to philosophical questions at: not whether, but how we want. Or would you prefer to relax?
The game board shows a path to move which is built out of 3 circled which have field where the pawn can move from one to another circle.
Their are 4 kinds of event fields (drivem by Cards):

2 types: Inform about something about his person or his life
Opening a discussion about an issue
ColourChild: Define parts of yourself with colours, based on the colour psychology


Each player has a pawn moving on a path of the board, dice role driven.
Game ends when 1 player has finished his colour child. All other Players are allowed to finish also their colour child.

name: Hilfsconvoy nach Rumänien
description:
The Story behind of this dice driven game is the truck convoy to Romanian orphanages.
The board game shows multiple tracks from Germany to Romainia.
There are many different Action fields.
Some of them you need to hit, e.g. phone, gas station in each country and Orphanage in Romainia. On some fields you can upgrade your convoy. New truck, new trailer, good storage.
Some event fields (Cardstocks for the different contries), negativ event fields e.g. boarder control (user has to stop here, except he got a special card to move on.
The player wins, whos convoy has deliveres goods to 2 orphanages in Romainia and Comes first back to Germany.

name: Rocky Mountain Murder
description:
The Crime: Welcome to the beautiful world of Banff, Alberta: A playground of adventure . . . and intrigue! Charles Vandersnoot, the wealthy owner of posh ski resort, Mystery Mountain, shocked everyone in Banff when he announced he was dying of a rare disease. Even more shocking was when Charles was found murdered – killed by a single gunshot while riding his own chairlift!

Everyone is a suspect in this chilling crime! See if you can help expose the killer.

The Game: Spice up your party by adding a little mystery and a dash of murder to the evening. Just invite eight to ten guests to dress up and play the roles of the scheming suspects and you’re in for an evening of unforgettable fun! No one is who they appear to be . . . can you find the killer?

The Suspects: Bunny Vandersnoot, Cecilia Vandersnoot, Chet Jet-Set, Doctor T Bar, Franz Flash, Gertrude Greenrun, Hank “Hot Dog” Hooper & Rudy Red-Eyes
Extra Players (Non Suspects): Ranger Rick & Roxy Rundle

The Contents:
Party Planner
Eight Character Booklets
Two Character Booklets for bonus players
Ten Character Profi les to include with invitations
Ten Party Invitations and Envelopes
Eight Secret Clues
Compact Disc Co-host: Complete with introduction, evening commentary and solution to the mystery

name: Godslayer: Banebrood Starter Box
description:
This Banebrood Starter Box contains 6 highly detailed metal miniatures for gamers and collectors.

The enclosed miniatures represent a fully playable warband of 160 points, and in addition you get a printed version of the Quick-Start rules.

With this Banebrood warband and the Quick-Start rules you are able to immediately start playing Godslayer® – the fantasy miniatures skirmish game set in a bronze age world of sword and sorcery.

Get your starter box and start discovering the world of Godslayer®!

Contains:

1x Quick-Start Rules
1x Gorelord model (45mm, metal)
1x Pestbringer model (50mm, metal)
1x Maldire Mongrels Leader model (40mm, metal)
1x Maldire Mongrels Trooper 1 model (40mm, metal)
1x Maldire Mongrels Trooper 2 model (40mm, metal)
1x Maldire Mongrels Trooper 3 model (40mm, metal)
4x 30mm round plastic base
2x 40mm round plastic base
Gorelord profile & item cards
Pestbringer profile & item cards
Maldire Mongrels profile card
Tokens


- The plastic bases are not textured.
- Some modeling is required.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Mythology, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Grave Robbers from Outer Space Resurrected Edition
description:
Grave Robbers from Outer Space the Resurrected Edition (GROS:RE) is a reboot of the original B-movie card game, Grave Robbers from Outer Space (GROS).
Back from the dead, with a new layout and art, GROS:RE introduces new gameplay elements to the classic game.
GROS:RE is a strategy card game for 2-6 players. Players are competing to complete the "best" b-movie. Characters and props add to the value of a player's movie, while locations may add or subtract depending on the location in question. FX cards do all manner of different things. Creature cards are used to attck an opponent's movie in an effort to kill off characters.
Cards have a cost to play (anywhere from 0-3 "popcorn"), and some cards generate popcorn. If a player can't afford the cost of a new card by using their cards in play, additional popcorn can be generated by discarding cards from hand. The popcorn mechanic makes players decide between playing a card to do something now, or holding onto it to pay for something later.
categories: Card Game, Horror, Humor, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction

name: Kaj & Andrea: På Spileventyr med H.C. Andersen
description:
Collection of three games for two children with Kaj & Andrea from Danish children's TV, where they are playing with the fairy tales from Hans Christian Andersen:

Game 1: Find the 10 pictures from your fairy tale; Image Lotto style with two difficulty levels. First one to find their 10 images wins

Game 2: The Fairy Tale picture that dissipated; Show the pictures from the fairy tales - remove one and let the child guess which one is missing.

Game 3: Read, Listen and find the right fairy tale pictures; Read the fairy tales (included in the booklet that also contains rules) and let the kids find the picture that shows what happens right now. The one with most right ones wins.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Pentris
description: Pentris is an abstract tetris like game for 1-2 players. Each player has got the same wood set (12 different tiles, each three times). A Java APP or a card tells you what tile you have to use. The players stack their pieces together and they are trying to get the least negative points.

name: Wacky Races: das verrückte Rennen
description: Up to 5 Wacky Racers try to be the first to reach space 360. They can chose for themselves, which way to follow. Movement is determined by a die. Each player holds 10 cards he can use to hinder the player to his right. Whenever a player plays a card, he draws a new one fom the deck.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Start und Ziel: Das große Wicküler-Rallye-Spiel
description: Each player joins the race with 3 cars. Movement is determined by a die. The first player to get all 3 cars to the finish line wins the game. The players are hinderd by 7 traffic signs on the red spaces, which can't be passed by. Only a player who lands direct on a space with a traffic sign can remove the sign and put it on another space to hinder another player. If a Player gets on a green space he has to draw an event-card and follow it's instructions.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Battle Up
description: Battle UP is a game of two halves. First, you build up your hand of cards, each card adding to your ability to defeat the other players in the combat that follows. Then, after a round of bidding and wagering on how likely you are to win, you use your cards to fight with the other players, attempting to reduce their health to zero while keeping yours. At the end of the round, the winner takes all of the tokens, and another round begins

name: Chainsaw Maniac
description:
The objective of the game is simple:

1. Don't get killed by the chainsaw maniac

2. Be the first to collect four keys, unlock the front door and leave the house.

Players have been invited to the Chainsaw Maniac's dinner party. Clearly poor judges of character, on arrival they have discovered that the chainsaw maniac intends to murder them and has quadruple locked the front door to ensure that they don't escape before he has a chance to do so. A player wins the game by either getting four keys and touching the front door, or by being the last player alive on the board.

A player moves around the board by rolling dice and moving as many squares in any direction accordingly (but having to move around holes).

After the initial first 3 goes, the maniac is released and follows the nearest player to him (who is moved by a player rolling the dice to determine the amount of spaces he goes once each player has had their turn). Once the maniac touches a player, the player must roll a certain number or higher than that number to ensure that they have not been 'hit' by the maniac.

Keys are obtained by searching through furniture (a card is drawn from the deck each time someone looks through furniture). The card can also be one of a special move which they can use).

A player wins once they collect 4 keys and then rush to the front door to unlock it and escape.

name: Leksoscor
description:
It's a fresh word game with a touch of scor 4!
Each round a player picks a letter and puts it in the corresponding space!
He takes one point for every letter of each word that is being formed (horizontally, vertically or diagonally)!
Nice word game in which you have to score as well as you have to be careful not to create great opportunities for scoring for your opponent.

name: Heedless Tommy
description: Typical spin and move game. The first player, who cross all 66 stops, wins the game.

name: Limited Mail and Express Game
description:
Typical spin and move game. The first player, who cross a board, wins the game.
Chromolithographed board with a map of the United States; 39 train cards and 3 metal train playing pieces; directions applied to the underside of the box cover.
The game board show Oklahoma as a large portion being Indian Country.

name: Cops And Robbers
description:
Cops and Robbers is a two-player card game that pits a deck of Cop cards against a deck of Robber cards. Each player races to occupy the locations provided to either gain loot as the Robber, or protect the city as the Cop. The Cop player also attempts to arrest Robbers that are on locations. The game ends when the Robber has gained 24 loot, or the Cop has 24 arrests. The cop can also win by stopping the Robber from getting 24 loot after all the locations have been played.

The Cop and Robber each have a deck that includes Units, Items, and Actions. The Units and Items are used to occupy the locations. Each location requires a different number to occupy, and a specific number of turns. There are 4 locations out at a time, and 24 locations in the game in total. The Action cards are used to affect things like occupy time, defense and attack buffs, and hand management. If a player wins a location uncontested, as a Robber they win the loot, and the Cop gets 1 more location off the game board. If the other player does contest while occupied, they must play that same number of Units and Items required against the occupied player. Each Unit has a level and it becomes a war type-highest number wins after all levels are added up, action cards are played, and a die is rolled. Along with the win, the player also get an Event card, which can be played for big bonuses and affect the game positively or negatively.
Lastly, each player has a home base. The Robber has their Hideout, and the Cops stay in the Police Station. Loot and arrests are also held in these home bases, and through the play of an event card, Each player can attack the others home base for bonuses, and to lower the number of arrests and loot they have collected.
Its a fun fast paced 2 player game, with a fun light theme, and some great art and cards.
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Dice, Humor, Math
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Take That, Worker Placement

name: Hero Heads
description:
Guardian City was named for the League which kept the people safe during the last Great War. Previous Leaders have included the Atomic Wizard, Blue Streak, and Human Meteor. But now, Guardian City is in need of a new Super Hero to head the Allied Legends League. Each hero is on a quest to earn Feats of Bravery, in consideration of being nominated to run the League. To keep things interesting, Commissioner Freeman has enacted a Rule of Brawl, which will give heroes the opportunity to prove their mettle.

Hero Heads is a card game of Super Heroes and their ability to Save the Day. All the heroes of the game are from the Golden Age of Comic Books including such heroes as Miss Masque, Blue Beetle, and the Black Terror. Captain Marvel proved to be one of the most popular superhero comics of the Golden Age, regularly outselling the adventures of Superman during the 1940s. The Core deck is for has 70 Cards and is playable by 2 to 5 players, including 10 Public Domain Super Heroes, 10 Crisis Cards, and 40 Feats of Bravery Cards. The game is a quick card drafting game that is best played in rounds--the average round taking around 20-40 minutes. For those of you that are a fan of the Golden Age of Comics and enjoy quick competitive card games, then Hero Heads is a great choice for your upcoming game night.

Each player is given a Super Hero to start their game, then dealt five cards from the Core Deck. Players compete to be the first to obtain all nine required Feats of Bravery, using simple symbol mechanics to give the player the sequence needed in order to win. This mechanic resembles poker or gin--each Super Hero has a sequence needed to win seen on the card as signs in the form of road signs.

There are also Special Powers and Crisis cards which allow players to force opponents to discard important cards breaking up their sequence.

On each hero's turn, they must perform one action:


Draw a card from core deck
Play a Special Power or Crisis card
Discard any number of cards to discard pile
Obtain all Feats of Bravery needed
Win the game, by obtaining your Hero's total required Feats of Bravery

name: Spaceship Ping
description:
Spaceship Ping was once a thriving independent spaceport, now rival companies fight for control of the singular central robot control panel in an effort to arrange shipping containers and meet the demands of the struggling space colonies. The company that can earn the most money will also earn sole control of Spaceship Ping!

Spaceship Ping offers a combination of worker placement, movement
programming, trading and a brand new 3 dimensional spatial puzzle
element that will have gamers thinking in new ways.

Players must compete for action spaces needed to rearrange their
container stacks, while also being attentive to the cargo in the center stack and their opponents piles. The player who can find the patterns and ship the most valuable combinations will take the lead, but trade is important, so careful strategy is needed - after all no one likes to help a front runner increase their lead!

name: Das goldene Spiel mit den zwei Punkten
description:
The players have to move 4 pawns from their starting spaces to the star in the center of the game board. Movement is determined by a six-eyed die and a special die.

If the player rolls:


a pawn: the player can bring a pawn from his house into play on the ring indicated by the eye-die.
a golden arrow the player can move a pawn forward as indicated by the eye-die.
two golden arrows the player can move a pawn forward about twice the rolled eyes.
a black arrow the Player has to move a pawn backwards.
a golden dot the player can move all pawns from the ring indicated by the eye-die to the center star.
a black dot the player has to return all pawns from the ring indicated by the eye-die to his house.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Robot Dash
description:
Theme: Robots racing through security rooms to be the first to reach "Master Control" and win.

Set-up: Characters are selected and the remaining deck is separated into a Main Deck, the "Master Control" goal card, Shieldpass cards, and the Dice Deck. The Main Deck is shuffled and the first thirteen cards are placed face down on the table in a cross, with one in the center and three leading out on each spoke. Each player chooses one of the spoke ends to start on. The goal card is placed face up as a fourth card at the end of one of the unchosen spokes. One card from the Main Deck is then dealt to each player and the card at the end of the spoke they each chose is flipped face up, revealing the first room they must move through.

Game-play: Players take two actions per turn from an assortment of actions including drawing new cards, using special rooms to fabricate protective Shieldpass cards, place a new room from their hand into an empty spot adjacent to one or more cards, check a neighboring face down room, or move from room to room. To move from a room without spending cards, a player must either have a Shieldpass attached that matches either the Security clearance of the room (Theta, Sigma, or Omega) or the attack type of the room (Fire, Ice, or Bolt). Alternatively, a player may elect to "crash" a room by discarding cards from their hand to draw cards from the Dice Deck in order to equal or overcome the number at the top left of the Security Room they are in. Once a room is crashed, it no longer hinders any player for the rest of the game. The first player to move their robot character to the goal card and spend an action there wins the game.

The game also serves as an alternate art poker deck, and has a one-to-one correspondence with a standard deck. Rules for playing a free version, by using a standard deck of cards are also available.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Math, Racing, Science Fiction

name: Cults Attempt Hokypoky
description:
"An unauthorized third-party parody expansion compatible with Cards Against Humanity allowing you even more horrible combinations for you and your horrible friends to chuckle at.

You will want the Cards Against Humanity base set at the very least to play. Go. Give them money. It's worth it."

Theme and game-play is identical to Cards Against Humanity, just additional card options to revitalize your play experience.
categories: Card Game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game

name: CityProGame Hamburg
description:
Objective: Using the detailed street map of Hamburg each player is given five companies to be established in the city as close to the centre as possible.

With the help of dice and counters, each players chooses where to place, turn or remove company tiles.
Once a company is established on the map, the corresponding four 'places worth seeing' are revealed, so familiarizing players with the sights of the city.

Contents: 80 cards, 8 counters, 3 dice, rules and city information.

name: Woerdens Familiespel
description: A variant to the classic Monopoly game. In honour of the city Woerden in the Netherlands.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Dice Rolling, Player Elimination, Set Collection

name: Dice of Destiny
description:
Dice of Destiny is an extraordinary, intense and fun board game for 2 to 6 players. The race is going on incredible diverse terrain with many obstacles. Among them are a waterfall that you can fall in, an angry bees, quicksands that you can stuck and many others.

There are six characters and at the beginning of the game each player can choose one of them. The characters have special skills that affect the gameplay - increase pickpocketed gold, allows you to push other players back or just helps you to run faster.

Throwing the Dice of Destiny, which is 12D with different special symbol on every side, affects the other dice values and defines which and how many of them will be thrown. The special symbols on the Dice of Destiny can give useful opportunities for the player. Additionally there are 6D dice - a wooden ones that are for moving and a golden ones for earning gold.

The goal of every player is to collect and keep big fortune and finish the race before anyone else. Roll The Dicе of Destiny to see what expects you in the next throwing.

The combination of unique characters, the result from the Dice of Destiny and the variety of the map obstacles makes the game extremely fun for young and not that young players.

name: Side Pocket Pool
description:
The Game of 8 Ball, Cards & Beer!
Welcome to Side Pocket Pool! Enter the Side Pocket pub, grab a drink and rack'em-up for a game of 8 ball.

Balls!
Play with a full set of 16 plastic pool balls with seven reds, seven yellows, the black ball and the white cue ball.

Cues!
Yes two of the finest cues are provided for players. They just happen to be playing card size!

Tables!
The games box doubles as a 3D pool table. Three extra 2D pool tables are also included:- there is a green, a blue and a training table.

Cards!
A five card hand containing reds, yellows and white balls of varying power which can be played on their own or combined to create shots.

Players!
Play One vs One, team up for Two vs Two or even One vs Two.

Frames!
Enough beer is provided to play the best of 3, 5 and 7 frames. The winner of each frame wins a Beer card.

The player with the most beers wins! Enjoy your stay in the Side Pocket pub!

name: Luxembourg-Shopping
description:
Promotional Monopoly-style game featuring shops and services of Luxembourg. Instead of houses and hotels, there are card board markers which increase the rent to be paid. If you roll doubles, you draw 2 cards. If at least one of them mentions a business (Monopoly: street) you already own, you are entitled to add the marker.

If you land on an own business, you can create a "shopping center" by placing 3 of your owner cards (your choice!) together and paying the base rent of each.
If you land on an own business, you may merge 2 of your own shopping centers by placing the cards together and paying each shopping center's value.

If you land on another player's business, you must pay the rent. If the business is part of a shopping center, you must pay for all cards belonging to that shopping center.

If you land on an own business, you receive the "rent" from the bank.

You win if you own a certain number of markers, if your largest shopping center consist of a ceertain number of businesses or if all other players are bankrupt.
You can decide to stop the game after an agreed time. The player with the most markeers wins. There are 4 tie breakers mentioned.
mechanics: Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Das Wild-West Spiel
description:
There are 3 games included:
The Gold Transport Raid: One player has 4 indians which whom to capture the gold transport and get it to the edge of the game board. The other player has 4 cowboys, which try to escort the gold transport to the fort.
Cattle Raid: The indians try to steal as many of the 6 cattle as they can, while the cowboys try to get the cattle from the waterhole to the farm.
Cowboy-Lotto: Up to 8 Ppayers get a cowboy or an indian to occupy the picture on the game board, which corresponds with the number on their playing piece. Movement is clockwise and determined by a die. The words on the pictures are covered by the letter token. When a player gets on a picture, he may take a letter token (if available) he needs to form the word from his starting picture. The first player to complete his word wins the game.
mechanics: Grid Movement, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Panzer Squash
description:
From the back cover of the rulebook:

Panzer Squash is a not so serious clay combat game between WWII tanks that you design!

Players craft their vehicles and combat to the death.

Completely compatible with the other Squash series games by Tri Tac Systems.
categories: Humor, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Simulation, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up
publishers: Tri Tac Games LLC (Tri Tac Talents)

name: PrisMix Card Game
description: PrisMix is a color spectrum card game. Players mix and match 12 prismatic colors to create 30 colorful scoring combos with prisms. Players want to strategically create color mixing combos to play multiple cards from their hand at a time to quickly play out all the cards in their hand first to win. So even though a player may have more cards in their hand... they can surprise their opponents by creating color mixing combos with 2, 3, or even 6 cards in a single play. May the best color mixer win! Quick prismatic fun with family and friends is what you will have when playing PrisMix.... let's play!

name: Extraordinary Voyages
description:
Race around the world with Phileas Fogg and his faithful companion Passepartout. Explore the depths of the world's oceans with Captain Nemo. Set forth today on your own extraordinary voyage!

Extraordinary Voyages is played in a series of rounds, over multiple boards using each player's individual deck. A player may draft a card, play up to three cards from their hand, or go adventuring.

Around the board will be various goods you need to acquire while adventuring, but the main goal is to finish any one of the three maps before any of your opponents!

name: Double Feature: Everyone's a Critic
description: Double Feature: Everyone's a Critic is an expansion for the Double Feature base game in which all you need to know are the movies you've seen!

name: Super Clashland
description:
User summary

In this platform fighting card game that emulates videogames like Super Smash Brothers, players take turns revealing action cards to move and attack. Damage adds CRASH cards to each players deck and they are eliminated after a set number are revealed, or if they're knocked clear of the map.

This game was included in PNP format within the RPG bundle Indie Mixtape Volume 3.
mechanics: Action Queue, Area Movement, Cooperative Game

name: Die Seekuhmilch-Rallye
description:
Objective: be the first transporting 5 l sea cow milk (=Seekuhmilch)to hungry shark babies through the stormy sea

Players take turns moving their pawns according to the number (0-4) rolled on a six-sided die, transporting milk. Board with 29 spaces has 4 'traps' which you should avoid - otherwise you'll loose your milk due to stormy weather and must start again.
categories: Animals, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Novel-based, Racing, Transportation

name: Parhelion
description:
The underlying concept in this game is that you, as a player, have all means of employing strategies, controlling the movement of your troops and tactical insight in order to win.

The goal of the game is to destroy your opponent’s base, but how you can achieve this is left to the player.

You play the game with cards on a map, each card has their own strengths and movement speeds. Strategic and tactical gameplay are a necessity to win!

name: Ninja Schoolgirls Vs Zombies
description:
A horde of zombies has invaded your secret ninja school. Many fellow ninja students have died all around you. You ran and found shelter for a brief moment, and have now gathered your Ki Energy and your resolve to escape from your current hiding place. Before venturing out into a potentially hostile world overrun with undead you are determined to gather some items to build your confidence to face the nightmare. Grab some things and get out as soon as possible. Good Luck!

The game is designed to run on Six-Sided Dice and can be played in a solo/survival mode. Each player will want to have 2 Six-Sided dice to use as counters on their Character sheets, 1 for Ki Energy and the other for Zombie Stalkers that are looking to rip the Ninja Schoolgirl into itty bitty pieces if only they could get their hands on the lithe and sneaky Ninja.

A community of 3-4 Six-Sided Dice can be shared in turn order to the active player. The typical Action Roll will use 2 Six-Sided Dice. The extra Di can be purchased with Ki Energy Points that are gained mostly through successfully eliminating a Zombie Stalker.

After that it is up to you to run around the school acquiring items that give you Confidence enough to leave the school. Whoever has the most Confidence at the end, wins the game! Who will be the most Confident Ninja? If anyone actually lives that is…

name: Wer andern eine Grube gräbt ...
description:
The first player to get his two pawns from space 1 to space 90 wins the game. Movement is determined by a die. On the roll of a 6, the player moves a pawn and gets to place a pit to trap his opponents. But beware, some pawns may fall into their own pit. Pawns that fall into a pit have to start at the beginning again.

The game was published between 1922 and 1938.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Dracovalis
description:
Dracovalis is a game about dragons attacking, capturing, and destroying cities. The players send dragons to attack or defend cities in order to control as many cities as possible. Players can also cast spells to strengthen the beasts. Aside from the pure joy of burning your friend's cities down or forcing his dragon to turn tail and run, Dracovalis features simultaneous play, so you'll be guessing where your opponent will go every turn.

During your turn, you will secretly decide what towns you wish to attack, or which of your towns are vulnerable and need defending. Once all players have decided, everyone moves simultaneously and the battles begin. Combat is resolved through a simple multi-round dice-pool mechanic that feels like combat and resolves quickly.

You will have a limited number of spells that you can cast during your turn, and the spells can be cast in multiple ways. Will you burn many spell components to ensure your spell goes off properly, or will you risk spell failure to hold some components in reserve?

At the game end, the player who controls the most territory wins.

name: Murmelspiele
description:
A children's game system based around marbles with instructions for four different marble based games.

1. Castle Marbles(Schlossmurmeln) - players take turns rolling marbes into the front gates of the castle for points.

2. Tin throwing(Dosenwerfen) - players attempt to throw marbles into the game tin for points.

3. Mini Bowling(Miniboule) - the cork marble is placed in a 1 inch circle and players attempt to roll their marble as close as possible to the cork marble without pushing it out of it's circle.

4. Pyramid rolling(Pyramidenroller) - players build a pyramid with their dice and draw an 8 inch circle around it. Another player then attempts to roll marbles at the pyramid, all marbles knocked out of the circle to to the rolling player and marbles in the circle go to the player who set up the pyramid.

name: Hierarchy
description:
Hierarchy is a highly interactive negotiation and voting game, built on top of a simple roll-and-move game, with a splash of player selected special player powers on top for spice. A game with 4 players takes 45 to 60 minutes to play.

Each player starts Hierarchy as a pawn, advancing up a simple roll-and-move track. As you advance up the track, you "promote" from pawn to rook, knight, bishop, queen, and (ultimately) king. Each promotion gives you a new special power to help you bend or break the rules of the game. Several of these powers pertain to voting.

Oh, did I forget to mention voting? Each player has a hand of cards. Some have immediate one-shot effects while others are votes. Votes introduce new rules to the game. When you propose a vote, you declare who (one, some, or all players) the new rule will apply to. If the vote passes, it stays in play one round for every vote it passed by (If a vote is 5-to-3 in favor, that vote's rule will stay in play for two rounds.). Votes can affect many different things such as movement, cards in hand or in play, votes, etc.
