The first player to reach the last square of the board wins the game. With the player powers, unexpected one-shot card effects, and the possibility of sanction through votes against you from the other players, it's a task easier said than done.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Variable Player Powers, Voting

name: Eiszeit
description:
Ice Hockey trivia game.
Players use dice to move along the track. When they land on a ? space they must answer a question. If the correct answer is forthcoming, that player's pawn on the score table is moved up one row. There are 16 rows and if you get to the top first (16 correct answers), you win the game.
On the track there are also ! spaces. Land on one of these you draw an Event Card and resolve it.

name: Zhu Zhu Pets: Wild Wacky Hamster Game
description: Welcome to the land of Zhu Zhu Pets and get ready for the Wild and Wacky Hamster Race! Travel along the Zhu Zhu Pets path. But this is anything but a simple race: there are many obstacles you'll encounter along the way. Some will push you ahead, some will send you back, and some can be used to slow down the other players.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Animals, Children's Game, Racing
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Take That

name: Der Hobbit: Eine unerwartete Reise: Fürst der Adler – Die Mini-Erweiterung
description:
This card may be shuffled to Carrock Adventure deck.
If drawn the Prince of Eagle help You.
Roll the die:
1-2 = Look at the 2 topmost cards and put back in any order
3-4 = Nothing happens
5 = Move any free dwarf to empty space where the prisoner was hold
6 = 1 or 2 dwarfs or Bilbo may move 6 fields
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Novel-based

name: Der Hobbit: Eine unerwartete Reise: Azog – Die Mini-Erweiterung
description:
This card may be shuffled to Trollshaws Adventure deck.
If drawn roll the die:
1-2 = If Gandalf is present in Trollshaws He left 2 fields in chosen direction
3-4 = All game-figures in Trollshaws move 4 fields back
5-6 = Nothing happens
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Novel-based

name: Luddit
description:
Name: Luddit. Mix of "Ludit" (Latin: "He plays") and "Luddite" (-"against the machines"- cause the ultimate purpose of this game -project- is to be impossible to solve by computers; i really hope some of you would want to join forces with me in this holy crusade ).

Characteristics: the leading objective was (is) to make a game which could be as difficult as possible to solve for the computers (maybe...impossible?). By the moment, contrarily to my interest, the rules are by far not simple, ...im trying to improve that. I tried to achieve complexity by giving to the game a very chaotical and recursive nature. The board is defined in order to try to let an action to have infinite repercussion in the unfolding of the game. Its notable that, strictly speaking, the board doesnt have borders (as may be seen in the rules), so there is no "preferential positions". Its interesting to note that the definition of "loop" does lead to literally infinite possibilities of combination in some cases (its definition is precisely the feature that has leadme to think that this game can be much more than just "dificult" for the computer...). And its interesting to note that wining implies to reduce this possibilities to one, that is, to reduce the number of possibilities, which is the thermodynamic definition of negative entropy. So you have to play with chaos to bring order.

Equipment:
- 9x9 Torus board with 9x9 square grid (a standard 9x9 GO board can be used, obeying the mechanic of the torus board), 18xwhite stones, 18xblack stones. (i decided this size mostly to facilitate initial playtesting. Of course the game can be played in larger boards)

Rules:

1 - Game is played on the intersections. Adjacency is defined as orthogonal and diagonal (i.e. every intersection point has 8 adjacent points).

2 - There can’t be more than 18 total stones on the board at any time.

3 - We will call "piece" to every single stone or loop. A piece is of the color of a player if every stone that composes it is of the color of that player. A piece is "at range" of another if they shares at least one of their adjacent intersections.

4 - We will call "loop" to every group of pieces (regardless of color) where every piece is at range of at least another two pieces of the group (nothing prevents loops for sharing pieces). Its implied by the rule, but to clarify: If a piece A is composed by all the stones that composes a piece B, and viceversa, then A and B are the same piece, and B cant be considered has "another" piece for A, and viceversa.

5 - We will say that a piece is "conditioned" to a player if its of the player color or if any group of pieces (regardless of color) that are at range of that piece conforms a loop.

6 - A player makes a "move" by either:
a) Taking a single stone of his color from the outside of the board and placing it in an empty place over the board.
b) Removing a piece that is conditioned to him from the board.
c) Removing a piece that is conditioned to him from the board, and then placing it back on an empty space on the board. If the removed piece is a loop, it has to remain a loop when placed back on the board.

7 - At the start of the game the board is empty. Each player is assigned a color. Black plays first. Then both players play alternately. In his turn, a player can do one or two moves, if he has no legal move to perform the game ends, and he loses.

name: 9 y medio
description:
In 9 y medio (9 and a half), each player will beat the opponents in a "gambler game".

The players should get 9 1/2 or near it for beat their opponents. A player will win if all players are eliminated (losing all their coins), or when all rounds are played and who has more coins get the victory.

This game is a "re-version" of Las siete y media

name: Primary Pounce
description:
(Summarized from the rules. Published by Neil A. Kjos Music Co.)

Similar to "Slap Jack" this is an educational card game for 2-8 players to help learn music keys, signatures and chords.

To start the game, the deck of Cat KEY cards are shuffled and set aside and then the Major KEY SIGNATURE cards, the Primary CHORD cards, and the WILD Mouse cards are shuffled together and dealt evenly among players. A Cat KEY card is turned over to show what key the players are in, and which primary chords and key signatures they are looking for.

Players take turns flipping over the top card from their deck and placing it in the central discard pile until the flipped card shows a Major KEY SIGNATURE or a Primary CHORD card belonging to the key of the Cat KEY card, then players race to "pounce" on it by slapping it with their hand. The first to slap correctly adds the discard pile to his deck and then play continues. If someone incorrectly slaps, he has to give a card from his deck to each other player.

The player who can collect the entire deck (or a majority, if playing with a time limit) is the winner!

name: Pinke Pinke Schwein gehabt
description:
Objective: Gain most money

On an outer and inner circuit each player moves forward, based on a die roll. Ending on spaces with symbols follow instructions printed into the lid. Crossing the money pot in the centre of the board: pay for it. Landing on: get it all.

name: Frag mich was!
description:
Objective: Gain most of the cards by finding correct answers

The game contains 32 question cards (on rhyme) and 32 answer cards. The answer cards are distributed among the players. Players take turns drawing a question card. The player with the matching answer card must respond, otherwise each player may give the right answer gaining the card.

Frag mich was! has elements of Bezzerwizzer.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Trivia
publishers: Dr. Herbert Schulze, VEB Landesdruckerei Sachsen

name: Legends of Rakasa: Fordra
description:
Legends of Rakasa is a sandbox style (open gameplay structure) game with hunting, crafting, battling, puzzle cracking, and more. The game box is magically packed full of endless adventures.

Legends of Rakasa: Fordra introduces players to the world of Rakasa through Five Introductory Chapters. After players play through those first five chapters, players can go on to create their own unique adventures, or go to the Trivatch.com Forums page to check out game types others are creating.

The game is played on tiles (some holding decks representing the Roads, the Ocean, and the Forest). While seeking to complete different objectives, players hunt across Rakasa by moving their player tokens to the different locations and battle creatures using their player equipment. Players use the parts of defeated creatures to upgrade their equipment. Though upgrading isn't ever the main objective in the Introductory Five Chapters, players are much more likely to succeed in their adventures with stronger equipment.

Along with hunting, crafting, and battling using the cards in Rakasa, players perform different actions using Rakmin, a mini puzzle game included in Legends of Rakasa. Rakmin consist of small tiles and dice. The Rakmin puzzle system is used for actions such as tracking down something or unlocking items.

Five Chapter Story cards guide players through the introductory chapters of Rakasa. The events of these chapters play out over the space of roughly three days in Rakasa. Time passes, hour by hour each turn. Day turns to night and night to day as the events of the chapters unfold. Players may decide to work together cooperatively or work in competition with each other throughout all of the chapters.

The Introductory Five Chapters can be played as individual game instances (each consisting of 30 minutes to an hour of gameplay). The chapters can be played as a set of sequential events, with players progressing their equipment through the chapters. Players can also jump straight into a chapter without playing previous chapters by starting with general gear that matches the difficulty level of the game at that point in the Introductory Five Chapters. After playing through the standard chapters of Legends of Rakasa: Fordra, players will be ready to venture off and create legends of their own!
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Role Playing, Trading, Turn Order: Time Track

name: Chunky Fighters: Franck Choillard
description: Chunky Fighters: Franck Choillard is the twelfth expansion to Chunky Fighters. The expansion comes with the dice and card for the patriot. This fighter has the power of Camembert (yes, the cheese) to lower all opponent's rolled die rolls by 1 while brandishing his Camembert. He can only Dodge when doing so.
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Humor

name: Chunky Fighters: Aimé Rikain
description: Chunky Fighters: Aimé Rikain is the eleventh expansion to Chunky Fighters. The expansion comes with the dice and card for the cowboy. This fighter has the power of Ambidexterity (he may both attack and cure himself during the same turn) and gets +1 Damage during Standoffs.
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Humor

name: Space Brew
description:
Space Brew is a drinking game played with cards. The game has a retro sci-fi theme and the object is to gather enough pieces of salvage to repair your ship. This is done by battling space monsters using various quantities of alcohol.

Equipment can be won from monsters to help your cause and you can hire mercenaries. There is also a range of space sicknesses to endure and currency cards to coax away other player's mercenaries.

name: Chicken Out
description:
Are you brave or are you chicken? Play Chicken Out, a fast game of risk taking and second guessing.
Play the turtle and mosey along. Play the frog and take a big leap. But beware the snakes and the vultures!
Chicken Out is a game for 2-6 players and is recommended for players of at least 8 years old

In this game players secretly choose a character to play each turn and then take a die roll and advance on the track. The die rolls become riskier every turn and the characters that other players choose can change the results of the turn. Players may decide to chicken out and score points, but the player who is furthest along when they chicken out gets the most points. The player with the most points at the end of the game wins.

name: Taxi! Taxi!
description:
"Deliver your passengers first and win!"

A taxi game where you have five passengers needing to go to five different and randomly selected locations. The first to deliver their passengers to their destinations and returns back to the taxi stand at their corresponding color wins!
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Pick-up and Deliver, Roll / Spin and Move

name: And Sometimes Y
description:
Word creation game using cards printed with individual letters placed onto the table in grid format. Players construct words using adjacent consonants and any of three vowels available for that round.

Consonants count positively towards player score, wheres as vowels subtract points. The letter Y is the exception in both of these cases, losing the player points when used as a consonant but gaining the player points when used as a vowel.

The contents in the box allow for three different ways to play:


Classic Contest


Players construct as many unique words as possible within a given time limit.


Most Valuable Word


Players choose a single word from those they construct within a given time limit. The player with the highest-scoring word wins.


Elimination Challenge


Players compete to construct words in a “shout it out” format. The letters used are removed from play until no new words can be formed. The scores on each consonant card are added. The person with the highest total wins.

name: Shipwreck: Freeplay '88
description: Freeplay '88 is a supplement to Shipwreck with add on rules and campaign information. Based around a NATO military exercise in 1988, it is an in-depth look at what happens when the gloves come off... Features include: A fifty page rulebook with a laminated cover. Nine separate scenarios as well as a full campaign option. Full detailed listing of all ships, aircraft (including payloads) and airfields involved. More than twenty five pictures and illustrations. A two page campaign map of the North Sea. Over seventy fully made out detail sheets of forty nine different ships and five airfields from six different nations. Lists of abbreviations and designations. Extra weapons systems and aircraft.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Modern Warfare, Nautical, Wargame

name: Divine Empire
description:
In Divine Empire, the players are gods. Their target goal is a predetermined level of civilization. Each god has to reach this level as soon as possible.
The gameplay is stuffed with battles, magic and technology. The multiplayer version also adds a serious amount of backstabbing...

You can play the game with a starter deck (76 cards) for each player. More cards were available in booster packs of 12 cards each. Cards had different rarities.

Plans were made to publish English and Dutch versions. Unfortunately the Chinese market back then was not what it is today. We're talking about 1997 and distribution of the game was the ultimate nemesis that led to the demise of this game.

name: Stolpersteine
description:
In Stolpersteine each player tries to be the first to reach the peak. Before the game begins, a path up the mountain is layed out from stones across the board. Roll the die and move your hiker forward. If you end up on solid ground, he will stick to the stone magnetically. But watch out for stumbling blocks (without a magnet hidden inside) which will make you fall: You'll have to start anew!

German description from the publisher:
Wandern macht ja bekanntlich riesig Spaß, aber man muss auch sehr vorsichtig sein. Denn nicht auf jedem Stein steht man gleich gut und manchmal wird man sogar von einem anderen Wanderer geschuckt, so dass man wieder ganz unten im Tal beginnen muss. Wem gelingt es also als erstem, den Gipfel zu erklimmen?
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement

name: Imperium Chronicles: Fleets at War – Theater of Operations
description:
Fleets at War: Theater of Operations (F@W:ToO) is a strategic wargame set in the Imperium Chronicles universe. The game represents the large scale organization and resource management of the Imperium and the Magna Supremacy during armed conflict, most recently the Third Imperium-Magna War.

Theater of Operations is designed with ease of play in mind, including rules that are simple to learn and execute.

One player takes the role of the Imperium while the other player controls the Magna Supremacy. Each side starts the game with a fleet of ships that can be placed anywhere on their side of the demilitarized zone (DMZ). As the game progresses, each side gets points based on the number of zones on the map they possess. These points are then used to build new ships. The winner is the side that defeats the other player, usually by destroying all of his ships and/or capturing his zones.
categories: Miniatures, Print & Play, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: [gram-er puh-lease]
description:
Why not play a game where people have to correctly pair a sentence together with the words in their/there/they're hand.

The rules are fairly simple, you will need to make pairs in order to gain a point. So you will have cards with sentences and a blank space. For instance; 'The boy had to grab his bike to get to _____ house.' Seems simple right? You would want to use your 'their' card. Laying it in front of you, would claim that you correctly made a pair. Not everyone will be able to pair correctly, it's human to make mistakes. If a player lays a pair that you deem incorrect that is when you play your [puh-lease card] which is pretty much you calling your friend an idiot. So the game can be rude, it really depends on who you are playing with.

1. Each Player is dealt five card (this will include two different types; Sentences and Words)
2. Throughout a players turn they will combine sentences with words using correct and proper grammar.
3. If a player plays a pair that is not correct, another player may use a Puh-Lease Card to call out their play. This will either award or penalize them based off their play being correct or not.
4. The player with the most pairs is the winner, the game ends when the last card is drawn.

name: Skip Stones
description:
User summary:
In this game, players move a king and 4 soldiers and compete with their pieces in a manner akin to Chess in order to take their king to their opponent's side of the board. If a player's king is taken during the course of the game, he loses.

As the name of the game suggests, the game's greatest distinguishing feature is the fact that pieces are moved by being skipped over "skip stones", which can be freely arranged on the board. In contrast to the player’s own "skip stones", the opponent's "skip stones" act as barriers, preventing pieces from moving over them. The skip stones themselves can also be moved in a turn.

Strategy involves effectively using "skip stones" to create useful formations.

Publisher's summary:
王様駒と4個の兵士駒を動かしてチェスのように駒の取り合いをしながら王様駒を敵陣地まで到達させるゲームです。途中で王様駒が取られたら負けとなります。
ゲーム名の通り最大の特徴は、手番で自由に配置することが出来るスキップストーンを飛び越して駒を動かせることです。反対に敵のスキップストーンは障害物となって駒を動かすことができません。またスキップストーン自体も手番で動かすことができます。
スキップストーンを上手く利用して陣形を作ることが戦略となります。

name: Teams! Mayhem
description:
Teams! Mayhem is a place-your-minis-to-win board game by MiniMishaps Games. Your chosen team of characters has been pulled into a world that is fraught with portals to other worlds. The powerful mages here control who comes and who goes. They have created tasks to help them figure out who to send home. Use your pieces to accomplish these tasks before the other Players or you will be stuck here in oblivion.

This game has a strategy component, but also a luck component. It combines pieces that can move and attack with an ever-changing deck of cards that limit or enhance how pieces are played, moved, or captured.

Each Victory card has a task. The first player to three Victory cards is the winner. Victory cards are won be being the first player to finish the task, and you also gain a Victory card if you take over another player's portal. There are even cards that require players to work together before being able to continue to work on their own.

name: Planeteer
description:
Planeteer is a unique dice allocation and tile laying game set in a retro science fiction universe. Each player takes on the role of a freelance space exploration agency. Throughout the game they will be hiring personel (known as Planeteers), exploring planetoids, encountering aliens, and completing objectives based on scenarios.

The game begins by drawing a random 4"x4" starting tile. This tile will set the scenario for the current game, whether it be a crashed starship of colonists that need rescuing, an alien hive that must be destroyed, or a cache of rare space minerals that can be mined and exploited. Players will then take turns laying down tiles to create a 5x5 grid that will serves as the planet's surface.

The game is divided into two phases: The Preparation Phase, and the Action Phase. During the Prep Phase, players will allocate dice to different tasks, such as acquiring components to build rovers to explore the planet surface, building and deploying rovers, researching technology, or recruiting more Planeteers (represented by 6-sided dice). Players have a maximum number of Planeteer Interaction Points (or pips) that can be allocated amongst their available Planeteers. Once players have taken their actions in the Prep Phase, any remaining Planeteers go to the Flight Deck, and will become the Pilots for the rovers during the Action Phase.

During the Action Phase, players will assign their Pilots to any rovers they have on the planet's surface. These vehicles can perform tasks such as moving around the planet, interacting with objects (like salvaging or mining for minerals), or attacking (other players or aliens). Each scenario has a certain objective to complete, and the player who does so most efficiently wins the game.

One of the most unique aspects of Planeteer are the rovers. Rovers are built by stacking components (cardboard chits). Each stack has a hole in the middle to fit a die (the pilot). The die face will show how many actions are available for that rover. Actions are dependent on the components equipped. Each component stacks so that it's available actions (icons) don't overlap, so any icon showing is an action available for that rover.
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Modular Board, Pick-up and Deliver, Tile Placement

name: Henolfetta
description:
The players have to move their playing pieces (1 hat, 8 hatstones, 4 cones) into the starting positions of their opponent and back again to their own starting positions.

The hats move 1 space along their predrawn path.
The hatstones move 1 space straight in any direction.
The cones move any spaces diagonaly in any direction.
Hatstones and cones may jump diagonaly over an opponent hatstone any number of spaces away.


If an opponent hatstone blocks the movement of a hat, the player may roll a die. On the roll of a

1 or 6 the hat jumps on top of the hatstone,
2 or 4 the hat jumps over the hatstone and, if applicable, on top of a second headstone,
3 or 5 the hat has to use the detour (dashed line), if one branches off from the space it occupies.
mechanics: Grid Movement, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Gladiadores
description:
In Gladiators, each player represents one Ludus of Rome, and he will need to fight for the glory.

Each turn players can contract new slaves, train them, buy New abilities and weapons, etc..

Also you can upgrade your house to get bonuses and fight in the events. Win events gives you victory points to win the game.
The fights does not use dices,only cards.

Spanish description:
En Gladiadores cada jugador representa a un ludus romano, y tendrá que luchar para conseguir la gloria.

Cada turno los jugadores podrán contratar gladiadores, entrenarlos, perfeccionar sus habilidades,comprar armas...también podrán mejorar su ludus y por supuesto pelear en la arena para ganar el favor del pueblo.

El juego utiliza un sistema de combate novedoso que elimina por completo el uso de dados.

name: Madzzle
description:
Madzzle is a universe of engaging games which explores the most exciting worlds on our Planet & beyond!It was created to give anxious parents an alternative for their smartphone/ tablet hooked kids.

Madzzle has reinvented the way world looks at Jigsaw puzzles. Jigsaw puzzles always meant broken images,however with our patent pending zero gap technology, we have eliminated all gaps literally in a puzzle. This also meant that the completed puzzle could in turn become a board to play endless new games. This is how we added two more games for unending fun.
Object Hunt: In this game players race to find objects on the completed puzzle.
Data Duel: Its a trump card style game where players square off with each other based on facts and location of the object on the completed puzzle.

Madzzle also solves the biggest problem with Jigsaws i.e. that it is not portable and once completed have to be dismantled. With the help of our magnetic mat, Madzzle can be moved around and players can also roll up the completed puzzle and roll out the completed puzzle whenever they are in the mood for some Madzzle Fun.

Madzzle is available in three exciting themes- Bermuda Triangle, Mysteries of the Amazon and Worldopedia.

name: Third Age: Eternal
description:
Ho, traveler! If you would wander these lands, you must prepare yourself; pitiless death stalks all those who roam far here. Carry with you strong iron blades, and cover your shoulders with heavy cloaks. Select with care those hale companions whom you can stoutly trust. I pray ye have honed your skills in combat, or perchance taken on the trade of magics. You will find many aged relics on your path: make use of them, if ye will. For there are those who would pursue you, and their steel is sharp, their ilk stalwart, their wits keen. The fragments of that ancient alliance weaken now, and the tenuous peace of this age threatens to expire…

Third Age: Eternal exists in an exciting universe where beasts, known as the Awakened, inhabit a land that would not be unfamiliar to the player. As a modular card game, one must select a cadre of heroes, outfit them with arms and armor, call upon the aid of companions, and employ skills and actions to face the opposing player in battle.

In Third Age: Eternal, vitality, a card’s life force, is also one’s main form of currency, and a delicate balance must be stricken to win—so weigh your defenses against your offenses or you may quickly find yourself overrun. Certain cards or abilities require additional payment in the form of exhaustion, a card’s capacity for exertion; but overwork a companion or gear and you will find it will expire. In Third Age: Eternal, one must constantly balance one’s own vitality and exhaustion, which ensures a challenging game of tough choices and rich tactics.

Each deck in Third Age: Eternal can play through wildly different strategies. You may be a hero whose skills with the gun are all you need; or strike among an army of companions and ride into battle with your brothers-in-arms. Or maybe you’re a mercenary of magic and action, and you will weave great firestorms to devastate even the largest forces. The possibilities are endless, but you must be clever if you wish to be standing after the dust settles…

Third Age: Eternal is a robust and customizable game that is unmatched in its flexibility of strategy.

name: Unlimited VS
description: Unlimited VS is a card game that let you have your favorite characters from video game or anime fight each other using various attack and support cards. Each character can gain a level after he/she is damaged by your opponent. When you are able to deal 5 damage to your opponents, you win.
categories: Card Game, Fighting, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Video Game Theme

name: Ludwig's Labyrinth
description:
Ludwig's Labyrinth is a Dungeon Crawl for 2 to 4 Brave Players.

In Ludwig's Labyrinth you take on the role of an intrepid Adventurer, Wizard, Berserker, Thief, Ranger, Knight or Warrior as you bravely traverse the challenges of an ever changing dungeon to see who can emerge victorious from its dark and dangerous depths.

Ludwig, “The Grinning Trickster” has packed the dungeon with vicious monsters, mystical magic, honed weapons, ancient elemental stones and strength enhancers for players to compete over. And of course plenty of gold to satisfy a thirst for riches.

Welcome, brave explorers, to Ludwig's Labyrinth

Right out of the box the game comes with
3 Levels of Difficulty that can each be paired with...
1 of 2 Modes of Gameplay for a total of...
6 DIFFERENT WAYS TO PLAY!

MODE1 - Dungeon Runner:
Each player will create their own labyrinth path of 8 cards, race to last room then flip the cards over, to reveal a brand new path of 8 new rooms. First to make it back to the START wins!

MODE 2 - Last to be Lost:
All players, together, will lay out 19 of the labyrinth cards in a large hexagonal formation composed of chosen challenges and random cards. All players will start in the middle of the labyrinth. If a player's HP hits 0 they are immediately eliminated. Last player left alive, WINS!

PLUS...
With the design of the game's components and cards it is easy to create house rules and custom dungeons and modes. Don't just let Ludwig have all the fun. Make this labyrinth your own!
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Player Elimination, Point to Point Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Milch
description:
Objective: be the first player to reach space 40 (and learn more about milk and milk products).

Typical Roll & Move game, similar to Game of Goose. Certain spaces (marked in red) trigger a special effect described in the rulebook.

Note:
published ~ mid 1930s; printed by Schettlers Erben A.G., Köthen (Germany)

name: Think
description:
Think is a Trivia game with 5 knowledge areas.

On each player's turn, another player takes a new Card for reading the question(s).

On each Card there are 5 questions, for one each knowledge area. Which question is asked is determined by rolling 2 dice.
Rolling doubles or 6s results in a special effect, such as getting a free Point or getting 2 questions.

Different numbers (without 6) gives the active player the possibility to choose the knowledge area.

1 question/area on each card is bold. This is the master question where you bet 2 or 3 of your previous owned victory points, for doubling or loosing them.

In the small editions the actual Player gets the card for knowing the answer, in the big boxes there are additional "nuggets" (black stones) for counting the victory Points.

Game Ends when 1 player has a predetermined amount of victory Points.

name: München ist ja soooo schön!!
description:
Easy roll die and move game for Munich tourists.
The board shows Munich with its sights and streets. The streets are crossing each other, which means the players are free to choose their way on the plan.
Each player gets a card with a list of sights.
He has to make a sightseeing tour visiting his sights.
The players sights give him 5 points (automatically stop on the field), other sights (exact hit with the die number) give additional 2 Points.
Game ends when the first 3 players are back at the train station (also the start field). From them the player with the most points wins the game.
There are event fields which may help or hinder the players way.

name: Breakable
description:
Breakable is a game of futuristic ground and air combat for 2 to 4 players. Its set in the same future-history as Inteformic's earlier release Unbreakable.

You decide what forces and weapons you need to complete your mission. Employ fast but vulnerable skimmers to deliver a lightning blow to your opponent. Or choose sturdy tanks armed with heavier weapons. For defense, nothing beats the staying power of your bunkers. And don’t forget recons; shadow warriors who can infiltrate behind enemy lines to call in nuclear strikes from afar.

Then equip your units with nukes, lasers, autocannons, cluster bombs and more. Thanks to advanced materials technology your units are hard to kill, but still breakable.
publishers: (Web published), Interformic Games, Print & Play Productions

name: Kunterbuntes Lernmobil
description:
This is an electronic-based educatioan boardgame.

There are exchangable cards. On each card there 8 pairs of matching things. The players have to find the matching pairs and touch them with a finger on both. The sensors behind the card will give a signal if this is a pair or not.
First step is learning Colors, later Levels are about numbers and words.

name: Wimmel-Electric
description:
There are 12 sheets with each 1 big image overfilled with people and things. There are 6 small parts of the big Image shown at the right side of the sheet.
One of this sheets has to be choosen and put on the board.
The actual player has to find one of the 6 small image parts in the big image.
The player touches both with the Ends of the 2 cables attached to the board. The electronic in the board will show if it's right or not.

name: Au Pole Antarctique
description:
Objective: Be the first to rach space 65
One of several roll&move games that came out early 1900 as the public was enthralled with expeditions to the arctic/antarctic.
The board features illustrations of the trip south, by ship and dogsled. The dice rolling trip covers the successful journey south.

Likely published in 1912 or 1913.

name: DraftCraft
description: In DraftCraft, players draft a hand of resource cards that also have plans for objects that they can craft. After drafting, they craft one of their plans by spending the resource cards. The crafts generate effects such as an increase in hand size, additional resources, and discounts for future crafts. After seven rounds, the player with the highest total Victory Point value in crafts wins.

name: Plumps: Ein Kreiselspiel für jung und alt
description:
The board has a number of holes in it; in a turn, the player sets off his spinning top in the start area, with the intention of sending it forward towards the scoring holes. If it drops into a hole, points are scored.

First to reach a pre-agreed total of points, wins.
likely published ~1947-1950

name: Die Pfadfinder
description:
Objective: Be the first reaching target space 99 and learn more about scouting.

This is a game in the style of Game of Goose. Players take turns rolling the die and moving their pawn the indicated amount of spaces. When they land on a marked (red) space, some special effect occurs.

Botes:

Pewter pawns
Likely published early 1910s

name: Der Wichtelwald
description: A simple race game in the tradition of Game of Goose. Move by die roll. If you land on a red colored space, obey the instructions glued into the lid. Target space 75 must be reached with a matching number.

name: Deutsch-englischer Seekrieg
description:
The gameboard is your battlefield. You have a fleet at your disposal including a battleship, cruisers, submarines ... Your mission: protect your flagship and capture your opponent's flagship.
Once the ships are in place advance them. When you're one space away from an enemy you must attack if your ship is strong enough (see Category groups).
If yes, opponent's ship is defeated and out of play.
Game ends after a flagship is captured.

name: Stop-Over Wuppertal
description:
This game consists of two sub-games. In the first game players take the role of journalists and try to get to the sat-van as quick as possible in order to upload the three pictures they have to capture in this game. The pictures are all Wuppertal-buildings or sites and have a UFO sighting on them.

This is a Malefiz kind of adaptation.

In the second part the game, journalists try to get the cover-story before the other players can by running up the stairs of the publisher trying to beat the others to his office.

name: The Last Word: Gilbert Harding's Party Game
description:
Contents. 17 sheets, on each of which several 4-letter words are printed; one sheet on which the solutions are printed, and 12 answer cards.

The host keeps the solution sheet, and places the 17 sheets around the room separately so that each one can easily be seen. Each player is then given an answer card and a pencil. The players write their names at the head of their cards.
On line No. 1 on each answer card appears a 4-letter word, and on line 11 a different 4-letter word is printed. The players have to write in each of the 10 spaces (Nos. 2 to 10) on their answer cards a 4-letter word, each one different by one letter only from the word immediately before it, so that the tenth word has only one letter different from the word printed at the foot of their answer cards.

The words they require all appear on the 17 sheets distributed about the room; so, on the word “ Go! ” the players examine the sheets until they see on one of them a word different by one letter from the word at the top of their answer cards. They write this down on line No. 2 and then proceed to look for the next word, which will be one letter different again from what they have just written, and so on.

The winner is the player who first completes a correct answer card. He takes it to the host for checking.
N.B.—The words on the 17 sheets are not, of course, in correct order.

Note
Gilbert Harding (1907 - 1960) became a TV celebrity mainly thanks to his regular appearances on the BBC version of What's My Line? He was cantankerous and had volatile outbursts against contestants he found rather dull. This character trait made the show compulsive viewing in the 1950's.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game, Word Game

name: Leva Livets Stora Bibelbingo & Bibelmemory
description: Leva Livets Stora Bibelbingo & Bibelmemory is a big box edition of Bibelbingo & Bibelmemory. This box contains of 82 characters (instead of 36) and 75 bingo cards (instead of 25). The game can be played in three levels, eg. sundayschool year 1-3, with 25 characters for each level. The game plays the same way as Bibelbingo & Bibelmemory.

name: Chance
description:
The players attempt to buy and then develop properties in different German cities. Income is gained by other players visiting their properties and money is spent when they visit properties belonging to other players. players may have to mortgage their properties to raise cash for fines, taxes and other misfortunes. The goal of the game is to be the last player remaining with any money

On his turn, a player rolls two dice and moves that number of spaces around the board. If the player lands on an as-yet-unowned property, he has the opportunity to buy it and add it to his portfolio or allow the bank to auction it to the highest bidder. If a player owns all the spaces within a color group, he may then build 1 hotel on each of these spaces, generating even more income from opponents who land there. If he lands on a property owned by another player, he must pay that player rent according to the value of the property and if there is an hotel on it. There are other places on the board which can not be bought, but instead require the player to draw a card (Lotterie or "?") and perform the action on the card, pay taxes, collect income or winnings, or go to jail. The players may stay on the "Weekend" space and rest, if they pay 1000,- per turn.
mechanics: Player Elimination, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Portfolio
description:
Portfolio is a card game designed to capture the ebb and flow of trading on the stock market condensed into 45 minutes. You'll buy and sell shares of public companies, represented by the cards, based on your limited knowledge of the upcoming trends of the four market sectors. After 9 to 12 rounds, the game ends and the player with the most valuable portfolio wins!

Before the game begins, players will secretly contribute cards to a market deck, which governs how well the four sectors of stocks perform in each round. Players will thus have partial knowledge of how the markets will improve or degrade. Then they must fill the gaps in their knowledge by keenly observing how their opponents play.

On a player's turn, he or she may buy stocks from their hand to add to their portfolio, sell stocks for some liquid cash, work to increase the value of a stock (by discarding similar stocks from hand), play a headline card to enact an event, or pass. They will want to be careful, though-- There are multiples of each stock card, and each card of a given company will gain and lose value identically throughout the game.

So look out before adding value to your share in Manitoba Maple; your opponent may own a share in the same company and directly benefit from your action!

name: ITLMAKEUTHINK
description:
From the publisher's website:


THE BOARD GAME FOR ONE PERSON ONLY....ANYONE, ANYWHERE, ANYTIME.
EVERY GAME AS EASY OR AS DIFFICULT AS YOU CHOOSE TO MAKE IT.
107 LETTERS...CAN YOU USE EVERY ONE OF THEM ?
EVERY GAME YOU PLAY.........ITLMAKEUTHINK.


OBJECT OF THE GAME
Successfully place all 107 letters on the board, by forming words both horizontally and vertically.
With 7 different levels of play to choose from, the smaller that you make your playing area, the more difficult your game then becomes.

name: Οριζόντια - Κάθετα
description:
It's a game like scrabble and crossword puzzles.
The player who creates the words with the most rare letters scores the most points.

name: Transit
description: The players have to go around the game track three times with their trucks, while picking up and delivering cargo. Movement is determined by a die. At the end of the game, the players get points awarded for the cargo on their truck (more if it is in their own Color) and for the order of their arrival at the finish.
mechanics: Pick-up and Deliver, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Valley Of The Ape
description:
From the front cover and opening chapter:

Rules for a tabletop game of jungle exploration and monster hunting for kids age 7 and older.

Includes Bonus Game Cowboys vs. Dinos

The crazy wild man stumbled out of the jungle into the village on the Nile. He babbled about lost treasures, a remote valley, and a giant ape. Nobody believed him at first, but then, as he gasped his last breath, his hand fell to his side and a golden medallion clattered to the ground. Rumors quickly spread to all parts of Africa: somewhere in the deepest, darkest jungle is a valley filled with treasure...and one giant ape guarding it all.

Into the Jungle
Valley of the Ape offers some simple rules for kids to play a tabletop game of exploration and monster hunting. Adults might offer some advice and help collecting all the terrain and pieces; they could also provide guidance, answer questions, or referee disputes at the game table during play.

User description
Valley Of The Ape is a light, kid friendly wargame. Players take turns moving then attacking. Resolution is done with d6. The PDF includes rule summary sheets and marker cards that can be cutout and use during play.
categories: Adventure, Children's Game, Print & Play, Wargame

name: Knowledge travel Greece
description:
Trivial game with questions about Greece and Cyprus

It contains 6 fields of questions:
1.civilization and arts
2.cinema
3.history and mythology
4.geography
5.sports
6.language and tradition

Excellent trivial game in which winners and losers gain some knowledge!
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Creepy Treat Combat
description:
Creepy Treat Combat is a collectable trading trading card game based on the cards found in the video game Costume Quest by Double Fine

The game uses a simple push your luck mechanic. Each card has a number, and may have text describing a special effect. Players take turns drawing cards or holding, attempting to reach the highest total without going over 13.
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Video Game Theme

name: Biblisches Frage- & Antwort-Spiel
description:
Objective: gain as many victory points as possible; use the bible as a guide for all vital questions.

Biblisches Frage- & Antwort-Spiel is a trivia game. Players ask each other questions extracted from better-known Bible stories.
For each correct answer the player gains a card/victory point.
The game includes 2x 110 cards with 110 questions and answers each.

Later edition (after WW2) are containing modifications, such as difficulty levels (with more victory points for more difficult questions).

name: Planet Zongo
description:
Planet Zongo' is based on the proliferation of small arms. This game is about an epidemic, but instead of being threatened by diseases or zombies, the players must escape their own weapons. In this game, players may even want to give weapons to their opponents in order to get rid of them.
Like in other games, players need armies to protect themselves or attack their opponents. They also have populations to sustain their armies. But the problem is:
1. Weapons never leave the game. When an army is killed, its weapons stay on the board. Those weapons are given to another population (even belonging to another player). That population thus becomes an army.
2. But armies need populations. When an army is not sustained by a population, it starves and is removed from the game. However, as explained in rule 1, its weapons stay on the board and will be given to another population.
As more and more weapons are added in the course of the game, this mechanic threatens the players with a snowball effect: The more armies get destroyed, the more populations become armies by receiving weapons.The more populations become armies, the less armies can be sustained… And so it gets only worse: as those unsustained armies are eliminated, the remaining populations receive even more weapons ...
The winner will be the player that best survives this process.
mechanics: Action Queue, Area Majority / Influence, Hexagon Grid, Take That

name: Yomi's Gate
description:
The Goddess Izanami has fallen, allying the spirits of Yomi with the demons of Jigoku to invade the mortal realm through Yomi's Gate! Will you enlist with the shogunate to protect the celestial order? Or will you join Izanami and seek to shatter it?

Yomi's Gate is a tactical game of map control and unit management. Lead samurai and oni units into battle and use each of their special abilities to conquer a map that's different every time you play.

Capture the enemy stronghold, defeat their leaders, or eliminate their army to win!
mechanics: Grid Movement, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Dead Sails
description:
Dead Sails is a 3-4 player tabletop game where you use coins to attack ships and out-plunder your pirate friends. The player with the most treasure at the end of the game wins. Plays in 30-60 minutes.

Played with laser-cut coins, Dead Sails is a bidding game about choosing your battles wisely and outwitting your friends. Use attack coins to plunder ships from the Merchant Fleet and the Royal Navy, treasure coins to bid on weapons from the Black Market and to hire mercenaries, and special coins like the Spyglass to gather intelligence on what your opponents are plotting.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Betting and Bluffing, Memory, Secret Unit Deployment

name: I-List Music Party Game
description:
From the publisher:

"It's the fast-find song frenzy that pits your playlist against your friends' in a simultaneous music challenge for up to four players! Connect up to four MP3 players (not included) and let your fingers do the flyin' as you show what you know about your music collection. When you're done playing, use the console to play your favorite music! Plus, the console stores everything, making it easy for you to take this tune-tappin' song-matching game anywhere you go! Game console comes with cables, 60 cards, and instructions."

This unique game is played by everyone connecting their MP3 players or smart phones to the game console via the included audio cables. Players take turns drawing cards and reading aloud the categories. All players must then search through their playlists in a race to be the first one to play an appropriate song. If the song does indeed fit the category, that player earns a point; otherwise, they lose a point. Once all cards have been played, the game ends and the player with the most points is declared the winner.

name: Murder Mystery Video Party Game
description:
From the box:

Everyone loves a great party...with the Murder Mystery Video Party Game, you'll throw the party your friends won't stop talking about It's fun! To play, you and your friends assume the roles of the characters in the story. You act out your parts as the game is played.

When a popular restauranteur is suddenly murdered, no one is allowed to leave and everyone is suspect! Why is Miss Svenson so emotional about the murder? Who is Oscar Himmel and what does he know about Miss Swift? At THREE POINTS in the movie, the detective will tell you to stop the video, question your suspects and pick up clues to track down the killer. Is Fred Simms really an aluminum siding salesman? Who is the floosie hanging around Mr. Engels and where did the waiter disappear to?

A thrilling whodunnit! YOU FIND THE KILLER and YOU SOLVE THE MURDERS. But watch out, your character may be the next victim!

name: Alkemy: Aurlok Nation Starter Box
description: The Aurloks are largely organized into nomad tribes, following the rhythm of the seasons and the migrations of the animals they hunt. They are generally a peaceful people, but do not underestimate them for this appearance! Their war-songs can echo as quickly as a thunderstorm in the summer. The Aurloks then become savage and merciless warriors whose wrath is guided by their totems: the Manitous.
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Hand Management

name: Ancient Construct
description:
User summary:
古代建築 (Ancient Construct) is a 3-dimensional puzzle game in which 24 pieces comprised of a total of 99 blocks are piled on top of one another in a chimney-like stack. The player who stacked the greatest number of blocks through their pieces wins!

There are six 3-block pieces, ten 4-block pieces, seven 5-block pieces, and one 6-block pieces, for a total of 24 pieces. This allows 2-4 people to play. If anyone makes the tower collapse during the game, they lose. The blocks are slightly uneven, so the game demands 3-dimensional spatial awareness, a good sense of balance, and dexterity in stacking.

Publisher's summary:
99個のブロックからなる24個のピースを煙突状に積み上げる、立体パズルゲームです。
積み上げたピースの総ブロック数が多い人が勝ちとなります。
3ブロックピースが6個、4ブロックピースが10個、5ブロックピースが7個、
6ブロックピースが1個の合計24ピースなので、2～4人で公平にプレー出来ます。途中で倒したら負けです。
ブロックは微妙に歪なので、立体空間認識とバランス感覚と積み上げる手先の器用さが必要とされます。

name: The Magic Shop
description:
The Magic Shop is a game of magical, mercantile mayhem! Players each assume the role of a wizard or witch running their own magic shop, using ingredient cards to to concoct potions, talismans, scrolls, and magical weapons and armor with the help of your apprentices. Apprentices are sent into the market to gather magical ingredients and advertise to potential customers, or you may have some stay in the lab to help with the work of enchanting.

Ingredient cards are placed into your "cauldron" to produce a dice pool. This dice pool is then rolled in an attempt to complete enchantment lines (sets of specific dice facings). Players may opt to try and add more dice to their cauldrons to complete additional lines to make their items more valuable, but risk drawing magical accident cards that may make their apprentices vanish, curse the item, or turn some of your hard-earned gold into lead.

Cast spells to help you in your endeavors by having an apprentice visit the caster's tower, or hex your opponents to give you an edge in your quest to be the greatest magic shop owner in the city.

Try to anticipate your customers' needs when they arrive and sell them as many of your finished items as possible and pave the way to your victory! Victory Points are earned primarily by making the most gold selling your enchantments, but victory points may also be earned from completing all enchantment lines on a magic item. Points may be lost if your items end up cursed. The wizard or witch with the highest number of victory points at the end of eight turns is considered the winner.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Worker Placement

name: Ladrones
description:
Ladrones ("Thieves") is a party-game, created by David Vaquero, easy to learn and very funny to play. In this game, 2 to 5 players fight each other for being the best white collar thief.

The players will try to form a band of specialist in some criminal skills, like strong-box opening or server hacking, to perform the most risky robberys. They could draw cards from the deck or place the highest bid to form their crew.

When a player is ready to carry out a robbery, he will announce it and will replace its specialist cards by the respective color specialist dices. The player will have only 30 seconds to get the perfect combination in any dice by throwing them as many times as necessary.

After the assault, it doesn't matter if the player has had success or not, it's time to go out and run. The player will have another 30 seconds to throw the Driver's dice to left behind the police and scape.

The game will finish when all the plans of robbery run out or all the available diamonds have gone. The player who has the biggest diamond amount is the winner.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck, Set Collection

name: Χαρούμενο Σχόλασμα
description: A children's game in which you have just finished school, and you have to go back home with the least possible distractions. The game teaches children some basic principles about life. The game play is just roll and move.

name: Crusher
description:
Crusher is a fantasy trading card game that can be played with various deck sizes: A Skirmish game involves no deck, just a starting hand of 7 cards. A Clash game uses 20-card decks. A Battle game uses 40-card decks. A War game uses 100-card decks.

Two players exchange attacks using character cards and booster cards played out of hand. The object is to eliminate all of your opponent's characters in hand while that opponent lacks the ability to draw more characters from the deck.

name: PinBox 3000
description: The PinBox 3000 is a cardboard, assembly-required, customizable, modular arcade "art-cade" system of tabletop pinball, and gravity-powered games.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Educational, Real-time

name: Game of Fox & Geese
description:
Cards are placed center of table, stacked, face down.
Each card has four of these numbers on it (1,2,3,4,5,6,7,8,9)

First player calls a number, turns over top card, reads number.
If number called is one of four digits on card, player keeps it.
Otherwise it is placed faced down on bottom of main pile.
Next player does the same procedure, and so on.

When all cards are taken, he who has the most wins.

name: Saban's Adventures of Oliver Twist: Das große Spiel
description:
You roll a dice, select a direction and move this number of fields. You try to reach one of the adventure fields, which allows you to challenge one of your opponents. The winner gets one chip. If you go on a field, on which an other player is standing, you can steel a chip from them.
The first, who has 7 chips wins.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Gute Zeiten Schlechte Zeiten: Das Spiel
description: You roll a dice and move your character as many fields on the board. The field, you reach tells you which kind of challange eg drawing, acting, you have to fulfill. The first, who has 15 points wins.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Unter uns: Das Spiel
description:
Each player gets a secrect card with 4 characters, which he has to move to his target fields in his corner of the board. The first player fulfilling this wins.
At the beginning the 16 pawns are placed in the corners and the 9 caps, which can hide the pawns, are placed in the middle of the board. Each turn you move one of the pawns to an adjacent field or jump if it is occupied and additional move one of the caps.

name: Gute Zeiten Schlechte Zeiten: Das Spiel zur Serie
description:
The game is based on the German TV series "Gute Zeiten Schlechte Zeiten".
The whole game board has square fields like a chess board.
There are additional drawn walls which separate parts of the boards from each other (rooms). The lines have spaces where the rooms are linked (doors).
There are 20 differnt pawns representing each a different character of the TV series.
At the begin of the game, each player gets 2 cards of the character stock, showing each 1 character/pawn and a room Card showing 1 room.
The player who is first to get his 2 character in the room of his room card wins.
On players turn he rolls 2 dice and moves 1 character for each of the die the number shown. Movement is allowed horizontal, vertical and diagonal also with changing while moving. Moving through walls is not allowed.
One of the oppenents (the fasted) may say which charcter is owned by the actual user. If this is right the Player has to show this character card and has only 1 die and 1 move in his next turns.
If the opponent is wrong, he has to show one of his character cards with the same effect. If a player has to Show his second card, he looses and is out of the game.
The game can also end if only 1 player is in the game. This player has won the game.

name: Bibelspiel 1
description:
It's a dominio game where children should learn about the stories of the bible and there "historic" series.
The start stone shows the Genesis. The activ player tries to find the next matching Stone/story from all stones which lie open in the middle of the table.
The game should lead the children asking questions about the bible stories, which main content are discribed in little books in the game.
There are Stones allowing to continue different bible series in different directions.
All Player win when they can finish the stories.

name: Die Sendung mit der Maus: Was passt dazu?
description:
The game persists of 7 panels in different colors, which show the 'Maus' in different situations and 7 cards of each color with suitable items . One card of each color is put on the corresponding panel, the others cards are shuffled and build a stock. The players have time to memory the items on the panels, then the cards are turned facedown.
The topmost card of the stock is taken and shown to all players. The first player, who says which hidden item is laying on the panel of the same color as the card drawn, gets the memorized card and the new card is put on the panel facedown.
The game ends if the stock is empty, the player with the most cards wins.

name: Sei auf der Hut!
description:
This is a trivia game about dangerous situations in life.
The game board shows 6 situations where a person behaves wrong.
Each player gets a puzzle of 6 pieces which shows one of the situations on the board, but with the right behavior.
This is the counter, how many questions each player has answered right.
On players turn he gets a question from a card deck about dangerous situations in life and how to behave right in this situation. With each question answered right the player places one of his puzzle pieces on the board. Who places first all 6 wins the game.

name: A Hold Birodalma
description:
A Hold Birodalma ("The Empire of Moon") is an almost ancient pen-and-paper RPG from Hungary, with modular board, where small cards represent the various locations, such as Towns, Swamps, Cemeteries, Caves, etc. The world's layout is always changing, depending on where the players are going to place the terrain cards. The box contains a small Event Book; according to the specific terrain, a die roll is needed to decide what is about to happen in that round with your character. Unfortunately, the game has a very poor design, but a unique charm as well, if you're interested in retro games.

Your goal is to kill the Dark Mage in the Black Tower first. Can be played in solo, in a team, or in full competitive mode.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Role Playing, Solo / Solitaire Game, Team-Based Game

name: Turnpike
description:
Turnpike is the game of highway mayhem. Life on the road means relying on quick wits, mad skills, and a bit of luck to get you there in one piece. Turnpike captures the rolling shark tank that is the modern highway system where complete strangers shamelessly screw each other over in an infuriating race that no one really wins — until now.

1. Players roll dice to move. The play actions are inter-weavable and open. Players may do the following in any order:

move their car
play cards
move a non-player car
add or subtract a car
generally wreak ruin upon the road


3. Every turn, players move non-player cars out of their way and into the path of opponents.

4. The cards give players movement bonuses, allow control over road traffic, and let them mess with other players.

5. The card types are: DRIVER, TRAFFIC, AGGRESSIVE, INSTANT.

6. The winner is the player to push through the traffic jam and get to the EXIT first.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move, Simulation, Take That

name: The Coterie
description:
The Coterie is a headless cooperative tabletop role-playing game where uncommon heroes are pitted against an unfamiliar enemy. Choose your path through dark dungeons while searching for your objectives. Find lost materials and gain favor with the town to upgrade your weapons and armor. Your choices, both small and large, will determine your campaign. Band together with your allies and name your own coterie!

Your Coterie is the last line of defense for the land. The heroes you know are gone. You must stand together, or die alone.

Game features:

Tile placement system that builds as you play to eliminate setup times. Each game will be different from the last.
Terrain adds an additional layer of complexity and variation to the game. As regions are discovered, so are their terrains. Terrains are drawn randomly, and can vary each game with each region.
Backgrounds and skills to mix and match anyway the players wish. Each combination creates a different style of play.
Limited resources are available. Not everyone will be able to be the plate armor wearing, front-line tank. Choose your equipment to best compliment your background and skill!
Lasting equipment upgrades for your weapons and/or armor.
Evolving enemies that gain strength depending on how they are defeated in combat.

name: Major's Raiders
description: Major's Raiders is a word forming game which may be played by two or more persons, preferable FOUR. It consists of four racks and 150 blocks marked with letters and symbols, each of which, has a particular usage in the game. This game a word building game similar to Scrabble, the winner is the one with the most words when no letter tiles are left is the winner. Unique to this game is the "flag" tile which allows words to be captured.

name: Cazadores de Humanos
description:
In Cazadores de Humanos ("Human Hunters"), the players are alien hunters that arrive to Earth to hunt humans. They need to get trophies and get to the ship before other players to win.

Each player needs 6 trophies for hunting humans. Each turn you take a card from the neighbours deck, Each card have a number or two. You need the same number in the dice. If you didnt get the number you can use one of your four HELP tokens to achive the number. For example you need and 8, you roll a 7, you can use he HELP token +1 to take the 8 and the trophy. Then its next players turn, and repeat the process.

You need 6 trophies before you get to the center of the board and get to the ship. If you are in the ship but you dont have all the trophies, you go backwards to the middle of the path, until you get them.

name: Inferno of Rock: The Hard Rock Game From Hell
description: Inferno of Rock is a unique Hard Rock Trivia Card Game that steers away from the traditional board game format. All players face off and answer trivia questions while collecting platinum records to win.

name: Reflex'S
description:
Are you bored with traditional party games where you just have to react quickly when the cards are identical or different? Do you want to play at the next level game? Do you want to think and say « O my gosh! I can't remember how it works! » And, at the end of the game, do you want to say « ok, let's play again, I will do it! » Then, Reflex'S is for you!

It is a game that combines reflexes and reflection in which players must associate colors, shapes and numbers in an unusual way. Rules are quickly understood and heat up your brain. A card with two criteria identical to yours? Grab the object corresponding to the third criterion! Two identical cards and everybody must tap on the center.

And now, watch out, think twice and hurry up!

name: Pizza Delivery
description:
For most people, ordering a pizza is just a phone call away. What does it take to get that hot pizza to you? Do you have what it take to deliver? Find out with "Pizza Delivery". Race against your friends to earn the most tips in one evening, or be the "Top Driver" by delivering the most pizzas by the end of the game. How ever you choose to play the game, you'll find that Pizza Delivery delivers the fun.

Players move with dice and use event cards to move their cars and make deliveries.

name: Cat Traders
description:
User summary:
猫町商會 (Cat Traders) is a psychological strategy game in which players try to detect crooked merchants by exchanging transaction cards with other merchants (opponents) using 8 gold-coin cards.

If a player detects that a merchant has submitted a transaction card with a lower value than the gold-coin card (crooked merchant), he will acquire the transaction card and also impose a penalty on his opponent. If he fails to detect this and passes the obtained card to his opponent, he will incur a penalty himself.

The person with the highest number of total points on obtained transaction cards when the game is over will be the winner.

The game was prototyped in 2007 and first published in 2010.

Publisher's summary:
金貨カード8枚を使い、商人（対戦相手）と取引カードと交換トレードを行い悪徳
商人を見破る心理戦略ゲームです。
商人が金貨カードより低い金額の取引カードを出した（悪徳商人）ことを見破れば、取引カードを獲得し、しかも相手にペナルティーを課せられます。
見破るのを失敗すると獲物カードが相手に渡ってしまい、反対にペナルティーが課せられます。
ゲームオーバーの時点で取引カードの獲得合計点がより高得点の人が勝ちとなります。

name: Kelleks Tahad Saada?
description:
Children's card game with occupations and letters on the cards.

You can play different popular and new games based on memory, old maid, guess who?, hangman etc.

In one variant each player draws a card with occupation and other players must guess each other occupations one by one by asking questions. Current player can answer only Yes/No. Each question scores him 1 point until his occupation is guessed. The player with the most points at the end of the round is the winner.
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Children's Game, Deduction, Memory, Word Game

name: Configure
description:
An educational game where players utilize geometry to design floor tile plans in Mt. Vernon, George Washington's house.
There are four rule sets with many variations for each. Some of these include racing to complete a room first, utilizing various color combinations, picking all the tiles to complete a room before laying any out, etc. Some variants are for solo play as well.

name: The Great Air Race
description: Inspired by the 1934 MacRobertson air race from England to Australia. 32-space race track over map of the route, with 2 possible paths connecting some check-point cities. Instead of rolling dice, players draw numbered cards to determine how far they move. some spaces require the drawing of Danger cards which impose penalties.

name: Hometown Heroes
description:
Attention, Heroes! The law-abiding citizens of mid-western Hometown, USA need you! Super villains from nearby Colossal City have come to expand their criminal enterprises. Their minions are wreaking havoc on this once peaceful town, and someone must rise up to challenge the masked mayhem. You are the only people capable of thwarting these diabolical criminals. Though you are but a handful of courageous citizens, you possess unique powers and abilities that give Hometown its best hope for salvation. You are the Hometown Heroes!

Hometown Heroes is a Superhero-themed card game by Roger Alan Cotton for two players, ages 11 to adult. Play Time ranges from 30 to 90 minutes, depending on how many episodes are played. The starter version of the game comes with seven Comic Book Issues, made up of twenty-one episodes. Expansions will introduce new comic book issues, episodes, and characters.

Players play out a "comic book issue," which is comprised of three Episodes. Each episode lists objectives worth different amounts of Victory Points. The player whose team of superheroes or super villains completes objectives worth the highest number of Victory Points by the end of the comic book issue, wins.

As your characters complete Episode Card objectives, you gain Victory Point Counters equal to the objectives' VP Values. As you gain these counters, keep them on the game play area, next to your characters.

You also gain (1) Victory Point for every enemy character that is Knocked Out at the end of the game, as well as (3) Victory Points for every enemy character you have captured.

name: Let's Hike!
description: This page does not exist. You can edit this page to create it.

name: Mirror Mirror
description: This page does not exist. You can edit this page to create it.

name: Nuramuru
description:
Nuramuru literally means "earth track" in many of the Aboriginal dialects still spoken today. Travelling their land without maps, Indigenous Australians created a series of songs based on the contours of the land. The songs defy language, and are aural representations of the landscape. Knowlegeable Aboriginals could navigate very great distances with accuracy by singing the landscape. Nuramuru allows players to explore the continent of Australia, expand their territories through strategic game play, and become educated about the rich history and culture of Aboriginal people.

Nuramuru pits four players against each other in a race to explore the country of Australia. Players must explore territory and collect point cards to be the first to 75 points and win.

The game was inspired by Bruce Chatwin's 1987 book 'The Songlines', and draws its game mechanics from Ticket to Ride and Settlers of Catan. Played on a point-to-point network map of Australia, each player moves to an adjoining location, draws a card from the deck, and if he has the required card type(s) for the location, can claim that location by placing one of his tokens on it. Another player can steal possession of that location by moving to it and spending twice as many of the the required card type(s). Players receive points for each location controlled, extra points for individual locations on the ancient Songlines, and a bonus for complete control of a Songline.
categories: Educational, Environmental, Exploration, Mythology, Prehistoric, Territory Building
mechanics: Hand Management, Network and Route Building, Open Drafting, Set Collection

name: Nighthawks
description:
Nighthawks is a tactical space combat microgame that feels like a minis game.

In Nighthawks, players will each pilot their own fleet as they battle for control of the Dyner System.
categories: Card Game, Print & Play, Science Fiction
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Byte Run
description: Byte Run is a hacking race game. Hackers are represented by icons in code, and they are racing to get data points. First one to 10 points is the winner. Icons move specific number of spaces each turn, and each space has it's own power. When am icon reaches a space it must either use its power, or reroute, move protocol token to his pool, or to any other space. There are 10 powers, one token per power, and ahacker can use only one of each protocols each turn.
mechanics: Modular Board, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Player Discretion Advised
description:
The game consists of two decks of cards. One deck has descriptive words like slippery, hairy, leathery,or enormous and the other deck has some of the strangest REAL words you've NEVER heard before. Some favorites are "dipthong", "niblick", "aholehole", and "peniaphobia".
Players choose a "reader" for the round. The reader picks the top card off each deck. The reader then places the two cards face up for all to see. Each player schemes up a sentence containing the two words. Note:No altering of words. The two words can be placed in any position or location in the sentence.
ie. Fiery + Knobber
"I was overcome with a fiery sensation the moment I saw that knobber" Players then discreetly hand it over to the reader. While trying to retain composure, the reader then reads all sentences out loud. Each player gets to vote on what they think is the funniest sentence. The player with the most votes that round wins the vote. You can be as dirty or dignified as you want. But be sure to be funny.Don't let the fact that you're clueless as to what the word actually means intimidate you. Many players get a kick out of improvising. It adds to the hilarity. The object of the game is to laugh. Best played by 4 or more people.

How to play

LET'S VOTE:

After the reader reads all sentences, taking turns, each player, without knowing who wrote what, votes on which sentence is the funniest.The sentence with the most votes wins the round.

name: Koi
description:
Koi is a competitive set collection card game.

Introduction
You are a fish breeder who has been breeding Guppies and Minnows for fisherman to use as bait.  Recently you have decided that the real money is in breeding Koi, so you started to breed them in your Guppy and Minnow ponds.  You have figured out that 5 Koi gives you the right amount of genetic diversity without breaking the bank (because Koi are expensive).  You have also fallen in love with a certain color of Koi, and any Koi with this color is what you're after for your collection.  There's a problem though; your fish breeding neighbors have seen what you're doing and come to the same conclusion.  It is now a race to get to 5 Koi the fastest so you can start breeding and making money to buy out your competitors.

Object
To collect 5 Koi with the same color in your pond (hand) before everyone else. 
The color of Koi you collect is your choice and can be changed at any point during the game, as long as you end with 5 Koi that have the same color.
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Print & Play

name: Moneyball
description:
Moneyball combines euro-style mechanics and the latest in advanced analytics (Sabermetrics) to build a true 21st century tabletop baseball simulation. Moneyball plays faster, smoother, and more accurately than anything before it. Player cards are not jammed with complicated and unsightly dice tables, just 5 straightforward 1-10 ratings for hitters (Contact, Patience, Power, Bunting, Baserunning) and pitchers (Control, Velocity, Repertoire, Move, and Stamina). There are no dice rolls with multiples charts to reference, just a simple card draw for the pitcher and chit draw for the batter.

Run your front office like a real front office by evaluating talent using the same metrics actual scouts and GMs use today. Not the stats of yesteryear. With advanced Sabermetrics, we've learned there are just a handful of underlying statistics that determine a player's performance. For pitchers the only stats that really matter are his walk, strikeout and fly ball rate. It’s been statistically proven that a pitcher’s “stuff” has very little influence on the outcome once a ball is a play. It’s much more dependent on the stadium, weather, the defense behind him, and pure luck – all factors beyond his control. For hitters, strike out and line drive rates, more than anything, determine their batting average. Moneyball has been built from the ground up using these underlying principles.

Pitchers are streakier than hitters and are therefore modeled differently in Moneyball. Their performance is highly volatile and can vary greatly from game to game because your starting pitcher’s draw deck is constructed before each game. The pitcher deck, which determines strike outs, walks, and home runs consists of 108 cards. Your starter’s deck has only 36 of those cards and it is typically reshuffled several times each start. One of your roles as the manager is to evaluate his “stuff” as the game progresses. This creates fantastic “heat of the moment” decision making that does not exist in other baseball sims. If your starter is wilder than usual or has served up several gopher balls, it’s probably because he didn’t have his best “stuff” i.e. his draw deck has more walk and home run cards than usual. So recognizing when your starter doesn’t have his best stuff and yanking him is CRUCIAL to your success as a manager. Starters in Moneyball are not purely random dice rolls with a backwards cause-and-effect “fatigue” modifier added after they’ve already gotten lit up. Manage your starting pitcher like a real manager, not a dice roller…

name: Meltdown
description:
This is a cooperative chemistry review game in which students must work together to keep a nuclear power plant from melting down. As the game progresses, radioactive nuclei will undergo fission and as a result neutrons will be emitted to continue the chain reaction. Students must control the rate of fission by using control rods to absorb the neutrons before they collide with another nucleus. Students must answer review questions in order to obtain the all important control rods. Students choose an employee role, such as the Nuclear Technician, Nuclear Scientist, Station Manager, etc. Each role has its own special ability. To win, students are going to have to find a way to work together to coordinate the special abilities of the employees to stop the meltdown!

Watch out for surprises along the way! Funding cuts happen as well as radiation leaks. Students must stay on their toes because they never know when an Uncontrolled Chain Reaction might occur!!

This game forces students to work together and apply what they have learned in the classroom to achieve a common goal: Stop the Meltdown!

name: Knock It Off
description:
Two players sit at opposite ends of the modular game board. Simultaneously, the players place marbles from the tray on their side of the board into the drain pipe in front of them. As their opponent's marbles roll down the gutter towards them, players try to keep the marbles from landing in their personal drain cup by pressing down on bellows. The bellows activate various mechanisms along the marbles' path which can knock the marbles into a different gutter that instead leads back into the tray.

The game ends when all the marbles have landed in the drain cups. The player with the least marbles in their own drain cup wins.

name: Qaanaaq
description:
Qaanaaq is a game of palindromic pattern building for two or three players.
