Needed: Paper and pen

Goal: To have the most points when the board fills.

Setup: Draw a 5x5 grid on the paper with the center square blacked out, or an 8x8 grid with the center four squares blacked out. For two players one player plays 'Q', the other plays 'A', and the letter 'N' is neutral. For three players each plays one of the three letters.

Gameplay: On each turn, players write one of each letter into any empty cell on the board (the center is not a playable cell). When the board fills up then the scoring begins.

Scoring: Palindromes are checked along the horizontal and vertical axes. For each palindrome containing your letter, score points equal to the palindrome's size minus the number of opponent letters therein. The neutral letter 'N' (2p only) is not considered an opponent letter. In addition, palindromes may also contain sub-palindromes that are scored separately.

Examples: The palindrome QAQ for the Q-player is worth 2pts. However, the palindrome QNQ is worth 3pts. The player with the highest score wins.

The palindrome QQQQ is worth 4-points, but also contains sub palindromes QQQ, QQQ, QQ, QQ, and QQ, making it worth a total of 16-points.

name: Kidsmap Expedition
description:
Kidsmap Expedition is collection of three card games that can only be played in combination with the "Awesome Maps Kidsmap", a map of the world that is decorated with Stickers of awesome places, animals and buildings.

"UFO: Thieves from Space" is a game for 2-5 Kids (Age 5+). One Player Plays the role of an Alien who wants to steal awesome and unique things from earth. The other Players are scientists who try to detect and catch the ailiens cooperatively.

In "Kiungo" (Kisuaheli: Connection) the Players (2-5 Players, 4+)are zoologists who try to create new animals by combining Cards to become the wolrd-famous zoologist.

"Kidsmap World Tour" is a Story-telling game that uses Cards to travel around the world and tell stories about the travel. The game Ends when the Players come back nto their starting positions, but the winner is not the first one, but the Player who has experienced the most interesting Story.
categories: Animals, Children's Game, Educational, Racing, Travel

name: The Game of Espionage
description:
From the introduction in the instructions:

"Each player is a Secret Agent trying to capture enemy spies by carefully plotting their constantly changing locations. The spies are hidden on the indexed underworld turntable below the playing surface. In turn, Agents make secret investigations with the DetectiMeter, which will register the presence of a hidden spy. Using these readings, each Agent marks his own findings on the plastic plotting chart in his notebook. Players send their turns by reindexing the turntable, which changes the locations of the spies. All Agents must adjust their notebooks accordingly, in order to "shadow" the spies as they move about in the underworld. When an Agent can arrest a spy in the act of committing espionage, he uses the Limousine to pick up the spy and drive him out of hiding. The Agent is rewarded with the point value assigned to the crime where he made his arrest. When all seven spies have been captured, the Agent with the most points is THE WINNER."

The game makes extensive use of magnets. The spy disks contain magnets, and the Detectimeter detects their presence. The Limousine, which is played on the upper board, has a magnet with which it picks up a spy below the board. When the Limousine is brought back to the Agents home base, the spy disk falls out of an opening under the upper board. Cool game!

name: The Win/Lose/Draw Game of Gettsyburg
description:
Similar game to Monopoly or Easy money. Local Gettsyburg properties and businesses are depicted on the board. There are deeds for the businesses which can be bought. Also certain properties are tied to the cards in the game that function similar to the cards in Monopoly. There are no hotels or houses to build for improvements though. The object is to bankrupt all your opponents as you amass more property and money in the game.

The game is meant as an advertising tool for the community and as a fundraising product as well. There is a list of owner\donors in the center of the map board face. On the back are numerous pictures and stories of Civil War events. Dice are used for moving and some events. The player tokens are colored pawns.

name: Calcubes
description:
An exciting mathematical game: educational fun for the whole family.

Similar to the more modern and popular Rummikub/Rummiking, this predecessor by the same company uses the same format with the addition of math! Get the tiles you need, and outwit your opponents by juggling valid formulas to be the first to get rid of all your pieces.

name: All About Columbia, South Carolina
description:
The object of All About Town is for players, using dice and playing pieces, to acquire 8 Travel cards by moving around the game board. You can adjust the length of the game by changing the number of collected cards required to win.

Players can acquire money from Banks and Money Spaces. Surprise Spaces allow players to draw Surprise Cards that provide money, movement, both or cause them to lose a turn. Whenever a player acquires a Travel Card, another one is turned up.

All About Town: Columbia, South Carolina appears to have been sponsored by Columbia, SC businesses. Ads for various business appear on the rulebook, Surprise Cards, Travel Cards and money, some with addresses and phone numbers to those businesses. For instance, the money features: $1 Sandy's Famous Hot Dogs, $2 Best Western, $5 WCOS 98FM AM14, $10 Blue Cross Blue Shield of SC, $20 WXRY FM93, $50 C&S, $100 WSCQ Stereo 100, $200 Jewelry Warehouse. A full Participant Listing appears on the back of the rulebook. According to the rulebook, coupons were also included.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Masterword
description:
The world's newest crossword game.
The longer your word the greater your score.
An equable crossword game.

name: Finance Game
description:
Finance Game is a board game in which players face the challenge of developing and managing an international corporation.
As CEO you must issue debt to finance your corporation, contract executives, purchase companies worldwide to create positive synergies in your corporation, invest financial surpluses in the market and monitor your cash-flow to deal contingencies.

There are different areas in which you can invest: Primary sector, leisure industry, finance sector, applied sciences sector etc ..
Finance Game is a very complex game that tries to simulate the strategic management of a large corporation.

name: Architectus
description:
Architectus is a game in which players face the challenge of creating a city.
Players have cards that represent different buildings: library, theater etc. and there is a map on which players can place these buildings.

Each turn each player plays a card and builds a construction. This will give different points depending on where the construction is located and the buildings that are next door.

Each player has a card of neighborhood that gives extra points if certain buildings are constructed.

After all cards are played, the player with most points wins.

name: Make-a-Word Card Game
description:
Make-a-Word Card Game is "a fun game of building words!".

Description from the box: "A fast-paced game of word building fun. Words change quickly as players play a beginning sound card or a word family card. The first person to play all his cards wins."

In the game, each player is dealt a hand of five cards showing either a single letter as the start of a word or a two-letter combination as the end of a word. The remaining cards are placed in a draw pile. The first card of the draw pile is turned over, and the first player must then place a word start card before it if it is a word ending or an ending word if it is a starting card. If the player cannot make a word, he or she must draw a card, and must then either play it if possible or end his/her turn. Play then proceeds around the table, with each player trying to play either a starting or ending card on top of a card already showing in order to make a new word. The first player to empty his or her hand wins.

name: Money Madness!
description:
Money Madness! is a game designed to teach children the value of US coins and currency as well as arithmetic.

From the publisher:

"Have fun moving around the board buying, selling and learning the value of money. Scan your purchase through the scanner to find how much each item costs."

There are two ways to play the game. Level 1 is called Shopping Cart Match. In this game, each player has a card with a shopping card marked with circles corresponding to various coins. Each player in turn draws a card, passes it through the "secret scanner" to determine the value and then takes that amount in play money from the "cash register." The coins taken are placed on the circles on the card if they can fit. The first player to fill all his circles wins. Players figure out which combination of coins to take in order to fill the most circles on their card.

Level 2 is called Secret Shopper. In this version of the game, players start with a set amount of money. They then roll a die and move a pawn along a track. Each space will instruct them to buy one or more items, buy for a friend, return a previously bought item and collect money, or lose a turn. If an item must be bought, the player draws a card, passes it through the "secret scanner" and then pays the indicated amount back into the cash register. Coupon spaces reduce the price of items. Once one player reaches the end the track, the game ends and the player with the most money remaining wins. Unlike Shopping Cart Match, there is no strategy to this version of the game, although players must be able to make change.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: The Zlatan Board Game!
description: The Zlatan Board Game! appears inside the back cover of the book Zlatan by Illugi Jökulsson. It follows the life and career of Swedish soccer star Zlatan Ibrahimovic. It is a simple roll-and-move game where players roll a die to progress along a track. Spaces along the way refer to setbacks and successes in Zlatan's life and career, corresponding to moving forward or back on the track or gaining or losing turns. Some spaces also require player to complete actions such as counting to 60 or speaking in a French accent. The first player to reach the end of the track wins, although the rules specify that players decide whether an exact roll is necessary.

name: SingaPlorers
description:
In SingaPlorers, players learn about the different challenges Singapore faced and is still facing. Key events that demonstrated how Singaporeans have rallied together to harness opportunities and overcome challenges are also featured in this game.

SingaPlorers is a cooperative game where the players have to play cards to support each other in overcoming the challenges that Singapore faces. In playing the game, the players will experience working cooperatively, negotiating or even sometimes have to make small sacrifices to overcome the constant challenges and work together towards achieving peace and progress in Singapore.

name: NRL Micro-Figures Game
description:
The National Rugby League (NRL) Micro-Figures Game is a children's game produced by the NRL and sold through Coles supermarkets.

To date, two series of Micro-Figures have been released as well as a stadium, playing field and a number of sideline accessories. The Micro Figures themselves are sold separately in 'blind' booster packs. Each Micro Figure is 4.5cm tall and is fully articulated & uniquely designed to replicate well known NRL players.

50 separate Micro Figures were released with Season One, 42 new individual Micro Figures were released with Season Two.

From the box:

Now you can coach your own footy team at home with the official NRL Micro Figure Game.

Select your Micro Figure player then roll the die to run, tackle and score tries! Use your smartphone* as a digital scoreboard and countdown timer.

Do you have what it takes to coach your team all the way to the grand final?


Smartphone not included
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Simulation

name: AFL Micro-Figure Game
description:
The Australian Football League (ARL) Micro-Figures Game is a children's game produced by the ARL and sold through Coles supermarkets.

To date, two series of Micro-Figures have been released as well as a stadium, playing field and a number of sideline accessories. The Micro Figures themselves are sold separately in 'blind' booster packs. Each Micro Figure is 4.5cm tall and is fully articulated & uniquely designed to replicate well known ARL players.

30 separate Micro Figures were released with Season One, 50 new individual Micro Figures were released with Season Two.

From the box:

Now you can coach your own footy team at home with the official ARL Micro Figure Game.

Select your Micro Figure player then roll the die to run, tackle and kick goals! Use your smartphone* as a digital scoreboard and countdown timer.

Do you have what it takes to coach your team all the way to the grand final?
categories: Children's Game, Collectible Components, Dice, Sports
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Simulation

name: Le Ver'ONE
description:
This game of French origin derives its name from the French names of the wind directions West-North-East (Ouest-Nord-Est) and is played on a circular board showing four arms, like the vanes of a windmill. Each such arm consists of three paths of seven cases, leading up to a eighth case (one per path) which is located on a mounted, turnable disc in the middle of the board.

Each player sits at the end of one arm and places one her own three playing pieces (marbles) on the first case of each path. A neutral playing piece is put on the eighth case of each middle path (so four in total, one per arm). The goal of the game is to move the own pieces to the opposite cases, one in each arm. (The color coding on the board makes clear which path to use in which arm.)

Note however, that the other players' pieces can be passed but that neutral pieces form an obstacle to all players.

On each turn a standard six sided die is rolled on each turn. The player can then either move one own piece over the according number of spaces or make one of the following alternative moves instead:


When a even number was rolled, the disc in the middle of the board may be turned 180° (thus relocating all pieces - neutral and owned by the players - on it).
When an odd number was rolled, the disc in the middle of the board may be turned 90° - clockwise or counterclockwise.
When a 6 was rolled, the player may take one of the neutral pieces in play and move it to any free space on the board.


When making a normal move and landing exactly on an other playing piece (neutral or belonging to an other player), the active player may also move that piece any free space on the board.

In a two player game, each player plays with two colors. In a four player game, the two players sitting opposite to each other can play as teams.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move, Team-Based Game

name: Naval Action: A Simple Combat Resolution System for Model Fleets of the 1898-1945 Era
description:
A relatively fast and simple naval miniatures (or boardgame, if you want to grid it) set of rules. Each simultaneous-movement turn is 5 minutes of real time. Floor scale is 1 inch per unit, while tabletop scale is 1 centimeter per unit. Ship statuses for all World War 2 ship classes are provided, as are 5 sample scenarios, including Denmark Strait, where Bismarck sank Hood.

Torpedo tracks are laid out before pre-plotted movement, so "friendly" torpedo hits (in addition to those from malfunctions) are a real possibility.

Air and sub/antisub rules are simplified.

This was being considered for publication by Game Designers Workshop, shortly before GDW went out of business. It is currently free print-and-play on CoatneyHistory.

I refer to my Naval Action rules as an alternative naval battle resolution system for my boardgames Lion's Lair: Malta Convoy Battles 1940-42[/thing], Murmansk Run: Arctic Convoys to Russia[/thing], and now Matapan: The Naval Battle for Greece, Mar41[/thing], and I provide individual (deck plan) ship pieces for individual Royal and Italian Navy ships there, using reductions of the U.S. Navy's Office of Naval Intelligence identification manuals' deck plans and/or my own pixel-by-pixel reconstructions.
categories: Dice, Educational, Miniatures, Nautical, Print & Play, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Simulation, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Epica: An evanescent world
description:
Epica is a collaborative thematic and adventure game for 2,3 or 4 players, with many elements of book game, role, classic graphic adventure and board game. Live a history, influences its evolution ,takes the role of one character , develop their combat capabilities, fight collaboratively effect without leader effect, hunting, traveling through various scenarios, talk to its PNJs, do side quests , loot , and found objects find out what they are ...and in the meantime try not to die trying it !

The game use a tablet as master of the game. Every player has a playermat to track life, experience points and character status and to hold her money, food, combat deck, potions and other items.
Your hero pawn travels from map to map (there are a map booklet). The Tablet helps you when something of the map interacts with the adventure (combats, talking to NPCs, use objects as in a graphical adventure)...

You can save the game in the tablet every 60 minutes aprox.
You win the game if all heroes end the adventure alive. If a hero dies, all will do.
categories: Adventure, Book, Dice, Electronic, Exploration, Fantasy, Fighting, Travel
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Role Playing, Storytelling, Variable Player Powers

name: Oblik
description: Oblik is an abstract strategy game of pattern creation and set collection. Each turn, you place a tile next to one already on the playing surface, forming clusters of your player color in an attempt to create specific scoring patterns, while at the same time collecting sets of matched or mismatched shapes and colors.
mechanics: Pattern Building, Set Collection, Tile Placement

name: Sands of Infinity
description:
Players team together to survive the perils of the "Sands of Infinity" arena. In this epic struggle of real-time action, players use magic, mechanical weapons, and sheer brute force to beat the opposing team and win the day.

Sands of Infinity is modular and scenario-based, allowing for infinite replays. Varying classes, items and treasure to be discovered, and mysteries to be solved are all part of any game. Games are quick, and brutal — with a maximum game time of twenty minutes. The goal of each scenario varies, but is similar to a League of Legends style MOBA; thus Capture the Flag, Base Control, Elimination, and many other goals are possible.
mechanics: Action Queue, Area Movement, Cooperative Game, Modular Board, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Off with His Straw Head
description: This page does not exist. You can edit this page to create it.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Horror, Humor
mechanics: Hand Management, Pick-up and Deliver, Rock-Paper-Scissors, Set Collection, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Via Passare
description:
There are 7 different fashions for 2, 3 or 4 players to play the game. Each player has up to 24 pawns, which can be moved in every direction or jump over other pawns. In some games opponent pawns can be taken by jumping over them, as long as they are not in neutral territory (starting positions and center spaces). The goal is to get ones pawns to the starting positions of the opponent or on the center spaces of the board.

The game was published before 1908.

name: Kamasutra: The Game of Love
description:
Kamasutra: The Game of Love was originally published as 8 pages of rules insert between pages 92 and 93 of Lee Siegel's book Love in a Dead Language. It is a competitive two-player game played on a board easily customized from a standard Pachisi board. In addition to the board and the text of the Kamasutra itself, the game requires the following components:


6 pawns of three sizes and two colors
64 unique cards divided into eight suits (each card representing a sexual technique)
1 pair of dice


One player has three male pawns, the other has three female ones. The goal of the game is to move these from their home circle to the central Kamaloka ("World of Eternal Pleasure"). To make the final approach to the Kamaloka requires that each pawn first collect one card in each of the 8 suits of the Kamakala deck. Cards may usually be acquired when a pawn is moved into a space containing a pawn of the opposite sex. Special spaces provide other conditions for acquisition, loss, or trading of cards.

The board design includes some double-sized spaces that provide a choice of paths, allowing players to adjust the effects of dice rolls for movement. Also, a pawn may move clockwise or counter-clockwise, but only one of the two directions on any given turn.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: OGO
description:
Overview and goal:
OGO is a game for two players played on a hexagonal arrangement of hexagonal cells. You will need 5 clear rings and 31 black and 31 white pieces.

The goal is to make a four in a row in your color before placing your third ring.

Play:
One player plays black the other white. The board starts out empty. Black moves first, turns alternate.

Place a piece onto an empty cell on the board. When a straight line of three pieces is made; place a ring over one of the three pieces. Pieces with rings are neutral and are not considered when making a four in a row.

name: The Party
description:
The Party is a verbal-social game for two or more players. One player describes the plot of either a book, movie, or TV show (telling the group which of those it is) but converts everything into fantasy roleplaying scenarios and characters. For example:

"The Party consists of two Dragonriders, the best Dragonriders in their clan, who must attend a school for elite Dragonriders where the competition is fierce, and one of them ends up dying in a dragon flying accident." (Top Gun)

Play passes to the first correct guesser.
categories: Book, Fantasy, Humor, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game

name: Crave
description:
Crave is a social psychology game, with only verbal components.

Crave is played by creating the need of some tangible object in another Crave-player's mind, enough so that they physically leave the current room and travel to some destination to obtain said object. They cannot be tasked with retrieval and cannot be forced to go. The idea is that you can talk so glowingly, so descriptively, so persuasively about some item (food, beverage, clothing, knick-knack, etc) that it would induce someone else to go get it.

Get someone to do this, and you won "a Crave".

name: Rush 81
description: An intense, multiplayer electronic puzzle game based on visual perception and pattern recognition. The objective of the game is to be the first player to play all of the pieces in your hand correctly according to the rules of the puzzle. The game provides instant feedback so there is no debate as to whether a move is correct or incorrect.

name: Crystal Quest
description:
Each player attempts to obtain the plutonium crystal and bring it back to their own planet.

This is a simple roll-and-move game with the ability to draw cards and play them in order to move further, be protected from attacks, take wormholes, etc.

name: Artificer
description: Welcome to the world of Artificer! Artificer is a deck-building board game with a twist. You must buy (and forge) new cards to put into your deck, but you must also buy ingredients to make artifacts from recipes. Once you have made an artifact, it remains in play and you may use its special ability for the rest of the game! You earn prestige for making artifacts and for buying titles once you have met their requirements.

name: Jungoeira
description:
Stay linked and on track as you twist and criss-cross hands and feet in this fun and physical game for all ages.

Jungoeira comprises eighteen foot-pads and eighteen hand-pads, and a deck of ‘track’ cards all packed in a handy rucksack. Players lay out a track of hands and feet as shown on one of the cards (two tracks if you are playing in two teams). Then players race along the track placing a foot on a foot-pad and a hand on a hand-pad, all the while staying linked to the person in front and behind – often with hilarious results.

Jungoeira, published early this year and already a hit in Scandinavia, was devised by Oxford Games’ very own Frederica Scott Vollrath. So we are delighted to be able to introduce this fun-filled party game to the UK as an Oxford Games exclusive.

name: History of War: Szenario Westfront 1944
description:
Westfront 1944 is a stand alone expansion for History of War which adds new German and Allied cards to the game system.

The game consists of two sets - one with the Axis forces and one with the Allied forces. You need at least one of each decks and the basic game rules to play.

Included are special scenario rules and Land Cards for the recreation of the Battles after D-Day towards Germany.

It uses a special way point system, in which you follow certain routes (Lands). The Axis player tries to retreat, while the Allies player tries to cut of the retreat of the German forces.
categories: Card Game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management

name: Skylords: Warriors of The Wind Core Set
description:
SkyLords is a game of mid-air jousting where warriors leap from towers and clash in flight. The combat tests skills of both agility and brute strength. A powerful, heavy fighter may offer up a formidable defense, but a lighter opponent can attack from above. It is crucial to find a balance between power and weight that will beat the strategy of your opponent.

Games of SkyLords are for 2 players, ages 12 and over. Players draw from the same deck, which must contain at least 26 cards.

Before beginning, players set the number of starting Game Points, which corresponds to the amount of Life each player starts with.

At the end of each turn, players deduct Game Points corresponding to the amount of damage received. The first player to reach zero loses.
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Variable Player Powers

name: Wer wird denn weinen?
description:
Each player has a set of 4 pawns that start in his or her corner of the board. The goal is to move the pawns around the board to the "home" section. Movement is determined by a die. The Players have to pay an entry of game coins into the bank. The winner is the first player to move all pawns "home". pawns can be brought into play by rolling the number indicated at the "home" sections.

In game 1 up to 3 players share one game track (red or black). If a player gets on a "W"-space, the pawn either is returned to the players corner and has to start anew, or the player has to pay a prior fixed amount of game coins into the bank. If a pawn would get on a space, that is alredy occupied by another pawn, it jumps over and gets one space ahead.

In game 2 all players move around the same game track and may capture each others pawns. Captured pawns are returned to their player's corner and must start their journey over. If a pawn gets on a "W"-space, the player has to pay a prior fixed amount of game coins into the bank. If the "W"-space is already oppupied, the first pawn gets captured and it's player has to pay the same amount of game coins to the owner of the second pawn.

The clover on the cover may indicate that this game was published by Klee
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Flagship: A Game of Naval Action
description:
A WWII era naval-themed game game of strategy for two players. The object is to attack and capture the opponents flagship with one of your submarines. The game setup and play is very similar to the later and more well known Stratego. Each player sets a "fleet" of 20 ships on the first three rows (24 spaces)of the 8x8 gridded board nearest its home base. Four spaces are left vacant. As in Stratego the placement/order of battle is hidden from the opponent. One side is chosen to go first and movement is one space in any unoccupied direction with alternating turns. Attacks are made when one piece moves to a vacant space directly in front of an opponent's piece and the rank/class of the ship is announced. The ship with the highest assigned value is the winner and the lesser piece is removed from the board. If both have the same value, they're both removed. One important difference is that each side is given 4 Submarines with the lowest assigned value of 1, but they take ALL pieces except the 4 Subchasers (value 2). Attacks need not be made when a piece moves into attack position. If no value is announced with the move, the piece acts a block to the opposing piece. The player whose Submarine attacks the opponents flagship first wins the game. If both flagships are removed through a draw attack, the game continues until one fleet is removed entirely from the board or the game may be called a draw.

Fleet pieces/order of battle

1 Flagship - value 10
1 Battle Cruiser - value 8
2 Battleships - value 6
2 Cruisers - value 5
3 Destroyers - value 4
3 Torpedo Boats - value 3
4 Subchasers - value 2
4 Submarines - value 1

20 pieces in each fleet (red and blue). Pieces are made of wood.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Nautical, Wargame, World War II

name: View-Master Piramido
description:
Use one of the reels included to build the pyramid. Start at the base of the pyramid and reach the top to pick up a key to the underground labyrinth. Each player uses a reel to find their starting space and the path they have to take to get to the top. They use the dice to move to each space shown on the reels. The sphinxes can be placed to delay the players - needing to roll the number on the back of the sphinx to pass.

The winner is the one who has completed the route in the correct way, and if there is more than one who has done this, the one who arrived first.

name: Winston-Salem
description: This Monopoly knock off from the early 1980's features local properties such as K&W Cafeteria and WXII Channel 12. 2-6 players go around the board in this roll-and-move game buying properties in hopes of being the last player standing.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Pirates Fantasy Island
description:
Translated from the publisher:
An old Pirate locked in prison who must whisper to his apprentice on the outside the pieces of the treasure map. A team game,

It's no issue to simulate ambient noise, the poor quality of telephone communication, .. On the one hand we'll put two teams in the competition (which will happen to find his treasure in first... and then it will create an emulation.. a sense of urgency, like a crisis situation). And in addition, we will impose, round after round, a way to communication even further (sorry.. pas could help..), such as talking with your hand in front of your mouth, or like a ventriloquist...

To take into account the possibility of being wrong because different terrain typess, near the treasure the different areas of the treasure map will bear the name of beaches... all different beaches, but with similar pronouniations. (Oracabech Playa, Ocarabess Palia, Oracabess Playa etc etc...).

Finally, to follow the paths on the reconstituted map with your finger... These paths are almost impossible to follow with the naked eye... Indeed, they have green dotted amid the lush greenery in orange red tones... On the other hand, when we place the small red filter of transparent plastic on the map and push it with our finger, flora disappears, leaving the path that must be followed...

The most interesting part of this game, it is that, in explanation, we are told only the rules of the game to the different teams. Each is free to use the mode of communication and following the roads seems it best adapted to the situation... And with the urgency of the game, against the competition, each trying to go to the more quickly... and forget everything else. Except that at the end of each part, without using clear communication techniques, no chance to have found the right solution... repeat the exercise with communication secure leads, each time to find the solution.

In summary, this game is more meaningful than all the usual seminars playful setting, and which led to doubt one's understanding...

User summary:
Game is only played with 4 players, 2 on each time. One of each pair of players is the apprentice attempting to find the treasure with the map by blindly pushing a smaller red player piece. As you get closer and closer to the treasure (likely different colours or borders to indicate different zones), the other player (playing your pirate mentor) has their directions conveyed more and more muffled to simulate their memory or your understanding of their directions becoming less and less certain. Either it's a time trial between the two teams, going one at a time or it's simultaneously play (and the first to reach the treasure wins.
mechanics: Area Movement, Area-Impulse, Cooperative Game, Memory, Point to Point Movement, Simulation, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: LR Kliszow 1702
description: A small simple Hex and Counter Wargame of a battle from the Great Northern war. Rules and Vassal module in files section this page.

name: Cache Cache Party
description:
From the publisher's webpage:

Communication, card, observation, reflex and memory game.

There is a party at the small beasts and They are playing to cache-cache! So where are the small beasts? Who have seen the tomcat? Is it in the cabbages? And the ant, where does it hidden?

We will have to open the eye to find these charming small beasts. Cache Cache Party is a game of observation and speed which proposes to find the small beasts hidden among the fruits and vegetables.

It is necessary to play Cache Cache Party, some memory, a touch of reflex and good look ... But all that is learned, and as a part is you can train faster often. It is a game intended for both small and large through various levels and is beautifully served by Pauline illustratins Stive.

Solid folder box - Card size: 8 x 8 cm - Box size 13 x 9 x 3 cm
Material: 32 square cards with round edges (16 "little creature" card; 16 "fruits and vegetables" cards with 1 (very) large wooden marker.
mechanics: Action Queue, Memory, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Honor Among Thieves
description:
You and your gang pulled off the perfect heist. Now all you have to do is sit tight and wait for the right time to escape, grab the stolen goods and meet up with your colleagues. But then again, if they were all caught by the authorities you wouldn't have to split it so many ways...

Mechanics:
You must rid yourself of all incriminating evidence while making sure everyone else has evidence against them. You play cards to get rid of evidence tokens and to force the other players to take evidence tokens, but timing is important. If you pick an action someone else has, you will not get an action that turn, so pick wisely.

Once an action card of yours is played, it stays in your discard until you are "out" (you and one or more other players chose the same action card). When "out" for the round you can pick up all your spent cards.
mechanics: Hand Management, Memory, Simultaneous Action Selection, Take That

name: A vos paniers!
description:
A silly market day! A great little game of communication for a fun time!

Grandma gave her grandchildren a list of groceries, but there are many market stalls to choose from! The first player to finish their groceries wins.
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Set Collection

name: Arche de la nature
description:
A thrilling adventure in the heart of the Ark of the Nature. Over 600 questions about animals, plants, water and the very nature challenges to complete: who will be able to draw a dandelion? Which animal makes these tracks? Charades, riddles and a beautiful photo gallery: for laughs with family or friends and to discover the secrets of the Ark of Nature almost as if we were there!

A wonderful game for the whole family.

name: Sur les traces des animaux de la Ferme
description:
Designed for 2 to 6 players, players have to recognize animal prints in this educational game.

There is no need to refer to an instruction manual to determine if a player has guessed correctly: the publisher has developed a system that shows the result immediately. The footprint of each animal is unique and is shown on the backside of the tile with the depiction of the animal. Innovative and very playful, this system brings very great fluidity to the game.

For the youngest, aged 5, a cooperative mode is suggested, which allows to take in hand the prints of each of the 24 animals, allowing for fun and easier gameplay. Then, for older players, the interaction between players is at the heart of the game and greater speed is required.

name: Sur les traces des animaux de la Foret
description:
Designed for 2 to 6 players, players have to recognize animal prints in this educational game.

There is no need to refer to an instruction manual to determine if a player has guessed correctly: the publisher has developed a system that shows the result immediately. The footprint of each animal is unique and is shown on the backside of the tile with the depiction of the animal. Innovative and very playful, this system brings very great fluidity to the game.

For the youngest, aged 5, a cooperative mode is suggested, which allows to take in hand the prints of each of the 24 animals, allowing for fun and easier gameplay. Then, for older players, the interaction between players is at the heart of the game and greater speed is required.

name: The Talent Game
description:
From the directions: "The Talent Game was designed to depict the Christian's journey through life, culminating with entry into the glorious Kingdom of God."

The Talent Game is a family game designed to build Biblical knowledge. Players roll dice to move pawns around a track. As they move, they land on various spaces that require them to answer questions in either various categories or various levels of difficulty. Correct answers earn the players "talents" represented by poker chips as well as moving them forward on the track. In some categories, players will lose talents for incorrect answers or take talents from other players. Players continue until they reach the final space, known as The Kingdom. The player who finishes with the most talents wins.

name: Bilby Buddies
description:
From the box: "Bilby Buddies is a matching game designed to teach animal recognition to children between the ages of 18 months-6 years."

There are two ways to play Bilby Buddies, both takeoffs on classic games. In "Bingo Style," each player has a board marked with 12 animals. Players in turn choose a tile from a face-down stack and call out the name of the animal. The player who has the animal on his or her card claims the tile. The first player to fill the boar wins.

In "Memory Style," each player gets a game board. The 48 animal tiles are spread out face-down. Each player in turn takes a tile, tries to match it to their card, and if it doesn't match, puts it back face-down. Other players may gain an advantage by remembering which tiles are where. The first player to fill his or her card wins.

name: Hipsters
description:
Welcome to the pretentious game of Hipsters. A world of social intrigue, popularity and betrayal. In a game of "Hipster", you will fight over the current trendy location and its hipsters. By spending items or purchasing items, you can pretend to be something, that you are not. The hipster who persuade the most followers, win the game.

Are you ready to become a pretentious board gamer?

GAME PLAY:

Setup: Each player draws a random Hipster card from the Hipster cards deck. Add it facedown in front of the player. Add the “In the City" starting location card to the middle of the table. Each player draws 5 single value Item cards from the Item cards deck.

Shuffle the Item cards deck and split them into X piles face up (X is the number of players). Shuffle the Hipster deck and split them into X piles face up.

The player with the lowest Hipster initiative, chooses the starting player. Players take their turn clockwise.

Round: Starting with the first player, the player can play five Item cards from their hand. Each card has a printed status value, which can be used to purchase other Item cards. Item cards also have bonuses, when paired with other items. The more you combine, the bigger the pay off.

The player can also “make a move” on a new hipster, from the Hipster deck, at the current location (not another players hipster). They do this, by spending items equal to or higher then the Hipsters printed status value. They place these item cards facedown at the location, and in that players turn, other players can fight for attention, buy spending items which subtract from the cards added by the initiating Hipster. When another player choose to spend items, the cards are discarded afterward and they will have that amount of card less in their turn, as they have played their card out of turn.

Each Hipster card, has different status values with each an attached event. The player can choose to “buy” one of these statuses and activate the attached event. When buying a hipster, it becomes part of that players following. Each hipster card also has a printed association (i.e. Cafe Hipster). The players gathers hipsters, which match their starting hipster association, as they are the only one giving credit when ending the game.

If a player has spotted, that another player is collecting a specific association/trait, they can challenge that player by naming the trait. If they are correct, the player can once per game, select that players current hand. If they are incorrect, they must give the other player their hand. When a Hipster is bought, the player can choose to change location, as each location has events or abilities that might make things better or worse for the other players as the location will alter items and hipster values, traits and abilities.

Ending the game: The game ends, when there are no more hipsters in the hipster deck.

Winning Condition: The Hipster with the most like-minded hipsters win the game (cards of the same trait).
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Pattern Building, Set Collection

name: Galactic War One: The First Great War on a New Frontier
description:
Interstellar armies compete for dominance in unclaimed sectors of a galaxy made accessible by the discovery of warp gates.

The rules are Company level rules meant with 15mm in mind. Though they can be used with 28mm with a little adjustment to the ranges and movement distances. Armies consist of several units which are made up of three to six infantry fire teams or vehicles.

The system includes rules for all kinds of cool sci-fi troop types that include walkers, grav vehicles, and giant fliers that can not only transport large quantities of infantry, but also vehicles as well.

The Universe is meant to be a pretty open and accessible space opera.

There are 7 forces to choose from that range from the forces of Terra, to mysterious psychic aliens.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Variable Phase Order, Variable Player Powers

name: Green Jackets and Voltigeurs: Skirmish Rules for Gaming the Peninsular Wars
description:
From the website:

This game has been developed as a fast-paced, fun and exciting method of playing Napoleonic Skirmish Games set in the Peninsular War. The rules are easy to play, allowing the War Gamer the creativity in designing or modifying the rules to their own standards utilizing their own scenarios or using the numerous scenarios included based loosely on many historical skirmishes and some fictionalized accounts throughout Portugal and Spain. The game uses a random card generating system, in which each miniature figure is matched to a game card shuffled into the card deck. Figures are assigned a random number of Action Points each turn based on a 1d6 die roll at the start of each round so their action abilities also change each turn.

name: Das große Reitertreffen
description:
This game includes 6 different game options for horse races and a fox chase. Movement is determined by 1 or 2 dice.

1. Simple horse race for 2 players with 3 horses
2. Simple horse race for 3 players with 2 horses or up to 6 players with one horse
3. "Fox Chase" for 2 players with 3 horses and 1 player with 1 fox)
4. "The Big Horsemen Meeting" for 2 players with 12 horses
5. "Push Through" for 2 players with 6 horses
6. "Stop! Don't Move!" for 2 players with 12 horses
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: WarGods: The Wendigo Warband Guide
description:
From the publisher's website:

Fully compatible and playable with WarGods of Ægyptus, this full color guidebook contains the complete rules and background for playing the Wendigo warband in the WarGods of Hyperborea game.

Also included is a full color Wendigo painting guide, a miniature and scenery gallery, two sheets of Wendigo Command Counters and an all new campaign.

name: War on the High Seas
description:
War on the High Seas is set in the year of 1750 around the time that world trade was plagued by piracy, dangerous ocean voyages and fierce wars. Can you a small time merchant battle the stormy oceans and avoid the scourge of piracy to rise up with a fleet of merchant ships and enough wealth to become the leading merchant the world has ever known. Or will you get drawn in to a life of piracy, fighting and stealing your fortune. Or perhaps you will find wealth in war and help your nation conquer the world.

Players begin the game representing one of the major nations of 1750 as a small time merchant with limited ships and wealth, they have to trade goods across the world visiting ports until they can expand. With each new ship they add to their convoy their power across the oceans grows and they must decide when the time is right how they will gain a victory and win the game.

There are four ways to win the game, by trade, piracy, war or a mixture of all three. Each turn players roll a dice and move across the seas from port to port, where they can either trade, attack, offer passage, repair or buy another ship. Attacking ports and other convoys will lead to piracy unless first a letter of marquee is obtained from the players government. Becoming a Pirate has few rewards and will immediately alienate you from ports unless it too flies the Jolly Rodger.

The game evolves quickly and as the players get closer to their winning objectives, a race emerges to either beat them to the pip or to sabotage their efforts and gain some more time to build on their own convoy. Only the brave and unscrupulous can hope to gain a foot hold in the war on the high seas.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Pick-up and Deliver, Trading

name: Deadlock City Bounty Hunters
description:
There is a place in a godforsaken corner in the wild west called Deadlock City. From time to time 2-5 players gather in this city to decide who the most capable bounty hunter is. Who will find out first who is who? Or will the stronger win in the end? This is a game of observation, deduction, deception and luck, for which only 20 cards are needed, so it has no box either.

Setup:
Deal 1 card to each player. Deal a card also to the table face down and put the rest of the deck on top of it perpendicularly.
This card will not be drawn except if the last action is a mandatory draw (with card #2).

Gameplay:
1. Draw a card from the deck next to your own card
2. Put one of these card down in front of you and execute the action on it (active cards #1-#6 and #9, passive cards #0, #7, #8)
The cards are collected face up on top of each other so that the numbers on the cards are visible. The players play in clockwise order.

The game ends when only one player is left in the game or all cards are removed from the deck. In the former case, the last remaining player is the winner. In the latter case the winner is who has the highest card in their hand.

Cards (pieces in the deck):
0 (2) If another player looks at this card, that player is out.
1 (5) Guess a player and a number (except #1). If that player has the card you named, that player is out.
2 (2) You or a player of your choice must put their card down and have to draw a new one. The active card’s (#1-#6, #9) effect does not apply.
3 (2) Secretly look at another player's card in hand.
4 (2) Swap cards with another player.
5 (2) Secretly look at another player's card and compare it with yours. Whoever has the smaller value is out.
6 (2) You are safe from another players' actions for one round.
7 (1) If this card and #5 or #6 are in your hand, you must put this card down.
8 (1) If you put this card down, you are out.
9 (1) You can play this card as any card from #1 to #6. If they guess this card you’re not out but you have to draw another card.
categories: American West, Bluffing, Card Game, Deduction

name: Hunters: The Adventure Card Game
description:
Hunters is a fantasy adventure card game for 1-4 players, where you and your friends take on the role of battle-hardened monster hunters, out to fulfill contracts delivered to the Hunter’s Guild to slay all manner of foul beasts.

Choose your class and build your unique character by selecting from hundreds of abilities, random personalities and backgrounds. Then, work alone or as a team with your friends as you journey out into the wilderness on a hunting contract to track down and defeat a vicious beast in an exciting card-based
adventure.

You will face the dangers of the environment itself on your trek, battling against the elements, treacherous obstacles, native creatures and the unforgiving weather as you hunt your prey through a variety of regions, before finally engaging in mortal combat with your vicious quarry in an epic confrontation to complete your task. At least, until you head back to town to take up another contract.

During the course of your journeys, you will gain experience with each kill. This can be used to purchase new abilities, recover a number of useful items such as weapons, armour, crafting materials, trinkets and hunting trophies, pick up valuable companions to fight by your side, or sustain ongoing injuries that will stick with them for the rest of their hunting days.

Do you dare to venture into the wild?

Gameplay
A game of Hunters involves choosing from a selection of hunting contracts, kitting out your character with abilities and equipment, before working your way through a Region, represented by a deck of cards, on the hunt for your chosen monster. During your hunt, you'll face native enemies that can be combated, challenges to face and obstacles to overcome, all of which are completed using a simple dice-based system.

Combat in Hunters uses a mix of card-based Abilities, dice and a simple resource management mechanic. A Hunter can only take a limited number of abilities with them on a contract, so choosing the right combination for the job is key. These abilities are then used in conjunction with dice to determine the results of attacks. Once a contract is completed, the players can earn experience and rewards, before heading back to town to take on a new contract and a new adventure.
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Dice, Exploration, Fantasy, Medieval, Print & Play
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Role Playing, Variable Player Powers

name: Kinnikuman: Title Match of the Hell
description:
Part of Bandai's Party Joy series of lighter boardgames. (#20)
"Kinnikuman" is one of famous japanese TV-charactor.
The player turns roulette and goes ahead through the route on the game board. I collect advantageous cards on a route and prepare for the fight with the enemy.

Already out of print.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Der gerupfte Spatz
description:
A simple race game in the tradition of Chutes and Ladders in combination with Game of Goose. Move by die roll. If you land on a grashopper (step forward), sparrow (fall backwards - if indicated) or draw a card and follow instructions. The first to reach space 120 exactly is the winner.
note:
likely published during early 1900s

name: Power Up! Jewel Thieves
description: A two-player card game of cube placement to power up your abilities to steal gems from the supply and win by collecting gems or preventing your opponent from collecting them. A bit of take-that.

name: Nusantara
description:
In Nusantara, players try to build the largest archipelago. On each turn matching tiles are placed to build up their island chains to get the most poin (points) and win the game.

A turn consists of possibly placing a tile and moving their kano (canoe). Tiles can only be placed on areas where an island has been started or where a players kano is currently exploring.

Poin are tallied by completing islands. The Larger the island the more points its worth. After all tiles are laid, poin are added up and the player with the most poin becomes the Batara and wins the game.

name: Wir suchen einen Parkplatz
description: The first player to get all 3 cars on a parking spot wins the game. Movement is determined by 2 dice. Even cars already on a parking spot can be forced to leave the parking spot by the roll of the dice. Each car that gets on a parking spot, gets a parking-ticket. The car is safe, if the ticket has a "0" on it. Every other number means, that the car has to leave the parking spot, if the player rolls the number on the parking ticket, while trying to park other cars.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Kreuz und quer
description: This game includes 24 Halma variants on one game board. Each variant is called by a female or male first name. Each player has up to 42 playing pieces, which he has to get to the other side of the board. The center space can not be moved on or jumped over.

name: Der Hobbit: Smaugs Einöde – Smaug: Die Mini-Erweiterung
description:
The Fight against Smaug gets harder with this new rule. The power of the dragon's shield is rolled by dice.
1-6 = The rolled power must be exactly achieved by the player's cards.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Novel-based

name: ASSEGAIS AND BAYONETS: A Solitaire Game of the Zulu War of 1879.
description:
BACKGROUND: ASSEGAIS AND BAYONETS is semi-historical simulation of the Zulu War of 1879. The Game begins shortly after the Great Britain determined that the Zulu Leader, Cetswayo, is in violation for not disbanding his Impis (Battalions). Natal is feeling threatened and has organized a Military Force to cross into Zululand and force Cetswayo to disband his Army. As the Commander of British Forces in Natal, South Africa, you must protect the British Settlements and squash the Forces of Cetswayo by capturing their Capital of Ulundi and 8 additional Zulu Kraals.

GAME OBJECTIVE: Player takes command of the British Forces during the invasion of Zululand. The Player’s Objective is to attempt to capture the Zulu Capital of Ulundi and 8 other Zulu Kraals before the Campaign Deck is exhausted or the Zulus have Looted 5 of the starting British controlled Towns. If the Zulu Army Loots 6 or more of the originally British controlled Towns or Settlements, the Zulus win. Also, if the British do not capture Ulundi and 8 other Zulu Kraals before the Campaign Deck is exhausted, the Zulus Win.
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Rebuke Junior
description:
Introduction:
Each player assumes the role of a Christian within the church. Each Christian will collect harmful sins through the game. Knowing that your fellow Christians may be in error, you will still need to band together and help everyone overcome their sins.

REBUKE Junior is a family game that uses teamwork and hand management to remove Sin cards. This game is not trivia based and because of this it allows everyone to pick up and play easily.

REBUKE Junior educates players in three ways.
1. It shows the sins that break The 10 Commandments.
2. It demonstrates the Christ-like traits that keep us from temptation.
3. It finally shows that by following God and asking for forgiveness our sins, we are covered in Christ's righteousness.

Great to play with:
• Ministries
• Bible Studies
• Families
• Friends
• Churches
• Academy Classrooms
• Anti-Bullying School Programs
• Road Tripping
• Game Nights
• Camping
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Memory, Team-Based Game

name: REBUKE: Heavy Burdens expansion
description:
Do you find the original "REBUKE" too easy? Want a challenge or more strategy? Then shuffle "Heavy Burdens" expansion into your game! Heavy Burdens is created for adult audiences. This expansion covers Sins that are considered taboo. Do you think you can handle this rebuke?

In a world where iniquity abounds we mustn't give up. Even during the most trying times when our own burdens are heavy. Keep up the "good fight" and follow Christ because his yoke is easy and his burden is light.

Heavy Burden cards can be easily stored in the original REBUKE box.

Great to play with:

Bible Studies
Friends
Young Adult Vespers
Road Tripping
Game Nights
Camping
categories: Educational, Expansion for Base-game, Memory, Real-time, Religious

name: Gold
description: The game is based on the 1934 movie "Gold" with Hans Albers. At the beginning of the game, the players move around in the laboratory to find out, who plays "Ingeneur Holt". The roles are previously determined by card drawing. If a pawn gets on a space, that is occupied by another pawn, this pawn has to reveal it's identity. When "Holt" is exposed, he sabotages the gold-making machine and the sliding doors begin to close. Now all players have to leave the laboratory before the doors are closed. The pawns that don't make it, die in the explosion and their players are expelled from the game. The rest have to move over the turntable and reach one of three escape tunnels. The first one to accomplish this wins the game.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction
mechanics: Grid Movement, Point to Point Movement

name: Turnier-Halma
description: The players move their 15 pawns along the black lines or by jumping over other pawns. The goal of the game is, to get all pawns on the spaces of ones color at the opposite side of the game board. But before moving to the destination spaces, the players have to gather al their pawns in one of the blue areas.

name: Wer holt die Kuh vom Eis?
description: On a frozen lake in Wer holt die Kuh vom Eis?, Hilda the cow finds the ice breaking underneath her feet. With a bold leap, Hilda should be able to save herself on an ice floe? Who can help Hilda get back to shore safely?

name: Zugepackt, weggeschnappt!
description: In Zugepackt, weggeschnappt!, the two birds Anton and Adele have a fun game to present to you. They want to know who can first recognize the two colors showing on the dice on the image cards laid out before you. As soon as you've found it, be fast and snatch the right card!

name: Quilt-opoly
description:
“Quilt-opoly” board game is from The DMC Corporation and debuted at the International Quilt Market in 2008.  It features quilts and quilting, and lets quilters share their passion for quilting with friends and family.

The properties are all quilt blocks with escalating degrees of complexity. Players pick their favorite quilting game pieces and move around the “blocks” collecting Quilting Techniques and Block Designs to create their very own quilting empire! However, they must be careful that they don’t pick the “You sewed the seams uneven and now the points don’t match” game card or they will have to go to “Rip Out Seam” without passing “Start Quilting” and collecting $200.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Die Börse
description: The players move around the board, while buying and selling shares of public corporations. Movement is determined by a die. Three special dies determine the share prices and dividends. If a the stock rises, dividends are payed to the share holders. If a player has at least 6 shares of a company, he has to buy this company. As a result he, instead of the bank, has to pay the dividends. But he also gets 10 times the dividend from players who land on one of the spaces of his company. The game Ends when one player gets bankrupt or if the bank runs out of money. The Player with the most capital (money, shares, companies) wins the game.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Stock Holding, Track Movement, Trading

name: Leben in Hamm
description:
A game published about the German City of Hamm.
By playing the players get to know a little bit about the city and its shops.
During each player's turn they roll a six-sided dice to move along a game-board depicting a map of Hamm. At certain spaces players can acquire cards of the shops or they can go sightseeing by following the instructions on the back of the card. Sometimes there is only information written, sometimes you have to pay an amount of money or at other times you may earn some cash.

The game ends when the last player reaches the finish space with his playing piece. The winner is the person who has acquired the most sightseeing and/or shop cards.

name: BeeKeeper
description:
INTRO:
Beekeeper is a family friendly game for children and adults to enjoy. The game consists of 37 Hexagonal Playing Pieces, 1 set of instructions and a nice Black Cloth Pouch w/ drawstrings to hold all the pieces! Set-up time is approx. 2-3 minutes with playtime amounting to 5-10 minutes, and this game can be played with up to 6 players.
GAMEPLAY:
1st) dump out the hexagonal pieces onto your playing surface and find the queen chit (she has an image on each side of the chit so it should be easy to find her).
2nd)Place the queen in the middle of the playing surface.
3rd)Arrange the rest of the pieces (beekeeper logo side facing up) around the queen piece until you have 3 rows around the queen. (The playing surface should resemble a giant hexagonal shape, or honeycomb)
4th) Youngest player gets to go first by pulling 1 chit from the game (*NOTE* only pieces with 3 open sides can be removed from the arranged pieces). He/She will then flip over the piece and find the following;
BEE POINTS: These give you points to win the game
ANIMALS: These guys make you lose turns
HONEY TOKENS: You need at least 6 honey tokens to pull the queen from her throne when she has at least 3 open sides and end the game and with her you get 10 bee points.
BEE NET or HONEY EXTRACTOR: Use these cards once during gameplay to steal a bee chit or honey chit from an opposing player (once used they must be discarded to the side)
Once the first player's turn is complete, then the person to the left is next to pull a piece from the hive.

ENDING AND WINNING THE GAME:
The game is ended when the Queen chit is removed from the playing surface, which can happen two ways;
One way is if she has at least 3 open sides and someone has 6 or more HONEY TOKENS.
The other way is if there are no more chits to pull from the game, then the queen is rewarded to the next player's turn.
The game is won by the person with the most Bee Points, so count up all of your drones', larvas', workers' and queen bee's chit values and that will be your Bee Point count.

Norshanks Game Cause:
As with most of the games that Norshanks Games will be marketing, this game is tied to Beekeeping Associations in various countries, and every time a game is sold, part of the profits will be donated to the Purchaser's Current Country of Residence National Beekeeping Association.
The donated funds will go to the Beekeeping Associations to help save the bees by; researching colony collapse disorder, increasing bee populations, educating the public about the importance of bees, and many other great projects!
With your help we can help reverse the collapse of bee populations everywhere!

Game is expected to be ready for shipment in Winter.
mechanics: Chit-Pull System, Set Collection, Take That

name: Words on My Mind
description:
"Shake and toss the dice! Race against the clock to create the most words using the letters rolled. Now you have words on your mind!"

Words on my Mind is a word dice game in which players roll lettered dice and then all use the same dice to form as many words as possible in the time allowed, in almost a simplified Boggle-style game.

name: Mech Arena
description:
Mech Arena is a tactical card-wargame where you pilot giant Mechs in gladiatorial combat. Where your goal is to defeat your opponents by shooting, hacking and kicking their Mechs to bits. An easy task, save for the fact they are trying to do the same to you. Equal parts MMA and demolition derby it is no wonder Mech Arena is the sport of choice for all citizens of the twenty third Century.

To get started build your Mech Deck from a variety of System, Chassis and Pilot microdecks. Then combat each other in a turn based battle on the arena game board. The battles are quick pace and every draw and play of the card counts because when your deck is depleted you are out of the game.
categories: Card Game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Area Movement, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Player Elimination, Variable Player Powers

name: Nipponzenkoku Mikenekotomato-no-Haitatsuyasan
description:
Part of Bandai's Party Joy series of lighter boardgames. (#27)

This game about home delivery in Japan.

The players draw luggage card, load them on their trucks and gain victory points when the deliver them at their destination. However, the destinations are not easily found. Moreover, there is a deadline, depending on the type of luggage, and players receive no points when they are to late.
In addition, when a player catches up with a truck of another player, he make take some of his luggage.

It became stereotypical pick-and-deliver game, published in Japan about three years earlier than Auf Achse.

Already out of print.
mechanics: Pick-up and Deliver, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Rome: From Republic to Empire
description: Rome: from Republic to Empire is a solo game in which you take control of the Roman Empire in the period from 200BC to 100AD. You will need to conquer the provinces of Europe, the Middle East and North Africa using a card based conflict system. Gather resources, using a dice rolling mechanism, to expand the glory of Rome in each of six key areas: Military, Spiritual, Production, Commerce, Political and Wonders. However, beware! This is the time of the slave uprising and so if you fail to keep your citizens happy they will revolt and ultimately overthrow your rule.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Chit-Pull System, Push Your Luck

name: Wendy: Das große Spiel
description:
Objective: Be the first leading your riding stable to biggest success.
As a owner of a riding stable each player moves along a circle according rolled number; the space you are landing on requires certain activities like giving correct answers, buying horses, participating in tournaments, 'event cards' (scandals)...
depending on result you may move your meeple forward on a ranking list. First player entering target zone (250 victory points) is the winner.
categories: Animals, Children's Game, Economic, Racing, Trivia
mechanics: Open Drafting, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Prima Veroletta!
description:
The players have to move their three pawns on the track of their color from space 1 to space 100. Movement is determined by the "Verolette" in the center of the game board. The "Verolette" gives results from 1 to 9.
Some spaces have a Symbol with Special meaning.
Dot: Move 3 spaces forward and move an opponent 3 spaces backward.
Cross: Move 6 spaces forward and move an opponent 6 spaces backward.
Crossed dot: Move 9 spaces forward and move an opponent 9 spaces backward.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Treffpunkt
description: The players have to move 4 or 6 pawns into the center of the game board. Movement is determined by a die. Under certain conditions, the mpawns can change from an outer into an inner circle. On the green circle there are 4 meeting places. The first two opponents to meet there combine their pawns (stack one on the other) and are allies for the rest of the game. They win or lose as one. The combined pawns can be separated, if an opponent lands on a space that is already occupied by two combined pawns.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Angry Pavement
description:
From the publisher:

Two bands of nomadic survivors are on a high-speed trek down the rubble of Interstate 9 to what is fabled to be the last source of water. Will you be able to quench your thirst or will die trying? In an odd mix inspired by Wings of War, Mille Borne, and Mad Max, we have a head to head card game with dice rolling, location smashing, and card shooting fun!

A deck of Distance Cards is shuffled and placed between both players. A deck of Item Cards is also shuffled and place between both players. Finally, a set of six vehicle cards (representative of each player's car layout) and a gear box card is given to each player.

Players take turns drawing cards from the Distance Deck and rolling 1d6 to try to beat the difficulty value listed on each card. Different locations have different difficulty values, sometimes causing damage to vehicles or rewarding players with items like armor or weapons. As players successfully maneuver through locations, they add these cards to their Distance Traveled deck.

Players may also choose to attack each other to cause damage to their vehicles, use items to boost their position, or press their luck and avoid disastrous terrain (no one likes minefields).

The player with the most Distance Traveled cards at the end of the deck or have gained 10+ cards than their opponent wins.

name: Wajiphanyin: A Kanza Language Game
description:
Exciting and educational boardgame for learning about the Kanza language and culture. The traditional language of the Kanza people is Kadnzele, or simply Kanza. ALthugh it is a separate language, it is closely related to the languages of the Osage, Ponca, Omaha and Quapaw tribes. Kanza is a Siouan language, and so it also has similarities in grammar and vocabulary with loway, Otoe-Missouria, the languages of the Sioux peoples, as well as more distant ties to Crow, Mandan, Hidatsa, Biloxi and others.

Wajiphanyin is played as a roll and move game. Points are awarded for translations from English to Kanza, Identifying animals, other objects and words with the Kanza words, and translating Kanza to English. An emphasis is placed on worlds from the natural environment. Score sheets are used to keep track of the points and task. The player with the highest score at the end of the game is the winner. The duration of the game (usually time) should be decided prior to playing.

During a long and very devastating period in the history of the tribe, usage of the language began to taper off dramatically. This trend continued into the twentieth century until only a handful of the fullbloods in the 1970's could speak fluently. Today all of these elders are gone. The Kanza people today speak English as a first language, but many can still understand and use the Kanza words and phrases.

The Kaw Nation is interested in both preserving the language and more importantly reviving it. The Kanza Language Prodject is a special department of the tribal operation devoted to this task. This game is an important part of the education and preservation of this language and its importance in the culture.

name: Ente gut, alles gut
description: A game about newspaper and newspaper hoaxes. In several different variants players try to come up with headlines and news stories to fool the others to believe them while at the same time guessing the true headline or news.

name: Hasta La Vista, Baby!
description:
Hasta La Vista, Baby is the ultimate tabletop wargame for players of multiplayer shooters and casual tabletop gamers. We designed the game to recreate the feeling of an intensive online match and included all the popular modes you already know how to play.

The game is designed for two players. Each player commands a team of soldiers and sends them on various missions like defusing bombs, occupying strategic positions or capturing a flag. To succeed, you are going to use the strengths and weaknesses of your soldiers, assign tactical equipment, and dominate your opponent.

And just before you win, don't forget to rub it in by saying: "Hasta La Vista, Baby!"

name: Directive: Invasion!
description:
A 4x territory control game for 2-6 players.

Take control of an alien mother ship that has crossed the galaxy to invade Earth. Unfortunately for you, your not the only one to have this idea.

Harvest natural resources, destroy monuments, fight your rivals, and deal with the human resistance as you try to conquer Earth.
mechanics: Modular Board, Tile Placement, Variable Player Powers

name: Reise durch Deutschland mit der Deutschen Bundesbahn
description:
A simple roll and move game with different maps within Germany.

First game modus:
2-4 players start their trip in a chosen location and end it in another place. The first player to reach the target wins the game. On red spaces the players get rewards if they know some interesting data about that place.

Second game modus:
3-8 players start their round trip in a chosen location and end it there - if possible after 17 rounds. They collect victory points by stopping at certain places, skipping one round & informing other players about touristic attractions. Player with most victory points is the winner.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Race, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Mensch hupe nicht!
description:
Objective: be the first reaching target zone (space 130) - b amused by forced rhymes (rules printed on the map).

Simple 'Roll & move' game.

name: Abstract Restricted Rock Paper Scissors
description:
Description from the designer:

A game of deception and deduction based on a 4 way modifiable relationship graph, much like a 4 item version of rock, paper, scissors. There is quite a bit of strategy and great mind games to be had by playing this game.

The game is played with 2 players alternating turns. They start with 16 cards each, 4 of each of 4 abstract symbol types.

Each turn one player is the modification player and sets the relationship graph, i.e. symbol 1 beats symbol 2, 3, and 4, symbol 2 loses to symbol 1, but beats 3 and 4 etc. Both players then lay down one card from their hand and then use the relationship graph to see whose card beats the other. If a player's card beats the other's according to the relationship graph, then they score a point. The first player to score 8 points wins.

The Goal of the game is to win 8 points first.

name: Pimp: The Board Game
description:
What Is Pimp: The Board Game?
It truly is a terrible game where you are rewarded for greed, misogyny, and narcissism.

As a player you play the role of Pimp and gather properties - i.e. hookers. Battling other players to take their properties is just one aspect of the game that really shines, allowing strong fighting words to be traded amongst players and a genuinely good time.

"Ladies of the Night" can be acquired by using a combination of drug cards and bling cards. Weapon cards are used to fight other pimps and take their ladies. Cash, ladies, and cards are collected throughout the game and the player with the most at the end wins.
mechanics: Commodity Speculation, Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Trading

name: Titan Wars: Coastal Defenders
description:
Titan Wars: Coastal Defenders is a hybrid game that integrates the game play of a worker placement function but also incorporates some player vs player interaction as well as co-op player vs the board elements.

Theme
The game is built around a feel that will make you think of movies like Pacific Rim or Godzilla. You and the other players are running companies that are vying for a contract with the World Government for the right to defend the world coasts against the incursion of a wide variety Kaiju (Giant Monsters). You are fighting them off and dealing with each other in your race to protect the world coastlines but still land the lucrative Coastal Protection Contract.

Game Play
You will have a factory game board that will allow you to placer your worker meeples and trigger various worker placement functions that allow you to build your strength and power. The work is driven by acquiring the resources you need to upgrade your giant battle robot. This robot is the means by which you and the other players work to test yourselves against each other and also defend your cities from the invading hordes.

You use workers to gain resources and upgrade your robots as the Kaiju incursions get stronger. Every so often you will need to each battle and invading Kaiju and defeat it. If you fail a city will fall. Lose too many cities and you all lose, the world.

The person with the most victory points at the end and with at least one city still standing will be awarded the Coastal Defense Contract and is the victor.
mechanics: Hand Management, Semi-Cooperative Game, Worker Placement

name: Auto-Toto
description:
Auto-Toto: All players start with 10 points. At the turn of the spinner, points are added or subtracted as stated on the outer ring (illustrated with traffic signs) at the space, where the race car of the player stops. The winner is the first player who reaches a prior agreed upon number of Points (e.g. 50 points), or who has the most points after a set time. If the spinner stops at the "+" the player has an accident and is eliminated from the game. On some spaces, the player has to sit out one or two rounds.

Auto-Preisfahrt: The players pay 10 coins to the bank. On the results on the outher ring, the players get payed negative amounts from the bank or has to pay positive amounts to the bank. On some spaces, the player has to sit out one or two rounds. If The spinner stops at the "+" the game ends and the player gets all coins from the bank.

Nimm - Gib: On the result of the inner yellow ring, the players give or receive coins to or from the bank.

Nimm alles: This game is played on the two blue rings in the middle. In the first round the players have to pay coins according to the inner blue ring. In the second round a player gets all coins, if he spinns "Nimm alles" on the outher blue ring. Till a player achives this, the two rounds are repeated.

It is also possible to pla a standard roulette game with the numbers on the outher ring.

name: The Treasure of Skeleton Island
description:
