The Treasure of Skeleton Island is a fast card-swapping, set-collecting bluffing game themed around the classic novel Treasure Island by Robert Louis Stevenson.

Gameplay takes mere minutes to learn and a single game lasts under half an hour.

Players have only one move on your turn; swap a card in your hand with a face-up or face-down card in the table’s middle.

Face-up cards can be claimed as treasures at any time by any player who claims to possess the right cards.

Get caught bluffing and you are marked with the Black Spot, preventing your bluffing until you can pass it on.

name: Drillernauts
description:
Drillernauts is a pick-up and deliver game wherein rocket ships outfitted with giant drill bits smash into distant, ore-rich planets in order to mine their precious resources--imagine that your gaming table is the surface of such a planet. A deck of tunnel cards depicts the subterranean void left behind by the drilling ship as it burrows deep underground. Meanwhile, robot miners (controlled by talented robot pilots such as yourselves) emerge from a hatch at the rear of the ship and venture outward. As the game unfolds, the stream of tunnel cards will become longer and longer, stretching across your table. The drill ship can be advanced in any direction you wish, so long as the tunnel does not intersect itself.
Object of the Game: As robot pilots, players use dice to move their robots through the tunnel, pick up ore, and deliver it back to the ship. Space bucks are scored for each ore cube brought back, with big payouts earned for multiple ore of the same type. The pilot who earns the most space bucks before the end of the game (at which point the ship will resurface and return home) is the winner!
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Pick-up and Deliver

name: Medspil
description:
Medspil is an entertaining quizgame, where you will use your knowledge and strategic skills to win over your opponents. You either play alone or in teams.

There are always 3 possible answers to each question, and your or your team chooses the question category each turn. There are five different categories; Nature, Science and Health; Entertainment; Useless Knowledge; Sport and Games; History, Geography and Tourism.

First team pick a category, and answers a question. If the opponents disagree, they can supply their own answer - but if it's incorrect there will be consequences. The team that answers correctly will move the category line towards themselves.

First team to get three category lines on their side of the board wins the game.

There are no dice or luck in the game, only you and your teams knowledge and will to take a chance.

name: The Royal Trivia Quiz
description:
Any Number can play.
1344 questions on the British Royal Family in 6 categories:-
Queen & Duke
Charles & Diana
Mixed Monarchs
Queens Family
Royal Riddles
Miscellaneous

name: Renards et Poulets
description:
Renards et Poulets (Foxes and chickens) is a travel game dated 1980.

It is a 2 player game for ages 10 and up.

Goal of the game:
The chickens have to occupy 9 blue positions (the foxes lair).
The foxes have to eat the chickens en stop them conquering their lair.
The winner is the one who fulfills their goal first.

How to play:
The chickens may move one place following the black lines on the board. They can't go backwards. The Foxes can go in all directions ; they can jump any number of chickens, in condition that the end of that straight line there is an open place on the board, and eat the chickens he has jumped. The eaten chickens are then removed from the game. If a fox forgets a possible jump he must wait for the other to complete a jump before moving.
Chickens can't eat foxes, but they can block them.
The game starts with 20 chickens so if the foxes eat 12 or more they have won because the chickens can't occupy the foxes' lair which contains of 9 places on the board.

name: Novanauts
description:
A star is dying. Harvest resources, hire crew, modify your ship, and manage to get out with the highest profit before it supernovas.

Novanauts is a card and dice game for 2 to 4 people that will take around 1 to 2 hours to complete. Players in the game act as the sponsor of a space salvage mission. The star in this solar system is close to going supernova, so time is limited.

Each player starts with a ship capable of harvesting resources from available planets in the solar system for profit. Each planet has a unique mixture and abundance of each of the possible resources: Noble Gas, Organics, Mineral Ore, and Research Samples. Resources are claimed by rolling dice to see if a particular harvest was successful. The monetary value of each resource is set by a market, which shifts up and down as demand grows or shrinks for the resource.

As the game progresses, players will hire crew and buy modifications to enhance their ship and gain new abilities to help them reach this goal. Crew usually grants small buffs, and modifications often grant new abilities. While a handful of weapons exist to punish a player who has put all his victory points in one basket, it is often not an efficient use of time or resources to pursue hostilities.

The game progresses through events called solar instabilities. Each die roll has a chance to produce one or more of these events. As more and more of these events occur, the player's home base, Stardock, slowly moves further and further away from the unstable star. When the Stardock reaches the last planet in the system, it prepares to leave and does so immediately before the star explodes.

The game ends when either the star goes supernova (harming any players still left in the solar system) or every player safely leaves before that point. The winner is the player who has accumulated the most victory points through collecting money, crew, modifications, and research samples.

name: Conan: Rise of Monsters
description:
Conan: Rise of Monsters (CROM) is a new skirmish miniatures game based on the Conan stories by Robert E. Howard as well as the amazing Marvel and Dark Horse Comics. The game features exquisite 28mm plastic pre-painted miniatures in Starter Boxes supplemented with separate warbands, leaders, and monsters. It is a completely scaleable tabletop miniatures game with rules, special dice, and markers!

Thoth-Amon has assembled the blasphemous Legion of Set to bring the Serpent God into the world of Hyboria. His sorcerers, swordsmen, and serpents scour the lands gathering ancient artifacts and destroying the icons of those gods who might oppose his apocalyptic plans. King Conan of Aquilonia has forged an alliance to stop them--the Circle of Iron. His knights, archers, pikemen, war mammoths, and other beasts are all that stand in the way of the dread sorcerer and his unholy minions.

name: Election
description:
Election is a poker style card game where the absurd events of the campaign trail dictate the action. Each player's hand consists of cold hard cash and political strategy.

There are 3 decks of cards in Election, the States, the War Chest and the Campaign Trail decks. The goal of the game is to win the most votes. Votes are won by winning Elections, in which a set # of states are up for grabs.

Players are dealt 7 cards War Chest cards at the beginning of the game. War Chest cards consist of money, boosts and strategic, "take that" cards that allow you to affect the "Elections" and the other players winnings.

On their turn players draw from the humorous Campaign Trail deck to find out if their Campaign is going well, in which they can improve their hand, or if it's not and they receive a disadvantage.

When a player draws an Election Card, the appropriate # of state cards are drawn and an Election takes place, in which each player plays their highest valued hand. However, "Take That" cards, such as steals, and recounts can affect the results. The winner of the Election wins the States and the votes. After an Election, players turn in their cards (unless they drew the option to retain a card) and everyone is dealt a new hand and continues gameplay until all the States and votes are won.

name: Catch My Drift
description:
Catch My Drift is a hilarious and interactive card game of hip hop charades. Think Taboo meets urban dictionary. Outguess your opponents in the most lingo to win! Teammates race against the clock to guess as much urban lingo as possible in 2 minutes. Each lingo card is worth 1 or 2 points.

The person giving the clues is called the shot caller. If the shot caller mentions a violation word while helping the team guess the lingo, the opponent a.k.a. security will clap the hand clapper and deduct 1 or 2 points if a violation word is mentioned.
The shot caller can mention the clue, use gestures, be creative and have fun. The team with the most points after 3 rounds wins!
Game play is 25 minutes 4 or more players required
categories: Card Game, Party Game, Word Game

name: Ordklur
description:
This game is similar to Scrabble, but in this game the tiles don't have different values, and the squares on the board don't either.

Each player gets 8 tiles. Every round starts with the player spinning a spinner that will say whether he or she should create a crossing word in either the beginning, middle or end of an already existing word on the board. If you can't make any words you have to take extra tiles.

The first player to get rid or all his or her tiles wins the game!

name: Last Days
description:
Theme:
After a zombie apocalypse, several characters try to thrive upon the ashes of a ruined city.

Game-play:
Players select randomly a character at the start of the game. Each player must discard cards in order to make his character perform actions such move across the map, kill zombies or jump across security walls. Each character must complete several objectives before been able to access the safe zone and win the game.

Goal:
Be the first in complete your objectives and get access to the safe zone.
mechanics: Area Movement, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Open Drafting

name: Plundering Pluto
description:
The zepuin on your shoulder flaps nervously as the giant tusks of a palgus wroth surface in the distance. It doesn't seem pleased with all the exchange of cannon fire. Neptune rises on the iceberg riddled coast. Someone put your loot on that ship, and the time to retaliate is running thin!

Overview: Plundering Pluto is a dexterity, dice and deduction game pitting two seafaring K9 pirates against one another. The first player to destroy the three sectors of their opponents ship with their p.a.w.s. canon fire is the winner.

The game has three levels of play for various types of gamers. The introductory dexterity game simply builds the strength of ships by rolling the die, then taking turns firing cannon cards to subtract their values.

The next levels of gameplay introduce ship customization with weapons and icebergs. Finally, a bluffing, deduction card game may be used to add a strategic twist. The choice method to plunder Pluto is yours!

name: Race for the Kingdom
description:
A strategic card game of epic superpowers and divine kingdom building…

Introduction:

Descending from heaven, divine angels find themselves fashioned in human bodies. Bound to who they truly are, these angels discover themselves called by God to build His magnificent kingdom. Chosen and blessed to be given special powers from heaven, these spiritual beings race amongst themselves to influence the realm of Earth. In an epic battle of extraordinary powers, faith and fellowship, these devout angelic bishops seek God for guidance and authority. Which faithful child will God use to build His holy kingdom? God knows, but only time will tell!

Game Description:

Race for the Kingdom (RFTK) is a strategy card game, where 2-4 players become powerful angels gifted with unique individual abilities. These angels race around the realm of earth building and seeking God’s kingdom. With heavenly favor and a divine influence to fellowship with mankind, your challenge is not with flesh nor blood, but against other principalities and their impressive powers.

In RFTK, the game is about racing to achieve 1 of 3 victory conditions:

Kingdom Expansion (place all 12 kingdom churches in play)
Kingdom Development (stack 3 churches on a chosen number of territories)
Kingdom Rapture (hold in hand 3 out of the 4 God cards)
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Modular Board, Open Drafting, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Stabling Rivalry
description:
Stabling Rivalry is an exciting, card-driven, streamlined simulation of thoroughbred racing. You and an opponent represent friendly, rival stable owners, who train and race horses for fun and profit. On this racing day you both have a lot of horses at the track, and you’re focusing on bragging rights. Which one of you is the better judge of horseflesh—and which stable will win the most races and side bets? Playable in 30 minutes to an hour, Stabling Rivalry will provide the thundering excitement of the sport of kings—and the ultimate answer!

From his stable of horses, each player selects one for each race. During play, a player draws a card from a small display of action cards and then plays one from his hand. If it matches the color required on his horse’s card for the current furlong, its normal value is used. (If not, it is played "penalty-side" up-- with a lesser value.)

The cards played each furlong are totaled throughout the race. If tied at the start of a furlong, initial post position breaks it. Class markers allow a player to re-draw a card-- to help himself or to hinder his opponent. Additionally, players can "jockey for position" and sometimes "dump" the face-up cards of the display; the leader and other player have separate criteria for this.

After both players have played a card for the current furlong, the top card of a special deck representing the other horses in the race is turned face-up. Some of these cards have various effects in addition to their numerical value, while others have two possible values and one of the players will have to choose which to play.

After all furlongs have been played in a race, the horse with the most total value wins. Class markers and then post position breaks ties between players. The number of races won plus betting chips won are totaled to determine the winner of the game.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Hand Management, Open Drafting

name: Hatoup
description:
From the box:

Full sail ahead!
The importance of the sea was considerable in 19th century Brittany, form the Royal and Merchant Navies to the fishing fleets. The ports are as diverse as they are numerous, from the Orient to Ponant, Lorient, a port of the Royal India Company, Nantes with its international trade, Saint Malo the port-town of buccaneers, Paimpol with its Terre-Neuve breed of life-saving dogs and last but not least that high-point of fishing and maritime history, Douarnenez. At a time when the wind, the currents and the tides were master, commercial shipping and fishing was assured by 'bisquines', 'chasse-marees', 'lougres', 'goemoniers' laden with sea-weed and other ships.

Hatoup will take you on a series of original regattas with simple rules to follow, allowing you to discover the maritime feeling of the Breton ports.

Overview of the game:

Two teams of two players each compete to be the first to deliver the 4 trade goods (gold, wine, linen and timber) to the right port. There are 5 major ports: Douarnenez, Nantes, Saint-Malo, Lorient and Paimpol. Each player is native to one of the ports and their mission is to deliver all 4 commodities to the port that buys them. Each port accepts only one type of goods (for instance Nantes is the port for wine). But you cannot deliver to your own port, but to the free port of Paimpol instead (thus the Nantes player must take the wine to Paimpol). The movement of each ship is driven by the play of one card from your hand each round. There are 52 movement cards in four suits (sextant, telescope, knife and cosh) numbered 1 to 10 plus M, I, K (this is a customised poker-like deck). After playing a card you follow the instructions of how to move your ship. The goal is to deliver your cargo and bring your ship back to port. The winner is the team who docks all eight ships first.

name: Cuban-Mexican War
description: This game is based on the War at Sea system and is a what-if WWI era naval simulation on conflict between Mexico and Cuba in the Gulf of Mexico and the Caribbean.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Nautical, Wargame, World War I

name: Gambling & Hookers
description:
Gambling and Hookers sees 2-4 players competing to have the wildest night out. Think the night before The Hangover, or one of Barney’s legendary nights.

Players are vying to be the first to buy a set number of vices - vices like alcohol, gambling, drugs and hookers. But each vice bought leaves you open to different downers. Buy a hooker, for example, and risk other players hitting you with a pimp card, or an S.T.D.

So it’s a take-that style card game, but one where you control which attacks you are vulnerable to.
categories: Card Game, Mature / Adult, Print & Play

name: Das Märchenschloss
description:
Objective:
Be the first reaching space 75.

Players take turns rolling the die and moving the indicated number. If a player ends on a shaded space, he follows the instructions in the manual, which may cause him to pay or get a coin, skip a turn, or move back or forward.

This game was likely published before the First World War.

name: Cadeau caché
description: In Cadeau caché, players try to find the right gift for each of their six characters. The difficult aspect of this simple game is memory. Even if you find the right gift for a character, you must remember it when the die brings you back on the square that gives you the chance to benefit this information. Taking notes is prohibited!
mechanics: Memory, Pick-up and Deliver, Roll / Spin and Move

name: DTR DieCastTableRacing
description:
Racing games, that allow to use DieCast models (1/62 scale like Matchbox, HotWheels, etc.), or a cardboard models.

Each car has some parameters like Acceleration, Braking, TopSpeed, etc.

Depending on these parameters each driver will note the speed of his car in next turn.

Then depending on the speed each car is moved on track using 4 moving pieces. Length, and angle of moving pieces are different and depend on speed.

Cars may become damaged if collided.

No board is necessary. Race may take place on table, diorama, printed track, carpet, etc.

Smaller scale elements (1/180) are also prepared.

Simulation mode, and RC (less damage mode) mode are available.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Graine d'explorateur: les dinosaures
description: This dinosaur card game lets children try out a great range of questions. The 100 questions are divided in two categories of age: One for 4-5 year olds and the other for 6-8 year olds. The game is played with the help of Mr and Miss Haricot, two funny characters from the game. The different categories are numerous: the different kind of dinosaurs, their height, their disappearance, the fossils...

name: Sweet Tooth
description:
Sweet Tooth is the quick and easy game that everyone will enjoy.
Get ready for a sugar rush as you frantically trade sweets with your friends and family.
Pig out on someone else's sweets and avoid going on a diet.
Aim for the highest number of sweets at the end of each round.
Will you have the sweetest tooth when the timer runs out?

name: Même pas mal
description:
Shuffle the 36 knight cards and deal all the deck to all the players. Each player keeps these cards as a face down pile in front of him. At the same time, they reveal the first card of their deck. The one that revealed the highest card takes all of the cards and place them under his deck. If there are ties for the highest card, tied players play a second card face down, then a third card face up to see who wins all the cards in play. If an other tie occurs, you repeat (one face down, then one face up).

If a player loses all of his cards, he is out of the game. The winner is the one that won all the 36 cards.

The drawings and the lenght of the weapons help the children players to understand the cards value : The longest blade wins!

name: Nazi Spies over London
description:
This is a set of rules with scenario instructions and background material to create a story set in London during WW2. Players take on the role of characters involved in a net of wartime espionage, and attempt to fulfill specific goals assigned to their characters by the scenario.

Based on the premises of the situation, players discuss possible ways to advanced the story. Next, players use the Matrix system created by Chris Engle to establish how likely certain proposed developments in the plot are to occur, and roll dice to determine how the story will progress. Discussion after discussion and roll after roll, an overall narration emerges.

Specific victory conditions exist based on the mission that is being played, but as in many storytelling games what matters the most is to work as a team towards the creation of a rich and satisfying narrative.
categories: Political, Spies/Secret Agents, World War II

name: Pulp Adventures: Journey to the Hollow World
description:
Pulp Adventures: Journey to the Hollow World is the first of a series of modular adventure games where players cooperatively adventure through the pages of a comic book. Specific tiles are placed to create each page and card sets are added to the base game for each different adventure.

Each player has a deck of cards representing their character's skills and abilities and may play cards toward encounters even when it is not their turn.

name: Star Trek: Attack Wing – I.K.S. Klothos Expansion Pack (cancelled)
description:
Star Trek - Attack Wing: I.K.S. Klothos Expansion Pack is part of the Wave 24 expansion packs from WizKids Games, and this expansion comes with one new ship and a new set of cards for Star Trek: Attack Wing.

The Klothos is a D7 class ship.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Phase Order

name: Star Trek: Attack Wing – I.R.W. Devoras Expansion Pack (cancelled)
description:
Star Trek - Attack Wing: I.R.W. Devoras Expansion Pack is part of the Wave 24 expansion packs from WizKids Games, and this expansion comes with one new ship and a new set of cards for Star Trek: Attack Wing.

The Devoras is a D'deridex class ship.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Phase Order

name: Star Trek: Attack Wing – Assimilated Vessel 77139 Expansion Pack (cancelled)
description:
Star Trek - Attack Wing: Assimilated Vessel 77139 Expansion Pack is part of the Wave 24 expansion packs from WizKids Games, and this expansion comes with one new ship and a new set of cards for Star Trek: Attack Wing.

The Assimilated Vessel 77139 is an Aerie class ship.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Phase Order

name: Big 2 Revolution
description:
Description from the publisher:

Big 2 Revolution, the first release of the Revolution series from Smoothie Games, adds dynamic features to the original Big 2 shedding game. The card deck of 52 standalone poker cards features twenty cards — J, Q, K, A & 2 — that have been customized with hero abilities to enrich the original Big Two gameplay.

name: Advance Australia
description:
A simple roll and move race game played on a map of Australia overlaid with a 12x12 grid f squares numbered from 1 (Brisbane) to 136 (Sydney), with 8 unnumbered squares.
The object appears to be to move from Brisbane to Sydney via the numbered squares. 9 of the squares appear to be hazards: 5 at sea (2 wrecks, 2 contrary winds), and 4 on land (3 desert and 1 bush).

The game appears in the "Australian Town and Country Journal" on May 12 1909 and described as a 'New Game' by a Sydney Bookstall company. An advertisement for the game was later published in the "West Australian" newspaper (Perth) on Wed 6. Oct. 1909, p.6 col. 7:

"This, it seems, is an adaptation to the Commonwealth of a map game, said to have been exceedingly popular in the different countries to which it has seen made applicable. The Australian map is marked of into 136 squares, and with the aid of dice which determine each stage and counters for each of two, three, or four players, a journey is performed throughout Australia, beginning at Brisbane and terminable only at Sydney. In the shape of contrary winds, a wreck, deserts, bush, and other obstacles to easy journeyings, the way of the traveller is made difficult, and at the same time exciting, and by an ingenious contrivance in the rules the question whether he will ever reach Sydney is attended with considerable doubt, which enhances the interest of the game. Both for young and old it should prove thoroughly diverting, and it has the added advantage of possessing considerable educational value. Wigg and Son are selling it at a price intended to bring it within the reach of everyone".
publishers: Chad Valley Co Ltd., Johnson Brothers

name: Driller
description:
Driller is a hybrid, quick, family card game. Players have to devise a strategy to score the best score with cards given. There is no pile, no drawing, you get all cards at the beginning and have to deal with them!

Driller uses a mobile device to scan the cards, visualise the drilling and control points, player turns and drill temperature. The device is placed on the game box and players place the cards beneath it, so the app can scan them.

The deck consist of 44 cards - 4 different ground types, each with 10 cards with values 1-10 and one EndDrilling card. The number on a card indicates the speed of the drill. Players can score points for speeding up the drill, using EndDrilling card or matching the card ground type with the ground, currently being drilled through. But if the players drill too fast for too long, the drill may overheat and break! Be aware that other players may want to destroy the drill on purpose to stop you from scoring!

name: Act Out
description:
Do you have...
A quick wit?
A creative mind?
A sense of humor?
A little acting talent?
At least three friends?

Then you're ready to take on the challenge of Act Out! You and your team will take on opposing teams in a hilarious, quick thinking game where your team improvises skits based
on the cards you are given by your opponents!

When you play Act Out!, every game is different! Act Out! includes methods for both novice and advanced play, and is great for
drama education, team building, or a fun night with friends!

name: Horoskop: Ein astrologisches Spiel
description:
This game is about astrology. The central game board shows an astrological solar system. The board is 12 sectors for the 12 star signs. There are 7 concentric rings (wire rings in their hollows), one for each celestial body. The rings are Sun, Moon, Mercury, Venus, Mars, Jupiter and Saturn. Each ring has a colored bead for the celestial body itself and red (favorable effect) and black (unfavorable effects).

Each player has an individual board with 2 concentric circles. They show also the 12 star sign sectors, written at the edge of the big circle. In the inner circle the sectors are numbered with 1 to 12. This numbers are called houses, which represent astrological aspects like personality, "possession and wealth", "adventure, erotic".
The inner circle has 5 concentric rings where special marker placed at the beginning on each field of the middle ring one.

At the begin of the game the inner circle is positioned by random (special dice rolling) and stays then till the end of the game.
Also the position of the rings on the central board are random turned at the beginning as described in the rules.

The player chooses a house (number) with as much red and colored beads in the equivalent sector.

Dependent on the number each player has another star sector.
Each round the sun ring is rotated by 1 (Counter clock) and for the other circles 2 dice are rolled. 1 dice shows which circle is rotated and the second die shows how much.

How many dice rolls are possible for the actual player is calculated out of the sum of red plus colored pearls minus black pearls in his star sign sector.

The player is allowed to roll the dice less than allowed.
The players look at the Pearl of the actual moved circle in the sector relevant for them. If the pearl is red or colored he moves the marker on his board 1 ring to the edge otherwise (black) 1 ring to the center.

Game Ends after a preset sun moves (e.g. 1,5 rounds). The player who has most of his marks on the outer ring wins the game.
The rules allow to read the astrological result for each player.

name: Geschichten aus dem Bärenland
description: Each Player gets a bear as figure. The game is a version of Snakes and Ladders. Additional there are fields on the board,when reaching them you can roll a second time, have to go backwards or to pause.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: IWO TABLE-WAR
description:
War game on a European map.
Each player has a bunch of military figures (tanks, Artillery, Ships, ...)
The map is separated in different countries with each a number of cities.
The whole map shows lines which cross each other, each point (possible position for a figure) has 6 neighbors.
At the beginning the players choose countries and place one of their figures on each of its cities.
If the player has not enough figures to place one on each city he has to choose another country.
Each type of figure has it's own "length of move", "shot range" and "Value of points".
On players turn he can move each of his figures it's "length of move" and shoot on one of the opponents figures. Roll a die (5 and 6 hit). The opponent is allowed to shoot also with all of his figures which are in range, also with the hit one.
After this all hit figures are removed.
Then the Opponent has his turn with move and shoot and the first player may shoot back.
After each double turn it is checked if a player has conquered a capital City. If this is the case all opponent figures are removed from this country.
After 8 double turns there is a value of points calculated from the number of his cities. With this points new stones can be bought dependent on the "Value of points" of the different types. These can be placed on own cities.
The same calculation is done at the end of the game. The winner is the player with the higher number.
The game ends after a predefined number of rounds or if one player has lost all his figures.
categories: Territory Building, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Dice Rolling

name: Katz & Maus
description:
The players have to save the coloured mice from the cat.
The mice are placed randomly on the board. After time to memorize theirs positions the mice are covered by hats. At the border of the board there are coloured holes. The players have to move the hats with the mice under it to the hole with the same color as the mouse has. If the color fits the player gets one point, if not the cat captures this mouse.
The game ends when there is at most one, captured mouse. The player with most points is the winner.

name: Sushicon
description:
User summary:
In the game of スシコン (Sushicon), you win the game if you get rid of all cards in your hand before anyone else does.

This game also has an educational aspect. If you play it, you will learn the importance of three steps to use the internet safely: "STOP. THINK. CONNECT."

Players try to achieve their goals considering "STOP. THINK. CONNECT.", using a limited resource of cards and their own skill of bluffing.

The rulebook for the game is distributed for free by the designer at events promoting defense against cyber crime, such as the "Shirahama Cyber Crime Symposium", "Information Security Workshop in Echigo-Yuzawa". The rulebook has the URL to allow the player to download the cards used for the game.

Publisher's summary:
「SUSHICON」はいち早く手札をなくしたプレイヤーが勝利となるゲームです。使うのは、たった31枚のカード。
プレイヤーはインターネットを安心して利用するための習慣 『ストップ | シンク | CONNECT』を意識して、限られたカードとブラフ（はったり）を駆使して、ライバルを出し抜いて勝利を目指します。
このゲームをプレイすると、インターネットを安心して利用するための3つのステップ　「STOP. THINK. CONNECT.」　（立ち止まる | 考える | 楽しむ）の重要性について理解が深まります。
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Educational, Memory, Print & Play

name: Advanced Persistent Threat Challenge
description:
User summary:
Advanced Persistent Threat Challenge, or APT Challenge, is a card game for two players with a theme of Advanced Persistent Threat, a method of cyber attack.

Players assume the role of cyber attackers who are planning to steal confidential documents from each other. To achieve their goals, they have to read each other's hand, plan an effective set of targeted attack procedures, and conduct a cyber espionage.

After the game, add up the level of sensitivity of documents each player has stolen. The player with the higher total wins the game.

The rulebook for the game is distributed for free by the designer at events promoting defense against cyber crime, such as the Shirahama Cyber Crime Symposium. The rulebook has the URL to allow the player to download the cards used for the game.

Publisher's summary:
Advanced Persistent Threat Challengeは、サイバー空間におけるAPT(Advanced Persistent Threat)をテーマにした二人用の対戦型カードゲームです。
それぞれのプレイヤーは、攻撃者（スパイ）となり、機密文書の奪取を狙って、互いの手の内を読み、標的型サイバー攻撃の手順を組合せサイバー・エスピオナージ（諜報活動）をしかけ、勝利条件を目指します。
機密文書を奪取し、そこに定義された機密度の合計値を比較します。より大きな合計値のプレイヤーが勝利となります。
categories: Bluffing, Deduction, Educational, Modern Warfare, Print & Play, Spies/Secret Agents

name: Hohe Schule des Verkehrs
description: The players start at the space of their color and have to move along the streets around the board, while minding the traffic rules. Movement is determined by a die. The first player to return to his starting point wins the game.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Mit dem Auto aufs Land
description: The players have to get from space 1 to space 120. Movement is determined by a die. On the circular spaces with pictures, events occur, that hinder or benefit the players. The first player to reach space 120 wins the game.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Lorestar
description:
Somewhere in our galaxy, a small, starless planet wanders aimlessly inside of a vast nebula. Highly advanced satellites that the inhabitants think of as gods - “Lorestars” - orbit this world, periodically irradiating the surface in an endless cycle of long-abandoned experiments. The native lifeforms and human settlers live a primitive state of violence because of the volatile effects that the satellites have had on their genetics over the centuries. When specific satellites are in certain parts of their orbits, the bursts of radiation even cause some inhabitants to change into alien monsters.

In this part of the Lorestar story, you play as one of five unique characters that turn into savage creatures when their satellite god passes through the right constellation. Vying for survival in the wild outskirts of small towns, some of these characters, like the planet they live on, are confused wanderers, while others take advantage of their abilites to ruthlessly hold power over weaker people.

Control the position of the Lorestar icons by outsmarting your opponents in a simultaneous card draw that spins the central game board. Once your character has turned into a monster by aligning the Lorestars in the inner board to the constellations on the outer board, play attack cards and use your monster abilities to continue to foil your opponents and dwindle their health until you're the last monster standing.

Survive this battle and unlock the next chapter of Lorestar!

name: EverDark
description:
In EverDark, players make their way through the forest (represented by a single deck of cards) and try to assemble the highest valued hands possible by collecting special combinations of cards.

It won’t be without surprises though, as several negative-valued wolves are on the prowl, and a notorious thief calls the forest home.

name: All About Louisville Game
description:
From the rulebook:

The object of this game is for the players, using dice and playing pieces, to travel on the gameboard from a residence square to the bank and shopping locations shown on their shopping lists. The first player to return to his residence with the travel cards for all locations contained on his shopping list wins the game!
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection
publishers: All About Town, Inc., Windsor Publications

name: Themewords
description: A crossword game in which up to four players build word grids on a grid of coloured squares bearing preprinted letters. Each word must match a pre-determined theme and points are scored for word length with bonuses for matching letters on the board and for starting a word on the player's colour.

name: Jagt den Koffer-Mann
description:
This game was adapted from the british TV-series "Man in a Suitcase" (Der Mann mit dem Koffer) from 1967.

The players have to reach the safe in the center of the game board with their agent. Movement is determined by a die. If a Agent gets on an orange space, he advances according to the printed arrow. On a red or yellow space the player has to draw a card to hinder or benefit his agent. if he rolls a six he doesn't move, but has to drop the glass marble into the slot. Any agent that gets hit by the marble has to return to the starting space. The player who drops the marble has the option to remove his agent from the board and return it after the marble has run it's course. However if he chooses to remain on the board and his agent isn't hit, he advances a number of spaces, according to the compartment, where the marble comes to rest. The first player to reach the safe wins the game.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Racing, Spies/Secret Agents
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Despotic
description:
Despotic is a fantasy themed 2 player spatial-tactical strategy board and card game. In Despotic, players assume the role of gladiator-like parties sent to battle one another for the Emperor's pleasure.

Unlike the abstract game of Chess, Despotic plays fast, adds some luck, probability management, decision limitation, and equalization(handicapping of Chess-Masters). In Despotic, the goal is to destroy your opponent's "King" or to run your opponent out of their 20 Power cards. Losing a Unit requires the removal of Power Cards equal to the Unit's Value. Also, Players remaining in Check must remove 2 Power Cards from their deck.

Initial set-up is like standard Chess, however each Player has 2 decks of cards (20 Movement Cards and 20 Power Cards). Each Player starts with 3 Movement Cards. During a turn, the player can (a) Play 1 card from their hand and resolve its effect, (b) Discard any number of cards from their hand and draw back up to 3 cards (Power and/or Movement Cards), -OR- (c) May remove any number of Dead Cards in their hand from the game, and then may draw and play 1 Power Card for each Dead Card removed. At the end of a turn, the Player draws back up to their hand limit size of 3 cards (from either Power and/or Movement Cards).

Movement Cards allow a corresponding Unit to move as indicated (standard Chess patterns). Power Cards allow non-traditional movement and/or create special effects/abilities in the game.

name: Chevalier: Medieval Battles
description:
Chevalier: Medieval Battles is a wargame for two players which simulates the battles of Europe’s Middle Ages. Players take on the roll of a Medieval general, building their army, maneuvering them on the battlefield, and issuing special orders. The game uses unit cards to represent units in the players’ armies which are arranged on a unique play mat to represent the flanks, front line, and reserves of the army.

Players construct their armies by selecting up to eight unit cards representing fifteen different types of Medieval units. Each unit has a listed maximum army limit, type, equipment, and combat stats for their differing “status levels.” Players also select a hand of eight “orders cards” which can be issued to units during gameplay to move them to a new location on the player’s play mat or gain one-time buffs.

After players alternate deploying their armies on their play mats, combat occurs in a series of turns divided into an Orders phase (when orders cards are played and resolved) and Combat phase (when combat is resolved).

During the Orders phase, players simultaneously play any orders cards they wish to use face-down on the unit receiving the orders. Progressing in a set pattern determined by the play mat, these orders are then sequentially revealed and resolved.

Combat between units on the board is resolved following the same sequential pattern as resolving orders cards. To resolve combat, players add up the relevant combat skill for the current unit and any situational modifiers (such as the type of unit opposing a unit, whether the unit is charging that turn, or any orders cards affecting the unit) to determine how many dice to roll. Each die rolled which meets or exceeds the target unit’s current “defense” value for its current status level scores one “hit” and permanently reduces that unit’s status by one level. As each unit’s equipment listed on its card gives certain bonuses against certain unit types, often while imparting a penalty against other unit types, players can gain an advantage by careful use of their deployment and orders to pit their units against their optimal opponents. Units decrease in effectiveness as they take hits, becoming weaker in both offense and defense. Each unit has three status levels ranging from undamaged to heavily damaged. Any unit reduced by hits beyond its third status level is removed from the game.

The winning player is the one with the last unit remaining on the board.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Rock-Paper-Scissors, Simulation, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Monster School
description:
Part of Bandai's Party Joy series of lighter boardgames. (#37)

A game in search of "the world of Satan complete works" which were covered by the monster school while confronting a monster.
The game field is comprised of six boxes and boards. When somebody of the player finds "a door", those boxes are overturned and show a different aspect.

Already out of print.

name: Calcaptum
description:
The object of Calcaptum is to move all one's building blocks to the centre squares (marked "24"), one block being transferred every time a score of 24 is achieved.

The winner is either:

the first player to complete a pyramid OR
the player who can play on when the opponent cannot
mechanics: Grid Movement, Pattern Building, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Step Jun -Koi no tokimeki hatsumei -GAME
description:
Part of Bandai's Party Joy series of lighter boardgames. (#39)

It made an TV animation a game.
Chief character Jun is a girl of the invention enthusiast. Jun wants longed-for male Zero to come to like oneself.
Each player becomes Jun, using robot Kichinosuke, competes for sending inv. to Zero.

Each player take two pieces "Jun" and "Kichinosuke". Go ahead through the route with Jun, and prepare an invention. In addition, Kichinosuke works by going ahead through the route.
The player who let Kichinosuke arrive at the trout of Zelo wins.

Already out of print.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Russian Roulette: A Game of Luck and Betrayal
description:
Have a score to settle? Want to choose the first player for the next game on game night? Need to pick the next person to clean the bathroom?
Russian Roulette for it!

Shuffle the deck and place it face-down in the middle of 2 to 6 players. First player to draw a card goes first. That player reads the card to all other players and does it’s action if required. Players draw one card clockwise around the table placing the cards in front of them for all to see. When a player draws a “Bang!” card, they are instantly out! They shuffle the deck, and go again. So keep your fingers crossed and hope you draw a "Click" you lucky son of a gun!

Push yer luck and pull multiple cards if you dare.


Includes the Traitor and Gun Jam expansion cards.
categories: American West, Card Game, Humor, Party Game

name: Esquinas
description: Paper-and-pencil game in which two players build a playing area using the letters of the Spanish word ESQUINAS (corners) and then shade in different sectors of it, trying to "collect" more corners than the opponent without ever having the same amount.

name: 107 City
description:
Big changes are about to happen in the charming town of Sanset City. Reforms in mental health care, dubbed "107 City" are coming.
You live in this town and are confronted with different mental health issues. Try to find solutions by making the best use of the available services.
Will you be able to improve your quality of life?
Or will you be washed away by even more problems heading in your direction.

Each player incarnates a citizen, each with his own personal problems. For this you get a personal player board with starting stats on money, medical health, social situation. By playing cards and moving you can get to locations which improve these stats by rolling a die or get you the help of characters in the game.
You play once on each side of the board; one side representing the state of the city before reforms and the other representing the state after reforms. Make sure your citizen ends with the best stats; meaning the best quality of live!

name: Bite the Bullet
description:
Try your luck - will you dodge the bullet - round after round?

Play the exciting/thrill seeking game of Roulette (safely) in this easy to carry party game that everyone will get a BANG out of.

Randomly place the tokens on the revolver tile and select who is pull the trigger first!

Continue playing until someone is out of the round by pulling the BANG token.
Reload and continue...

name: Monstres & bobos
description:
The infirmary is full! Nurse octopus needs help to take care of the injured monsters.

In this game each player gets a personal player board depicting 6 injured monsters. On their turn a player can look through the starting pile of 36 image tiles once, to find a healed monster image that corresponds to a hurt monster on his board. The aim is to collect all six corresponding image tiles.
The first player to have helped all his injured monsters is the winner.

name: Canailles à la maison
description:
It is fun to play in the house, but do you recognise the dangers lurking around? Come to the aid of the children.

Find 12 sets of 3 token images. At the beginning all images are hidden and you look for a set by turning the images one at the time. Find three matching images and you can continue. Place these in order, thus identifying: danger, accident and preventive actions to take.

name: Turnajaispeli
description: A four player game where everybody gets 4 knights. They all start in their own castle. Players can put their knights on the board one by one. The goal is to take out all the opposing knights by bypassing them or getting in the same hex. When your knight is killed you can put anotherone on the board. There is also one sorcerers stone wich can be used to revieve knights.

name: Piima Teekond Toidulauale
description:
Educational board game about milk. The game is produced for kindergartens.

Game board is divided to 5 areas: pasture, farm, industry, shop and home. In Her turn player draws a card with element (cow, bull, haystack, milker, cheese, sour cream etc.) and must find the same thing from the board to get the card as a point.
There are information about the elements on other side of the cards.

If the deck is exhausted the player with the most cards is the winner.

name: Epic Tales
description:
Every spring, when the snows thaw and the adventuring season begins, the greatest heroes in the land go forth to do mighty deeds and win great fame throughout the land. In autumn, when the cold winds force the noble heroes home, they return to the king's court and tell of the mighty deeds they have done...sometimes embellishing their stories a bit.

Epic Tales is a card game in which players put together a hand of cards composed of monsters, items, and treasures, and then boast about the mighty deeds they have accomplished. The goal of the game is to gain the most fame by defeating the most monsters, visiting the most exotic locations, and finding the greatest treasures in the land.

The King's Humblest Servant--the player who boasts the least fame--gets to hear each other hero's tale and decides whether to force them to prove their story or to accept it as they say.

If you are forced to prove your story then you must show how you used your items, companions, and skills to defeat the monsters you boasted of defeating. If you were telling the truth then you win even more fame; if you were lying then you lose fame for each monster you were unable to defeat.

Whoever has earned the most fame after 3 years wins the game!

name: Trivia Party: Sports
description:
Trivia Party: Sports is a card game that combines a traditional deck of cards with sports trivia. There are four different ways to play:

In Trivia Party, one player draws a card and asks a question of another player. The answering player may choose from questions ranked from 1 (easiest) to 5 (hardest) and gains points equal to the difficulty level on a correct answer. Incorrect answers gain no points. After one question, the next player takes a turn. Players play until the deck is used up or to an agreed total.

Upward Mobility is played similarly, but each player starts off being asked question one and proceeds through the questions to number five, earning the point value for each question answered correctly until he or she answers wrong. So, for example, if a player answers questions 1,2 and 3 correctly but misses #4, the score would be 6 points. Like Trivia Party, play continues until the deck is used up or until one player reaches an agreed point total.

In Auction Trivia, each player starts with 25 points. One player chooses a card and reads the 5-point question. Players then bid on the card. The highest bidder then wins the card and tries to answer all five questions on the card, gaining points for each question answered equal to the point value of the questions (for a maximum of 15 points per card). These points are added to his starting point balance. The winninbg player then becomes the next auctioneer. Players are eliminated if their balance drops to zero. The player with the most points when all cards are used up wins.

In Trivia Poker, score is kept in the same way as Trivia Party. However, when a player answers a question correctly, he or she keeps the card. Players try to gain cards to build the best poker hand possible. When a player gains a sixth card, he or she must discard any chosen card, keeping five cards. The game ends when all cards are used or when all players hold five-card poker hands. There are two winners: the player with the most points and the player with the best poker hand.

name: Convoy
description:
A turn based two player game of naval warfare where the two players try to sink each other’s hidden ships.

A divider is place between the two players so they cannot see each other’s fleet which consists of seven ships – one carrier, one battleship, two torpedo boats, and three submarines.

Each player lays out his ships (occupying between 2-5 squares) on a plastic frame that consists of two grid sections (one larger – the ocean, one smaller – the target control area) with the ships occupying the larger section. Each grid section has numbers (1-10) across the top and letters (A-L; J and K are missing) down the side.

After deciding who goes first, the first player calls a shot on his opponent’s ocean grid, say E7. His opponent must declare a hit if the grid square is occupied by a ship or a miss if it is not. The player that fired marks the grid number on his target control area with a Red bomb if it is a hit or a White bomb if it is a miss. Then the second player takes his turn, with either a hit or a miss being declared by the first player and the results recorded by the second player. Turns are taken until all the ships in one players fleet have been sunk. The five ships have a total of 21 hits. Each player keeps track of the number of hits he has made and declares himself the winner if his target control area has 21 Red bombs.

This game is very similar to Battleship, but based on the art and packaging was most likely published before Battleship, between the late 1950's and the mid-1960's.
categories: Deduction, Nautical, Wargame, World War II

name: Bransonopoly
description:
It's Monopoly set in Branson, Missouri. Game is like the original Monopoly, with the board, cards and money done over in a Branson, Missouri theme. The 4 playing pieces are generic and colored tokens are used instead of houses. Game board measures 18" X 18". Paper instructions are included. Box does not have an insert.

This game was made in 1990, so the theatres, shows, restaurants & businesses included in the game are all from that era.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Who's Boss. Animal Riots: The CARD GAME
description:
From the publisher:

Who's Boss. Animal Riots is a gang battling game for wannabe gang bosses, Rioters and control freaks who love to beat the socks off..midnight roaming shombies, terrifying sheeponators, intimidating bully-builders, a One ton crusher Hippo Butt, lamb chop LORDS who love their steak RAW ants with nanchaku skills gone nuts ,..and many many more wacky characters ready to defend their territory no matter what!!

To win this highly strategic animal powered card game, first you’ll be forced to become a mob boss!!
A number card is placed on the table facing up. Based on the hand of cards, you must play your positively and negatively numbered cards in an increasing or decreasing sequence, kicking your rivals butt through wicked strategies and tactics, leading your blood thirsty crew to victory.

You must try to get rid of your cards by deploying ATTACK cards, COUNTER-ATTACK and REVOKE cards, cards that allow you to predict the next players move, SKIP and FORCE cards and many more!!

To win this highly strategic game, you must decide which cards to play, when to play them and which of your rival Bosses to target.
The game is kids friendly, lots of fun and easy to play.

name: Partying Puppies
description:
Partying Puppies is a lighthearted walk through a land of Puppyliciousness, with a dark zombie undercurrent that you are always trying to avoid. The object of the game is simple, be the last puppy standing as the other players fall to the zombie apocalypse; the last player not to be bitten by a zombie and get infected by the virus wins! It's that easy.

The twist of Partying Puppies is not only do you get to avoid getting bit by presenting an antidote card, or skip a turn, or the usual expected game mechanics but there are physical tasks to accomplish along the way. As a result, it's a combination card game, truth or dare, and charade mix. To progress a card may call on you to bark like a pup,fetch something, or force another player to do your ridiculous task.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Fantasy, Horror, Humor, Party Game, Print & Play, Zombies

name: John Carter: Warlord of Mars – The Board Game
description:
Description from the publisher:

In John Carter: Warlord of Mars – The Board Game, you'll enact the greatest adventures across the ancient world of Barsoom as you lead your heroes through crumbling ruins and take to the skies in the beautiful ships of the Helium Navy. Can you save Barsoom from ruin at the hands of dastardly scientists or ancient forces?
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Novel-based, Science Fiction

name: Total Transmogrification
description:
Take on the role of mighty shape shifters. By using powerful attacks and assuming the form of mighty beasts the shifters do battle to see who will reign supreme. The first player to empty their hand is the winner of the duel and can lay claim to the title of the Ultimate Shape Shifter.

Play

Select a Form - Each player selects one Form Card from their stack of face down Form Cards and places in the center of the table but in front of them.

Select a Combat Style - Each player then selects one of their combat style cards from their hand and places it face down besides their form card.

Reveal - All cards are flipped face up.

Resolution: The success of a combat style depends on the form.
If successful, players put the Combat Style Card face down in the discard pile.
If unsuccessful, players put the combat style card back in their hand.

End of turn - Players put the Form Card they just used aside, face-up and return any previously used Form Cards back to their stack.

Winning

The game ends when a player ends a turn with no Combat Style Cards in their hand.

Note

This contains all three Transmogrification Games; Transmogrification, Advance Transmogrification and Epic Transmogrification.

name: Commanders: Tactical Strategy Game
description:
Dice-based combat with tile-based resource gathering. Spend resources to expand your armies, upgrade soldiers, or climb the tech tree.

The goal of the game is to capture 20 enemy soldiers. The first player to do this wins. However, if all of one player's soldiers have been captured (they have no more on the board or in their reserve pile), then the player who has the highest number of enemy soldiers captured wins.

The board is made up of hexagon-shaped tiles set up in a large hexagon shape. These tiles consist of six different kinds of resource tiles as well as a base tile in the middle of the board and at each of the six corners.

As players move soldiers from tile to tile, they leave behind Possession Markers to claim those tiles as part of their territory.

If you expand too far away from a base tile, another player could move in behind you, separating your territory from a base tile and capturing your soldiers.

Each turn you may collect one resource card for each soldier you have on the board - corresponding with the resource tiles they occupy.

On your turn, you can trade resource cards with other players regardless of whether or not they are your ally. Your resource cards can be spent on a wide variety of items to help you win.

name: COLOR: Strategy Board Game
description:
Discover territories, collect resources, build, upgrade and pass through events!

COLOR: Strategy Board Game is a turn-by-turn multi-player game where players are colonizing territories, collecting resources, building connections and mines, discovering hidden lands and passing through positive or negative events.

It can be played by two, up to four players aged ten years and up. The playing time is around 30 to 60 minutes. The game can be easily played even at the very first time without being an experienced player.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Modular Board, Network and Route Building, Trading

name: Stockopolis
description:
User summary

The action revolves around a twenty-four card chance deck and a pair of six-sided dice, three numbers of each die are green and the other three are red.

Each player begins the game with $40,000. After the deck of cards is shuffled and placed face down on the superfluous game board, the top card is drawn and read aloud to establish the conditions of trades for that player. That player follows the direction on the card. The dice are rolled and the results are enacted based on the chart on the card.

After twenty four turns, the deck is depleted and the Power Play round begins. Each person, in turn, chooses one last trade and rolls the dice and check the card for each individual result.

The final round of play has each player roll the dice one last time to determine if each player must pay a trading fee.

Now, the game is over and the player with the greatest net worth is the winner.

name: Charlie's Angels Throws Bullets
description:
Charlie's Angels Throws Bullets (Lanza Balas) skill game with Farrah Fawcett, Kate Jackson and Jaclyn Smith pictured.

RULES:
1) Tap & tilt cardboard so that bullets begin in the start position and enter maze.
2) The goal is to get each bullet in its own chamber.
3) Each bullet that enters the waste area become "loose cannonballs".
4) When 5 bullets become loose cannonballs, the game is over.
5) The player who places the most bullets in chambers in the shortest time wins.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Travel in Time
description:
Ταξίδι στο Χρόνο ("Time Travel") is an educational game in which 2-4 players are been asked about important facts from history of Greece and the other world. The game is played with four different ways, depending on the difficulty you want to play, if you want to use sand timer etc.

The game consists of 500 cards, 200 blue(easy) and 300 red (difficult) and 1 sand timer, and every player can choose the color of the card, so children with different ages can play together.

name: Avalanche
description:
The charge is set, the choppers are primed, and the riding conditions are nearly perfect. It's time to shred this slope like no other!

In Avalanche, each player assumes the role of an adrenaline crazed snowboarder, and participates in an event where riders deliberately race an avalanche (and each other) down the mountain. It is of course important to stay in front of the snow, and to try and finish the event first, but what really matters to these shredders is bragging rights. In the end, whoever has the most to brag about wins!

Each round, players will simultaneously choose up to three action cards to bet, and place them face down on the table. Once everyone has decided which moves they want to try and pull off, they reveal their cards, and each player rolls in turn order for the resources they need to successfully complete their actions. Some actions are easier to pull off than others, but will usually grant you either fewer bragging rights, less combo, or less movement.

After each player has completed their rolling phase, the avalanche is advanced, and anyone who is caught by it must subsequently roll for an immediate rescue. Once they've managed to successfully latch onto a helicopter, they lift out, land one space in front of the avalanche, and a new round begins.

name: Teh Cutest Wittle Awwpocawpse
description:
The Four Horsemen of the Apocalypse come to Earth to collect all souls.

The goal is to bring about the Awwpocawpse by wipe away the planet's entire population in 4 turns. Be the horseman with the greatest collection of souls at the end.

Each player take one horseman (Death, Famine, Pestilence and War) and moves over the game board (the world) and snap up as many souls as possible. Each time they can use 3 Action Points to achieve that goal. Actions that can be taken are:

Move to an adjacent territory
Reap: take a population token from the territory they occupy or adjacent to.
Use a special ability, as described on the character's card.


The game is oriented at children.
mechanics: Action Points, Area Movement, Cooperative Game

name: The City of Gold
description:
A spin-and-move race game for 2-4 players with a man on foot, a man on horseback, a man in a car, and finally a man in an airplane. All four compete to be the first to reach the City of Gold. The man on horse moves 2x as fast as the man on foot. The car moves 3x as fast and the airplane 4x as fast as the man on foot. The airplane has the longest distance to travel while the man on foot has the shortest.

As in many race games, two players cannot occupy the same space at the same time. The person spinning knocks the occupant back to start. Blue spaces on the board are "safe" spaces where the occupant cannot be dislodged. The player spinning returns to start.

The player with the airplane must hit the red #4 by the exact number to enter the City of Gold. Likewise, the car must hit the red #3, the horse the red #2. and the man on foot the red #1. Only then may the player progress to the finish. The first player reaching the finish is the winner.

name: To The Last Drop of Blood The Battle of Kobani October 2014
description:
By the beginning of October, 2014, the first set piece battle in the war with the radical ISIS terrorists occurred at Kobani, Syria, along the Syrian‐Turkish border. ISIS intended to secure this border town to make it easier for their volunteers to enter Syria from Turkey. But, like many battles, it was a battle that need not to have occurred. ISIS volunteers had entered from Turkey from many crossing points but the one difference was its close proximity to the ISIS capital of Raqqa. It was that reason that ISIS decided to fight a more conventional battle this time. It seemed like a sure win as up to 4000 ISIS soldiers gradually descended upon the Kobani area along with some 25‐30 AFVs from captured Iraqi booty when Iraq allowed the city of Mosul to fall. These AFV's, American M1 and T‐72M were still formidable weapons even in inexperienced hands and add to this numerous artillery guns from war booty, and ISIS was almost assured a victory. But like at Stalingrad in WW2, where the Russians refused to be defeated, the Kurdish YPG (People's Protection Units) felt the same. Kobani had been in Kurdish hands and as ISIS swept many Kurdish towns into their hands and slaughtered them, the Kurds decided to make a stand.

A map hex is 550 yards across. Each unit represents a 100 men and each turn represents one week. The game lasts from Oct 1 to Jan 15. Leaders represent a single person, while AFVs represent 5 five tanks. Artillery units represent one battery of 4-6 guns.

name: Dora ABC-Pilot
description:
Dora the Explorer travels to her friends.
By travelling the kids learn to write the letters of the alphabeth.
There are 13 cards for the 26 letters. On each letter there are ways where the players figure have to move to the friends of Dora (also on the letter) Which way they have to go is written on the card. There are chips which show each a friend. Finding the right chip allow to move.
categories: Children's Game, Educational, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Aggressivität Partnerschaft-Spielserie
description:
With this game the player's reaction on aggressive utterance of the other players is rated.

1 player gives the instruction and makes the Rating (-3 to 3 points for each reaction)

Each player gets 20 of the 120 cards. On a player's turn, another player chooses 1 of his cards and attacks the active player with the aggressive sentence on the Card. The player has to react in 5 seconds. The more positive he reacts (open for further discussions) the more Points he will get from the moderator.

Whoever has the highest positive sum of points after 20 rounds, wins the game.

Note: Although a player count of 8 and a card count of 120 doesn't seem to make sense (8 people would need 160 cards), the player range of 4-8 is given in the rules. No rule change for 7-8 players seems to have been provided.

name: Remy
description:
The player who has first moved all his 4 Pins over the board wins.

The game board is a 6x8 Chess field.

This game is a mixture between Pachesi and Chess.

Players roll a die. With 6 the Player has to place a pin on the first row of the plan.

The figures move like the figures in Chess. Which Chess figure they are at the moment is shown in a little hole in the field where the figure stands. There is a board below the fields. This can be moved in the positions 1-6. Each position changes the chess values for all fields. The rolled die shows on which position this board is moved.

All chess figures of a player on the board are moved in each turn.

The player has to throw out an opponent figure if possible.

name: Mungo
description:
The game board shows 4 trees which grow from the center to all 4 edges.

Each leaf of the trees is one field where the figures can move.

There are some spaces between the leaves, where the figures have to move around. The figures can even move from branch to branch or from tree to tree if the leaves are neighbored.

At the beginning of the game places his 8 colored stones on different leaves (2 on each turn until all are placed)

If a Player can jump over an own stone he lines it with other own stoned (jumped over in previous rounds) to a line (namesd snake).
If all own stones (which are on the board) are lined, the player moves his snake instead of his pawn.

If he reaches one of the start fields with his snake he can place the Stones of his snake on the nest fields, in the middle of the board. Fields have to be free.

The number of fields the player is allowed to move his pawn or snake is driffen by an additional figure, the Mungo.

The Mungo is moving on the top line of leaves of the trees (at the edge of the board). The number of leaves the branch where the Mungo is, is the number the Player can move. Additional the length of his snake (number of stones) enhances accordingly the movement number.
The Mungo is moved the doubled number of the calculted movement number.

There are additonal rules for removing and adding stones from the board.

Game ends when all fields in the middle (between the trees)are filled with stones. The player with the majority of stones in the middle wins.

name: ISNOGUD Endlich Kalif ?!
description:
The game theme is based on the comics of Isnogud who always tries to become caliph instead of the actual caliph Harun al Pussah.

The game is about jewels. Isnogud tries to hold four different colors of them to win.

At the beginning Tunichgud (Assistent of Isnogud) has 1 of each 4 colors and Isnogud has 4 from each color.

On a player's turn he rolls the die and moves his 1 figure clockwise or anticlockwise on the track.

If the color of the field is equal with the 1 of the stone Colors the player gets one of this from Isnogud.

If the players have all 5 stones of 1 color they win.

If the Color of the field is black, one of the 12 cards is opened. They show 8 times Isnogud and 4 times the caliph.

If the card shows the fourth caliph the players win if it shows the sixth Isnogud the players lose.
categories: Children's Game, Comic Book / Strip, Dice, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Word Shark
description:
From the box: "Feed the Sharks! How many words can you make? Use word families to build reading, spelling, and comprehension skills."

Word Shark is an educational board game where players compete to use tiles to build or complete words. It comes with two-sided mats, offering two ways to play.

Side one, the Shark Mat, has five different incomplete words, each with the first letter missing. The letter tiles with consonants are placed in a pile face down. Each player in turn chooses a tile and tries to complete one of the words on his or her mat with the letter. If a word cannot be completed, the tile is returned to the pile face down. The first player to complete all five words wins.

Side two, the Ocean Mat, challenges players to make as many words as possible on their mats. Each player starts by drawing an agreed number of starting red consonant tiles and yellow vowel tiles. Players then work simultaneously to create as many words as possible on their mats. Players may continue to draw or trade tiles from the center pile to continue making words. (The rules do no specify how many tiles can be taken at a time). Players can decide whether to make words individually or in crossword fashion. The winner can be either the player who made the most words or the player who used the most tiles.

name: Paper Airplane Flying Game
description:
Paper Airplane Flying Game is a dexterity game where players fold paper airplanes and then fly them toward a board representing a landing strip, trying to land them in the highest point value areas. The highest point value areas are both smaller and further away, making it harder to score higher point values.

Description from the package: "First, fold your paper airplanes following the instructions. Next, stand 2-3 paces from the front of the game board. Throw a plane and try to land it on the runway, aiming for the highest points. Let each player take a few practice turns. Then, throw one plane per turn. Whoever has the most points at the end of the game wins!"

Players may decide on their own how many turns to play and how to score plane points (i.e. exactly where the plane must land and how it must be placed to score points for section it lands in.)
categories: Action / Dexterity, Aviation / Flight, Children's Game

name: Curious George Adventures Pop-Up Candy Game
description:
In Curious George Adventures Pop-Up Candy Game, players compete to be the first to reach the Man in the Yellow Hat while collecting as much candy as possible along the way.

The game comes with packages of Rascals candy, which are placed in the candy circle on the board. Players choose a game piece and place it on the start square. They take turns rolling a die marked with various fruits, then move their piece to the next matching fruit on the track. Along the way, players may land on spaces that cause them to move forward or backward or lose or gain candy. Some spaces have pop-open doors which have hidden instructions inside. The first player to reach the end of the track wins and gets to eat all his earned candy. Other players must return their candy to the candy circle and go hungry.

name: Apple Addition
description:
From the box: "Practice number recognition and basic addition with this fun apple-picking game."

In Apple Addition, each player uses a two-sided card shaped like an apple tree. There are two way to play.

Level 1 - Pick & Match Apples: Each player takes an apple tree card showing several numbers. Players then take turns randomly choosing an apple marker from the box. Each marker shows a number of apple seeds. The player must correctly count the seeds and then, if it matches a number on their card, place it over the number. The marker is then flipped. If the player counted correctly and the number matches, the marker stays on the card. If the number does not match one on the player's card or the player counts wrong, the marker goes back in the box. If the player draws an apple with a worm, he or she must put an apple from his tree back on the box. An apple core causes loss of a turn. First player to cover all the numbers on his or her tree wins.

Level 2 - Apple Addition: Each tree displays three addition problems. The game is played by the same rules. The first player to find the answers to all three math problems wins.

name: Ninja Game
description:
The object of the game is to survive your journey and enter the palace. Along the way you are challenged by masters of ancient oriental weapons, pick and pass cards and spaces you land on. Also you are confronted by with the pit, which is the house of Dim Mak, and by the March, which is guarded by the fearful dragon.
You are competing with palace ninja all along the way. Each player can attack or challenge opposing players during his journey. Combative point tokens are exchanged. Spinning shuriken wheel is used to advance each players ninja.

name: Paper Doll Game
description:
A poem on the box describes the game: "A Thoughtful Girl must dress with care. / What goes with what? What shall you wear? / The spinner says to pick some shoes. / But only YOU know which you'll choose. / And with your clothing you'll select / the hobby that you most respect. / Pursue your vision with a passion-- / There's more to life than only fashion! / The first one dressed and on her way / has won the game. / Do you want to play?"

Each player chooses a paper doll and take turns spinning the spinner. The spinner will tell them which piece of clothing or accessory to add to their doll. One space on the spinner requires the spinner to lose a piece. The first player to completely dress and equip his or her doll wins.

The game is notable for its diverse paper doll characters, multi-ethnic outfits and selection of hobbies that is less stereotypically girly, such as astronomy, guitar and science.

name: I Remember: A Matching Game
description:
I Remember: a Matching Game is part of the Crayola Games line. It is a new twist on the classic game Memory. Like Memory, a collection of tiles is placed face-down. In I Remember, a spinner is added and tiles are assigned to one of four categories (food, animals, toys or transportation). The game can be played at three levels. Level one is played with only one category of tiles, reducing the number to make matching easier. Game play is identical to Memory--players turn over two tiles trying to find a match. If the tiles match, the player keeps them. If not, they are replaced in the same positions and the next player plays. When all tiles have been claimed, the player with the most tiles wins.

In level two, players spin the spinner to determine which of four categories they must match. The current player then turns over a single tile. If it matches the category spun, the player keeps the tile. If not, it is replaced in its original position. The next player then attempts to match the same category. Once a match is made, the next player spins to determine the new category and play continues. When all tiles have been claimed, the player with the most tiles wins.

Level three is played in a similar way to level two, except after spinning players must find two tiles with matching pictures in the category spun.

name: Family Happenings
description:
Family Happenings is a roll-and-move game designed to be used as a tool for stimulating discussions during therapy sessions with children. The rules note that it "should only be used by a trained professional."

In the game, players roll a die to move pawns on a track. As they move, they land on various types of spaces. On Feeling Card spaces, the player must draw a card with a feeling printed on it and describe a time when he or she experienced that feeling. On a Do A Stunt space, the player draws a card and performs the action printed on it. On a Mail space, a card with the start of the first sentence of a letter written to a friend or family member is drawn. The player must complete the sentence. On a Family Happenings space, the player draws a card with a question that refers to a family problem that the child may have experienced (cards are marked with categories so the therapist can customize the deck to his clients). The player must answer the question. Roll 'n Go squares occur at junctions in the path and allow the player to roll again and move in a direction determined by their roll. Sent To Your Room squared require the player to go to their "room," a space marked with their pawn's color. They must then answer the question in their room before rolling to leave the room on their next turn.
