On a Spin space, the player spins a spinner and may gain or lose a turn or gain or lose chips depending on the roll. At the end of each player's turn, he or she receives one chip as allowance.

Players attempt to reach the end of the track, which if the peak of the roof on the house-shaped track. The game may end in one of two ways. The first player to reach the peak of the house can be declared the winner, or a time limit can be imposed, with the player holding the most chips when time runs out winning. In this version, reaching the finish space brings a bonus of five chips, after which the player may continue to move on the track.

name: What Do You See? Colors
description:
In What Do You See? Colors, players choose face-down cards, trying to be the first to complete a set and win the game. There are three different ways to play.


Search and Match Colors - Each player takes a card marked with a colored star designating which color he or she will collect. Picture cards are placed face-up in the center of the table. Each player in turn takes a card to match their color. If the color matches, the player keeps the card. If not, he or she must put it back. Play continues until all players have six matched color cards. This game is for very young players, and is meant to teach color recognition.



Seven That Match - This game is played similarly to Search and Match Colors. In this version, each player has two color cards to match. Cards are placed face down. Players pick one card at a time and try to match it to one of their cards. If it matches, the player keeps the card. If not, it goes back to the center face down. The first player to collect six cards matching the color of one of his or her star cards wins.



What Color Do You See? - In this version, each player has a game board with spaces for eight different colors. All cards are placed face-down on the table. Players take turns choosing a face-down card. If the player doesn't yet have the color, he or she covers the corresponding space on his or her card. If he or she does have the color, the card goes back face down. In this version, there are also wild cards, which can be placed on any color. The first player to cover all colors on the card wins the game.

name: Cop Salad
description: Trick-taking game based on characters from the comic series Fried Pickle Noir by J.R. Mounts. Players assemble teams to take on jobs in the crime-ridden city of The Pits. The goal is control the teams and win the jobs by selecting the right Good Guys, Mobsters, or Shady Characters to send in. Shady Characters can count as both Good Guys or Mobsters, and each one adds their own twist to the game!
categories: Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Humor, Mafia

name: Ghoulball
description:
Ghoulball is a fast-moving card game based on the favorite sport of the monstrous citizens of Moonrise, from the comic series Scairy Tales by J.R. Mounts.

Ghoulball combines quirky characters and CCG-like battle mechanics into a crazy sports simulation played from a shared deck. Players take on the role of team managers and coaches, recruiting players, setting strategies, and attempting to score more goals than their opponents. The real fun begins when the Ghoulballs themselves come alive and impact the game in surprising ways!

More about the game and the world of Scairy Tales can be found at The Ghoulball Clubhouse and scairytalesnoir.com.
categories: Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Horror, Sports

name: Add On
description:
User summary:
This is a majority game in which players stack their 6 tiles depicting the numbers 1 through 6 on 3 spaces on a common board. A player who occupies 2 or more spaces wins the game. A player may roll his dice at any time and use them as a tile of the number of depicted pips. Players are free to choose whether to use their dice.

To place a tile on top of an already placed tile, the new tile must bear a higher number. Additionally, even numbers must be placed on top of even numbers and odd numbers on top of odd numbers. The fact that 2 or more tiles that add up to the higher number may also be placed is a key feature of the game.

Publisher's summary:
お互いに1～6の数字がプリントされた６個の駒を３カ所のボード上のスペースに重ねて置いて行き、2つ以上のスペースを占拠した方が勝つ陣取りゲームです。
任意のタイミングでダイスを振って、出た目の数字駒として使うことができます。ダイスを使う使わないは任意です。
既に置かれた駒の上に駒を重ねて置く場合は、重ねる駒の数字より大きく、奇数の上には奇数を、偶数の上には偶数を置かなくてはなりません。
ただし２個以上の駒の合計数でも置けるのがミソです。

name: Street Race: Katukilpailu
description:
Street Race -boardgame is a game for car enthusiast. The Main goal of the game is to become "The Car King".

Game features:


Hot Rod City which has 44 different places/functions (for example garage, casino, court house, traffic lights, police station, chip tuning, car repair, speed camera, slippery road, hot rod shop, used car shop, classic car shop, sports car shop, restaurant, speed pumps (50 different cards) and so on.
Race track for track - and pinks slips race (money or car as a bet)
Buy and sell cars (30 different carcards) and race against other players
Put pedal to the metal on track, but in the city watch out for the moving police unit and speed camera (or you will get the speeding ticket, 50 different tickets)
Lots of playing money
And many more


Game is a combination of luck and tactics!

Different playing modes:

The Car King (winner is who buys first one sport car (easy) or winner is who buys first two sport cars(harder)).
Elimination mode also possible
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Variable Player Powers

name: Halo: Fleet Battles – UNSC Fleet Box
description:
Few in the upper-echelons of the UNSC are as respected as Admiral Lord Hood. As a veteran of numerous military campaigns throughout his military career, Hood is an outstanding choice to lead your fleet to victory. Supported by the Artificial Intelligence Cortana, one of the most potent and valuable assets in humanity’s arsenal, your fleet will ensure the Covenant pays a heavy price in ships and soldiers.

This is an ideal way to upgrade an existing UNSC force or begin building your brand new fleet. Within this boxed set you will find two Epoch-class Heavy Carriers, four Marathon-class Heavy Cruisers and thirty Paris-class Frigates. Armed with Light MACs and an array of impressive missile batteries, the Epoch is able to deploy both Bombers and Interceptors into the heat of battle. Marathon Heavy Cruisers are your bulk heavy hitters, commonly fielded in Battle Groups with Paris-class Frigates in either Arrowhead or Trident Formation.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Video Game Theme, Wargame

name: Halo: Fleet Battles – Covenant Fleet Box
description:
A giant even amongst the Sangheili, Xytan ‘Jar Wattinree is revered by his comrades for his incredible prowess in battle. Supported by the Minister of Etiology, a minor Prophet in the Covenant during the Human-Covenant war, this fleet delivers the leadership needed to harness a tireless religious zeal that will eventually lead to the Fall of Reach.

This is an ideal way to upgrade an existing Covenant force or begin building your brand new fleet. Within this boxed set you will find two ORS Heavy Cruisers, two CCS-class Battlecruisers and sixteen SDV Heavy Corvettes. Armed with a host of plasma-based weaponry, the ORS and CCS are able to launch both Bombers and Interceptors directly into the heart of battle. Supported by SDV Heavy Corvettes, watch your heavy vessels lay down overwhelming weapons fire and obliterate your enemy.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Video Game Theme, Wargame

name: Duel List
description:
Duel List is a competitive knowledge listing game in which players simultaneously list as many items in a topic as they can in 60 seconds on a piece of paper.

Gameplay: On a turn, the active player picks one of the 9 knowledge decks and rolls 2 dice. 1st die chooses category, 2nd die chooses specific topic. Players have 60 seconds to list as many items as they can in that topic on a piece of paper. Once the time is up, the active player starts to list out the items they wrote. Players list out their answers in clockwise order, scoring as needed. If any other player shared an answer, every player score 1 point for that answer. Otherwise, the player receives 2 points for every valid, unique answer.

End of game: Once every player has had the chance to be the active player and choose a knowledge deck, then the game is over. Count up points, whoever has the most points wins.

name: Alpha Colony: The Galaxy Prime Expansion
description:
Build a settlement...in Galaxy Prime!

Colonial settlements have breached the infinite reaches of the universe and found their way to Galaxy Prime. Over 2 dozen of the indigenous races now vie for new territory on an unexplored world, each bringing their own unique abilities and culture to the struggle. They will have new terrain to develop and new buildings to erect, as well as new events to contend with. So whether you choose to colonize with the militant Kor or buy your way to victory with the wealth of the Thasians the fate of Galaxy Prime's Alpha Colony is in your hands!

name: Mecha 1945
description:
Mecha 1945 is a tactical board game where you pilot big robots in a world war II alternate history.

It is a turn-based game, programming and simultaneous resolution. Each turn you can program movement, technic and combat order and resolved them on 91 hexagons board representing Manhattan.

The game is customizable with a lot of game modes, 9 board parts, around 190 cards to build your own mecha and a website with a 3D design module. The idea is that you can assemble the arms, legs, torsos, etc. so as to design the robot that suits you the most. You will have a 3D model that you can output with a 3D printer.

Depending the game mode you have choose you have to destroy foe Mecha, stay in the center of the map, capture flag, escort VIP,...

Play with you friends in teams or against them!
categories: Fighting, Science Fiction, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Action Queue, Open Drafting, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Patagonia War
description:
Argentina and Chile almost came to blows over Patagonia at the turn of the century before war was averted. What if peace negotiations had not been achieved? Who would have won the naval contest? Now, using Avalon Hill's Victory in the Pacific (VITP), you can find out for yourself.

Avalon Hill games, though dated, are still among the most fun to play. Unfortunately, they can take a long, long time to play. Even game of VITP can take a good 4-6 hours to play to completion. Patagonia War allows players to play a game with a similar system, but in a much shorter time (5 turns, 3 sea areas, 26 ships).

VAIPA Quarterly #10, Patagonia War, contains the following items:

1. The Rulebook
2. The Map
3. Twelve Chile ship counters. Fourteen Argentina ship counters. Six Control markers (counters).
4. Small zip lock bags to place your counters into (Your option).

In addition, since this game is based on Avalon Hill’s Victory in the Pacific game, you will need a copy of that game. Specifically, you will need:

a. Damage markers
b. Disabled markers
c. Sunk markers
d. Dice
e. Rulebook

name: Perplexity
description:
Perplexity is a word game in which you attempt to collect letters to spell a 5-letter word. Letters are collected by landing on spaces containing a letter and answering a question. Questions are made up of some form of wordplay (double meanings, anagrams, sounds, etc).

Letters may be stolen or swapped with other players when landing on special locations on the board. All successful actions require answering a question.

The first player to collect 5 letters, spell a word with those letters, make it back to the center of the board and answer a question correctly wins the game.
mechanics: Pattern Building, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: SlapCAT
description:
From the publisher:

SlapCAT is a wildly fast reflex game full of slapped cats, cats in hats, dead rats, and poo. Players race to slap the parts they need, then try to build a beautiful cat while throwing fishbones and stealing from their neighbors.

Each round players build a hand of cards by slapping from a limited selection of cat parts. The players then play from this hand of cards to build a high scoring cat in front of them. But watch out -- your neighbors may attack and take your only head! What's a cat with no head?!

A mixture of reflexes, card drafting and strategic card play, SlapCAT is feisty fun that's over so fast your friends and family will be clawing at you to play again!
categories: Action / Dexterity, Animals, Card Game, Party Game, Print & Play
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Take That

name: Seas of Iron: Battleship Expansion Pack
description:
From the publisher:

The Battleship expansion pack contains two additional iconic ships, German Battleship Bismarck and Japanese Battleship Yamato.

name: Ormen Långe
description: Ormen Långe is a children's game where the players roll a die with different colors on the sides, telling which square to go to. If the square has a snake piece on it, the player can collect this and add to his snake to make it longer. The player with the longest snake at the end of the game is the winner.

name: Revansch
description: Revansch is a real-estate game, where player starts with low capital and collects sets of properties and invests to industry. The player moves around the board trying to visit places like bank, stockmarket and salary. The winner is the only player left after the other players left the game due to bankruptcy.

name: Jeu du Cirque
description: Jeu du Cirque is a board game that is played in 15 minutes. It consists of a board, 4 pawns and 2 dice, each for a different level reached on he board, with colours and pictures on the die sides. Players roll the dice and advance their tokens along the board, like in Snakes and Ladders. Depending on the square that they end up on, they can either ride along the neck of the giraffe and win tickets, or descend on the trapeze and fall back several spaces. The winner is the player who arrives first at the circus tent, at the top of the board.

name: Devine Super Héros
description: Devine Super Héros is a game of memory and deduction. Each game lasts 15 minutes. Among a hand of 16 cards, each player chooses a character and places it on a stand before them, hidden from their opponent. By asking each other questions, each player must guess the Super Hero chosen by the other player. The first to guess the other's superhero wins! This plays very similarly to Guess Who.

name: N30N City Rumble: Final Boss
description:
Final Boss is the long awaited mini expansion for the base game:

It adds 3 new fighters, an entire new mode (co op) 3 new "boss cards" and new type of cards to be used in the new mode.

The package is small but it adds a lot to the base game
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Rock-Paper-Scissors, Simultaneous Action Selection, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: Big Box Office "The Movie Business Game!"
description:
Big Box Office "The Movie Business Game!" lets you become the Producer, Director, Writer and Agent of a Big Box Office Hollywood movie!

When you arrive in Hollywood, you first go to work. After you make $10,000 you enter the main playing board. As you move your token around the board, you accumulate "Industry Title Rings," such as Black for Producer, Red for Director, Blue for Writer and Green for Agent.

As you go around the board, you accumulate "Movie Titles" when you enter the theatre where the movie is playing. You enter the theatre and multiply your profits depending on how many "Industry Title Rings" you have on your token.

Other squares have "Pick Director (or other industry title) Card." These cards direct you to other areas of the board, which can be good or bad, depending on which "Movie Titles" you have.

You can also land on a "Spin the Wheel" square. This wheel will either give or take away your industry title.

The first person to make $1,000,000 wins the game.

name: Balazoo Jungle
description:
From the box front:

The 3D Balancing Animal Game. Easy to learn, exciting and quick to play and Educational too! To beat the clock, pile on the pressure, don't tip the balance. Hundreds of ways to win.

From the box rear: The first player turns over top card and the sand timer. The player then attempts to Score by performing a successful Balazoo before the timer runs out. A successful Balazoo occurs when all 5 animals are arranged in a pattern very similar to that shown on the configuration card. The player must take their hands away and the animals must freely stand.

name: SeraQetra
description:
A chess-style game using a hexagonal grid (with seven cells across each edge) and 25 custom pieces per player. Pieces may move in straight lines in up to 12 directions, either through the sides or corners of the cells, capturing pieces by landing on them. A player loses when their "God" is captured.

The game supports either two or three players, with each player starting with control of a "universe" that is the region of cells formed within the triangle of three consecutive corners of the board. In a two-player game, the universes are opposite. In a three-player game, they form a complete ring around the edge of the board.

Players may place their pieces anywhere within their universe at the start of the game (with no fixed set-up), even holding some pieces back to be placed on the board (in their universe) during play. The exceptions are the three corners, which must be empty before play begins (the central corner is termed the "throne" and the two flanking corners are the "palace gates").

The types of playing piece (with number of pieces per player listed in brackets) move as follows:

God (1): one step in any direction.
Ruler (2): unlimited steps in any direction.
Ambassador (4): unlimited steps through sides only.
Warrior (4): unlimited steps through corners only.
Priest (2): one step through sides only.
Spy (2): one step through corners only.
Minion (10): one step in any direction.


Only a God or Ruler can occupy the throne. A Minion can be substituted with a different captured piece if it reaches an opponent's palace gates (to any piece except a Ruler) or an opponent's throne (where it can be substituted for a captured Ruler).

name: The Metabolism Game
description:
An educational game that uses Abstracts of Sciences to assist students learning the major oxidative pathways, glycolysis and the citric acid cycle. The multicolored gameboard shows these pathways with each metabolic intermediate identified by name, structural formula and number of carbon atoms. The names of the enzymes are printed on arrows that symbolize the chemical reactions of the pathways.

The players move tokens representing carbon atoms along the pathways. A molecule of a carbon compound is symbolized by a stack of the proper number of tokens. Thus glucose would have six tokens, and 3-phosphoglyceraldehyde, three.
A deck of 70 “enzyme cards” is used to regulate the play. Each card shows a reaction present on the board with the name of the enzyme. To move a molecule from one step in a pathway to the next, a player must have in hand the appropriate enzyme card. There are three enzyme cards in the deck for each reaction on the board as well as four “wild enzyme” cards which may be used to catalyze any reaction. The game makes use of ATP “currency” of three denominations: one, three and ten ATP units. The ATP is gained or lost by a player depending on the reactions being carried out as the game proceeds. The object of the game is to gain more ATP than the other players. Oxidative phosphorylation is simulated by the use of tokens representing NADH and FADH, and special cards representing oxygen. Oxygen debt is simulated whenever a player with reducing power lacks oxygen cards.

name: Mech Defense
description:
Mech Defense is a cooperative, tower defense inspired, strategy game where a group of 4 players pilot 20ft Mechs and rain down destruction on their foes. Your squad fends off wave after wave of incoming enemies over 12 missions and permanently alter your battlefield with every decision and explosive attack. The more you destroy, the more you get paid, but the stronger your foes become.

As a Legacy game, with over 20 sticker sheets included in the box, players will permanently upgrade enemies and modify the map with every mission you play.

The game also includes a native application for Windows, iOS, Android, and Windows Phone to help manage progress between missions. For people who prefer not to have the digital component, players can use a printable sheet to track progress.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement

name: Godslayer: Mortans Starter Box
description:
This Mortans Starter Box contains 8 highly detailed metal miniatures for gamers and collectors.

The enclosed miniatures represent a fully playable warband of 160 points, and in addition you get a printed version of the Quick-Start Rules.

With this Mortan warband and the Quick-Start Rules you are able to immediately start playing Godslayer – the fantasy miniatures skirmish game set in a bronze age world of sword and sorcery.

Get your starter box and start discovering the world of Godslayer!
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Mythology, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Godslayer: Nordgaard Starter Box
description:
This Nordgaard Starter Box contains 8 highly detailed metal miniatures for gamers and collectors.

The enclosed miniatures represent a fully playable warband of 160 points, and in addition you get a printed version of the Quick-Start Rules.

With this Nordgaard warband and the Quick-Start Rules you are able to immediately start playing Godslayer – the fantasy miniatures skirmish game set in a bronze age world of sword and sorcery.

Get your starter box and start discovering the world of Godslayer!
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Mythology, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Godslayer: Troglodytes Starter Box
description:
This Troglodytes Starter Box contains 5 highly detailed metal miniatures for gamers and collectors.

The enclosed miniatures represent a fully playable warband of 160 points, and in addition you get a printed version of the Quick-Start Rules.

With this Troglodyte warband and the Quick-Start Rules you are able to immediately start playing Godslayer – the fantasy miniatures skirmish game set in a bronze age world of sword and sorcery.

Get your starter box and start discovering the world of Godslayer!
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Mythology, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Godslayer: Wyldfolk of Annyr Starter Box
description:
This Wyldfolk Of Annyr Starter Box contains 8 highly detailed metal miniatures for gamers and collectors.

The enclosed miniatures represent a fully playable warband of 160 points, and in addition you get a printed version of the Quick-Start Rules.

With this Wyldfolk Of Annyr warband and the Quick-Start Rules you are able to immediately start playing Godslayer – the fantasy miniatures skirmish game set in a bronze age world of sword and sorcery.

Get your starter box and start discovering the world of Godslayer!
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Mythology, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Miner
description:
Theme and goal
In Miner the players steps in the role of hardworking Miners. The Miners are searching for resources like gold and iron on a 3D Game Board. To be more efficient they have to upgrade their shovels and pickaxes and can buy additional ropes. With negotiation skills they have to sell the mined resources on the market.
The player which earns the most money wins the game.

Gameplay
The special thing about Miner is its unique 3D sandbox in the middle of the game board. The sandbox includes 180 massive resource blocks. Hidden under soil there are stone, coal, iron and gold, that want to be discovered. The player steps in the role of a miner. With negotiating skill they try to sell the mined resources on the market for a good price.
Each round a player has 10 hours to perform actions. Every action costs time, which is displayed on the player’s game tableau. When there is no time left the player can knock off work and the next player begins his turn.
What actions a player can choose?
The key element of the game is the 3D sandbox. Inside of it every player has a game character. In the sandbox the player can move, climb or mine resources. In the beginning of the game all players are standing on soil, but the deeper they dig, the more exciting it will be.

But that's easier said than done. Every player starts with only one rope. So if you want to dig deeper you should better buy some additional ropes in the town. With the mined resources you can go to the market. But be careful, the prices shown by the resource dice are changing every round. When you don’t want to sell the mined resources you have to store them in a warehouse. Every player owns a warehouse on his private deck. There are also 4 warehouses in the town available which can be rented.

If you want to rank among the best, you soon have to go to the forge and buy better tools. Of course some coins have to be reinvested but with better pickaxe your mining will be much more efficient.

If there is some time left, you can work for the day laborer to earn some coins or you can visit the tavern. In the tavern you can get some benefit cards which can really make the difference.

With all these actions you can plan your turn. If there is no time left you have to wait for the next round. Plan your turns clever and you will have the right resources at the right time. The player who owns the most coins after 14 rounds wins the game.
mechanics: Action Queue, Area Movement, Dice Rolling

name: The Fool's Journey
description:
The Fool's Journey is a tarot-based storytelling game, in which a "journey" of nine cards is constructed collaboratively by the players. Bidding (using the non-trump suits) allows players to compete for the prerogative of decisions about trump placement, and to be awarded dice.

All players are encouraged to provide their own unique narrative interpretations of the journey at the end of the game. Dice won earlier in the game are rolled to determine priority for who gets to tell a story first.

The game requires a copy of the rules, a standard 78-card tarot deck, and "a large pool of six-sided dice (Generally a box of 36 will do)." Pencil and paper are also suggested.

name: Crabs in a Crate
description:
Crabs are the perfect example of what a team should never be. When one is placed in an open crate, it quickly scuttles out. But when multiples are placed in a crate all the other crabs will never let the one escape in their own attempt to climb free.

Crabs in a Crate enjoys the fun hearted frustration of exactly that situation. Trying to be the ONE to escape when there is more than just you in the crate. Players will do their best to help their crab escape by playing cards that let them push, pull, piggyback and climb their way out of the crate. "Why not play nice and just race to the top?" one might ask. Escaping isn't the only way to win, if you are the crab to gain the most points by pulling down their opponents you can win!
Game can handle 3-6 players in a thirty-ish minute game.

name: Last 2 Standing
description:
This is the ultimate party game of revealing truths. This racy game provides instant fun for 6 to 20 players in the most stimulating, thought-provoking, hilarious, intriguing, invasive, exciting way ever! This game will eliminate attractiveness while heightening the likability of the players. Whether you are married, single, dating, in-between, just kicking with friends, straight, LGBT, or Green... this game is for you. Dating will never be any easier after playing the Last 2 Standing!
It's simple! Remain standing in the game by answering a series of intuitive unisex questions that will certainly put you at the edge of your seat with a lot of "Ah-Ha" moments, and you will be crowned as a winner. Choose a moderator. Split into sides (i.e Men vs Women). Get a token. Place the tokens on the board. Roll the die. Select a card from 1 of the 6 decks. Read the question aloud to the opposite team. Start the 30 second timer. Answer the question on a slip of paper provided. Fold up the slip of paper and turn it in the moderator or team captain. Read the response aloud. Discuss and deliberate on the LEAST favorite response of all the responses. The best answer is awarded 3 pts, second best answer is awarded 2 pts, and the 3rd best will receive 1 pt. After six (6) rounds, you will tally up the points. The one with the most points from each side will be crowned as the Last 2 Standing.

Every player on the board is on the same playing field...physically. Now it's time to stand out mentally, personally, and of course... sexually. Last 2 Standing aims to make your dating relationships easier. Additionally, the last one standing from both sides will be hailed as the most idealistic man and woman for dating! You don't believe me... well GET IN THE GAME!
categories: Card Game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Memory, Paper-and-Pencil, Team-Based Game, Voting

name: Wreck Age: Showdown at Burnt Tierra Gulch
description:
Showdown at Burnt Tierra Gulch is a 2 player starter set that will get you right into the action.

The caravan paths and walking trails through The Wilds take many travelers through Burnt Tierra Gulch. Due to the high rate of traffic, it holds strategic significance to both the Stitchers and the Drifters in the Area.

Playing Showdown at Burnt Tierra Gulch will determine who will control the gulch, and in turn, the resources that flow through it.

This box set includes 5 Drifters and 3 Stitchers and stats for all 8 models, as well as 4 pieces of resin terrain, a scenario pack, quickstart rules, and waypoint tokens.

name: Sapphire Castle
description:
The object of the game is to reach Sapphire Castle and save the crystal babbie cotton tail.Who has been turned to stone by the evil villain rock slide. Ages 3 & up. Spin your way to the finish, teleport across the board and collect gems on this fantasy adventure to save a friend.

Sapphire Castle mixes learning and fun. Children will learn basic phonics by recognizing shapes, numbers and counting their 123's.

name: The Legend of King Arthur
description:
King Arthur went off to war against the Saxons and left his kingdom ruled by its allies.

Players must influence the various characters of Great Britain, as Merlin, Morgana, Lancelot, Mordred, Guinevere, to achieve infiltrate his knights at Camelot, and thus have more chances to succeed to the throne.

Meanwhile, players must send resources to supply King Arthur and thus keep up high with the legendary monarch.

Players use up to 6 knights each in 8 to 10 game rounds, to influence the characters, gather resources and ship other resources to help King Arthur.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Auction/Bidding, Set Collection, Worker Placement

name: War of Cakes
description:
War of Cakes is a competitive game where you will face other players in a pastry aggressive competition. During the game you have to build pies with ingredients and recipes that you get during the game, but beware! the other participants can ruin your creations. Nata, dynamite, chocolate or barbed wire are just some of the ingredients that we use to achieve first place in the contest.

War of Cakes it is a turn-based game. It is a card game consisting of a deck of ingredients and other recipes. On each turn the player may draw cards and put recipes you want to build. Each player has their own cakes, but the recipes can be placed on any cake. First put the recipe and then you are adding ingredients, turn by turn. Every player is required to use an ingredient in their turn (whenever possible). An ingredient can be used on their own or others recipes.

In short, to put a piece of cake in a cake we need to take several steps:

1) Put the recipe under construction.
2) Adding the necessary ingredients
3) Put the cake recipe.

They are not used dice or the like. The strategy is that players are required to use at least one ingredient per shift. And if not well managed, it can finish putting on good ingredients good recipes from other players.

This makes it a semi-cooperative game. There are also recipes for cakes remaining points.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Take That, Tile Placement

name: King Under the Mountain
description:
You and your friends are Dwarf Lords leading an expedition to a remote mountain, rich in resources the Dwarf Kingdoms need. You each lead a group of Dwarven Miners and workers as they delve deep into the heart of the mountain. You goal is to establish a new, powerful and wealthy Dwarven kingdom and become King under the Mountain.

Each turn you will send your Dwarf Workers out to mine through the mountain, build buildings, craft jewelry, ingots, coins, and armor. You make all the decisions, no dice to determine what resources you receive. Do you mine that gold and mint coins to lure more dwarf workers to come to your banner? Or do you harvest gems to start building your hoard of jewelry?

Resources located in the tiles include:
Iron ore
Raw Gems
Gold Ore
Coal

Items which can be built as cards you hold include:
Steel ingots
Gold Ingots
Cut Gem Piles
Gold Coin Piles
Warrior Gear
Jewelry Piles.

These are produced in the following buildings which are placed onto the table as tiles, replacing caverns and mines:
Smelter
Jewelers shop
Smithy
Mint
Armory

But plan your realm layout carefully, at some point your delving will converge with those of your competitors. At that time the game changes and you will need Warriors to defend your fledgling realm. Or you may even decide to go on the attack denying the enemy their buildings and resources.

Through the building of a mighty military or a greed inspiring pile of jewelry you can become the King Under the Mountain.

name: Speed Snacks: Der schwierige Kunde
description:
With this card, your everyday stress is as owner of a fast food restaurant becomes more realistic. It was missing a crucial element: The Difficult Customer

1 Card + 1 Rule Card

name: Dice Of Debt
description:
Dice Of Debt is a "serious game" designed to help software development teams deal with the common problem of technical debt. If you're not familiar with the concept, technical debt is the drag on productivity that sloppy coding and testing create. Teams sometimes have to take shortcuts, but they pay the price, in the long term. Here's where to get it: http://www.game-change-llc.com/diceofdebt/

Teams often have a hard time justifying to their management, or to themselves, the investment needed to reduce technical debt. Fixing the existing code, or implementing practices that improve the quality of future code, have a cost. Under time pressures, and with an unclear picture of how much of a drag on productivity technical debt really is, teams are hesitant to make a hard choice, even if it increases the amount of software value that the team will eventually deliver.

The game simulates the work of an Agile software team over the course of 10 sprints. (If you're not familiar with Agile, or sprints, just suffice it to say that we're talking about the work that a team can get done in a series of 10 2-week intervals.) The 12 dice used in the game represent the team's capacity, which is split between coding new features and dealing with the burden of technical debt. You roll one set of dice to represent the value of the new features, then subtract the total from the roll of another set of dice to represent the burden of technical debt.

The players (working cooperatively, since they're the team) can decide to implement measures that will reduce technical debt. Either the pool of technical debt dice will get smaller, or you will subtract from the final result of rolling these dice. You have to set aside some time and effort to implement these technical debt-reducing measures, so your capacity for coding new features will drop temporarily.

The goal of the game is to produce the largest amount of new software value (features) by the end of the game (again, 10 turns, representing "sprints"). There's no specific "win" condition, other than to see how much better you can do, in the end, than if you had taken no action to reduce technical debt.

The real victory the players can achieve is a good conversation about what they might do, in their own work on software teams, to reduce technical debt. Now that they've seen the long-term productivity gain they can achieve from a short-term productivity loss, it will become easier to justify the difficult choices.

The game is not designed to provide an extremely accurate simulation of the benefits that each technical debt-reducing measure might provide. However, it does simulate other aspects of decision-making about technical debt. For example, the players can see how important it is to invest earlier rather than later in reducing technical debt. In these ways, the game also provides simulation value.

Dice Of Debt is going to be part of a package of materials that the Agile Alliance is producing to help people combat technical debt. We will post more specifics when we have them. The current plan is to publish this package by the end of 2015.

name: Monster Math Munch
description: Monster Math Munch is an educational math game for children in grades 4 to 6. Each player places their game piece on the start of their own track. The first player chooses a card an reads the math problem on the card to the player to their left. If that player answers correctly he or she moves one space forward. Play continues to the left until one player reaches the end space of the track, winning the game.

name: Brainy Quiz Contest
description: Brainy Quiz Contest is a trivia game for children, published in India. Each player has a token which they move along a track. On each space, they spin a spinner to choose a trivia question category. Then the quiz master chooses a card and asks them a multiple-choice question in the category chosen. If the answer is wrong, the player must choose a "punishment" card requiring them to do some sort of stunt. If the answer is correct, the player moves forward and answers another question, continuing until a wrong answer is given. The first player to reach the end of the track wins, gaining the winner's crown and prize check.

name: Synodingo
description:
Ideal for CE1 and CE2, here are 5 rules different games (Battle,
Rummy, Mistigri, SpeedoSyno and DevineMoi) to learn 200 words.

Each word, in addition to its definition, has a synonym and two antonyms.
For example: friend → ally, foe, opponent.
A fun tool that increases in difficulty, to enrich the vocabulary for second graders onward.

name: Vocadingo: CM1 CM2
description:
Following the great success of Vocadingo for kindergardeners, here is a new comical game to enrich vocabulary children 9 and over.
Four aquatic heroes arrive to study our language.
Gameplay: 200 words each with its definition, its anagram and its riddle!

Give the right answers and win the most vocabulary cards!
mechanics: Action Queue, Pattern Recognition, Questions and Answers

name: Conjudingo CE1
description:
Conjudingo includes 3 easy and fun games to practice the present, future simple and past compound tenses with kids the CE1 to the CM1.

The different animals on the cards help you verify whether the combination is correct

Conjudingo is the practical and comical tool for all conjugations in the CE1 program.

name: Conjudingo CE2
description:
Conjudingo CE2 includes 3 games easy and fun to work the verbs of the 2nd and 3rd groups present, future and imperfect (auxiliary, 1st, 2nd and 3rd groups) with the children of CE2 in the CM1. The different animals on the maps help you verify whether the combination is good.

Conjudingo is the practical and playful tool for all conjugations of the elementary school curriculum.

name: Go Monsters!
description:
GO MONSTERS!

Go Monsters! is a card/board game that uses the card mechanics of Go Fish but adds board game mechanics of grid movement, tactics decisions, strategic planning, along with smashing buildings and victory points.

Age: Above 5
Number of Players: 2 to 4
Game Time: 20 to 30 min

Components:
[52 cards] - on [6] 8.5x11 single sided PDF sheets - Monster Cards "Equal to a regular deck of cards"
[1] - 8.5 x 11 Double sided PDF sheet - Game boards
[4] - d6 dice [2 white - 2 yellow]
[16] - building counters - "or you can use cubes, dice, tokens"
[4] – Individually colored Monster figurers with base – [red, green, blue, and yellow]
[1] rule book
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Print & Play

name: Superhero KO!
description: Superhero Ko! is a simultaneous action two, four, or six player game packed with Golden Era Comic Book Superheros. Duel your fellow players in dice rolling matches to win XP. Who will be the first to KO! another player and become the hero the people need?

name: Build Me Up!
description:
Build me up! The Self-Esteem Game is a roll-and-move board game where players attempt to earn money by praising other players and building their self-esteem. Players roll a die to move on a track, landing on various letters along the way. When they land on a letter, they must use three (or four or five, depending on the level chosen) positive words describing the player to their left or right in sentences, within 30 seconds. If they are able to do so, they earn an amount of money that corresponds to the difficulty of the letter (for example Y and U earn $1000, A and S earn $300). One player is The Negotiator, a sort of gamemaster. Players who are unable to think of enough words can buy a word from the negotiator (who has a book of suggested words) for half the value of the letter space. The Negotiator also controls the money and the timer.

Players may not repeat words that have already been used. Other players may challenge a word used by a player as being incorrect or not positive. If the challenge is successful, the challenger gets double the value of the letter. If the challenge fails, the original player gets double value. The rules specify that a dictionary should be consulted by the Negotiator. There are also "self-esteem" space where players draw a card which describes an effect of high or low self-esteem. These cards either give extra money to the player or cause a penalty to be paid. If a player must pay a penalty and has too little money, he or she must get a loan from The Negotiator, which must be paid back plus 10% interest.

Game play continues for 30 minutes. At the end of the game, the player with the most money wins, and is awarded a Certificate of Merit.

name: Multiplay
description:
Multiplay is a "multiplication learning game of luck and skill." It is played on a board numbered from 2 to 9 across the top and along one side, forming a grid. Chips showing all the multiplication products of the numbers on the grid are included. Each player takes an equal number of chips from a face-down pile and places them standing on edge, so they are visible to the owning player and hidden from other players. Leftover chips are placed on the correct squares of the board.

In turn, each player spins a spinner, looks at his or her chips, and places any chips corresponding to the number spun onto the grid. If the chip is placed incorrectly (i.e. not the product of the numbers in the row and column) the player must take the chip back and lose a turn. If the spinning player does not have the number spun, he passes to the player on his left, who may then play that number if possible. If not, play continues to pass to the left until a player can play the number. If no one has the chip, the first player to spin spins again until someone can play a number.

The first player to play all his or her tiles wins.

name: Little Dungeon: Maximus
description:
Seek adventure, loot the dungeon, and maybe fight a dinosaur or defeat an ancient king. Choose to be a wizard, rogue, barbarian or a knight. Work with your fellow adventurers or choose to win at any costs.

Little Dungeon: Maximus is the highly anticipated second entry into the Little Dungeon tabletop universe. This expansion adds: player roles, abilities, new bosses, new monsters weapons, armor, relic loot, traps, and rule updates and enhancements.

name: Castle Builder
description:
Castle Builder is a card drafting game where the cards you select build a castle that will house Nobles, Knights, Servants, Princesses and even a King and Queen! There are 3 rounds of drafting where the cards get more valuable, but more expensive and your gold is dwindling. Fortunately each card you add to your castle has 3 attributes, Victory Points for winning, Defense to protect against other players attacks and Favor. Favor is added to your Victory Points at the end of the game, but in between rounds it can be traded in for more gold so you can afford the more expensive cards, but then gold is not worth any Victory Points. There are other ways to gain gold such as sending your knights on adventures or buying Vaults for the Nobles to store their wealth in.

Speaking of Nobles and Knights these can be added to your castle through adding specific cards and score addition points at the end of the game. The real prize is when you add the right rooms to gain the King or Queen!

However, your opponents will be attempting to ruin your prospects of success. They can pay to discard cards you need, throw waste into your castle preventing people from inhabiting it or just outright attacking you to steal Victory Points.

It is up to you to manage your gold, Nobles, Knights and Servants to build the most impressive castle and win the game!

name: Childbirth Trivia
description:
Childbirth Trivia is a trivia game to test and teach knowledge about childbirth to expectant parents or health professionals. Players compete to answer questions in a number of categories. Players roll a die to determine which of six categories they will answer. Another player draws a card of the corresponding color and asks the question. If the question is answered correctly, the player rolls again and answers another question, continuing until an answer is wrong. Once a player answers questions in all six categories, he or she must answer one last question in a category chosen by the other players. A correct answer wins the game.

A longer version of the game requires players to progress through various levels. Some levels require answers in each category, some are free choice categories and others allow opponents to choose the categories.

Questions may be asked at level 1 (for the general public or expectant parents) or level 2, for health professionals or other childbirth professionals.

This game can also be played with a board from Trivial Pursuit or a similar game, substituting the Childbirth Trivia cards.

name: Ide4s
description:
Write down a secret word to do with a specific topic and use your imagination. During the game you will have to carry out 5 different tests: coincide with your teammates, try not to repeat the same as them, avoid secret words, discover secret topics and be the one to find the most words, all at blistering page.

In this word game a card theme is shown and then a dice is rolled to indicate the rule players have to follow this turn. Then they have 30 seconds to write 4 words that accomplish the rule. They will score one point for each right word. At the end of the game the player with the most points is the winner.

name: El Juego del Real Madrid
description:
A Trivial-like game with 2.600 questions about all facts and history about the soccer team Real Madrid. Players advance along the board tracks by correctly answering questions to complete his collection of trophies.
Depending on the squares where his pawns land they have to answer questions about specifics themes like players, history or prizes. But they can also stole trophies to the other players quicking penalties or dueling with questions with them.

name: Hoppla Dreizehn: Das neue Würfelroulett
description: The players move their meeples on the yellow spaces from "Anfang" to "Ende" around the game board. Movement is determined by the black die. The only function of the three red dies is to roll a 13, wich grants the players some benefits. The red, green or black spaces above the yellow spaces, in combination with the result of the red dies, determine if the player loses or wins money.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Space Junkers
description:
Space is a hard place and making a bit of scratch out here is even harder. Racing against fellow scavengers you must reach derelict ships and earn enough cash to buy your way out of this long, harsh and tedious life!

In Space Junkers, 2-4 players compete to grab fuel cells and spend them to reach derelict ships. Players roll dice and place them on fuel cell cards in order to outbid or block their opponents. Valuable fuel cells are used to buy derelict ships, earning victory points. The first to 12 points has collected enough from the derelict ships to move on to a better life. May the best salvage company win!
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Dice Rolling, Take That

name: With All Due Respect: The Party Game
description:
With All Due Respect is a new light-hearted game about what you and your friends really think of each other!

With All Due Respect - The Party Game is an adult party game for 2+ people. Gameplay is incredibly simple and unique.

Before the game starts decide who is lucky enough to be on your VIP LIST. When a player is answering a "With All Due Respect" playing card they choose their answer from this list.

You can add other people who are not playing the game to the VIP LIST. Adding these other people will give you more names to choose from when answering questions.

On your turn:
1.) Draw a playing card, choose any question from the card and read it out loud starting "With All Due Respect".
2.) You then secretly write down on your answer pad a name from the VIP LIST that you think is the best answer.
3.) Now everyone else will use their 2 Poker Chips to guess which answer you selected.

As fun and ridiculous as it may seem, it gets even more hilarious. The questions alone will sprout hours of laughter and debate. But unlike any other party game their are Drawing Cards and Wild Cards to play.

You will have the opportunity to draw a person from the VIP LIST and everyone else will use their 2 Poker Chips to guess your drawing.

Playing With All Due Respect - The Party Game is like taking your basic adult party game and injecting some steroids into it!

The player with the most points after 12 rounds wins the game.

name: Patron
description:
“Welcome to Rome” the eunich said as you enter the official's ante chamber, “We have been expecting you and have prepared the Senate for your arrival.” Lucius Quintellius will be here within the hour with your requested documents...

Patron is a card game where each player takes the role of a freedman, a class without oblique power, but very energetic and ambitious. You will seek to control the correct mix of Senators from various classes, affluent locations with vast prestige and resources and the laws of Rome itself.

Setup

Shuffle all the cards of Patron deck together and choose a starting player. Draw cards appropriate to the number of players, and choose one to play and discard the rest. In a 2 player game, draw three cards. In a 3 player game draw two cards. In a 4 or 5 player game draw two, but players also have the option of playing the top card of the discard pile instead of drawing.

Playing the Game

When playing a card, you must do that action stated on the card, but only if can: i.e. if a card requires you to sacrifice a Patrician and you don't have one, you may ignore the effect. In a 4 or 5 player game, do not mix sacrificed cards with the discard pile. A sacrificed personality is removed from the game.

Each player draws and plays in a clockwise fashion until there are no cards left to draw and the game is over. If there is only one card left the last player must play this card as their final card. Then each player tabulates their total.

Determining a Winner

The player with the most points at the very end of the game wins. Many cards are worth variable points based on the number of symbols, locations, agendas or personalities that player has.
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Open Drafting

name: WarChess-X: The Armageddon
description:
APEXWAR: The Armageddon
(The Height of Warfare)

A Game for Big Minds!
In the Era of a highly Militarized New World, Play Chess like a M.A.D. man and start Armageddon !!!

It's 2030 A.D. :
Advances in the developments of the FORD class and SHTORM class Aircraft Carriers and with the advent of the 6th Generation Multi-role Fighters, leads to a new balance of power between the adversarial spheres of influence.
Some are not happy with this new balance, whilst some are over-zealous with it.
Tension, Twilight, Point of no Return, Mutually-Assured-Destruction, and World War 3

You are Commander-in-Chief of a Super-Power Military Force about to clash with another.
- 1 Globe
- 2 Hemispheres
- 2 Commanders-in-chief
- 2 Super-Powers (Each spread across both hemispheres)
- 4 Navies (2 each)
- 4 Armies (2 each)
- 4 Air-Forces (2 each)
- Special-Forces Marines
- The Secret-Service (including Double Agents)
- Military Top-Brass; Generals, Admirals and Air-Marshals
- Strategic ICBM’s and Nuclear Deterrents
- Missile defense systems, Satellites & Radar
- Bunkers, Cities, Logistical & Economic Infrastructure including the 'Global Monetary Fund', bank rolling it all.
This is epic war on all fronts.
It's Armageddon!

ApexWar is a truly epic game in scope and in depth. A true union between strategic and tactical gaming.
An expansion on the ApexWar army and navy themes including other forces and a commander-in-chief, you control a super-power spanning two hemispheres.

In this epic struggle for supremacy, your primary mission is to protect the commander-in-chief piece from being captured at all costs to avoid losing the war and to win the war, you must capture the opposing commander-in-chief.
Your secondary mission is to protect your flag bearers and strategic facilities namely your admirals or capital ships, generals, air-marshals, satellites and radar from capture or destruction as they control your unit forces, whilst trying to capture and destroy the opposing commanders and facilities to significantly weaken their forces.
Everything else is canon-fodder, dedicated to upholding and achieving your primary and secondary missions.

The army and navy pieces all move correspondent to their representative standard chess character. Most of the other pieces also all move similar to standard chess characters but some of them incorporate modifications to their movements, capturing and abilities. Then their are the static pieces that do not move as the represent infrastructure, so they have to be defended.
Finally, the whole epic plays out within an economics frame, where you have to acquire control and protect resources like oil, steel and gold to boost your war efforts and also to protect your cities to keep up morale.

It's not easy being the President, Good Luck.

name: Rogue Squad
description:
Rogue Squad is a cooperative science fiction board game that combines fast-paced combat action with exciting strategic challenges.

In this compelling futuristic adventure, 1 to 4 players step into the boots of a misfit band of mercenaries who must battle their way through ever-increasing swarms of monstrous aliens.

Rogue Squad is an exciting turn-based game with easy-to-learn rules. Depending on the mission’s level of difficulty, one game lasts from 1 to 3 hours. A fully developed universe, intriguing characters, and story-based missions allow you to focus as much (or as little) on roleplaying as you like.

Rogue Squad at a Glance

• fast-paced combat action
• fully cooperative
• one-of-a-kind alien spawning mechanism
• unique combat system using custom dice
• no game master necessary – aliens are controlled by the game itself
• rich in variety: versatile elements can be combined in many ways (troopers, sidekicks, co-op robots, aliens, boss, non-player characters)
• add-ons change up gameplay even more
• mission-specific rules and special features make every gaming session fresh and fun
• troopers’ main weapons and skills can be upgraded
• large selection of weapons and combat equipment
• search, event, alien and alien overlord decks
• easy-to-learn rules
• can be played either as stand-alone scenarios or multi-game plot arc
• maverick (= skirmish) and expert modes offer truly grueling combat for especially ferocious fighters
• free mobile app for even more innovative gameplay options
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Modular Board, Open Drafting, Variable Player Powers

name: Wilson Gridiron Strategy Football
description:
A rather rare football simulation from Wilson Sports. Play happens through use of cards, dice, a gridiron board, and a wheel for offense and one for defense upon which players select their chosen plays and then compare results.

User note: I contacted Wilson Sports Equipment, and they at first told me that Wilson never made sports games, then, when I insisted that I had one in front of me, said that they had no knowledge of any such products.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Simulation, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Terra Incognita
description:
Terra Incognita is a scenario based solitaire game about organizing an expedition and explore unknown lands in the heart of Africa at the end of the 19th century. Your goal is the accomplish the chosen sceanrio by organizing and leading your expedition. You have to prepare your expedition with crew members and items to survive in the wild territories of Africa and then face events and decide how to continue your journey to reach your goal and return to the civilization to acquire fame and glory!

The game use a tile reveal mechanism in a point-to-point system. You discover new tiles as you progress on the map. On each tile you will find mandatory or possible actions what you have to resolve with the help of your crew members, items and the use of six sided dices. Time has a fundamental role in the game as you has to track the time spent on expedition and provide supply for your memebers from time to time. Random events also occures what can effect your scenario and you have to react them.
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Tile Placement

name: Micropolis
description:
Micropolis is a family city-building game with a modular board.

On your turn, roll two 10-sided dice, then select actions to perform using the numbers you rolled.

Acquire Property — Place a roof token on a city block bearing the rolled number. (Once you have two roof tokens on a city block, no one else can build on it any longer.) You can use 0 as a wild to place on any number, and doubles grant you a free bonus action of placing a single roof on any city block where you already have a roof.
Construct Buildings — Remove roof tokens from the footprint of the building specified on the contract card (you must have sole or shared control of each city block in question), and then place the appropriate building pieces as depicted on the contract card. Bonuses and penalties specified on the card for positioning relative to other features apply.
Build Monorail Line — Start the monorail line between city blocks, or extend the existing line, if it has already been started.
Acquire a City Tile from the deck.
Place a City Tile adjacent to existing tiles.
Reroll
Exchange Contract Cards


Once both Contract decks are depleted, the endgame is triggered, giving each player one more turn. The player who has accumulated the most points wins.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Take That, Tile Placement

name: Big Dope Deal
description:
How Good Is Your Karma? ...You'll know after playing this!!

Unpredictable and designed to be smoker-friendly, it's a great way to spend a stretchable hour or so with like minded friends. Not sneaky, not dishonest but likely to provoke profanity!

Chill with friends and visit Morrocco, Marrakesh and Amsterdam to try and score. Then, if you manage that, run the gauntlet of customs, police and your own Karma to get rid of it. The winner leaves loaded and holding, the losers just have some fun.

Originally created by stoner students in a UK university in the 1970's, the legendary Big Dope Deal board game is now available for anyone to play! Travel to London, Amsterdam, Marrakesh, and Kabul and score weed along the way, with all the board game fun of dice, fake paper money and full-color cards. Big Dope Deal is ideal for 2 to 6 adult players and an average game takes about one high-stakes, hilarious hour. The 15 x 12.8 inch board is flexible and rolls up easily, and it's laminated so don't worry if you spill some beer on it.

name: Screw: A Sexual Game of Who Done It?
description:
A Sexual Game of Who done it?

As an adult, how often do you actually have to piece together the details of a murder? In this revamped version of the classic game Clue, instead of solving a mysterious murder, players must piece together the details of the previous night's drunken activities. Did you screw Miss Scarlett with a condom on in the utility closet? Perhaps, after he called you a failure, you hit Professor Plum with a desk lamp in the library. Maybe you pleasured Miss Peacock with your finger in her ass. Have fun with your friends trying to sort out the twisted details because, chances are, you'll really have to solve these kinds of mysteries soon, you big party animal, you.

name: Das grosse Suisse Mania Spiel
description: In Suisse Mania you are ballooning over Switzerland and its 26 cantons. During your travel you learn a lot of interesting but also quaint things.

name: The Alex Morgan Board Game!
description: The Alex Morgan Board Game! appears inside the back cover of the book Alex Morgan by Illugi Jökulsson. It follows the life and career of American women's soccer star Alex Morgan. It is a simple roll-and-move game where players roll a die to progress along a track. Spaces along the way refer to setbacks and successes in Morgan's life and career, corresponding to moving forward or back on the track or gaining or losing turns. The first player to reach the end of the track by an exact roll wins.

name: It's Nothing Personal
description:
It’s Nothing Personal is your basic race-to-the finish game – assuming your definition of “basic” involves harpooning the other racers in the legs so you can gain the lead. Friends become enemies and enemies become bigger enemies as you race along your own individual tracks from the starting space to the finish line.

Here’s how it breaks down:

1. Roll the die and move forward that number of spaces
2. Decision time! You could:
a. Move yourself forward a few more spaces.
b. Move another player back a few spaces.
c. Place an obstacle on an opponent’s track
d. Place a benefit on your own track
e. Draw one of 60 mildly zany chance cards and let fate be the boss of you.
3. After each round of turns, there’s a non-secret vote to determine who should move back several spaces. Now’s your chance to convince the others to gang up on the player who’s winning, the player who wronged you last turn, or the player who just doesn't share your opinion about the 1973 NBA All-Star Game.
4. Repeat. Exact revenge as needed.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Humor, Party Game, Racing
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Take That, Voting

name: Empires of Tal
description: Empires of Tal is a set of miniatures rules for 10mm miniatures set in a fantasy setting but can easily support historic battles in the same scale. Empires of Tal has an extensive library of in game spells, monsters, equipment and special units for use.
categories: Ancient, Book, Dice, Fantasy, Medieval, Miniatures, Mythology, Wargame

name: Time for the Bus
description: Time for the Bus is a spin-and-move game designed to teach young children shape an color recognition. It was included in the Get Ready for Kindergarten! book and game set by Sharon Hinchey. In the game, each player places a school bus marker on a separate track leading to school. Each track is marked with one particular color and shape on each of its spaces. In turn, each player spins the spinner. The player whose color/shape is spun moves forward one space. The first player to reach the school wins. Along the way, players will land on "bus stop" spaces. Each time this happens, all players must sing "The Wheels on the Bus."

name: Class Cleanup!
description: Class Cleanup! is a spin-and-move game designed to teach young children color recognition and the need to clean up their classroom. It was included in the Get Ready for Kindergarten! book and game set by Sharon Hinchey. In the game, each player starts with a game piece and four tokens, each marked with a different object. All markers are placed on a start space with four separate tracks leading from it. Each track is marked with alternating red, yellow and blue spaces. In turn, each player spins the spinner, chooses a track, and moves to the next space on that track matching the color spun. When the player reaches the end of the track, he or she "puts away" the token matching the object show at the end of the track. On the player's next turn, he or she spins again and moves back toward the start by the same method. The first player to reach the end of all four tracks and put away all four objects wins.

name: Team Time!
description:
Team Time is an educational game designed to teach young children matching, counting and visual discrimination. It was included in the Get Ready for Kindergarten! book and game set by Sharon Hinchey.

Each player starts with a pile of matching coins or markers. The game board depicts a busy playground full of children.

On his or her turn, each player spins the spinner, which will point to a picture of a combination of colored pants, shirt and hat. The player must then find a child on the board with a matching outfit and mark the child with a marker. In order to make the game more difficult, a time limit can be set.

Players take turns spinning and marking children until all are marked. The player with the most marked children wins.

name: A-B-C Gallery
description:
A-B-C Gallery is a spin-and-move game designed to teach young children the alphabet. It is included in the Get Ready for Kindergarten! book and game set by Sharon Hinchey. Each player takes a playing piece and 13 of the 26 letter tiles, with the letter on one side and a picture of something starting with the letter on the other side. The game board is laid out as a grid of square spaces, each with a letter and a picture. Players start on the first letter of their first name. Each player spins the spinner in turn and moves the number (1, 2 or 3) spaces spun. If they land on a space that matches one of their tiles, they choose the tile, flip it over to make sure the picture matches, then place it on the square. A player who matches on his or her first spin may then spin again, and continue to do so until a match is not made. Squares marked "Trade a Piece" allow the player to choose one of the opponent's pieces and the opponent to chose one of his or her pieces. The first player to match all his or her tiles wins.

The game may also be played with lower-case letter tiles, adding the challenge of matching the lower-case and upper-case letters.

name: Dino Egg Hunt!
description: Dino Egg Hunt is a spin-and-move game designed to teach young children color recognition. It is included in the Get Ready for Kindergarten! book and game set by Sharon Hinchey. Tokens with pictures of dinosaurs or dinosaur eggs are places randomly face-down on the spaces of a loop-shaped track. Each player chooses a dinosaur playing piece and places it on a color-coded start space. Each player in turn spins the spinner, moving one, two or three spaces. As they moves, players secretly look at each token they land on. If the egg on the token matches their dinosaurs' color, they keep the token. If not, it is returned to its space face-down. If a dinosaur appears on the token, the player immediately moves to that dinosaur's starting "nest" space and ends his or her turn. Players may choose to move along one of two short cuts when they reach them. The first player to collect all five eggs matching their color wins.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Short and Long Vowel Dominoes
description: Short and Long Vowel Dominoes is an educational twist on traditional dominoes designed to teach short and long vowel sounds. In this game, dominoes have combinations of short vowels, long vowels and pictures. Each player draws six dominoes. Dominoes are played in a single line. Dominoes may be laid down by matching vowel to vowel, a vowel to a picture with the matching vowel sound, or tow pictures with the same vowel sound. If a player cannot make a match, he or she draws a domino and passes to the next player. Double dominoes are played sideways in the line, and afterward players may play on either end of the original domino line or off either end of the double domino. If necessary, a list of vowel sounds for each picture is included so players may check their plays. The first player to place all his or her dominoes wins. If no player can lay a domino, the player with the fewest dominoes wins.

name: Poppet's Party Game
description: Poppet's Party Game is a roll-and-move game with a Moshi Monsters theme. It is included in an issue of the British children's magazine Sparkle World. Each player starts at the beginning of a track and rolls a die to move forward on the track. Some spaces require the player to complete an action (such as whistling a song, solving a math problem or spelling your name backwards). If the player does not complete the action, he or she misses the next turn. Other spaces cause the player to lose a turn (or "miss a go," since the game is British) or move forward on the track. The first player to reach the end of the track wins.

name: Let's Race Home!
description: Let's Race Home is a roll-and-move game with a Puppy in My Pocket theme. It is included in an issue of the British children's magazine Sparkle World. Players represent puppies trying to get home. Each player starts in the center of a spiral track and rolls a die to move forward on the track. Most spaces on the track are color-coded. Players consult the key at the bottom of the board to find out if they move forward or backward or gain or lose turns. Near the end of the track, it splits in two, and each player follows a separate path, but both paths are identical so game play is not affected. The first player to reach the end of the track wins.

name: Tinker Bell and the Pirate Fairy
description:
Tinker Bell and the Pirate Fairy is a Disney Fairies-themed roll-and-move game. It is included in an issue of the British children's magazine Sparkle World.

Each player starts in a separate corner of a shared path (sort of like Sorry or Parcheesi). In turn, each player rolls a die and moves along the track clockwise. Landing on an anchor space causes loss of a turn. A jolly roger flag sends the player back one space. Crossed swords move the player forward two spaces. Each player has a separate ending space, and the first to reach it wins.

name: The Shade of Life
description:
The Shade of Life is a way for friends or complete strangers to bond like never before and realize everyone has a good, bad, and naughty side.
"We are eager for the game to shed inhibitions and foster new friendships across the country".
Intended for 2 or more players from ages 21 and up, The Shade of Life's instructions are simple. Shuffle the cards, stack them in one deck face down. Each person draws a card when it's their turn. When the deck is gone, whomever has the most points wins the game. Be clever and have fun!

name: Bus- und Bahn-Würfelspiel "Grüne Welle"
description: The players have to move 3 playing pieces (car, bicycle, bus/train) from start to finish. Movement is determined by two dice. The player may chose to use the result of either die or the sum of both dice to move one playing piece. Only pieces of different kinds may pass each other. A bus is different than a train, even if they are the same playing piece. So they can't be blocked and always have a "green wave". If a player gets on a blue space he has to follow the instruction for his playung piece. On a green or a red space the player has to draw an event-card or a decision-card. The first player to reach the finish with all three playing pieces wins the game.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Návarchoi
description: Návarchoi is a low to moderate complexity, card driven game that recreates the challenges of fleet command in the age of the trireme. Play is fast and furious, where players use a limited supply of cards (based upon their fleet's quality) to issue strategems to their respective fleets. The fleets are activated using impulses where they move and attack using similar mechanics to ram, rake, and fire missiles. The cards can also be used as events that provide period flavor.
mechanics: Action Points, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Simulation

name: The Dutch Pack
description:
Twelve scenarios focused on Dutch actions in Holland as well as the 1942 campaign in Java. In addition there is one page of rules.

The scenarios are in color and printed on cardstock.

FE 152: Millwork
FE 153: Battalion for Special Missions
FE 154: The Hero Maduro
FE 155: Moerdijk Massacre
FE 156: Ypenburg Airfield
FE 157: French Forward!
FE 158: Abda Command
FE 159: Attack Across the Paddy Fields
FE 160: The Wakamatsu Unit
FE 161: Cup O'Java
FE 162: Van De Ploeg to the Rescue
FE 163: Shadow Enemy
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Modular Board, Secret Unit Deployment

name: Das Trabrennspiel
description:
This game consists of a cardboard folder. The inner left leaf has the rules and a pocket holding eight cards with numbered horses. The inner right has a spinning wheel with 21 wedges of different size in either red or black, each with an instruction to either put money into the pot or take money out. The rules say tokens like matches or nuts can be used instead of money. The numbers 1 to 8 are printed around the wheel, each with a thin black line leading to the wheel.

One player starts in charge of the wheel. Players choose their horses in turn, starting from the left of that player. For each race, the player in charge of the wheel closes the folder, turns a thick cardboard disk on the back of the folder that is attached to the wheel inside, and then puts the folder back on the table and opens it. Each player looks at where his number lies on the wheel and follows the instructions for that wedge. Because of the layout of the wheel, the result for each horse will be different. If a horse's number is directly on a line, that player does nothing.

The wheel-spinning duty rotates around the table. The rules suggest that the spinning player's horse is out of each race. After the agreed number of races have been run, whatever remains in the spot is split equally, and the player with the most tokens wins. If the pot ever runs out of tokens, the game ends immediately.

name: Aristotle's Stairway
description:
Aristotle’s Stairway abstractly portrays the philosophical pursuit of human excellence, of achieving “perfect being” as envisioned by the famous ancient Greek thinker Aristotle. Players roll dice and make important decisions, developing their powers of Reason, Ethics, Wisdom, Virtue and sense of Well Being while gaining various Insights along the way. The player who becomes more fully enlightened (gains the most Insight Points) will ultimately triumph – and win the game!

Generally, players will randomly select and roll three dice and use two of them to move their playing pieces up five colored columns -- sometimes taking scoring markers (IPs) -- until they reach one of the top spaces of each column. Some markers allow special modifications to a die roll. The game ends when one player has climbed all five "stairways" and thus has maximized all five powers as noted above.

Playable in 30 minutes, Aristotle’s Stairway is a cerebral, two-player filler with dice-rolling, tough decisions – and, with several catch-up mechanisms – usually results in a hotly contested, down-to-the-wire game!
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Variable Player Powers

name: Falling Stars: The Red Line
description: Falling Stars: The Red Line is a tactical turn-based starship combat game set in Distant Sector of the Galaxy, where the last remnants of humanity fight for control of their future. Players choose a faction in Falling Stars, then assemble Star Fleets of customized Star Ships and engage in objective or mission driven space battles. Great war machines blast away in orbit of coven worlds, or in the vast dark of interstellar space. Explore uncharted systems in search of new riches or strategic advantages, all in an attempt to prevent the light of humanity from being swallowed up in the black of space.”

name: Advantage Basketball
description:
This is the fastest, most accurate basketball game on the market today. Zone and man-to-man defenses are your options. You become coach and player at the same time. Learn to recognize all types of offenses and defenses as you try to outscore your opponent. A mobile spinner decides your position on the court - you determine your game strategy. Both offensive & defensive rebounds occur; shots are blocked and shots are made, fouls are committed and foul shots are taken; you may take the hook shot, jump shot, or set shot and you may dribble, pass or shoot. A scoreboard is provided for score, quarters, and time outs. You determine your own defense and what offense to use against your opponent. Call the shots yourself when you play Advantage Basketball. (from brochure)

Play is advanced through a special "mobile spinner" with a different disk for each position on the court, the detailed playbook and strategy.

name: Advantage Hockey
description:
From the publisher:
This educational game depicts the actual high-speed excitement of the world's fastest sport. It is perfect for the beginner and advanced player or fan. All the strategic moves and fast action of hockey are provided for you. You can pass, skate or shoot - slapshot, wrist shot or backhand. Penalties can be called against you, and you can use the power play when your opponent is penalized. A scoreboard is provided for goals, periods and penalty time. The board play simulates every kind of action just like a real game on the ice. You create your own strategy and action.

Play is advanced through a special "mobile spinner" with a different disk for each position on the ice, the detailed playbook and strategy.

name: Advantage: Tennis – The Game of Singles
description:
