The most complete detailed game of singles ever created. Designed to provide great entertainment while teaching all the basic fundamentals of the game. A mobile spinner decides your position on the court - you determine your game strategy. Advantage, Tennis is perfect for every level of competition, from beginner to expert. You serve, lob, volley and smash to strategic points on the court. You play backcourt and net. You hit and return shots from every spot on the court. Keep score by point, game and set - even tie-breakers. A booklet of rules, illustrated shots, court diagrams, and other instructional material is provided.(from brochure)

Play is advanced through a special "mobile spinner" with a different disk for each position on the court, the detailed playbook and strategy.

name: Kender Du Typen?
description:
Kender Du Typen? is based on the Danish DR TV-show of the same name.

In the game, players try to become the best lifestyle expert, by answering various questions.
The questions in the game are divided into two categories: questions about how well you know your friends, and general questions about lifestyles.

name: City States
description:
City States is a board game depicting Ancient Greece and its' city states during the Classical until the Pre-hellenistic era.
Each round

At the start of each round, players are dealt historical personalities from each period like Leonidas, Pericles, Pausanias, Themistocles etc. Each such historical figure is attached to a specific city state.

Their role remains hidden as they secretly lay out plans during the round, beneficial for their city state (for example, fortify a city, build or improve temples, barracks etc. train/recruit soldiers) or detrimental to other city states like sabotage, war, espionage etc.

At the end of the round, all plans are revealed and resolved. Players gain victory points accordingly.

The winner of the game is the player with the most victory points.

name: Sneeze: The Card Game
description:
Sneeze is all about staying as healthy as possible while making sure that you're not too healthy and that everyone else has more infections than you. Be infected and infect others.

It's not good enough to simply get rid of all your germs. Players have to strategically infect themselves and cure themselves and others to win.

The last player who is not too sick wins. For three or more players, a player is too sick once infected with five different colored infections. While a too sick player can't win the game, he or she continues to play and infect other players.
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Player Elimination, Take That

name: Treasure Tomb: 5-6 Player Expansion
description:
From the publisher:

Treasure Tomb is a game of strategic tile-laying, dice-rolling, and card collecting. Players lay tiles to construct pathways through the mummy's tomb. Draw a treasure card when you pass a treasure token or place the mummy when you land on a sarcophagus token. Treasure cards can be either event cards or gold. Place the gold in a face-up pile near you. The first person to collect 50 gold wins the game.

But beware! Others may steal your gold with event cards or boot you from the maze.

This expansion includes components to add a fifth or sixth player to your game of Treasure Tomb!
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Network and Route Building, Tile Placement

name: Treasure Tomb 7-8 Player Expansion
description:
From the publisher:

Treasure Tomb is a game of strategic tile-laying, dice-rolling, and card collecting. Players lay tiles to construct pathways through the mummy’s tomb. Draw a treasure card when you pass a treasure token or place the mummy when you land on a sarcophagus token. Treasure cards can be either event cards or gold. Place the gold in a face-up pile near you. The first person to collect 50 gold wins the game.

But beware! Others may steal your gold with event cards or boot you from the maze.

This product is an expansion and cannot be played without the components from the basic game and the 5-6 player expansion. This expansion includes components to add a seventh or eighth player to your game of Treasure Tomb!
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Network and Route Building, Tile Placement

name: Do Men Really Know Women?
description:
Description from the official website:

"Do Men Really Know Women is a game that will reveal who knows the most about the other sex. The ultimate battle between the sexes. The 2 teams, men and women, must show their strength in categories that belong to the world of the opposite sex :

Men: Fashion, Home, Personal Care, Chick Flicks Women: Hobby & Engineering, Transportation, Sports, Movies

…And women must bet on what they think is typically men and men have to bet on what they think turns on women – and vice versa. All very interesting questions that might result in surprising answers!"

name: Battleforce Saturn
description:
Fast-Paced Tactical Starship Combat Card Game

In the late part of the 21st century Mankind is fighting for domination of the resources of his solar system.

In this card game of star ship fleet combat, 2 players select ships cards and play weapons/tactics cards in furious, and fast-paced action!

There are prepared scenarios and random battles and players can design their own scenarios as well. Play is fast and clean and easy! A good game for a short evening of starship combat fun!


Spacecraft range from small frigates, destroyers, cruisers, light & heavy cruisers, fighter carriers, dreadnaughts and battleships.



Weapons range from turbo lasers, rail guns, and drones, to torpedoes and boarding parties.



Each game is placed in a battlefield setting from planetary rings, asteroid fields, star bases, open space, etc. Each battlefield type has specific but simple rules for combat.



8 "Historical" scenarios follow the great Solar Civil War! The Scenario booklet can be downloaded separately as a PDF in "downloads" below (after purchase of the game).



Simple ship value-point system for keeping score.



Dice rolling for weapons fire and tactics resolution.
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Player Elimination, Simulation

name: Das Häschenspiel
description: The bunnies hop from nest to nest and deliver their easter eggs. Movement ist determined by a color-die. The first bunny to deliver an egg to every of the 12 nests wins the game.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Blood of the Magi
description:
On a distant planet, a lonely God peers over his barren domain. "If only there was an Other."
In that instant, a new race was born, perfect in mind body, and spirit. This new race, the Magi, had awesome powers and could control the elements of Earth, Fire, and Water.
They even manipulated the weather and the fabric of Space-Time.

Preferring the company of each other, the God sent a curse to the planet and attempted to destroy his "failed" experiment. A bloody battle breaks out between groups of these Magi.

Take control of an army of powerful Magi and arrange a battlefield to take advantage of elemental and tier advantages during the bloody battles where strategy, luck, chaotic effects, spells and d6 rolls decide who comes out on top.

A rich variety of spells with effects that range from buffing a Magi to damaging your foe's Magi, stealing their spells, even rearranging their battlefield. A few are powerful enough to resurrect a dead Magi!

Beware! When you have defeated your enemies to be the last one standing, the angry God will descend to the planet to battle you!

Prevent his attempt to eradicate your existence!
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Pattern Building, Player Elimination, Take That

name: Lost Heir: A Game
description:
This race to the end board game is based on the popular card game Lost Heir, which was based on the 1872 novel, The Lost Heir of Linlithgow by the widely-read 19th century author, Mrs. Emma Dorothy Eliza Nevitte Southworth (commonly referred to as E.D.E.N. Southworth).

The game comes with a spinner, playing pieces and game board, with spaces featuring characters along the outer edge of the board that look like the pictures on the card game. These spaces give instructions for the players to go to another character, move forward or back, lose a turn, etc. The winner is the player who lands, by exact count, on The Heir space in the middle.

name: Next One
description:
Next One is game like bluff and chicken race.
Players turn over chips and get VP or dead(lose game).
The player who more VP get win this game.

In each turn, players can 2 actions.
1. Turn over chips
2. Put the "chip of gas mask" on a target chip.

If chip that is turn over is "chip of skull", you lose this round.
And it is "chip of peace", you gain 1 VP.

Players play 4 round and the player who have most VP is winner of this game!

name: The Living Dungeon
description:
Up to 9 players can take part in a battle of wits, luck and skulduggery. Survive this cursed place through combat, agility or dungeon manipulation. Only the strongest, fastest and smartest will emerge victorious.

This isn’t your standard dungeon romp. The Living Dungeon has no ToHit rolls, no THACO, and no saving throws. Each player rolls their five chosen skill dice. They then have only 2 fretful minutes to decide what to do with those 5 actions. Panic will set in. The possibilities and threats will become overwhelming. Your mind will freeze up as your friends on different teams give you conflicting and misleading advice that you just can’t trust! Your time is running out, but there are just so many ways to die in The Living Dungeon.

Another player could hack you down! A wretched or a hybrid could maul you. You could fall down a bottomless pit, be crushed by a piston, be incinerated by a sentinel’s ever watchful flame, be torn to pieces by an incorporeal shadow, or flayed and consumed by the darkness its self. Choose wisely, as each move could be your last.
There really is nothing quite like The Living Dungeon.

name: Advanced Transmogrification
description:
Adds 25 Advanced Form Cards. Requires 5 Original Form Cards, and 20 Combat Style Cards from Transmogrification to play.

Set-up, objective, play and winning remain the same as Transmogrification.

Set Up
Each play gets one set of the four Form Cards. Unused Form Cards are set aside.

The Combat Style Cards are shuffled and dealt out until each player has an equal number. Un-dealt cards are set aside face down.

Objective
Be the first player to empty your hand of Combat Style Cards.

Play
Select a Form - Each player selects one Form Card from their stack of face down Form Cards and places in the center of the table but in front of them.

Select a Combat Style - Each player then selects one of their combat style cards from their hand and places it face down besides their form card.

Reveal - All cards are flipped face up.

Resolution: The success of a combat style depends on the form.
If successful, players put the Combat Style Card face down in the discard pile.
If unsuccessful, players put the combat style card back in their hand.

End of turn - Players put the Form Card they just used aside, face-up and return any previously used Form Cards back to their stack.

Winning
The game ends when a player ends a turn with no Combat Style Cards in their hand.

name: Thwack! Thwarbles!
description:
The flat magnetic marbles game. Set includes instructions for 10 different games. Contains: 1 Rat Fink magnetic board, 2 Thwacks for tossing the marbles and 12 flat magnetic marbles called Thwarbles. Instructions for assorted target games are included.

Tourni Thwarbles - Toss the thwarbles. The object of the game is to collect the most Thwarbles™ by touching or landing on previously tossed pieces.

Pick off ThWack! - Players place nine Thwarbles onto the board with one in the center and eight along the edges on small ThWack! dots. The Thwacks! on the edge can be placed in a position where they extend partially over the edge to increase difficulty. Players toss their ThWack! attempting to land it on a Thwarble. If successful, the player removes that Thwarble from the board. Play continues until all pieces have been removed. The player with the most Thwarbles at the end wins.

ThWack! ThWarbles - Players pitch and stick their ThWarbles to the board attempting to hit target areas.

RatFink Fly Swat - Players toss ThWarbles to tag ten fly images on the board. Whichever player manages to cover the most flies with his or her ThWarble wins.

Rotation - Players lay out four to six ThWarbles in a clock-like pattern or "rack" around the edges of the board. Players then call which ThWarble they will hit. If they miss, it's the other player's turn. If they hit, they call another ThWarble, continuing until they miss. Winner completes the pattern first.

Chip Shot - One player begins by tossing a ThWarble onto the board, which represents a golf hole. The players attempt to tag that piece in the fewest number of shots. The player who takes the fewest number of throws or "strokes" to hit either 9 or 18 "holes", wins.

Thwack 'Em - Four Thwarbles are placed on the board. Players pitch a thwarble trying to cover one on the board with his own thwarble. (If so he removes both thwarbles.) Player with the most thwarbles wins.

ThWack! ThWarbles 2 - Players determine how many rounds they will play, how many ThWarbles each player will toss out to start each round, and the distance that each player must toss from. Players see who can toss their Thwarbles closest to the edge without them falling off. Player who lands the most thwarbles closest to the edge wins.

name: ATS Core Module: Arnhem – One Bridge... Too Far 1944
description:
From the publisher's Website:

Defiant Stand - The Battle of Arnhem 1944: An all new take on the classic battle with remastered, ENLARGED MAP that makes this a one-of a kind Arnhem game like never before!

Welcome to the ATS CORE MODULES, all new for 2014. New map, larger, on cardstock, folding with no trimming needed -- did we mention new terrain art throughout AND larger hexes? Perfect for those classic -- YET ALL NEW ATS COUNTERS -- the you'll have on the map deciding history ... all ... over ... again! This module is for owners of the ATS 2014 Color Rules plus ATS Standard Small Markers + Large Markers but may also be used easily by owners of any past edition of the ATS rules.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Hexagon Grid, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: ATS Westerplatte: Opening Shots of World War 2
description:
From the publisher's website:

Westerplatte Peninsula, FREE CITY OF DANZIG, POLAND, 1 September 1939: In 1925 the League of Nations allowed Poland to keep only 88 soldiers in their positions on the Westerplatte peninsula. Secretly, however, the garrison was slowly expanded to 176 men and six officers. The position was separated from Danzig by the harbour channel, and only a small pier connected them to the mainland. The Polish-held part of the Westerplatte was separated from the territory of Danzig by a brick wall. Fortifications built at Westerplatte were in fact not very impressive: there were no real bunkers or underground tunnels, there were only five small concrete outposts (guardhouses) hidden in the peninsula's forest; and a large barracks prepared for defense, supported by a network of field fortifications such as trenches and barricades. Cellars of outposts were fit to fire heavy-machine guns from within them. In case of war, the defenders were expected to withstand a sustained attack for 12 hours. Beginning on September 1, 1939, German naval forces and soldiers launched World War two with their attack on the Polish Military Transit Depot (Wojskowa Skladnica Tranzytowa, WST) on the peninsula of Westerplatte. Despite estimates of their ability to hold out, the Polish garrison held on for seven days in the face of a German onslaught that included Stuka dive bomber attacks. The defense of Westerplatte served as an inspiration for the Polish Army and people in the face of the debut of the Blitzkreig amidst German Case White. Their struggle is still regarded as a symbol of resistance to the Nazi invasion that plunged the world into war.

This is ATS WESTERPLATTE: FIRST SHOTS OF WORLD WAR II, an amazing assault that will live proudly in the martial history of Poland forever. The battleship Schleswig-Hiolstein stood off Westerplatte to shell the defenders into submission.

There was just one thing the aggressors did not count on: the Poles would ... not ... submit! They stood, stoic, as the world watched in awe. And against every onslaught the Germans could hurl at them. Stukas, more Stukas, artillery... engineers. An amazing struggle on a map that has been described as a ‘work of art’ and is one of the more unique pieces of wargame cartology ever to see print. Includes all the combat counters needed to play.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II

name: Robot  Scrappers in Space
description:
You will be building and improving your robot as you explore custom spaceships looking for scrap.
Best scrapper wins!

The Game:
Players start out with a basic robot that they then are able to upgrade.

Three rounds are played in each round the player can:
1. Sell items from scrapping or old robot parts.
2. Buy parts and upgrade their robot.
3. Scrap a new ship.

Ships are designed by one of the players using the ship cards in the deck and explored with robot shaped pawns. Movement on the ship is based on the robot built, up grade the robot for better movement.

How much scrap or the ability to fight off an alien is based on the level of the robot. Upgrade the robot to not lose in a fight and to bring more treasure home!

The ship has events that happen so staying too long on a ship could cost you your scrap or part of your robot!

To Win:
Players will sell all their scrap and the robots they have built and the player with the most amount of money at the end of the game wins!

Set comes with poker sized playing cards, money and pawns.
categories: Card Game, Science Fiction, Space Exploration

name: Trail
description:
A Trail Making Scavenger Hunting Card Game

Trail is a new card game for up to 4 players. You will place cards to get to goals and place cards to block other players from getting to their goals.

The board is always changing!

First one to reach all goals and get back to their start block wins!

name: Trail Words
description:
A Trail & Word Making Scavenger Hunting Card Game

Trail Words is a new card game for up to 4 players. You will place cards to get to goals and place cards to block other players from getting to their goals. Combine with the Trail card game for 8 players and more fun!

The board is always changing!

First one to reach all goals and get back to their start block wins!

name: Bolognabalogical Science
description:
The concept: Players compete for associate, bachelor's, master's and, finally, doctoral degrees in Bolognabalogical Science by advancing the pawns around a game board depicting the campus of Baloney State University. Each "student" rolls a die to collect vowels and consonants to make up a word with a nonsensical definition. Pawns are advanced by the forming of nonsense words with nonsense definitions from two sets of drawing cards-one for vowels, one for consonants (example: "hinduey: The saggy seat of a loosely worn pair of denim trousers"). Once a player's opponents have accepted a nonsense word and its definition, the player moves his game pawn one space for every letter in the word. Wild-card "Report Cards" add an element of chance (example: "You were caught engaging in the latest campus fad-mud puddle mopping-Report to the Dean`s Office-Don`t Roll!")

The game comes with a board, pawns and die, plus a Baloney State University Student Handbook and a student newspaper, Tall Tales. The handbook provides photographs of the mock school's faculty. Sal Monilla is the cafeteria chef.

name: Drip Drop
description:
Patience and accuracy are needed in a game relative of darts but using water. With a water proof board at your feet, players aim for targets on the board with dippers in hand.
Their are positive, negative, and card spots.
Using a round setting, set the round maximum. Getting 3 drops per round, aim and call out which target you're attempting to hit. The objective is to gain the most positive points at the end of the round. Negatives decrease your points and the card will make you draw, giving you directions on how to drip your next drop. Maybe closing your eyes or dripping behind your back has a benefit? The card has many ways to Drip

name: Epic Transmogrification
description:
Requires Transmogrification and Advanced Transmogrification to play.

Increases the maximum player count to 8.

Adds 15 Original Form Cards, 15 Advanced Form Cards, and 30 Combat Style cards. Added to the cards included with Transmogrification and Advanced Transmogrification bring the total cards in play for 8 Player to 90.

No change in game play from the original game. Set-up, objective, play and winning remain the same as Transmogrification and Advanced Transmogrification.

Set Up
Each play gets one set of the four Form Cards. Unused Form Cards are set aside.

The Combat Style Cards are shuffled and dealt out until each player has an equal number. Un-dealt cards are set aside face down.

Objective
Be the first player to empty your hand of Combat Style Cards.

Play
Select a Form - Each player selects one Form Card from their stack of face down Form Cards and places in the center of the table but in front of them.

Select a Combat Style - Each player then selects one of their combat style cards from their hand and places it face down besides their form card.

Reveal - All cards are flipped face up.

Resolution: The success of a combat style depends on the form.
If successful, players put the Combat Style Card face down in the discard pile.
If unsuccessful, players put the combat style card back in their hand.

End of turn - Players put the Form Card they just used aside, face-up and return any previously used Form Cards back to their stack.

Winning
The game ends when a player ends a turn with no Combat Style Cards in their hand.

name: counterfeit
description:
You are in the currency exchange market. You will be trading money with other players.
You will have some possible secret partners. You can find out who your partner is or find out which currency is fake. There will be a secret card that shows the currency or the numbered bill that is fake for that round. Be the player with most money at the end.
Don't get fooled by the counterfeit bills.

Contents:
50 cards (1$, 2$, 5$, $10, $20) x 2 of 5 currencies
10 counterfeit round cards (5 money denominations, 5 of the currency)
15 secret player cards (3 of each that represent the 5 currencies)
50 score sheets (or provide your own paper and pencil)
1 starting coin

Set up:
Choose a dealer by drawing from the money cards, highest amount wins. If a ties everyone can draw and add total.
Place the starting coin in front of the dealer. Shuffle and place one counterfeit card in the center.
Deal one secret player card to each player, put the rest aside.
Deal 5 currency cards to each player. (4-5 players deal 4)

Play:
The person to the right of the dealer will start.
Their first action is to choose one face down card to look at.
They can look at another player's secret card or the featured counterfeit card in the center of the table.
After the player secretly looks they pass one money card to the player of their choice.
This card will remain face down on the table, not to be confused with the money in the players hands.
play then continues to the next player.
Repeat same action.

Play will continue for 5 full rounds, until everyone has used all the money in their hands.
Once all the money has been played everyone will reveal their secret identity cards.
They will flip over the money they have in front of them.
They will flip the counterfeit card in the center of the table.

Scoring:
Each player scores the amount of money in front of them
They also score the same amount as a person with the same identity
Ex. If player A has $21 and Player C has $9 and both are on the blue team, they both will get $30 for that round.


Any currency or denomination that matches the counterfeit card in the center is void.


Conclusion:
After the first round, write down each player's score.
Move the dealer coin to the next player.
The money and identity cards will be dealt.
The counterfeit cards remain in the center, once one is used, it is out.

Play continues for 5 rounds or till each player gets to start, your choice. Total up all the rounds, player with the most cash wins.
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Deduction, Party Game, Print & Play

name: Trafik
description:
The purpose of Trafik is to teach primarily children age 6-14 how to travel safely through traffic.

Each player or team (of up to 2 players) gets a car that is moved around the board through dice rolls. If the player lands on a blue square he rolls again.

Other squares require the player to answer a question about traffic to proceed. The questions are divided into 3 age-appropriate difficulties: 6-12 years, 12-18 years and 18 years and above. There are 2 questions in each difficulty on each of the 90 playing cards. Which one is used is decided by whether the dice roll was even or uneven. On a correct answer you get to go again - a wrong answer ends your turn.

Finally there are squares that move you further on the board or ends your turn.

Each time a player crosses start he is awarded a traffic-sign. The first player to collect 4 wins.

name: Xoom Cubes Challenge Cards: Junior
description:
From the publisher:

XOOM Cubes Word Race Games just got even faster! Inside this box you will find over 200 excited challenges! Get rolling with new word challenges from K to 3rd grade spelling lists, including Letter Races (3, 4, and 5 -letter words), Categories like “spell your favorite animal”, “favorite food” or “favorite place” and much more. Pick a card and roll the dice! XOOM Cubes is great for all ages! It’s time to get your family and friends together for lots of fun!

Are you up to the challenge?

Comes with 65 cards.

name: Xoom Cubes Challenge Cards: Original
description:
From the Publisher:

These cards are filled with more the 200 fun and exciting challenges in multiple categories, such as Letter Games, Category Races, Potluck, and Timed Games. Test your abilities to think fast while under pressure, spell words in record times, show off your knowledge about movies, TV, Music, Art, Geography , Science, Technology and Sports. The Categories are separated by color, making it easy to identify your favorite challenges!

name: Quiz Chef Junior
description:
This game challenges kids and parents with more than 200 trivia questions.
Play the game to get some great advice!

Each question has a "BEEP-ed" word: the players take turns trying to find the missing word. The first player answering five correct questions wins the game.

There are special cards where players should provide an ingredient of their choice to add in a given recipe and then, the Chef in charge for that turn will choose the winner based on his own taste.

The game also features some variants as the simultaneous possibility to answer: you need to be the first to catch an item in order to get the right to answer!

The game presents four different levels of difficulty: at the beginning of the game, the players may choose to play a specific level or a mix of all four.

name: Investor
description:
Investor is a game about owning and investing in companies. Each player starts of with a private fortune, a company and a company fortune.

The turn order is decided by the company you start with and every time you pass start you will be able to buy more companies - and thereby get more turns each round. Passing start also adds more money to your fortune and allows you to pay out dividend from your company if you have qualified.

Movement is decided by rolling either one or two dice - the player decides - but if you roll 2 and get two of the same you will receive a bonus. Where you land you will have to pay rent but that will also allow you to place your company logo on the square. From then on all players that land on the square will have to pay you rent as well.

If you get your logo on 5 different types of squares or a lot of players land on the same squares this makes the companies on them worth more.

In the game you can pay to get helpers in the form of lawyers and accountants that makes it possible to buy and sell more companies and negate consequences of special squares and event cards such as tax and a visit from the Fraud Squad.

Before the game starts it is decided when to end the game: At a certain time, at a certain fortune, at a certain number of companies owned or so on. The game should have a length of minimum an hour though. When the game ends your fortune is tallied up and the one with the largest one wins.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Auction/Bidding, Roll / Spin and Move, Stock Holding, Trading

name: Quiz Granny o Cywilizacji: część 1
description:
In Quiz Granny o Cywilizacji: część 1 (Granna's Quiz about Civilization: part 1) players move on the board with 18 fields arranged into circle and try correctly answer question from card.

Player rolls dice and move. If move ends on field with other player's pawn, he try answer question and if it's correct he gains point. Player with 3 points is the winner.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Tisch-Fußballspiel
description: This is a soccer game. The player who scores the most goals in a prearranged time wins the game. Each team has 11 player figures. Movement is one space per turn for an attacking player figure and any spaces in a straight line along friendly player figures or empty spaces for the ball. The defender may move one player figure two spaces or two player figures one space.
mechanics: Grid Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Manic Monster Mayhem
description:
Manic Monster Mayhem is a hilarious story-telling card game. Fend off terrifying monsters like the T-Rex with everyday objects, wit and a sharp tongue!



You’re walking down the street with a balloon in your hand, chewing gum in your mouth and a skunk on your shoulder. You’re just about to call your best friend, as you see a zombie that’s slowly approaching you on a unicycle. You can’t run, you can’t hide, so what are you gonna do? You’ve got 4 objects at hand…Manic Monster Mayhem is a card game about stopping monsters with everyday objects.

3-5 players
~30-45 min

How it works:

Each player gets 4 different objects, with which they have to stop beasts like a T-Rex on a pogo-stick from attacking. How they get rid of that beast is up to them – defeating, bribing, seducing, scaring... everything goes. Almost.

But since there are no heroines or brave adventurers among them, our poor players have to face ghastly monsters with ordinary things like spoons, lemons, vacuum cleaners and ladders. So the only way to succeed is using their wit and creativity – alright, a sharp tongue might be helpful as well…

Setup:
- Each player takes a pen and a piece of paper and writes his/her name on it
- Draw 1 Monster and put it in the middle of the table
- Hand out 4 item cards to each player
- Select starting player

As soon as the game is set up and a monster has been selected, our "heoroes" have to tell the others how they defeat the gharstly beast. Hereby the players take turns, beginning with the starting player.

Once all players have told their story, they secretly vote for the best one, writing the name of that player down. Afterwards a new round begins and a new player becomes the starting player.

After every monster has been defeated (number of monster = number of players) and everyone has voted, the grumpiest player counts the votes and announces the winner!

name: Unsere blauen Jungens
description: The players start at their harbor at the edge of the game board and have to reach their second harbor on the island in he center of the game board. Movement is determined by a die. When they reach one of the white cicles, they have to go around before advancing to the next circle. If a player gets on an occupied space the gets thrown back according to the game rules, if he gets on a mine he has to skip a turn and if he gets on a burning ship he has to go back to his harbor and start anew.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: We Built This City
description:
We Built This City is a fight between builders to develop the most valuable properties possible. Place your factories in their backyards and hope they don't build a trash dump in the middle of your developments. Remember to connect your buildings to city hall or all of your plans will go to waste!

Players place cards, developing the city block by block. Players will develop houses, offices, and factories but the neighborhood they are building in determines how valuable these are. The player with the most valuable properties, and thus the most points, at the end of the game is the winner.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Modular Board, Network and Route Building, Rock-Paper-Scissors, Take That, Tile Placement

name: Imperium Chronicles: Fleets at War – Theater of Operations: The Talion Front
description: Theater of Operations: The Talion Front (ToO:TF) is the first expansion for the Theater of Operations strategic wargame. It includes a completely new strategic map that can be used along with the original ToO map or alone. The expansion also includes a new faction (allied with the Magna), the Talion Republic, and a set of enemies called Marauders that attack the other main factions. Each faction has new ships including space installations (space stations and star bases).
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Print & Play, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: B.E.E.S.
description:
The year is 2112 and the machines being produced now run on quintessence, a fully renewable energy source held in Spirits. In 2040, Dr. Russel VanOrman Quine discovered that Spirits contain energy that can never be destroyed. Even when used to power heavy machinery, this energy source (quintessence) dissipates into the ether, returning to its unknown source. All we need to do is collect it.

You have just been hired by B.E.E.net to collect Bound Ethereal Energy Spirits (B.E.E.S.). Seems simple? Just find B.E.E.S. wandering around in any haunted manor and grab them with your VanOrman Machine aka “H.I.V.E.” (Held Intensity Vitality Extractor). The main issue is a H.I.V.E. needs to be exactly Arrayed to grab a Spirit by joining Tubes to match it. Of course there may be some side effects. So... BEE careful.

Holding Spirits makes a H.I.V.E. rise in Pressure and Tubes may leak. A failed Tube can lead to the unbinding of the Spirit and the Tubes must be trashed. The Spirit is released back into the unknown perhaps to be rebound another day.

Also keep in mind that although Spirit collectors work together, you must all fill your quota each day or you may lose your jobs! Alternatively, an especially good harvest may get your pictures on the wall at headquarters.

B.E.E.S. can be played cooperatively or competitively, and the cooperative game can be played with one player. Your goal in the cooperative game is to collect a quota of Spirits and Quintessence, and your goal in the competitive game is to have the most Quintessence when the game ends. To collect a Spirit and acquire its Quintessence, you must build an Array with Tube cards from your hand and pass both an Array test and a Pressure test. When you collect a Spirit, it goes into your H.I.V.E. and affects you Pressure. Players must manage their hand of Tubes and decide how to build their Array while balancing the board state when deciding which Spirit to target. Gameplay is relatively simple, but the nuances in your decisions determine your level of risk vs. reward and can also greatly affect the other players.

name: Trivia San Diego
description:
Trivia San Diego is a clone of Monopoly set in the city of San Diego, California. The game board locations are businesses and attractions from the city.

From the Publisher: Trivia San Diego is designed to bring hours of exciting challenges for all participants while teaching them interesting facts about their community. This game is for 4-16 players (2 to 4 teams of 2 to 4).
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: The Habs
description:
Test your knowledge on 100 players, coaches and builders from the most prestgious team in hockey history.

Learn more on these illustrious characters who gave made this team the envy of all sports organizations on the planet.

3 clues on the card. 3 points for a correct answer on the first clue, 2 on the second and 1 on the third. 0 for an incorrect answer. After 3 periods the player with the most points wins the game.

name: Arnhem: Defiant Stand Master Set
description:
Arnhem: Defient Stand and Oosterbeek Perimeter combined in one master set.The Battle of Arnhem in super detail, with a building by building map with big hexes (you can put a bunch of counters in each one).

10 mostly small scenarios
Two sheets of die cut counters with new art - big 3/4" AFV counters including lots of unusual German AFVs
Giant-hex two sheet map depicting downtown Arnhem in September 1944
Super-sized deluxe AFV cards for all AFV types
Sturdy box
Two ten-sided dice

Oosterbeek Perimeter is an stand-alone game that links with Arnhem: Defiant Stand that provides two additional maps and 16 more scenarios to expand your Battle of Arnhem action to include the entire British Airborne perimeter!

The new street-level maps at 50-yards scale provide the battlefield where King Tigers smashed toward the Hartenstein Hotel and numerous Victorica Crosses were won for bravery.

In keeping with the Advanced Tobruk approach you will receive a stack of small, fast-playing scenarios to get you on the maps right away, as well as monster-sized action across the entire map!

Features:
Two new historical game maps on heavyweight stock;
16 new Scenarios printed on separate heavyweight cards;
A snazzy ziploc bag to hold it all.
Both games in one package.

name: No King of England: A Solitaire Game of the Hundred Years War (1337-1453)
description:
BACKGROUND: NO KING OF ENGLAND is a semi-historical simulation of the Hundred Years War. The Game begins shortly after Charles IV of France dies in 1328. The Queen of England, Isabella of France, is unable to claim the French throne for herself, and has claimed it for her son, Edward III. France rejects the claim, maintaining that Isabella could not transmit a right that she did not possess. The Player represents the House of Plantagenet with the ambition of attaining control of France. As the Commander of English Forces, you must control a significant number of French Cities and Towns before the last Campaign Card is played.

GAME OBJECTIVE: Player takes command of the English Forces. The Player’s Objective is to attempt to control at least 10 French Cities and 12 French Towns before the last Campaign Card is Played. If the French control London and Portsmouth at the end of their Turn, the French win. If the last Campaign Card was played and Player does not control 10 Cities and 12 Towns, France Wins.

GAME FEATURES: NO KING OF ENGLAND features lots of colorful game counters of various Combat Units including Nobles, Knights, Archers, Handgunners and Cannon. English Nobles will gather their Forces and move on the Map in a strategic manner along rout lines of key settlements (and Naval Lanes). Combat is resolved in a tactical manner that includes individual combat between Champion Knights and Archers. The game, also, includes an eventual appearance by Joan of Arc.

NO KING OF ENGLAND can be found at the following URL:
http://www.berserkergames.net
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement

name: Relic Trader: The Pardoner's Game
description:
You are a FRAUD!

No, really, you are. But you're one of the best in London. You could convince a legless man to buy a pair of shoes. You could spit in a jar and sell it for medicine. You could sell a widow a charm to increase her husband's fertility. You rush forth where honest men fear to tread. Where other people see the love and joy of God, you see a chance for a profit.

Using your unscrupulous skills - and a copy of the Legenda Aurea - you work your way through the streets of medieval London, taking trash and turning it into treasure. You're just trying to help, of course, and if they're happy, who are you to let a little thing like honesty interfere with that? Why, you're doing a public service!

Your ultimate goal is to give up the life of deceit on the streets, and instead, become a lay clerk at St. Paul's Cathedral. Fortunately, you know where you can purchase, ahem, volunteer for the job. For the price of a proper bribe, why, it's a steal! Sadly, there are other citizens who share your desires, and they plan to take the job first. The first one to acquire the cash gets the job.

The object of the game is to roll dice to travel around the board, trying to collect Relic cards from the corner squares, and then sell the Relic cards at the markets. Gameplay is based on rolling dice for movement, and drawing an Action card at most squares. Action cards will affect the value of relics, the gain and loss of shillings (money), and the possibility of getting arrested. The winner is the first player to acquire thirteen shillings and return to the corner square, St. Paul's Cathedral.

name: Inconceivable: Kingdom at War
description:
Inconceivable: Kingdom at War is an intense microgame in which you must strategically read your opponent(s) and respond accordingly. Each player controls a part of the remains of a broken kingdom, fighting to restore stability to the fallen empire. With four battle cards in hand, you must choose: Should you play your Knight? Your Archer? Do you call in your Sorcerer, or save it for a future round? It all depends on the action of your foes, so do not be deceived by their trickery.

Inconceivable is a 2-3 player game that lasts about 10-20 minutes on average. Each player has 4 warrior cards, which can be seen below. There are 18 loot cards that are mixed up and placed face-down, creating the playing field. On each turn, there can be anywhere from one to three rounds to win these loot cards. The progression of each turn is a mystery; so be strategic!
mechanics: Hand Management, Push Your Luck, Rock-Paper-Scissors, Simultaneous Action Selection, Trick-taking

name: The Well of Souls
description:
The objective is to capture the opposition’s sacred book, release one’s captive ancestors and figuratively destroy the captured book at one’s altar.

Mechanically, the game is a roll and move format. Four players are required and the game is played in two teams--The People of Light versus The People of Darkness. Each player takes on an identity.

Game components include, a game board, deck of draw cards for each team, two sets of dice and other parts related to identity, movement and possession of goods.

The game board has an innovation where the end game expands the board by including a middle insert where the end game is played.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Open Drafting, Role Playing, Roll / Spin and Move, Team-Based Game

name: Expedition zum Mond
description: The players move from earth to the moon and back. The first player back on earth wins the game. Movement is determined by 3 dice. The player may chose the result of one of the 3 dice to move his piece. After each players turn, the turntable is rotated one step, changing the available flight paths. The players may block each others flight manoevres by placing stop-counters on the flight control panel of their opponents.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move, Simulation

name: Arcade-opoly
description:
The Classic Video Arcade Owners Game.

The classic video arcade in the golden age of gaming! Experience the lights, sounds & fun of the greatest arcade games on show and own them all! With players playing, buying & repairing cabinets the action heats up fast! Look out for power cuts, free plays, breakdowns and remember to empty your cabinets of all those shiny coins!

Overview:
Arcade-opoly is a 1(solo) to 4 player game where players dash around a classic video game arcade.

The object of the game is to buy and setup arcade games and begin to earn quarters from them. Your opponents will have to insert coins to play your arcade games should they stop in front them. Popular games will earn you double but don’t let your games break as “Out Of Order” games will earn you nothing.

Players move around the arcade clockwise by first throwing both a black and a white die. You may only move with either dice, choose wisely which of the dice to move with!

Gameplay cards collected by landing on the Gameplay spaces can help or hinder you. Some cards will offer free games, free plays or free repairs. Other cards though will trigger power cuts, force you to play an opponents game, move with only with one die or even send you back to Level 1.

To win the game you must be the first to collect enough coins from your arcade games coin box and reach the target money amount of 70 quarters. Be careful not to play or buy too many games because other costs may arise such as repair bills, loose change, power cuts and game crashes. Should a player lose all their startup money of 30 quarters the game ends. All the remaining players can then total up any coins left in their games with the highest being declared the winner.

Unique features:
Classic video game arcade theme.
2 dice choice mechanic
Money track scoring
16 colour wooden arcade cabinets
50 plastic coin Quarters to play & collect from the machines
36 gameplay cards
Power cuts, Free Plays, Free Repair and “Out Of Order” events
“Top Games” that earn double their price.
45 minute playtime.
3 lives per player for extended play.
Solo play variant as you compete against three CPU players.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Kumite
description:
Two players battle it out in the attempt to knock out their opponent. If you decrease your opponent's health to zero, you win.

Players manage a dojo of skills using Experience Points to build a deck of attack and defense cards that can adapt to an opponent’s evolving strategy.
The linear mat component allows players to control distance to avoid damage and get in range to strike.

Stuns and takedowns break an opponent’s rhythm leaving him/her without enough stamina to pull off brutal combos.

Holds can create an opening for attack and often work in combination with other moves creating another level of strategy.
mechanics: Action Points, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management

name: Daggers
description:
Daggers is an asymmetrical abstract board game played on an 8x8 board.

As described by João Pedro Neto on The World of Abstract Board Games:

UPHILL & DOWNHILL - "Downhill" refers to the direction towards the "Low player", and "Uphill" refers to the direction towards the "High player".
DAGGER - Daggers slide along the column or diagonals downhill as far as they like, but only one cell uphill or diagonally uphill. There is no side movement. Daggers can capture any piece along the diagonals (going either uphill or downhill) and can capture Crowns (but not Daggers) along the column.
CROWNS - A Crown can move to any (orthogonal or diagonal) adjacent empty cell. A Crown can also capture any enemy piece on any (orthogonal or diagonal) adjacent cell.
TURN - On each turn, each player moves one of his pieces. The High player moves first.
GOAL - A player wins by capturing an enemy Crown or by moving one of his own Crowns into the opponent's first row.

name: The Twinkles Game: His Trip to the Star Factory
description:
The Twinkles Game: His Trip To The Star Factory. Based on the General Mills Twinkles The Star Shaped Cereal with the Twinkles the Elephant mascot.

The players choose to be one of four characters: Fulton the Camel, Wilbur the Monkey, Leopold the Lion or Sanford the Parrot. The players begin on the Start square, and the Twinkles playing piece starts several squares ahead. Players draw cards that have colors on them and move to the next square with that color on the board. Players must draw a card for Twinkles and move him on his turn, as well. Players cannot pass Twinkles, even if that means they cannot move. Certain squares award the players stars, and others take stars away (if they have any). When Twinkles finally makes it to the Star Factory, the game is over. The player who has the most stars, wins.

name: Das Hinauswerfer-Spiel
description:
Each player has a set of 3 pawns that start on the starting spaces of his color. The goal is to move the pawns around the board along the spiral to the "home" section. Movement is controlled by a die. All players move around the same board, so they may capture each other's pawns. Captured pawns are returned to their player's starting place and must start their journey over. The winner is the first player to move all pawns "home".

On the back of the game board is the game Nine Men's Morris (Mühle).
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Huck Finn Game
description:
Based on The New Adventures of Huckleberry Finn TV show produced by Hanna-Barbera and based on the classic Mark Twain characters. It featured live-action heroes in an animated world.

Comes with 60 paint strips and Injun Joe spinner. Players take turns spinning and collecting paint strips. Players lose their turn if they pick Injun Joe or a messy paint strip. The first player to "paint" his fence with 15 correct paint strips wins.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Novel-based
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Tiny Token Toss
description:
Tiny Token Toss

Tiny Token Toss is an 18-card - 1 or 2-player Dexterity chit tossing game. "I may be starting a trend with these games!"

It uses the same chit tossing mechanic from castle under siege but in a nice and simple point scoring game.

Tiny Token Toss uses 6 cards in front of each player "a seventh card can be added to the back row" with each card having a circle with point values in it. Each player takes turns tossing chits at the cards to try and obtain the most points or trying to knock their opponents chits off the cards.

The rules are simple and the game is a light filler style game! I calling this new innovative style of game "The chit toss game"! LOL

14 cards make up the scoring cards.
2 cards represent each player's toss card.
2 cards represent the bean bags.

If you think of the beach bean bag tossing game, that's this game in a nut shell!
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Print & Play

name: Castle under Siege
description:
CASTLE UNDER SIEGE

Castle under Siege is an 18-card - 1 or 2-player Dexterity Medieval Castle Siege game.

Player-1 controls the Catapult and tries to loft "boulder, fireball, and disease" towards a castle. You use one of the cards as an actual catapult; tossing ammunition at the castle.

Player-2 maintains the castle and must use his forces to put out fires, repair boulder damage, and take card of the injured soldiers. To do this you must move around the castle trying to reach and resolve each situation before it gets out of control. All the while trying to stay alive because if a boulder lands in an area where your forces are they are either killed or injured.

You have a limited supply of ammunition and once you run out the game is over. You tally your score to see if you breached the castle wall or tower. Or see how many forces you were able to kill!

The player of the castle wins by preventing a wall or tower breach and trying to save as many soldiers as possible.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Point to Point Movement, Tile Placement

name: Wally Gator Game
description:
Help Mr. Twiddle...Find The Runaway!

Players spin & move around the edge of the game, landing on question marks with different colors and numbers on them. Using a number wheel, players get a clue to the color, character or activity of the runaway. The winner is the first player to identify the runaway.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Names of the Disloyal
description:
In Russia, everyone is responsible to the Motherland to ensure every citizens is a good comrade.

In Names of the Disloyal, you must turn in the names of those who are striving to disrupt the harmony among the people. Roll dice to gather the letters needed to discover the dissidents, use the help of your comrade workers, and find those rumored to be disloyal.

On your turn, you will roll dice, claim cards to your hand and then make names with those cards. The first player to a set number of names triggers the end game.

Game Contents:
162 Letter Cards (Letters of the Revolution)
36 Name Cards (Find the Disloyal)
8 Multi Letter Cards (Workers Unite)
7 Dice each in 4 different colors
12 Scoring Tiles
1 Scorepad

name: Vice Alley
description: This thrilling Pulp Alley expansion introduces two new character types (Gangs and Associates), ten new perks, over two dozen new abilities, and rules for Bystanders. Vice Alley also includes a thrilling multi-chapter campaign designed to play just like the old pulp magazine and serial adventures.
mechanics: Hand Management, Simulation, Variable Player Powers

name: Disneyland Pin Trading Board Game
description:
The Disneyland (60th anniversary commemorative) Pin Trading Board Game is a simple spin-and-move game (some spaces have variable effects as listed on the back of the box) along the Pixie Dust Path celebrating the attractions, films and magic of the Disneyland Resort. First player to the spinner in the center of the board wins.

The game includes 3 hinged standee token pins (Mickey Mouse, Aurora and the Genie) and a jumbo spinner pin. More player tokens (pins) and "completer pins" can be added with the separately-sold additional 3-pin token set (Minnie Mouse, Donald Duck, and Mr. Toad) and the 4 completer pins representing board locations / park attractions (Grizzly River Run, It's a Small World, Sleeping Beauty Castle, Space Mountain).

name: El Secreto de las Pirámides
description:
Es un juego de mesa para dos jugadores, donde las pirámides, momias, faraones y flechas deberán ser colocados de forma estratégica para sacar la diferencia necesaria para ganar los sets.
El objetivo del juego es ganar dos sets.
Cada set se gana obteniendo una diferencia de 7 puntos sobre el rival.
Los puntos se obtienen al conectar las pirámides con las flechas.
También se obtienen al colocar las momias y los faraones sobre las pirámides.
Además, al finalizar el juego, momias y faraones generarán puntos según la influencia que tendrán sobre cada uno de los territorios.

Si tratta di un gioco da tavolo per due giocatori, in cui le piramidi, mummie, faraoni e le frecce devono essere posizionati strategicamente per fare la differenza necessaria in set vincente.
L'obiettivo è quello di vincere due set.
Ogni set si vince, ottenendo una differenza di 7 punti sul rivale.
I punti sono guadagnati durante la connessione piramidi con le frecce.
Essi sono anche ottenuti mettendo le mummie e le piramidi dei faraoni.
Inoltre, dopo la partita, mummie e faraoni accumulare punti secondo l'influenza che avranno su ciascuno dei territori.

It is a board game for two players, where the pyramids, mummies, pharaohs and arrows must be strategically placed to make the necessary difference in sets winning.
The goal is to win two sets.
Each set is won, resulting in a difference of 7 points over his rival.
Points are earned when connecting pyramids with arrows.
They are obtained by placing the mummies and the pyramids of the pharaohs.
In addition, after the game, mummies and pharaohs accumulate points according to the influence they have on each of the territories.

name: The Knight's Journey
description: A race to the finish game with a beautifully lithographed board featuring a land of monsters, wild beasts and fairy tale creatures. Players draw cards to move.

name: 1863 Kampania na Kurpiach
description: 1863 Kampania na Kurpiach ("1863 Kurpie Campain") is a historial board game showing the hardships of brutal insurrection life during the anti- Russian Empire uprising of 1863 in Poland. The goal is to survive and finish as many misions as possible. The players get a random mission and travel the board. Players move according to their movement characteristic. Each movement results in a random adventure card. Additionally Tsarist forces randomly move around the board patroling in larger numbers each turn. Each mission has a turn limit after which the game ends. Players collect victory points for each adventure and succesful mission.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Role Playing, Variable Player Powers

name: Felix The Cat's Dandy Candy Game
description:
Players choose one of the Cowboy/Cowgirl character disks that have been punched out of the insert. Game also includes 12 orange slice disks and a punch out spinner with an inner and outer ring.

Players begin on the Starting House and move forward by the number of spaces on the outer ring of the spinner. When a player lands on an orange slice space, they receive an orange slice piece and spin again, this time using the inner ring of the spinner. Players continue until someone reaches the Candy House. The first player in the Candy House gets 2 orange slices. The player who has the most orange slices at this point, wins.

On the other side of the board is a checkerboard, and black and red checkers can be punched out of the insert, as well.
categories: Animals, Children's Game, Comic Book / Strip

name: Wer schafft's
description: This is kind of a soccer training simulation. One goal keeper (red) plays against up to 3 field players (yellow, black, green). Movement is determined by a die. The goal keeper has 9 meeples and each field player has 3 meeples. The goal keeper tries to catch the field players and vice versa by getting on the same space. If the goal keeper has lost all his meeples the first field player to reach the square goal space wins the game. The goal keeper wins if the catches all field players.
mechanics: Player Elimination, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move, Simulation

name: Meta-Trading-In
description:
What could be more fun then Trading good in the Mediterranean? It happens when you combine LCR components to create YADE (Yet Another Dry Euro). Move you ship from port to port and discover the shipping needs. Do the best job of matching the needs to win with the most Victory Points!

Objective: To have your sea ports end the game with the most total value in goods Shipped to it, and insuring that your home port has more value then your sister ports.

Game-Play: Players will take turns Useing dice to Launch/Land from port to port. While there they peak at the requested good and attempt to marry the right goods card in following turns. After the first chip is revealed take ownership of the port and begin to fill orders. Look out for other players that chose to mess with your effort at the port. They can improve the value of a sister port or try and ruin your home port value.
mechanics: Action Points, Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Memory, Trading

name: Diametric
description: Diametric is an abstract co-operative card game. The game consists of only 18 cards and uses hidden information to provide a challenge for 2 or 3 players.

name: Five Famous Favorites
description:
Tripoley: A standard deck playing card game played with a special layout (or board) and poker chips. It is a modern version of the game of Poch. Each hand has three phases: "Hearts", "Poker", and "Michigan Rummy". All cards are dealt out, including one extra hand which remains unseen. Players place chips in the spaces for the special combinations on the playing mat/board, the "Poker" pot, and the "Kitty". The first phase pays off for holding certain cards or combinations (that match the combinations on the playing layout/board). The second phase is a hand of poker; each player selecting five cards from his hand to play. A hand of Poker betting takes place, with bets added to the "Poker" pot, and the winner wins the "Poker" pot. In the third phase, players play a slight variation of the game of Michigan (similar to Fan Tan), and the first to go out wins the chips in the "Kitty".

Backgammon (Acey Ducey): a classic abstract strategy game where each player has a set of 15 "men" that must be moved from their starting positions, around, and then off the board. Dice are thrown each turn, and each player must decide which of his men to move based on the outcome of the roll. Players can capture each other's men, forcing the captured men to restart their journey around the board. The winner is the first player to get all 15 men off the board.

Number Chek

Horse Race

Checkers: is an abstract strategy game where players move disc-shaped pieces across an 8 by 8 cross-hatched ("checker") board. Pieces only move diagonally, and only one space at a time. If a player can move one of his pieces so that it jumps over an adjacent piece of their opponent and into an empty space, that player captures the opponent's disc. Jumping moves must be taken when possible, thereby creating a strategy game where players offer up jumps in exchange for setting up the board so that they jump even more pieces on their turn. A player wins by removing all of his opponent's pieces from the board or by blocking the opponent so that he has no more moves.

name: Cats Witch & Thief
description:
User summary:
Cats~魔女と泥棒~ (Cats Witch & Thief)
Each player acts as a witch with her two black cats, and sneaks into the mansion of a corrupt merchant to steal gold coins. The black cats' duty is to steal the gold coins. Use magic to support your cats.

You can steal gold coins from your rivals by jumping over them.
While stealing gold coins from each other and dropping and picking up gold coins, head for the goal, the room with the safe.

Publisher's summary:
プレイヤーは魔女となり、２匹のクロネコと共に悪徳商人の屋敷に忍び込み、金貨を盗みます。
金貨を盗むのはクロネコたちの役目。
プレイヤーはクロネコたちを魔法でサポートします。
部屋ごと回転させたり、ライバルを転ばせたり、ときには金貨の袋に穴が開くといったアクシデントも。
ライバルを飛び越すことで金貨を奪います。
金貨を奪ったり奪われたり落としたり拾ったりしながらゴール地点の金庫部屋を目指します。

name: Boku no Hinamatsuri
description:
User summary:
ぼくのひな祭り (Boku no Hinamatsuri) means My Dolls' Festival in English.

The players score points by placing their cards to form their original tiered stands of traditional Japanese Hina dolls.

Starting with the dolls of Five Court Musicians, the display is followed by Three Court Ladies, the Empress, and the Emperor. The players simultaneously complete their original tiered stands of Hina dolls by each using 10 cards.

Choose the 10 cards as you like. You may safely choose high-score cards, collect items to aim at a rally at the end, or bet on your luck by collecting dice.

It's a game designed to provide the warmth of Japanese tradition.

Publisher's summary:
カードを並べて自分だけのひな壇を作りつつ得点を競います。
五人囃子からスタートし、三人官女、女雛、男雛と続き、10枚のカードで各々のひな壇が同時に完成します。
どんな10枚を選ぶかはあなた次第。
無難に点数の高いカードを選ぶも良し、
最後の巻き返しを狙ってアイテムを集めるも良し、
サイコロを集めて運に賭けるも良し。
和のぬくもりを感じられる一作です。
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Set Collection

name: Cluckbot: Fight League International
description:
You are a cluck operator competing in the Cluckbot Fight League International, a brutal realm of mechanical combat as popular as it is illegal. Pick one of 10 cluck models, gather your arsenal, and take them into the arena!

Cluckbot is a board game for 2-player combat dueling. Each player controls a robotic cluck, one of 10 models, each with its own “cluck sheet” defining their attacks, gadgets, grapples and rush combos. You have 8 turns in the pit to eliminate your opponent either through raw damage or forcing them off the stage.

Each turn, players set their cluck’s movement (direction and facing) and action (step or leap) while the opponent does the same, double-blind. After revealing the commands, players resolve actions while spending "charge" to activate weapons and gadgets as they go. The right commands can foil your foe’s assault. Will you lure them under your claws? Outflank? Surprise attack? Strategic planning, anticipating your foe, and a bit of bold improvisation are key to victory!
mechanics: Action Queue, Grid Movement, Take That

name: Flouk Zybrides
description:
Welcome to the second generation of space refugies! The little Flouks were born on Earth, but some of them are Zybrides, who inherited their traits from the two peoples their parents belong to.

10 cards P'tits Flouks
5 cards P'tits chefs
14 action cards
1 card décret
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction

name: Popularity Contest
description:
In Popularity Contest, 4 to 6 players play cards on their turn to try and be the most popular. Being popular is good but beware, sometimes if you are too popular, your friends will turn against you. Play cards to add or subtract from your or an opponents popularity. If you are the least popular you will be eliminated. Don't get too secure in your popularity, if you get too popular someone may give you a zero card and you may also get eliminated.
If you are eliminated, you are not out. Eliminated players use their remaining cards to help determine the winner. Be the last person standing (the most popular) and win the game.

name: Les Robots Rigolos
description: A nice simple and fun game for kids of all ages. Each player spins the wooden wheel to collect robot parts. The first player to assemble his small robot wins. The box contains 1 wooden roller tray, 24 wooden magnetic pieces (4 robots), 1 set of rules.

name: Comptoir des Antilles
description: In a harbour of an island of the Antilles, 4 ships are to be loaded with goods. Each player wants to attribute his porters to the ships in order to get money when the ship leaves the harbour. In your turn, you must play one of your action cards. The card tells you how many porters you are allowed to attribute to a ship or if you may change their places. If there are as many porters in a ship as the ship needs, it leaves the harbour. All porters earn money. The player who triggered the departure must pay a commission according to the number on his played action card. But if he is the starting player of the round, he may denominate any other player with at least one porter on that ship to pay the commission.

name: Bastion: Ashur Kersam Promo Card
description: Ashur Kersam promo card for Bastion, available at Essen Spiel 2015. Language independent. Value of 8, archmage, legendary enemy. When in play, no alchemy spells can be used.
mechanics: Area Movement, Cooperative Game, Modular Board

name: Smarten-Up
description:
Smarten-Up is a game based on health and nutrition. The game consists of 6 packs of question and answer cards with 48 cards in each deck, 1 die, 2 score pads, 1 pen, and one rule/reference sheet. Each deck has a different colour back and a different point value.

The players roll the die to determine which deck to draw from. The starting player asks the question on the card to the player on the left. If the player answers the question correctly, they earn the full point value of the card. If the player fails to answer correctly, the asking player may score half of the point value themselves, or ask the question of the player on the first player's left. If that player answers the question correctly, they score full points. If the player fails to answer correctly, the asking player scores full points (except for true and false questions).

Some cards are bonus cards. The asking player reads the cards and gives the points to the player on the left. These two players then exchange places. This eliminates any possible preferred table positions. The game ends at a predetermined time or when a predetermined point value is reached. The player with the highest score is the winner.

name: The Spooky Marble Maze Game
description:
Casper's cousin Spooky, the tuff little ghost, haunts this simple marble maze game. The Maze is made of cardboard with cardboard tabs that are pressed down to form bumpers for the marbles to dodge. The top of the box is placed under one end of the box bottom so the maze is angled down. Game comes with five marbles.

In turn, players take and play ALL of the marbles by dropping them into one of the holes at the top of the maze. The marbles must be held one inch above the hole when dropped. The player receives points as the marble lands in one of the slots at the bottom of the maze. If a player gets a marble in each of the slots at the bottom of the maze on one turn, they get a 10 point bonus. If a player gets all the marbles stacked into one slot at the bottom of the maze, they get a 10 point bonus. First player to 100 points wins.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Comic Book / Strip, Maze, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Otenki Kaeru
description:
User summary:
おてんきカエル (Otenki Kaeru) means Weather Frog in English. This game is designed to be played by a family who is new to card games.

Players are apprentices of the god of the sky who controls the weather. Their goal is to fulfill one wish, which is either children looking forward to a sunny picnic tomorrow or a frog waiting for rain.

They take turns playing one or more weather cards (sunny or rainy), while controlling their hands so that there is exactly one wish card in their hand at the end of round.

When the fourth sunny or rainy card is played, tomorrow's weather is determined and the round ends. They reveal their hands. If a player's sole wish card matches to tomorrow's weather, that player has fulfilled the wish and gains victory points printed in the wish card.

After several rounds, the player who has earned four victory points wins the game.

Publisher's summary:
親子や夫婦で初めて遊ぶためのカードゲームとして製作されました。
プレイヤーは天気を司る空の神様の見習いです。
他のプレイヤーとともに天気カードを出して投票し、明日の天気が晴れか雨か決めます。
ピクニックに行きたい二人の小学生と、雨を待つカエルの願いは、点数カードとして手元に届きます。
決まった天気に合った得点カードを持っているプレイヤーのうち、一人だけがその点数を得られます。
最も早く決められた点数を集めたプレイヤーが勝利します。
publishers: トーホクウィステリア (Tohoku Wisteria)

name: Jewel Duel
description:
User summary:
ジュエルデュエル (Jewel Duel) is a 2-player game which is derived from Japanese traditional dice game チンチロリン(Chinchirorin) with magical flavour.

As a graduation exam from wizards' school, you have to gather jewels and forge miraculous rings from the jewels before your opponent does.

To collect a jewel, you roll three dice to determine the magic power and beat your opponents. A special effect is added if you roll a triple or a sequence.

Then you may transform three jewels of the same colour into a ring, or any three jewels into one jewel of your choice. If you have equal or fewer rings than your opponent, you may spend one jewel to conjure an elemental for a random effect. It may change the game drastically in your favour or your opponent's favour.

You win the game if you forge three rings first.

Publisher's summary:
日本古来のダイスゲーム「チンチロリン」をスタイリッシュにアレンジした２人対戦専用ゲームです。
魔法使いの卒業試験は、宝石を集めて奇跡を起こす指輪を作ること。しかし、同僚よりも早く指輪を作らなければなりません。
宝石を集めるために、プレイヤーは魔法を唱えます。何も難しいことはありません。魔法が込められた３つのダイスを振るだけです。ただし相手プレイヤーよりも強力な魔法、つまりは強い目の組み合わせを出さなければなりません。
相手よりも不利な状況にある場合、宝石を消費することで精霊を召喚することができますが、その結果もダイスの目次第。大逆転を呼ぶこともあれば、さらに窮地に追い込まれることもあります。
先に指輪を３つ作ったプレイヤーが勝利します。
publishers: トーホクウィステリア (Tohoku Wisteria)

name: Chatty Games
description:
Contains board with 2 sides for 2 different games to play "with" your Charmin' Chatty Cathy doll: Chatty At The Fair and Chatty Skate 'N Slide. Includes a record to insert into the Charmin' Chatty doll so she talks during the game. (Child can play games alone & doll can be the second player, or up to 4 players can play)

The first game is Chatty Skate 'N Slide: Play this game with the skates attached to the playing pieces and use side 1 of the record. Begin on the Start space, Chatty moves first. Pull the Chatty-Ring all the way out and let go. Chatty will say "Race to Orange", "Move ahead to Yellow", etc. Player will go to the next space of the color indicated. If Chatty says "Race to Orange and Slide", move to the next space of that color and use the slide if there is one. You cannot use the slide if Chatty does not say so. If Chatty says "You cannot move!", you cannot move on that turn. The winner is the first player to get to the winning "End" circle. Chatty must call one of the colors in the circle: red, orange, yellow or green, whether she says slide or not.

The second game is Chatty At The Fair: Use the playing pieces without the skates and use side 2 of the record. Child starts on My Start space and Chatty starts on Chatty's Start space. (When 3 or 4 play, 2 start on My Start and the rest start on Chatty's Start) Pull the Chatty-Ring all the way out. She will say HOW TO TRAVEL to the World's Fair. ("Why not ride the Pony?", "Go take the Whirlybird", "Go by Choo Choo Train", "Get in the Car and go", "Take the red Ferryboat", or "Take the Jet Plane - zoom!") Move to the next picture on the players path that matches what Chatty says. If Chatty says "Stop to see the sights", player does not move. If Chatty says "Green Light, go ahead 3" player moves ahead 3 picture spaces. Winner is the first player to get to their winner space (Whirlybird for My Start path and Choo Choo train for Chatty's Start path) (If player is 1 to 3 spaces from the winner space and Chatty says "Green Light, go ahead 3" player moves to the winner space and wins.)

name: Barbie: Bring The Bling Game
description:
Barbie: Bring the Bling Game includes 24 glamtastic rings. Take em, Wear em, Swap em. 2 Pinktastic shades included. Pinktastic Shades reveal a secret design that can be seen when sunglasses are on.

The object is to get at least one ring of each of the four Barbie icons to win. To play, put all of the rings face down in the center of the play area. The first player puts the Barbie sunglasses on and spins, following the instructions on the spinner. The sunglasses are only passed to another player when indicated by the spinner. The spinner may indicate passing the sunglasses, taking the sunglasses, drawing a ring or passing a ring. Any time a player thinks she has one ring of each of the Barbie icons she can say Bling. The other players take turns looking at the rings with the sunglasses on to see if she is right. If she is correct, she wins. If she is not, she puts one ring back in the middle and play continues.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Neo-Hunt 3
description:
Summary:

Neo-Hunt 3 is a round-based, multi-phase board/card game for 2-4 players. Each player controls a team of three "varans" (large, humanoid reptiles bio-engineered for combat). Players try to kill as many "troopers" and opponents as possible before one team is eliminated. Opponents include the varans of other players as well as "troopers" (non-player game tokens) who occupy the game board and arrive at the beginning of each turn.

Setup:

Each player selects a color and takes all the pieces for that color. Players sit on corners of the playing surface. The game board randomly is generated by creating a 3x3 grid from the board pieces. Each of the nine sectors of the game board provides various terrain benefits or penalties. During the game a total of fifty "troopers" will deploy into various sectors and players may move their varan units into sectors.

Game Play:

Play proceeds in turns. During turn setup, each player selects and plays four action cards. Then play proceeds in player order, with each player in sequence executing their four played action cards. Action cards are resolved in the order of priority indicated on their face; they may distribute damage tokens. Damaged "troopers" are eliminated and varans with enough accumulated damage tokens also are eliminated. After each player has taken their phase all "troopers" take automatic actions of either shooting at a visible varan or, if no varans are visible to them, by moving to a new sector. At the end of each turn new "troopers" deploy onto the board if any counters remain.

The game continues until end of turn when there are no more trooper counters on the board or one varan team has all its members killed. When game ends, the player with most points wins. If tied, the one with most surviving varans, and if still tied, tied victory.

User Comments:

The game is print-and-play and published for free access via HTML. Components and rules are downloadable in PDF format. Color printing is recommended.

name: Neo-Combat
description:
User summary:

Neo-Combat is a card game using print-and-play materials. Players hold "Varan" cards, which represent a combatant reptilian humanoid controlled by the player. Players also draw, hold, and play "Action" cards that drive the game. Varan cards are always played on the table but begin play in the "Cloaked" (face down) position. Varans remain "Cloaked" until play dictates otherwise, when they are turned face up and thus become much more vulnerable.

The playing surface is divided into Sectors which join in a central "Battlefield" Sector. Play involves moving Varan cards between Sectors and playing Action cards to evolve maneuvers. The goal of the game is to eliminate all of the other players' Varan cards. Played Action cards and defeated Varan cards go into Discard.

name: Lalaloopsy: Find 'N Seek – Memory Match Spinning Game
description:
A neat game is the Lalaloopsy Find N’ Seek – Memory Match Spinning Game. As the name suggests, this game is played to enhance the memory of the child by making him/her remember the images on the play card and then matching the image with those of the other cards. The game consists of 1 console, 8 chunky play cards, 1 mix up card, and 1 free spin card. The game also improves hand eye coordination since the children need to pick up the cards to see the images.

A fun interactive memory game for kids!

Pull the handle to make their matches! Your children will improve their memory skills and hand eye coordination with Lalaloopsy Find ‘n Seek!

name: Zoolu Card Game
description:
Zoolu is a fun family card game. The aim of the game is to collect a full set of cartoon animal cards, called Wild! Cards. Wild! Cards come in five Colours (blue, green, pink, white, orange) and five Types (cheeky, cruisy, freaky, cutesy, zany).
Target Cards tell each player the Colour or Type they must collect, and the first player to collect their full set of cards 'goes wild!' and wins the game.

Kaos! Cards add strategy and see players swapping, swiping, stockpiling and surrendering cards in their bid to 'go wild!' first.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Memory, Party Game

name: Heisei Hyakunin Issyu
description:
This is educational memory game.
a kind of Ogura Hyakunin Issyu:Japanese ancient card game

There are 100 pair pictures in the game.
Player can play "Old Maid","Concentration" using the cards.
there are hints printed on the cards.
if you know 100 famous ancient Japanese poems , you can win easily.

and you can play traditional Ogura Hyakunin Issyu too.

Heisei Hyakuninn Issyu is compatible.

Ogura is a Japanese place, and Hyakunin mean 100 people. Issyu: one poem. So, the tile means 100 poets who are picked by famous poet Sadaie(Teika) FUJIWARA at Ogura.
