The poem is written in ancient Japanese language. Many Japanese students have to memorise 100 poems even if the poem sounds like Greek.

name: Lalaloopsy: Ups 'n Downs 3D Game
description: Be the first to reach the finish line and win, but beware the falling stars! 3-D Action adds to the traditional game play of Snakes & Ladders. Contents: 3D plastic playing board with pop-up dice in middle, 2 Detachable ladders & 4 Colored marbles. Fun from top to button. Lalaloopsy - Sew Magical! Sew Cute!

name: DUNNIT: The Card Game
description:
DUNNIT is a party game where you learn all the scandalous secrets you NEVER wanted to know about your friends.

It contains 150 different fill-in-the-blank cards such as, "I have never ___ in public." and "I have never felt ___ on my ___." There are 3 ways to play, and here's the most popular version:

Players take turns drawing a card and (verbally) filling in the "I have never ___" card with a true statement. All players who have "DUNNIT" get a point. The first player to 20 points wins!

name: The Flatsy Game
description:
It's a hurry-scurry shopping game. Go with Flatsy to the Supermarket with your shopping list. How fast can you get all the items? Will another player beat you to the Checkout Counter? Hurry! Hurry! First player to checkout wins the game!

Contains: Supermarket Game Board, 4 Flatsy Playing Pieces, 4 Shopping Lists, 24 Food Cards & Spinner.

Players spin and move around the supermarket trying to collect the food cards on their shopping list. They must land on the space next to the food item to collect it and place it next to that item on their shopping list. A player may pass her turn if she is close to a food item when her spin will take her past it. If a player lands on a space occupied by another player, she can bump that player, removing one item from the other players shopping list and putting it back on the shelf. A player must collect 5 out of the 6 items on their list in order to go to the Checkout area. The first one to reach the Checkout area (Finish) with 5 items on their list, wins.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Good and Plenty Game
description:
Late 1960's game based on the popular candy. Each player begins with 2 Good and Plenty Chips, and spin the spinner to determine order of play. Highest number goes first, lowest number goes last, etc.

To play: Spin arrow and move your token the number of spaces indicated on the spinner. If you land on your own color, take one Good and Plenty chip. If you land on a Good and Plenty's Grabber space, give one Good and Plenty chip back. You may go backwards instead of forwards ONLY if doing so will land you on your color so you can get a Good and Plenty chip. First player to reach the Finish space gets 3 Good and Plenty chips, Second player gets two, Third player gets 1. If there is a fourth player, they get none. Winner is the player who has the most Good and Plenty chips once all players reach the Finish space. If the Good and Plenty chips are depleted before all players reach the Finish space, winner is the player with the most Good and Plenty chips at that time.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Fate of the World
description:
Humans are gone and Earth is up for grabs. In Fate of the World you lead an alien army battling for control of the planet. Deploy your minions to build and populate cities as you expand your empire across the globe, or unleash a monster on one of your opponent's cities to stop them creating a sprawling metropolis of their own.

Each creature card has two colors. Players collect sets of creatures with the same color to populate cities. Cities are constructed by sacrificing creatures and can be further expanded as the population grows. A limited hand size means the player must constantly balance collecting and sacrificing creatures in order to maintain their empire.

Creatures can be deployed from your cities to attack an opponent's city. If a city's population is reduced to zero it is razed and construction must begin again. Players earn points for building cities, winning battles and expanding their empire. Fate of the World is a game of strategic depth that is fun for the whole family.
categories: Card Game, City Building, Science Fiction

name: Polterfass: Die 2015er Mini-Erweiterung
description:
The rules of Polterfass apply. No extra game material is needed.
There are 3 new special card-combinations which the players can place in phase 2 (the guests' order).

German description:
Es gelten die Regeln von Polterfass. Es wird kein zusätzliches Spielmaterial benötigt. Es gibt drei Spezial-KOmbis zweier Karten, die bei der Bestellung der Gäste gelegt werden können.
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Print & Play
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck

name: White Elephant Gift Exchange
description:
Elephant Gift Exchange is the most fun you can have playing one of the crappiest games there is. You know those lame Christmas gift exchange games you are always plagued with at Christmas parties. We give you a super charged, fast paced version of that crappy game but in a simple 5-minute game with hilarious present cards. Presents range from unused items from your families closet to gifts you actually never want to receive. You will spend more time laughing about what present you just had then you will playing the actual game. Additionally we include one blank card so you can add your own family members and terrible gifts to your game. Pass the cards, laugh with each other, and whoever has the winner gift “wins” the game once all the foolish presents are opened.

One card in the game is labeled as the "Winner" and one as the "Loser". Roll the die, pass your crap however the die tells you to then, when the last player opens their present by turning it face up (unwrapped) the game is over. Whomever has the "Winner" card is the winner. If no player has the "Winner" card, then the player with the "Loser" card is just the big loser.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Memory, Party Game, Print & Play

name: Quaffers
description:
From the box:
It's about having fun whilst learning about wine! The board game is for 4 or more adults and key features include blind tasting and the testing of wine knowledge through answering "Experience" questions of varying levels of difficulty.

Each player is the owner of an internationally acclaimed vineyard. Each circuit of the board is a year in the life of their business and players must travel around the board to bottle their yield and sell their wine at market.

Each player will need to bring a bottle of wine, which they have to disguise from other players using one of the special Quaffers drawstring bags provided in the box.

To win the game, players can eliminate all others (survive without going bankrupt) or take over two other vineyards. Players vineyards are put up for sale when their wine is identified - "Taste or Bid" squares let the player have a go at identifying the masked bottle of wine that one of the players has brought to the party.

name: Who's the Princess?
description:
A fantastic educational game from the multi-award winning Chimp and Zee range of games and puzzles. Each child plays the part of a princess, who needs to collect a pair of shoes, a tiara, a ball gown, and an invitation. Once all the items are collected, the player places them in their own coach, in order to be the first to go to the ball but each player needs to watch out for the wicked queen. The first player to collect all 4 cards and get back to their castle space is the real Princess. This game is great fun for children and easy for parents to explain. This game can help children learn through play. Easy to set up you can start playing in just a few minutes and everyone has a chance to win. Only takes ten minutes to play and is even great fun when it's not your turn.

Who's the Princess was created to help children with colours, shapes, matching, and co-ordination along with developing the ability to play together. The game is presented in a quality cardboard carton complete with carry-handle and glitter printing. This game is for 2 - 4 players and suitable for ages 3 years and over.

name: Planet Zoom
description:
First complete the puzzle about different terrains and vehicles.
Then take turns matching the different modes of transport to the correct categories.
Who has placed the most tiles to the correct categories is the winner.

name: Lock Dice
description:
A dice game that simulates competitive lockpicking.

Players will contribute dice ("pins") to a lock in the center of the table, and then will take turns attempting to pick the lock by matching die rolls. As the game goes on, the player's skill and tools increase, allowing for faster and more efficient picking.
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Pattern Building, Set Collection

name: Mad Mansion
description:
Mad Mansion is a competitive tile-laying game for two players, ages 10 and up, that plays in around 30 minutes.
In the game, each player represents a team of 8 Workers. During the game, players place between one to three tiles per turn to build Hallways, Rooms, and groups of linked rooms called Suites to create an overhead map of the mansion. The Workers who successfully build and complete the most Rooms in the Mansion will win the game! To score points, players place Workers on the tiles they build to claim Rooms and Suites that are Under Construction. At the end of the game, points are scored for the total number of Rooms claimed by each player... one point each for Rooms that are Under Construction, and two points each for Rooms that have been Completed (meaning that every door in the Room or Suite is connected to a hallway, or all of the rooms are bounded by solid walls.) When all of the available tiles in the game have been placed the game is over and the player with the highest number of points wins.
Every game is a unique experience as no two Mansion layouts are ever the same.

name: Hidden Hints
description:
From the publisher:

Wrangle your way through word-sleuthing adventures to earn a shot at solving a mystery.

Challenges kids to figure out what words mean by clues in the text around them

Broadens vocabulary through engaging, mystery-themed game play

Includes 43 double-sided, multiple-choice question cards; 7 double-sided game play cards, 40 self-checking hint cards, 16 game pieces, briefcase, and Activity Guide with answer key

Durable cardboard briefcase measures 5"L x 7"W x 1.5"H

How to play:

Select a hint card and place it in the briefcase—don’t peek!
Draw a context clue card and answer the question.
Answer 3 questions correctly to earn a hint about your mystery object.
Be the first to solve your mystery, and win!

name: Precipitate
description:
The Fascinating Game of Chemical Formulas.

The idea of the game is to arrange cards as to form compounds letting each card represent an atom. Each player must have the correct number and kinds of cards for the compound being made, i.e. H2O - must have one oxygen card and two hydrogen cards.

Game is similar to rummy. Players dealt 9 cards. One draw pile and one discard pile (starting with one card up.) Players draw one card (from either pile) and discard one card on turn. Play continues until one player has all cards in had made into compounds. Player lays all cards down and calls out "Precipitate."

Every player gets score for cards made into compounds, points increasing for number of cards per compound. Player who called "Precipitate" gets 10 points. Game played until one player has 100 points.

Game can be played with any number of players (solitaire directions included) but best with 2-6.

name: Presto
description:
From the designer:

"Many musicians, even those of considerable experience, frequently have difficulty in sight reading music and it is often necessary for them to play a selection a number of times before they can be assured of rendering it with accuracy. This is due largely to the fact that many musicians are not sufficiently familiar with the positions of the notes of the musical scale to be able to recognize instantly a given note from its position, which is essential in sight reading. This is especially true of beginners or persons inexperienced in reading music." This game aims to teach the notes of the scale through game play. Includes board, 48 cards and 16 playing pieces, four of each color.

The board has the treble staff and the bass staff running continuously around the board with the musical notes of the scale on them, with the name of the note in small letters. Players have four game pieces each. The object is to move through the notes of the scales to get all four game pieces to the W-I-N-S zone. The players turn cards to determine what letter of the scale to move to. At first they may need to refer to the names of the notes, but as the game is played, they will begin to recognize the position of the notes, aiding in their sight reading ability. Players may move any of their pieces, and may have to move backward in order to get to the note indicated. The first player to get all his pieces in the W-I-N-S zone is the winner.

name: Sigfrid and Donatella
description:
If your children are incapable of sitting down and playing a board game then this is the answer! This game includes a pyramid shaped board on which players must advance and complete challenges. These challenges may include: running around the table twice, jumping up and down 3 times, imitating a lion, naming 5 animals, or standing still until your next turn… Fun challenges that will keep children entertained. All the pieces are made from painted wood.

Cognitive aspects

We have based this proposed classification of toys on recent studies and investigations, as well as recent domestic and international classification systems. Our proposal aims to be coherent, unified and practical at all times.
1. Visual perception: Perceptual ability to visually differentiate the objects multiple characteristics.
2. Motor skills: Ability to perform different movements with adequate precision.
3. Hand-eye coordination: The ability to synchronize visual perception with precise manual movement.
4. Spatial orientation: The ability to maintain oneself in a space with the help of spatial references in relation to the surrounding area.
5. Reasoning:
- Concrete: Ability to select forms, categories and objects, and then link them together.
- Abstract: The ability of thought to systematically analyse the possible combinations of elements or ideas to discover specific relationships.
7. Imagination and creativity: Ability to develop new ideas and fantasies.

name: Piratas
description:
To start the game set up the board and choose the character you like best. Each player has a treasure chest, which they must fill with coins as they move around the board, But beware of the skull which will take the coins off you. This is a simple board game for children aged 3 to 6 years old.

Cognitive aspects

We have based this proposed classification of toys on recent studies and investigations, as well as recent domestic and international classification systems. Our proposal aims to be coherent, unified and practical at all times.
4. Spatial orientation: The ability to maintain oneself in a space with the help of spatial references in relation to the surrounding area.
5. Reasoning:
- Concrete: Ability to select forms, categories and objects, and then link them together.
- Abstract: The ability of thought to systematically analyse the possible combinations of elements or ideas to discover specific relationships.
6. Concentration: Ability to detach oneself and keep the focus on certain elements.

name: Holiday!
description:
The four characters are going on holiday and must pack their bags. You will have to move around the board and pick up the items on the list, moving from room to room. You’ll have fun!

Cognitive aspects

We have based this proposed classification of toys on recent studies and investigations, as well as recent domestic and international classification systems. Our proposal aims to be coherent, unified and practical at all times.
4. Spatial orientation: The ability to maintain oneself in a space with the help of spatial references in relation to the surrounding area.
5. Reasoning:
- Concrete: Ability to select forms, categories and objects, and then link them together.
- Abstract: The ability of thought to systematically analyse the possible combinations of elements or ideas to discover specific relationships.
6. Concentration: Ability to detach oneself and keep the focus on certain elements.

name: Cartatoto Sums
description: A fun game including 110 cards in which you will learn to add up quickly. On one side of the card is the sum and on the other the answer. The more you get right the more you win.

name: Bugsy
description: A fun game that will teach you to add and subtract without you even realising. The object of the game is to fill your worm with coloured beads by following the instructions on the dice. Sometimes you will have to add beads and other times you will have to take them away. The first player to complete their worm wins!

name: The Maze: Teleportals
description:
In the future, the most popular entertainment event just got bigger and more intense. The stakes have been raised, up to 6 contestants can now compete for glory, fortune, and fame. With the addition of Teleportals, contestants can now attempt to teleport to different locations of The Maze. Who will win in this exciting new race to the finish?

The Maze: Teleportals is an expansion to The Maze. It adds two new contestants to the game so you can now play with up to 6 players. It also adds in Teleportal Tiles, these tiles allow players to teleport from one space to another, but the results aren’t always what you hope for.


NOTE* The Maze: Teleportals requires a copy of The Maze base game to play.


The Maze: Teleportals Contents:
48 Maze Cards - Including new Teleportal cards
2 Player Pawns
2 Six Sided Dice
1 Set of Rules
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Maze
mechanics: Modular Board, Roll / Spin and Move

name: PO TAY TOE
description:
This is a memory game for two to four players.

You are simple hobbit farmers, growing potatoes in the commons of the Shire. But you are clumsy hobbitses who lack communication skills, so there is no rhyme nor reason to your planting. How many potatoes can you harvest?

During the game, players take turns adding to a field of face-down cards. Each card may have one syllable on its face - PO, TAY, or TOE. (There is also a fourth card named "WHAT'S TATERS".)

On their turn, a player has the option to uncover three linearly-adjacent cards in the hopes that they spell out PO-TAY-TOE. If successful, the player collects the cards as "one potato". The goal is to be the player that finds the most potatoes.
categories: Card Game, Deduction, Humor, Memory, Print & Play

name: Election: The Game
description:
Election: The Game captures the excitement of a political election, and all the vote-buying and back-stabbing you love so much. Don't just watch it...live it!

Election is a strategy game. It is a combination Deck Building, Empire Building, and Land Capture game. The game has three phases: Gerrymandering, The Campaign, and The Election.

During the game, you will build your personal deck, build your organization, and purchase votes on the Districts that make up the game board.

Build your personal Deck, build your Organization, and purchase votes on the Districts that make up the game board to win Electoral votes. The player with the most Electoral Votes wins the game.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building

name: Fliqochet
description: Fliqochet is a dexterity area-control game where players take turns flicking game pucks across the game board attempting to accumulate the most points by successfully getting their pucks to rest into designated scoring zones. A Match is played over a number of Rounds and Games. A Round consists of flicking 9 pucks each. At the end of any Round if a threshold of 100 points or better is accomplished by one or both opponents then the player with the higher tally wins a Game. The first player to win 4 Games wins the Match.

name: Round-Up
description:
A Riders of the Range action party game for children.

Any number of players can be cowboys finding small cards representing cattle. An organiser hides the cards around the playing area. Each card bears a number representing the number of head of cattle (20, 30, or 40). The player who finds the most head of cattle wins.

name: Memo-Puzzle Der Blaue Reiter
description:
The game plays much like the classic Memory, but instead of finding two matching pairs, the players have to find four matching cards. The four cards which belong together are not the same, but create a picture when put together.

If a player finds at least two matching cards, then they are left visible. The player, who finds the forth card to a set gets it. The player with the most sets at the end of a game wins.

All the art in this game is from a group of artists called 'Der Blaue Reiter' (Munich, Germany, from 1911 to 1914).
The box contains 72 different cards and a book with background information to the artists of all pictures.

name: モテるための１２の方法 (Twelve Ways to Charm)
description: モテるための１２の方法 (Twelve Ways to Charm) is a set-collection game using colored and numbered cards.

name: Neo-Hunt 2
description:
Summary:

Neo-Hunt 2 is a round-based board and card game for 3-6 players. Each player controls a single "varan" (a bio-engineered humanoid reptile). The goal of the game is to kill other players' "varan" and to eliminate "trooper" units (game tokens). Play continues until only one "varan" remains or until all "trooper" units are destroyed. If multiple "varan" units remain then scores are tallied to determine the winner.

Setup:

The game board is randomly created by assembling it from hexagonal sector tiles. Players are given one random "varan" card and one "trooper" card; "varan" units are initially deployed in a hidden state. "Trooper" units are then places sequentially on the board. Players then draw a full hand of action cards and play begins.

Game Play:

Play proceeds in "rounds" during which each player gets a turn. Each player's "varan" can make an attack upon a unit it can see, either "varan" or "trooper". Successful attacks deal damage (which may be insufficient to remove a unit). Destroyed units are removed and scored. Players also draw special cards and may play them, taking whatever action is described. After the players have moved all "trooper" units then move or fire at visible "varan" units following a basic rule.

User Comments:

The game is print-and-play and published for free access via HTML. Components and rules are downloadable in PDF format. Color printing is recommended.

name: Neo-Hunt
description:
Summary:

Neo-Hunt is a board game about highly advanced cyber varans (large humanoid reptilians) in special testing zone or battleground. Their mission is simple: destroy as many trooper units or other varans as possible before being destroyed or until there are no more troopers left

Setup:

Players select a "varan" token and a corresponding "order" card. All the "order" cards for players are combined with one gray "trooper" order card; this deck is shuffled to determine phase order. "Trooper" cards are randomly selected to make a trooper deck; 7-17 cards may be used (this will determine approximate game length). "Sector Tiles" are then shuffled and randomly distributed into a circle form to create a random playing board. Players then receive a random "varan" card and eleven "action" cards.

Game Play:

Play continues until all "troopers" are destroyed. If a player's "varan" is destroyed they can resume with new "varan" but will suffer a score penalty. On each player's turn they utilize action cards and move their varan into a new sector or attack any other unit they see. On the trooper turn standard rules apply to move or shoot; troopers will only shoot at visible varans. The game supports a few special status conditions which may occur.

User Comments:

The game is print-and-play and published for free access via HTML. Components and rules are downloadable in PDF format. Color printing is recommended.

name: All Tricks, No Treats
description:
In All Tricks, No Treats you and your friends, brothers and sisters plus that one annoying neighborhood kid that always tags along have just finished divvying all of the good candy and you are down to those last terrible "treats". Stuff like pretzels, toothbrushes, stale candy corn and the dreaded rock. You want to get as little of that junk as possible!

All Tricks, No Treats is an abstract card laying game for two to four weary trick or treaters. Players take turns placing "treats" cards in a way to minimize the crappy "treats" they will get stuck with which is determined by one of the cards they have selected from their hands and not placed.

name: Conn8
description:
Conn8 is a 2-player abstract strategy game. The aim for each player is to connect their own colored sides on a board paved with octagons and squares.

On their turn players place:

one piece in an octagon, or
two pieces on two different squares.


On their first turn, the first player may only place a single piece in a square. After that, the normal rules apply.

name: Autocrat: The car trading game
description:
From back of the box:
Each player is a dealer in new and used cars. Players compete with each other to make car sales. There is a lot of friendly Wheeling and Dealing as players try to earn enough money to buy the Ultimate Car.

A roll and move game where players aim to earn enough money to purchase a BMW and have it complete a lap of lap of the board. The includes opportunities to interfere with trades and sales other players are attempting to make. This represents the car traders competing to get a sale by offering a discount.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Roll / Spin and Move, Stock Holding

name: Frogabout boardgame
description:
A fascinating educational game that tells you all about the ecology and life history of our extraordinary Australian frogs (description from the back of the game board)

The game is a roll and move. On about every third space there are instructions to follow (eg "Hot weather. Have a rest. Miss a turn.", "Jump for joy. You have found a mate already. Advance to 'Egg-laying lilypad.'", "DANGER You are eaten by a yabbie. Return to start.").

Sometimes the instructions are to take a "Tadpole" or a "Frog" card. These cards have a similar range of penalties and benefits as the board spaces with instructions. The frog cards are much larger than the tadpole cards, in full colour and include some factual information about frogs on them. A couple require the player to imitate a frog's call (described on the card) to receive the benefit.

There are two places where players get a choice of paths but other than that there is no choice in movement.

name: Murder Mystery Party: Murder in the Baths
description:
Who Killed Devius Taxus?

The year is 50 AD and the place is Ancient Rome. The last few days have seen the best Roman athletes, chariot racers and gladiators entertaining the vast crowds in the Colosseum and Circus Maximus. The Thermal Baths in Rome will be the venue for a lavish feast at which the cream of Rome's political and sporting societies will bathe and then feast. However, before the feast has begun Senator Devius Taxus is found dead in the plunge pool. Host your own party to discover how he came to meet such a steamy end.

name: Zogar's Gaze (Second Edition)
description:
Zogar's Gaze (2nd Edition) takes what worked well in the original version and adds new mechanics to improve the gaming experience for all!

Players take turns going to the market to buy items to equip their heroes with. Then they delve into dungeon one card at a time. Death is around every corner, but so is fame and fortune. How deep will you go on your turn? Will you risk it all for a possible pile of gold? Zogar, the evil wizard, is also watching over your every move. Attract too much attention and he will reveal himself, ending your turn, and possibly the game!
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck, Set Collection

name: Crazy Heroes
description:
Crazy Heroes is a game where players have to collect heroes and criatures to make the greatest team.

Each character gives the player a type of dice, that can use in the future combats.

Collect gold from your heroes and use it to buy more, or fight against creature to capture it and join it to your team. Get a team of 10 heroes (or creatures) to win the game.

name: Звездные войны. Война клонов
description:
A long time ago in a galaxy far, far away Clone Wars raged. Stand on the path of light or dark side of the Force and turn the tide of the war. Each player can choose one of four characters: Obi-Wan Kenobi, Anakin Skywalker, Count Dooku and Asajj Ventress. Each character has their own abilities and the ability to wield power. Moving on the playing field - circuit galaxy - players will perform the tasks of their allies, and fight each other for influence over the planets and military bases. With the game cards and dice the player can influence the other characters enter the battlefield and more troops to crush the enemy's defenses.

Contents:


- High detailed play field
- 4 player's cards
- 128 game cards
- Count Dooku figure
- Obi-Wan Kenobi figure
- Anakin Skywalker figure
- Asajj Ventress figure
- 60 game tokens
- Dices (1-6)
- Board game manuals

name: Riders of the Pony Express
description:
As riders for the Pony Express, you'll risk life and limb to make a buck in the old west.

Spend 3 weeks in the saddle, claiming parcels and planning your route from Missouri to California and back. Make your deliveries and pick up helpful items along the way.

Riders of the Pony Express uses a unique low-bid auction to claim parcels every round, and then hazard tiles can spice up the routes between towns, forcing players to stay flexible with their plans.

The rider with the most cash at the end of the game wins!

name: Auction Heads
description:
Auction Heads nos pone en la piel de los subastadores de almacenes abandonados en Estados Unidos, al estilo de los populares programas de TV donde los participantes de la subasta de un almacén realizan pujas por quedarse con su contenido, del que solo pueden ver una pequeña parte, no pudiendo ver la parte de atrás del almacén ni tocar nada del contenido. De esta manera el que realice la puja más alta se quedará con todo el lote, que podrá darle beneficios o pérdidas dependiendo de su valor real.

ENGLISH

Auction Heads is a game of abandoned storage auctioneers, bidding on and winning the most bizarre objects, appraising the items found within, and selling the most lucrative and interesting pieces to gain the game. The player who make the highest bid will remain with the entire batch, and after the deck ends, the player with the most money wins. But, be carefully! There may be hidden illegal objects that can make you lose money!

name: Unique
description: A twist on the usual trivia games; players ask questions personal to themselves.

name: Frag Doch Mal: Das Clevere Spiel
description:
The oldest player begins by taking the top card from the pile and reading the question to the player at his left.

In the card the mouse, the duck and the elephant each offer a possible answer. Read these three possible answers and always say by whom the answer comes: From the Mouse, the elephant or the duck. You can check the right answer in the back of the card. There, the mouse, the duck or the elephant are displayed with a detailed response.

The game ends as soon as there are no more cards. The player who has the most cards wins the game.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Expansion for Base-game

name: Frag Doch Mal:  Das Kartenspiel Set 1
description:
The oldest player begins by taking the top card from the pile and reading the question to the player at his left.

In the card the mouse, the duck and the elephant each offer a possible answer. Read these three possible answers and always say by whom the answer comes: From the Mouse, the elephant or the duck. You can check the right answer in the back of the card. There, the mouse, the duck or the elephant are displayed with a detailed response.

The game ends as soon as there are no more cards. The player who has the most cards wins the game.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Expansion for Base-game

name: Frag Doch Mal: Das Kartenspiel Set 2
description:
The oldest player begins by taking the top card from the pile and reading the question to the player at his left.

In the card the mouse, the duck and the elephant each offer a possible answer. Read these three possible answers and always say by whom the answer comes: From the Mouse, the elephant or the duck. You can check the right answer in the back of the card. There, the mouse, the duck or the elephant are displayed with a detailed response.

The game ends as soon as there are no more cards. The player who has the most cards wins the game.

name: Ninja Ninja Ninja
description:
Ninja Ninja Ninja features a 54-card deck, with cards numbered 0-5 in three colors, with each card appearing three times.

Players have a hand of seven cards, and they play three at a time to create strong card combinations, such as three cards of the same number and color (strongest), three cards in sequence, etc. As they reveal combinations, they can cause damage to one another based on the strength of their attacks and defenses.

name: Marseille Sophistique
description:
Marseille Sophistiqué is your guide to one of the most complex families of card games in the world! A 78-card deck, elegantly illustrated and faithful to the sensibility of its 15th century origins, updated with modern gameplay in mind.

The Tarocchi family of games is a historical set of point-trick taking games, played in a series of zero-sum hands. Most in the family include a signature fluctuating team system where one bids for the high-risk, high-reward position of the single opponent to the other players, who form a temporary team for the duration of the hand. Players may additionally bet on a series of secondary goals, to achieve bonus points along with those for the hand itself. A game is played to a variable number of rounds in which each player deals a hand.

Marseille Sophistiqué includes an introductory rulebook, containing historical game rules for
-Baronetti, a simple 2-player introductory rules set that focuses on the basic point-trick principles, also good for fast games and appropriate for children
-Scarto, a 3-player free-for-all
-French Tarot, the classic 4-player, team-based trick taking game, with variants for 3-6 players
-adaptations for 5-suited Poker

Free digital content extends these rules to include
-Droggn, a 3-4 player game with a smaller deck, more forgiving to the opponent.
-Hungarian Tarokk, a 4-5 player game with an advanced bonus system
-Illustrated Hungarian Tarokk, a variant for those who have mastered Hungarian Tarokk
-Rules variants reflecting some of the regional iterations of games

name: Wild Planet
description:
First complete the puzzle about different terrains and animals.
Then take turns to spin the spinner and matching the different animals to the correct categories.
Who has placed the most tiles to the correct categories is the winner.

name: Animals of the World
description:
First complete the large world puzzle with different animals.
Then take turns to spin the spinner and matching the animals and fish to their correct habitats.
Who has matched the most tiles is the winner.

name: Maíandros
description:
Maiandros is a 2-player connection game (such as Hex, Twixt, etc).

Games are always played in odd square boards with 9x9 being the minimum size recommended.In this game players alternate turns placing identical two-color tiles, each with an inverse side. Tiles must be placed in a way that its colours match the colours printed on the corners of each square (to ensure all tiles match each other). The goal of the game is to connect opposite sides of the board, be it horizontally (east-west) or vertically (north-south).

name: Bugs Bunny Race in Space Game
description:
Bugs Bunny is an astronaut on a mission to deliver urgently needed carrots to an orbiting space station. The object is to be the first player to deliver four carrots to their matching space station.

Players spin and move their pawn from their planet with up to 3 carrots of cargo at a time to the space station with the matching color. Players may move in any direction during each turn but diagonal, but they may not simply return to the square they started on. If a player lands on a space occupied by another player, the other player must take all their cargo and put it back at their home planet. They must then move back to the planet to pick up cargo again. Players do not need an exact count to enter their space station (or planet) and drop off the carrot cargo. After dropping off the cargo, they must return to their planet to pick up the remaining cargo and deliver it to the space station. First player to deliver four carrots to their space station wins.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Monster Rush
description:
You and your friends are part of an order known simply as the Keepers. The Keepers were sworn to contain any horrors that keeps coming out from Portals of Evil that appear in dungeons from time to time. It is your job to not only prevent them from getting out, but also to destroy the portal to prevent it from happening again.

Monster Rush is a co-operative tactical dungeon crawling game for 1-4 players. Play different card combinations to create a different hero every game and prevent the monsters from escaping the dungeon. Strategize and come up with adaptive tactics every turn, as monsters mass up and threaten to overwhelm you and your fellow Keepers.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: DamBeavers!
description:
DamBeavers is the tile laying resource collecting game of beaver colony control and proliferation! Thwart hapless rivals by unleashing the wolverine, lumberjack or redneck farmer. Beaver tirelessly through the rolling seasons to make your colony reign supreme!

Begin by laying river tiles and placing initial dam pieces. Move through the three turn phases in each season. Lay terrain tiles, send out beavers to gather resources, build dams and lodges and watch your beaver colony grow. Fortify your lodges before winter or your baby beavers will perish. And at all times beware the wolverine! With each passing year when the river floods, the landscape changes more and more due to your damming activities.

When the final tile is plucked from the bag, the winner is the player with the most...DamBeavers!

name: Benjamin Blümchen: Mix Mal
description:
Which head matches what legs? Which body is missing here? Who will be the first to assemble two matching Benjamin motifs correctly? A simple, entertaining game with the popular elephant.
The first player to assemble two Benjamin motifs with the tree corresponding cards, wins the game!

name: Romer
description: A card game where you play cards to stacks and score points for having cards on your hand with the same last digit as a card on top of a stack.

name: Election!
description:
George Washington and Abraham Lincoln are two of the most renowned figures in American history, but who would make a better President in 2016? In 1860? In 1792? Let the voters decide! Election! is an interactive family board game with a focus on America’s greatest leaders.

As a player, you have been granted the power to manage a political party that is desperate for control of the White House. In addition to selecting candidates, you may also take advantage of external factors to influence the election in your party's favor. Should you stay positive by gaining the support of a popular activist or attempt to smear an opponent's image by revealing a scandal? Do you take the high road and try to win ethically or attempt to sabotage your opponents through dirty politics? Should you throw in the towel or demand a recount? Votes are all that matters as you navigate your way to the White House.

GAMEPLAY

1) Determine the Election Year: Each round, randomly select an Election Year card that lists the most important issues of that time in American history.

2) Party Nominations: Each player selects 1 of the 5 Presidential Candidate cards from their hand. Players nominate a candidate based on ratings that show the card’s overall polling strength of the issues being discussed.

3) Roll Dice to Determine Votes: Custom dice are rolled based on a candidate's rating. The rating corresponds to the important issues set on the Election Year card. Higher ratings often result in more votes.

Bonus) Red Tape and Public Opinion cards are wild cards that have the power to impact an election (for better or worse).

4) The player with the most votes wins the election and advances along the game board. The winner is the first player to advance to the White House space at the end of the board.

After winning a series of elections with shrewd strategy and a bit of luck, the player who first advances to the White House space on the board wins the game and earns the right to be called Mr. or Mrs. President! Mudslinging and dirty politics guaranteed!

name: Kaiten: Die Sushi-Bar
description:
From the rulebook (translated):

In Kaiten: Die Sushi-Bar every player takes the role of a sushi chef. Collect the correct ingredients, produce different sorts of sushi and take care of your guests!
Full people are happy people and the tip will be generous - sometimes.
At the end of the game, the player owning the most money wins, called the most successful sushi chef!

Players have to buy and combine ingredients (wooden cubes) following different recipes (combinations) to make sushi (earn sushi tokens). These will be placed on player-colored plates onto a sushi-belt (the board) to feed up hungry guests. The guests - represented by guest cards and mostly with unique special rules - take place around the sushi-belt wishing for a variety of different sushi types.
On turn, players can choose from different fixed actions like buying ingredients, making sushi or cleaning dirty plates. Or they can roll a die to perform special actions (for example changing plates places on the belt) or to activate events like new guests or moving all the plates on the belt one field clockwise.
The game ends instantly when the last guest leaves the restaurant and the player owning the most money wins.

name: VersuS
description:
VersuS is a board game for two to four players. Players take turns moving their pawns around a uniquely designed board, trapping and capturing other players' pawns until there is only one player left on the board, who wins the game.

Pawns move like castles in chess: up, down, left or right, as far across the board as the player wants, and can also push and pull other pawns or jump over pawns.

With three moves each turn and a new turn after every capture games move quickly and the winner is never clear until near the end.

name: Auf dem Kriegspfad
description: The players start at the big red space in the upper left corner of the game board. They have to spy on the enemy camp in the upper right corner and get back to the starting space near their own camp. At the red assembling points the players have to wait for all the other players on the same path, before they can move again. On the black spaces marked with a "T" the indians are trapped and have to wait for a trapper to come along and free them. Players of the same team may donate their die rolls to one another under certain circumstances. The first indian or team of indians to return home wins the game.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Planiglob: Reise- und Handelsspiel
description:
Before the start of the game, the payers agree on the starting harbor and destination harbors of the game. The destinations get marked with a lighthouse. At the harbors along the way the players may buy and sell goods according to the export-products-table while minding the loading capacity of their ships. Each player has to make a previously agreed upon number of excursions per train. When the players return to their home harbors, they sell the rest of their products, in which each subsequently arriving player gets less profit.

The game was published about 1900.
categories: Economic, Nautical, Racing, Trains, Transportation, Travel
mechanics: Pick-up and Deliver, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move, Simulation

name: Cost of War
description:
Throughout the history of mankind conflict is at the core of our evolution, evident in each generation with war and expansion of territories to show dominance of one empire over its rivals. Such aggression is not a choice of right or wrong, but is instilled into our DNA through the course of evolution.

This strategy game challenges players to execute military war tactics, allows for population growth, encourages development of city infrastructure to fuel the economy, forces long term rewards to be weighed against immediate benefits, and calls for the management of your civilization's resource expenditure. Winning is a combination of dice rolls and decision making. The key to success is using your economic engine to fuel growth and strategically engage in battles to weaken your opponent and strengthen your dominance on the map. Victory points are gained through killing enemy population, building a city capital, being the peace maker, acquiring special events, and conquering enemy land. No one strategy wins the game but is a combination of several of the victory points to win.

How the game is played section: Players have two choices at the start of their return, (1) Improve Economy or (2) Battle. Improve Economy allows 4 action items for the player; (1) Roll dice which generates resources for all players by collecting resource cards based on dice outcome and the location of their pieces on the game board, (2) Player draws their own event card which generates additional resource cards, (3) Using resources can purchase buildings, population, and increased military strength and placement of those pieces on board, (4) Tactical movement which allows for 1 unit to be moved on board.

Alternatively, Battle allows 4 action items (1) all military units can be moved on board, (2) Engagement in battle which results in offensive pieces on board attacking defensive pieces and outcome decided by die roll, (3) Acquire a special event card through dice outcome, (4) Using resources can purchase buildings, population, and increased military strength and placement of those pieces on board.

How are units killed and battle outcome decided section:
Offensive team rolls X number of dice based on the strength of their military, and outcome of dice is based on value rolled:
(1) capture civilian
(2) kill civilian
(3) kill military
(4) kill military
(5) nothing
(6) special event

Defensive team rolls dice, and outcome is based on these values:
(1) kill military
(2) kill military
(3) steal resource cards from offensive team(called Cost of War)
(4) nothing
(5) nothing
(6) nothing

Purchase of the following can be made:
Barracks; generates Military based on dice roll
Bank; generates resources cards based on dice roll
Fort; provide military defensive mechanism when being attacked
Fortification; provide first line of defense when being attacked
Civilians, allows for collection of resources based on dice roll
Infantry, allows player to initiate military attacks
Land purchase, allows player to control more tiles of board

How to win, first to 6(2-player game) or 7(3-player game) Victory points:
Manifest Destiny; placement of 6 civilians on 1 tile; 1 VP
Established Capital; all buildings + 6 civilians on 1 tile; 2 VP
Peacemaker; 2 unused special event cards, 1 VP
Conqueror; capture enemy owned tiles, 2 VP
Slaughterer; 10 kills by military; 2 VP
Genocide; 18 kills by military; 3 VP
Assimilation; capture enemy capital; 3 VP

name: Super 4: Die Zeit läuft!
description:
You want to help Super 4 to defeat their enemies, the Black Baron, Shark Beard, Dr X and Baba-Cara? Your mission is to complete all ten tasks with Alex, Ruby, Gene and Étincelle in the four different worlds of Super 4 and to collect more gold in each of the worlds. But beware, in this game time is mercilessly against you.
Super 4 is a cooperative game where you all win or you lose.
During the game, you can consult and help each other, however each player does not perform his turn alone, they do it together.
By throwing dice and moving in the board, you receive tasks that you have to fulfill one by one. Your objective is to fulfill all ten tasks.
If you get to complete the ten tasks and collect four key pads in gold, before time runs out, congratulations you have all won!

name: Il Grande Gioco dei Quiz
description:
A challenging and fun game with many quizes developed in collaboration with the editors of Focus Junior.
Over 1000 questions designed for children in school age on many subjects like Science, Geography, Curiosity, Sports, Entertainment and more.
Very original and surprising game mechanics where everyone must bet, in fact, in the response of the opponent!

name: Kettousi Cardgame
description:
User summary:
決闘師カードゲーム (Kettousi Cardgame) means The Duelist Cardgame in English.

In the game of Kettousi Cardgame, two characters fight each other with character-specific decks of 18 cards each.

You play a card to move yourself or force your opponent move in 5 x 5 square grid board.

You win a round if your opponent cannot play a card, and you win the game if you win three rounds.

Publisher's summary:
それぞれ18枚、非対称のデッキを使う2人用対戦カードゲームです。
カードをプレイすることで自分のコマを移動。または相手のコマを移動させることができなくなったプレイヤーがそのラウンドを落とします。
先に勝利点カードを3枚手にしたほうが勝ちます。

name: ほとり (Hotori)
description:
User summary:

In the game of ほとり (Hotori), you are a commander of a battle and your goal is to gain strategic advantages over your opponents. You earn points by deploying soldiers and building citadels in the right places. The player with the most points wins the game.

Publisher's summary:

場に並べたカード「戦場」に兵士コマを配置して、
その配置した地形の価値を上げる。
もしくは価値の高いカードに兵士コマを配置することで得点を競うゲームです。
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Hand Management, Open Drafting

name: I.Q. Games: Culture Classics
description:
From the box:
"Learn about the exciting, mysterious and adventurous world of literature and the arts as you play this fast-paced quiz game! Each card contains five clues. Answer on the first clue and you earn five points. If you answer after all five clues (including a picture clue), you still earn a point! The player with the most points at the end of the game wins!"

One player starts by drawing a card depicting a famous artist or work of art (concealing the picture on the front and covering the clues one the back). He or she reads the first clue the player to the left. If that player answers, he or she earns five points. If not, the first player reads the next clue to the next player. This sequence continues until a player answers correctly, earning a decreasing number of points depending on how many clues have been revealed. The final clue is the picture on the front of the card. Once a card has been solved, the player earning the points draws the next card, and play continues until all cards are used. The player with the most points wins.

name: Tongue Twisters
description:
From the box:
"Tired tigers, ruffled rabbits, wiggly worms and others get together to make a very funny learning game. Your children will play again and again by themselves by themselves or with friends, at home or in the car. They listen to the Tongue Twisters on the cassette and match them to their lotto board.

To play, each person takes a lotto board and nine coloured tokens. Start the cassette at any point on either side for a different game every time. Find the picture of the Tongue Twister and cover it with a token. Cover all your pictures to win. For a real challenge, use the letters only side of the board."

name: Authentic Professional Football Game
description: In Authentic Professional Football Game, players use a stack of cards to simulate the plays in a football game. The offensive player chooses his play and then picks a card. Each card lists a result for all possible plays. The player checks his chosen play and applies the result by moving a football marker on a football field board. Downs, first downs and scoring work as they do in American football. Kicks (kickoffs and punts) are resolved by drawing one card for the kick distance and another for the return distance. When a play results in a penalty, interception or too-short field goal, another card is drawn to show the result. When all the cards in the stack are used up, a quarter ends. The deck is then shuffled and the next quarter begins. The second half (or third quarter) begins with a kickoff. As in a typical football game, the player with the most points after four quarters wins.

name: Hexaclub
description:
1964 Canadian abstract game with a colorful hexagonal board.

Each player has pieces of three different colours, which behave differently if they are on "home territory" or "enemy lines" (different colours).

The goal of the game is to send your pieces to the central "fortress" hexagon, but you can be sent back to your home square by an "assault" of an enemy piece.

name: Congregate
description: Congregate is a social political game where players use various Representatives to accomplish their hidden Agendas in a series of votes. Each Session (round) a player will choose a Proposition for all others to debate and vote on. Players augment their votes with different types of Representatives, from the highly influential Councilors to the destructive Spies. Whatever the approach, players must do anything in their power to accomplish their hidden Agendas and amass the most wealth.
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Negotiation, Political, Spies/Secret Agents
